gR4igXsMbQVS06DERoLIFA.text: It was a Friday around 3pm and my wife and kids were hungry so I checked the buffet at the Mandalay Bay since we were staying in the hotel already. I would give the hotel a 4 stars review but the buffet will only get two stars and I am very generous. It was a brunch and even though there were 10s of options to choose from, most of the food didn't taste good at all. Specially the meat. If it wasn't for the pancakes and the chocolate cakes the whole family would have left hungry for sure.   We talked to the staff, they refused to give us any credit saying that we could have talked to them earlier, so they could have talked to the chef! But they gave us complimentary two adult buffets to use in the future. But because of the bad experience we decided to skip the offer to avoid having the same bad experience again.

PFIEmjcnoq4fZX_Pjw54TQ.text: This place won't knock your socks off but it gets the job done and the price is very reasonable compared to other buffets. I enjoyed their breakfast buffets so much that I went there twice and was full for most of the day. I wish I would have come here for dinner instead of Wicked Spoon.

esyX3NfcMw00H9Zrk54TaQ.text: It's your standard buffet fare.  Some good stuff, mostly mediocre stuff.  I went here for lunch and there was zero line on a Friday.  Price was also very fair for a Vegas buffet.  One thing I liked about the buffet a lot was the seating area overlooking the pool.  The huge windows windows added a nice feel.  Couple things to note that I enjoyed were the oso buco, meatballs, salt and pepper shrimp, and sesame balls (in the chinese food area).  A couple of the desserts like the cheesecake and fruit cobbler was good as well.  Overall, it was an OK buffet.  If you're looking for excellent buffet food you would definitely be better off going to Bacchanal or something.

-H8_445XDZS_bduZc3siBw.text: Very good breakfast here. Omelets and eggs made to order. Bountiful selections across the board. Service very friendly and efficient. Would definitely return.

_MUVfmE3epNJLDUUsmPtAA.text: Used to be good, not sure what happened. Food is really rough... fish smelled REALLY fishy... I actually turned down unlimited crab legs.. that's bad. I kept trying stuff and really nothing was good. too bad. This used to be one of the best buffets on the strip.

03ReqWyUYPhvuJOQgc9VmA.text: We have been several times since we frequent Vegas. Breakfast is really good with ample choices and the taste was good. Dinner we love the crab legs. There are an abuse to amount of choices but the crab legs are why we keep coming back. Service is what you expect from a buffet. Decor is nice with views over looking the pool.

vvmYP936JUPV2t-SVa8Cpw.text: I gave this place 2 stars only because it is better than the Excalibur buffet which I gave 1 star. The variety is very sparse here and the staff is pretty rude. I would rate the food quality at low to medium range. Just basic things like sushi, spaghetti and meatballs, those kind of basic buffet foods.

UlCxVHBoTd43v7ddNxWlqQ.text: I tried almost all buffets in Las Vegas and i would like to say this was one of the best food. Not sure if everyday is like that, I've been here 3 times usually evening and i absolutely loved the food, not just me but my whole family and friends that i took here. Price is also fair. Would definitely eat here again when i go to Las Vegas

LBQD4pfOeEPv_eNo3rhDzw.text: I don't hand out a 5 star rating often, but this place was that good! I came here with my family for lunch & was impressed with the selection of entrees ( the NY Strip was real good , panko- crusted Salmon was great) Dessert was top notch & service was awesome... I loved it. Glad I stopped in for lunch!

nrYbxiFFSxsWdehFDf8oaQ.text: The WORST buffet EVER!!!! This price is expensive and the food is NOT good. We will never come here again!!!

-YJu-PVFIkclEB40ZNvwvw.text: came from a wedding and decided to eat here! food is amazing! and lina is amazing! felt at home! she is above and beyond customer service!!  highly recommend this place and will definitely come back again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food here is amazing! Just went for wedding and ate here. LINA is amazing She is Above and Beyond in Customers Service! Food is amazing!

eHSzzY6vq8W7lriVpxjghA.text: Seating is really tight.. Not much room in the booth for 4 people.  I thought the place overall had a chemical kind of smell to it.   It was difficult to get food from the back area out onto the plate without making a mess everywhere. That whole process was awkward. Would be better if you could go on both sides to get food, instead of only one.   Food was okay. But found a hair in my pizza. Not sanitary!  Service was good though!   Will not be returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake!

MwjHeIMg0Ob5YofmsEklWg.text: Went to this buffet on Easter for brunch. It had everything I was craving and more! It wasn't a huge buffet, but that's okay because if it were any bigger I would have gotten overwhelmed.  It was also very affordable. So worth it.

fdx9RAojfmUwnC-cxQfGtg.text: I play MyVegas slots and I was able to score comp buffet passes to Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay.  We trekked over to Mandalay Bay in the hot Las Vegas sun (Mandalay Bay is one of the last hotels on the strip).  The inside of Mandalay Bay is really nice, lots of glass, really nice decor.  We found the buffet pretty easily as there were lots of signs throughout the hotel.  We arrived there in time for tail end of breakfast.  As it was a Monday morning, I was not surprised that there was no line and it was very empty.  Once we got seated, we looked around the buffet and I was very disappointed by the selection.  There was not a lot food to choose from, but I did try the potatoes (which tasted mushy), bacon (which was tasty, but when is bacon not tasty?), and a few other items (which were not memorable).  Since it was breakfast time, we asked an employee if the could make us an omelet, but they refused stating that they had to get ready for lunch (even though there was 20 minutes left in the breakfast).    We were also able to see what came out for lunch and it was not all that impressive.  Since I was pretty stuffed from the breakfast items (most of it bacon) that I had, I only tried a few things.  I think the best thing was beef dish that they had in the carving station and I paired that with mashed potato and gravy.  They had other dishes that I did not want to try because it did not look very appetizing.  I also toured the dessert station, which seemed a little small.  I passed on the dessert since I was pretty disappointed by all the other items in the buffet.   I am glad that I did not have to pay to eat here and I do not think that I will be coming back to this buffet, especially since there are so many other and better options on the Strip.

ZFEAYd1hQHGkCYR8JljrSQ.text: I've eaten at this buffet before and must say that I recommend it on a weekend. We recently fined here on thanksgiving and it was a mad house. The staff could not keep up with the demand. The desserts were wiped out and sub par. I was very disappointed. A lot of the fresh fruit and other offerings I could not find. Last year I dined here and it was very good, when I enjoyed the crab legs, prime rib, and sushi.

S3Qi3XBtOoqH1BkP8egoKQ.text: Food was decent, desserts were fabulous.  A lot of things lack labels, especially at the dessert station.  Ate here for lunch, okay selection of foods.  Turkey at the carving station was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some other desserts, nothing was labeled but the one to the far right was fabulous.  Center one was gross.  The cupcake was very oily.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut cream pie...no label for it though, just happened to find it tucked underneath the counter.  Delicious.

v44XzDlMVsYtT--MVrUorA.text: Terrible!!!  No assortment of fresh veggies. My husband's prime rib had a hair in it. Worst merlot I've ever had from the all you can drink bar. Very bland food. Very few side selection. Crab was small and average.

EAuFSKc0OgFbCG3yGRA-jg.text: What can you really say about a buffet in Vegas that hasn't already been said. This was my second time at the Bayside Buffet. It's actually one of the better ones I've had, but buffet food is never going to be amazing.   Some of the pluses ... it has free champaign/beer/wine (option are limited, but still counts) ... crab legs (score!) ... and the dessert options are plentiful (though not all very good).   The pasta bar is great - though expect to wait a bit.  Everything else was so-so. The prime rib was a bit too rare for me, but apparently you can have them grill it some more for you (which my aunt did, who knew?).   Overall not a bad buffet experience. I'd go back if I'm in the Mandalay Bay and wanted a massive amount of food ... but otherwise there are other places I'd rather tryout first.

qiTN3Nqf8FAIkSQoOLAZHg.text: I will never come back to this buffet. The food was tasteless. The cuts of meat were dry. The crab legs were too watery, like they had been sitting in water too long. Difinitely not worth the $33 per person. The only reason they get 2 stars is the wait staff was really nice, and did their job well.

3qspsppFMGHqSVgNYVoHPg.text: Despite being someone who never writes reviews, I found myself mortified enough on this occasion to actually write something. We went to the dinner buffet several nights ago.  I noted the plethora of negative Yelp reviews but honestly didn't have time to go to one of the other restaurants at Mandalay.  Didn't think it would be as bad as some of the other reviews indicated. As someone who used to go to Old Country Buffet in the 90s with my family, I found this place very recognizable.  The scant selection, cheap salad bar, tasteless carved meats, greasy selections...all redolent of OCB twenty years ago.  The sushi was overstuffed with rice and unbelievably all cheaply-stuffed with cream cheese.   Except this wasn't OCB in the 1990s.  It was 8.99 with free drinks.  This was the prime time buffet of a five star hotel, roughly 33$ per person.  It is a horrific embarrassment of a dining experience, shameful for an establishment of this caliber.  OCB + cocktail shrimp.

-bUBjggW_cWd3pAw_ztISg.text: OK so their dinner i thought nothing was really special (the only great part is them having all u can drink champagne and wine) but i came here on another day for their brunch and their brunch was really good! I think for the price tag for their brunch it really nailed the spot! The prime rib and the braised ox tail hit the spot BIG TIME! I believe that both of these items are what makes this buffet worth it. The crab for me was too dry but the meats for the most part were tender and juicy! I think the prime rib and the ox tails were the only highlights to this meal, everything else was just mediocre. Service here was great! If you're going to vegas on a budget and still want a buffet i would say check this place out otherwise go elsewhere.

_t8K6MjSvsXC3Rk5Iu1PsQ.text: We've eaten here many times for dinner buffet decent selection , fresh food, nice service....always pleased!

ejgqwZcDpGS0rPPZmE5jeQ.text: Not one of my favorite buffets in Las Vegas.  Maybe it was because I ate on a weekday lunch. The price is great for Vegas ($19.99 per person). They did have prime rib and sushi, which were a plus. And the service was better than I have had compared to other Las Vegas buffets I've eaten. But that was where it ended for me.  Good price but in my opinion not worth the 1.5 hour wait.

2jZgR4dxImeyz371RTmLbQ.text: The service was decent although they waited to seat us even though there was many open tables. Food was OK. If you are looking for a quick eat and mediocre food then come here. However, there are many other better restaurants in the area. The place smelled of smelly seafood.

l9YgYRrVd4gI3jjomRqKNg.text: Overpriced rip off. Its bad enough that they charge $25 for an average weekend lunch buffet, but to throw you out at 3 pm is totally ludicrous.

mvr-aKI3XVDQtP00dF53ZA.text: Bayside Buffet serves great breakfast dishes. We stuffed ourselves silly with eggs (they have at least 3 different kinds including Omellete), Lox, Potatoes, Fruits, Yogurt, Waffles, Pancakes, and other breakfast offerings.  It's nice to go to a buffet that is not super fancy. I know it's a trend right now in Vegas, but sometimes nothing wrong with sticking with basic food and Bayside Buffet is great at doing that.   P.S.: We stopped by at MLife desk and asked if they could give us discount for buffet. The lady at the desk checked my MLife account and gave me $11 voucher. Pretty much I got my breakfast buffet for $4. Pretty good deal I say.

Q_ixd3er7ERVZC9yNMLxZg.text: Ate here with my family last night, as my birthday dinner.....i have to say, all 4 of us were ASTOUNDED at how miserable this buffet was!! Mandalay bay is the first big Hotel on the LAS VEGAS STRIP! not some little rinky dink hotel in the middle of no where, well thats exactly how this buffet represents its hotel! the decor and atmosphere is extreeeeemely dated! it felt like we were back in the 70s. the chairs were all ripped and cracked...but the food.....the food was a sad sad display of what our great city of Las Vegas is! the selection itself is measly...the things offered are also very dated, (a lot of the food even looked very old) the pizza bar had pizza that looked like it was microwaved, 3 days ago....the pasta sauce was  straight out of a can, tasting.....and .it really bothered me too that for being a billion dollar business, the owners of the hotel wont dish out money to get new little name cards for the food items. Most of the name cards were damaged and the names half scratched out....the salad bar was a poor excuse for a salad bar..old wilty cheap lettuce...no mixed greens....  ..over all we were blown away! at spending almost $40 a person this place should not be in Mandalay bay! it deserves to be in some seedy hotel on boulder highway, at best! the owners of Mandalay need to get it together and update this place and hire decent chefs!!

ynLL-_XA5Dw6ZfgWbeyV3A.text: This buffet was absolutely horrible, even by Vegas standards.  Surprising considering the hotel's reputation.  I would not even consider the food on par with golden corral.  Food variety was weak, ribs were overcooked to mush (wasn't even on the bone), shrimp were freezer burnt and sushi was crusty.  The most incredible part was the RAW prime rib.  I'm not talking red rare, the cut was deep purple raw.  The chef apologized to everyone in line and offered to throw the slices on the grill.  I'm guessing they underestimated demand and had to remove many of the roasts almost immediately from the oven.  Service wasn't any better as we were handed off to 3 people and waited 10 minutes to be seated despite there being no line.  Never again

6WG8WrVoxHKImUQe8ymd5Q.text: Came here for Easter brunch...... wow amazed by the prime rib salt rubbed steak...... they will flame broil the steak to what ever cooking level u want from rare to we'll done.... 5 stars for good quality steak....... 2nd the crab legs...... good crab legs hot and cold selection .....this special Sunday the buffet was 34.99 it did include unlimited bud light......Wine... and champagne..... I also tried their pizzas very good quality the mac and cheese was perfect....... cheesy potatoes......line was long but worth it........ if u want good food with good price I recommend I don't know why some people rate this place so low...... I did not try to many salads or pastries....... but the main meals are very flavorful and high quality......  enjoy my friends.....

nRYtzgli3bCvdEoFaFCEhA.text: We came here for breakfast and there was no wait.  However, one table had four people smoking and the server didn't do anything about it.  The service was prompt and the place was clean.  The food was OK for the price.  We'll be back.

pzBokIH0wdYl85fCVBs86g.text: Vegetarians take note: $30 will buy you all the wilty iceberg lettuce, overcooked white rice, baked potato, and oily asparagus your heart desires. Or you can just ask for your money back and go someplace else.

A17s0C_J33LiPIF6qgpd1w.text: They rocked out their buffet with crab legs, prime rib, shrimp, Spanish rice, too long to name.  Needless to say, they had a wine/champagne station!!!  I will go back.

gXpWgvBZPWXXHMOdkLozIQ.text: My suggestion is to walk on over to another Casino.  There are far better buffets than what you will pay for this one. The positives: most of the food was edible, but there was one item my husband had to spit back out.  The only thing worth it was the crab legs, but honestly what decent Vegas buffet doesn't serve crab legs.

DcVxjCDH6Ad-C0Zu6QdEWw.text: Tons of variety and unlimited champagne!!  This was definitely worth the price in my opinion. Some of the food was better than others, but on average everything was good.   They seemed to have almost every type of meat that you can think of and various food genres. The specific night I was here it was american, asian, mexican, and italian. They had a sushi station setup and custom ordered pasta. The dessert bar is also quite extravagant. It was full of various pies, cake, puddings, soft serve ice cream, and cookies, both regular and sugar free.   The only reason why I didn't give this place 4 stars was the table service was a little slow to get things like drinks and extra silverware, but it was no way impactful enough for me to not come back the next time I am here.

chOvORK3KgYNk9vsHNGSHQ.text: Super disappointed that I spent $85 for my husband and I to eat here. Yes, I know that is typical for a buffet, but I've been to cheaper with better food. The crab legs were soggy and the meat inside just fell apart and didn't taste good. I was out of water for a good portion of the meal. I stood at the meat section where they cut you out a portion and was ignored for quite a few minutes before I gave up on getting turkey. After the crab legs, I pretty much lost my appetite. Overall, they were friendly but it was not worth the time or money. I expected better because it was located in Mandalay Bay.

uJm9Inn02Y2GcT48a5iBvA.text: Not fresh , pizza half done and service spotty. The wine package for 10.99 extra was also just meh in terms of wine selection. Would not recommend

eOcmKBYv6no0PiXrpQ-5fQ.text: Over priced. I understand that as a casino you are allowed to charge more because we,the consumers, are willing to pay it. But come on, powdered eggs?? Really?! For $20 you can at least make real eggs.   This place should be last resort. McDonald's serves better food.

7pGGN3KG-nH8gJCNI3D7bQ.text: The food here is plentiful with wide variety.  Just not the best gourmet meal around, but good enough for the price.    Lots of breakfast options

8Eod2gZ551k1hZ5MtYGWyg.text: Wow. This buffet deserves 0 stars. First off, the warrior to enter was over an hour on a Monday night. Next, the selection of dishes was so minimal. The quality was so low. Many of the dishes were cold and rubbery. The price was so high for such a limited quantity and quality of food. Save some time and money and go to a buffet at another Casino. You'll thank me.

2VtYzoahPeUgSkU3xWKleQ.text: Best priced buffet on The Strip and it was really good. Not amazing,  but pretty good. I liked the sushi, carved turkey (soo good) and the mashed potatoes. Not a great selection of soups, but then again, who goes to a buffet for soup?  Dessert was the best part

HN35iFofzS8PnuMB6R6KYg.text: Prison Food? Ok, I was forced to eat dinner here. I had read the bad reviews and knew to stay away. But I had no choice. We ate dinner here or at least tried to. I hope this is as close as I get to knowing what prison food taste like. Seriously worst meal of my life! Stay far away! Mandalay Bay Management needs to eat here! And not the ones who work at the restaurant! If serious changes are not made to meet half way with the competitors like: The Wicked Buffet, World Carnival, Bellagio etc then the Bayside Buffet should be closed! The food had no taste and/or dry and/or ingredients don't mix well together. Are the kitchen staff being forced to cook against their will? That could explain the bad food then! This is a bad reflection on American Buffets. Just think of the poor foreign tourist! My personal favorite buffet is The Wicked Buffet. Oh, And you know how much we spent on this bad meal? $77 including tip! We got robbed!

P4_dQzfaNnlf1WFs08GQvQ.text: The prime rib was great and so were the desserts!

K60ylcJMqCL_1g8Bnt1V5g.text: I only ate here during breakfast and it was a GREAT breakfast!  They had really great steaks and braised short ribs.... and yes I ate those for breakfast! haha

U-EBAzRKY-kPH2XTF65hlg.text: This was a disappointment.  Everything looked good, but when I tried it, all the food on my plate was cold (pasta, fish, etc.).  I ended up eating nothing but the crab legs and mussels because they were okay cold.  It was odd because the crab plate was steaming.  Eventually I figured out that if I dug crab legs out from the bottom of the pile and avoided the legs on top they'd be warm, but by then I was pretty full.  Like all the other buffets we tried in Vegas, they expect you to tip before you are even seated.  If you don't want to give a gratuity for service you have not received and you don't carry cash, the only option you have is to stiff the server.

FvWcTDURgfOh16PUnqm8Ow.text: Good variety, mostly comfort food, nothing fancy, which may be good for those that don't like fancy cuisine. Kid friendly, good prime rib, coffee sucks.

MPybbJRNXB-vzAbaImBRGg.text: Excellent buffet. Warm and cold crab legs available. I personally prefer warm crab legs myslef. Prime rib is delicious. Would eat here agian next year. And they also have a new system that you can buy your buffet dinners through a self kiosk, grab the paid tickets and go straight to the buffet vs waiting in line and paying a worker. Dessert area is also awesoem.

mHP52FyZTASQbb5naDtc1w.text: Wow, this place used to be great.  Huge fried shrimp, hot and cold crab legs, tasty Chinese and Italian.  Now it is just average, and at $30 per person not worth it.  Crab was mealy and tasteless, no fried shrimp, sushi tasted like they bought it at a grocery store.  I would do this buffet for $10 and feel OK about it, but for $30... absolutely not!

TBuzYZfQQRHP7uUH8-_vEQ.text: Not too bad of a buffet here, Top 5 in Las Vegas. I came here real late for dinner when they were near closing, and it was great because the line was short (since it was almost closing time) and i just loaded up on the snow crab legs and had at least 2x the price of the buffet worth just from snow crabs.

GjUfFGx8x_-IFMUYZdpPQQ.text: For the price, not bad.  Request a window seat--it's the only way you'll get one, and the difference in the atmosphere between a window seat and a normal seat is HUGE.

WRiwpIoMU2QT9BLXCfcDDA.text: The restaurant has an unusual practice of letting the world see how much you tip.  You pay when you enter, and after I paid, the cashier wrote the amount of my tip (determined before we sat down) on a receipt in huge black letters with a sharpie.  Then they walked us to the table and left the slip on the table to be collected by our server when she arrived with the tip prominently displayed.  It left the impression that you had better leave a big tip in advance in order to get good service and/or if you leave a bad tip, everybody will know.  For the record, we left exactly 15%.  When I questioned them, they were very defensive and condescending.  Despite the poor start, the food was good and our server was great (and we left an appropriate additional tip).

Ez9VdbO35iG39lMpwwOiWg.text: There are only 3 words to say that sum up in TOTAL what you should do if you are thinking about heading down to the buffet at the Mandalay Bay...and those words are... eat somewhere else.

49Hq2JMusCYZd5qz1bziXQ.text: i'd give this place a 2.5 star rating.  went there for dinner and was expecting to get king crab, but got snow crab instead.  the disappointment didn't stop there.  the chinese food was 2 star and dropping, the salads were straight out of a package from dole or other pkg provider.  nothing was worth a B rating except the service.  No line to enter, and we all know why.  i'd find another place, if i were you.  if you're really desperate and want to save money, Mcdee and Subway is across the street.

NF6qlrNoZaMwfqEGv8UADw.text: Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay is another buffet I like. Its a nice buffet w/ good quality food, nothing too fancy. I  Heard Breakfast is really good, but only went for dinner. Good carving station (Prime rib, Turkey, sausage etc), good selection of foods (pretty big) -like steak/pork, crab legs and other seafood items. Dessert area is pretty good too. Place is a nice, clean,  wide open place.

dZhEg6GSImZtxVrHA7--hQ.text: We had dinner here for my first time (and probably my last) at this buffet. Some people are probably easily fooled into thinking that the food here is really good just because the dining room is so picturesque. I mean it was nice, sitting on the patio with a view, but it pretty much ends there. I must have taken one bite of everything on my plate and pushed it aside. The carrot cake was the only thing that I thought was good enough to finish. It's definitely not worth the wait. For around the same price though, I'd rather be at Paris or the Bellagio buffet.

xa8VO0mkjwgpszVxa8qjdQ.text: i believe i ate three times at this buffet and I've gotta be honest it's fine by my standard. they have quite the selection from Italian, American, and Mexican cuisines. they can also cook your omelet for you if you like, but i believe it's only during breakfast hours (correct me if i'm wrong) the place is kept well, it was clean when me and my friends dined. the service was fine too, no complaints at all. the only con for me is that they ran out of food fast. i sometimes have to wait for the food that i want. definitely a spot that i would hit up if i'm around Mandalay Bay.

ghgyr6VBlB8gmwv7zoC63Q.text: The Bay Area has everything a food lover could want, except for high quality buffets. That's why I always go to the buffets when I'm in Vegas. I'd been to Mandalay's buffet a number of years ago and rated it nearly as good as the Bellagio for quality and variety. Sad to say, the Mandalay Bay buffet was a huge disappointment this week. Black fungus on the stone crab claws, frozen, overcooked to mush vegetables, glutenous fried rice in the Chinese food section, roast chicken quarters that looked dry, the same sparse pieces baking away all night under the heat lamp, butterflied, deep fried prawns with mushy interior, cantaloupe and watermelon on the verge of crossing over to the bad side, chicken cordon bleu that was less flavorful than I can imagine coming from any brand in the Safeway frozen food aisle. Seems like the Mandalay Bay resort has given up on this restaurant. I will not go back.

ZDOCHsHRdqP-GsX7p-aqLA.text: When in Vegas I feel the need to checkout one buffet, went there for breakfast and left feeling pretty disgusted.  Not one memorable item, wait...the grapefruit juice was good.

TYY0F941W5DTLcyQRDyNew.text: I made reservations to eat at this buffet for my wedding reception this pass Saturdady instead of having a sit down dinner. I figure it willbe more worth it and my guests won't complain about not having enough to eat. I had about 70 people in my party so to guarantee that we all sat together, I had to folk up $250 for the deposit which doesn't go towards my food.  Since it was my first meal of my hectic day, I wasn't that hungry so basically I picked at stuff. I definitely got some steam crab legs. They were relly good, not that salty, but some may differ. I had some pasta that was freshly made at the pasta station. I ate some Bourbon beef and it was good since I don't usually eat meat. And I can't remember what I ate before my desserts. I must have not ate a lot, The buffet is setup with three sections, 1 for the meat and stuff, the other for ethnics foods/seafood, and the for dessert. If you didn't know better, you will miss the 2nd section since it is behind a wall. I found that the food was pretty good, for $26.99 a head, it wasn't all that bad. I might have spent more if I chose a sit down dinner.  PROS: -food is good -decent price -very roomy -great service  CONS: -no signs of stating where all the sections were. -had to pay a deposit to reserve seats

vvF_SeubmhfTfzZbPJpZNQ.text: hmmm...  given the way this place looked from the outside, one would expect to be inundated w/ all types of food but alas you aren't!  the food is relagated to one corner of this huge room and the dessert selection was as big as the food selection (which is not necessarily a bad thing but more on that in a bit).  all the selections were average at best with the snow and king crab legs being the only redeeming qualities.  the prime rib was below average and the shrimp was eh.  some of the fruits looked more like they were out of a can than just cut fresh in the back.  the desserts tasted like they were all made from a duncan hines batter.  only the peach cobbler was alright but that was once again made from a peach in a can (i could make a reference to the song peaches by the presidents of the united states of america, but i won't...but i just did...oh well)

JZBxk9J3YQE_u5IGKwgBtg.text: The dinner buffet was about $30. The alaskan king crab legs were great, big pieces of crab, shells sliced in half extremely easy to get the meat!!, served cold, tasted great either dipped in hot butter, or drizzled with freshly squeezed lemon.  The prime rib was fairly good for a buffet. Desserts were good.  This gets 4 stars for the great crab legs!

xeBVBzsrkRruRi1E3ErrdQ.text: Beyond aweful. There was nothing edible. By far the  worst food I have ever had. We went because we were in a rush. Definitely did not expect it to be so bad.

ugFo-Ppcg-5WoyYs_2H9yQ.text: This buffet had quite the assortment of food. We only went for breakfast but appreciate the variety. Service was great and buffet area was kept very clean.

vzTreVINwNXGXq8s8xO6-w.text: Been here twice, they offered good food. The service was outstanding. Crabs and desserts were my faves. Price is reasonable. But, parking is not free. Overall, great place to stay if you feel hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chop Gourmet
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet dessert  key lime piecarrot cake

JATvyc1M6YLYidED_ZXNMA.text: Given this is my third meal here during this stay (and I got one more to go), it warrants a review.  If what you have in mind is a grand spread like Bellagio or Wynn, or Ceasars, it's a far cry.  Think more like when a hometown diner puts up a sign for "all you can eat" and adds some cheap $7.99 platter of late night Vegas style prime rib and super skinny crab legs.    That said, it's a very convenient place if you're staying here to grab a quick light bite.  Yes, light, because since thanks to the warning of other yelpers I had appropriately lowered my expectations significantly, and can appreciate that I can get some steamed rice with lightly stir-fried or steamed veggies, and some meats that don't come with sauces, and platters of fresh fruits and berries in the morning.  You need a few light healthy meals while experimenting with all the amazing food options here, this isn't a bad place to make a pit stop.  I should mention though that's also because we're staying here, and they've included 2 buffets for every night of our stay... else I may have a very different opinion at $29.99 a brunch.  On the bright side... no 2 hour lines either, just walk right in!  The deals on the Mandalay Bay website, highly recommend it if you're staying over the holidays and it'll at least get you a convenient meal for free.  One more meal here to go... I'll post pictures tomorrow.  Another thing worth mentioning is that the service is really friendly, and people are very nice here.  Will be back... tomorrow!

ZMjCvEP-Bn7ERkcxO0Q4oQ.text: Lunch/brunch review.  For $25 and some change, it's not bad at all.  If the price exceeds that range, I wouldn't come back, unless the food quality and options rise.  The food is no doubt tasty, but I wouldn't say fresh.  After some heavy proteins, I wanted something light and refreshing with a crisp texture...so I went to the salad bar.  I had to sort out through the salads to pick out the foul pieces.  Nevertheless, everything else was pretty good and tasty. I do favor inexpensive buffets with no lines while the food being atleast decent.  The hot coffee was good and a nice touch at the end of my meal.  I stayed at the Delano, so it was a quick and easy access to a decent buffet.  I was satisfied.

K6mBBGsHAAkc9MoCupgIOg.text: Just awful. I expected so much more considering it was at Mandolay Bay.  I had been here once before, years ago, and remembered it much differently.  The food selection was very limited, and the quality of what they did offer was very poor /dried out and tasteless.   The seafood was not very fresh. The pizza was hard yet greasy. The sushi was mushy.  The carnitas were super dry and the tortilla was so old it actually made a sound as I tapped it on the table.   I could go on, but why bother giving anymore time to this place as I feel it's already taken up far too much. Even it being free courtesy of my husbands Mlife comps, it was still way too much for so little.    The one thing I will say is our server Todd was great. He was attentive and always ready to clear away dirty plates and offer refills on my drink. This one star by no means reflects on him personally. Here's a tip Todd - find a new job. Your better then this place !

eWI6kdO0UlAjKS4bYSgLuA.text: After going to the Caesar's this place doesn't come close. Their buffet had very little meat. Their sushi was pre packaged. I mean it's ok I am a little iffy if I'd go back. Staff was great.

ehSB1LwME47-9ghOKkt2zg.text: Had the breakfast. It was good. Lots of choices. Definitely didn't leave hungry. Didn't have to eat until 5 that evening. A bit pricey but I guess you have to pay for quality.

0QtY8G6GVhFdH3Z1sCf7Kw.text: Went in for lunch and was extremely disappointed in the selection. All of the food tastes and looks like cheap microwaveable meals. If you're looking for good food, I would not come to this buffet.

ZPIAhQOqqxWPUgl8aUBN_Q.text: I visited this location a few days ago on June 7th because I was staying at Delano. I am very loyal to the MGM brand and usually only stay at Signature when I travel to Vegas. After my experience here, I sadly have to say this was by far the worst experience I have ever had at a Food and Beverage establishment.   I was seated immediately after arriving and went immediately to get food. We received our drinks and from that moment forward, our server did not stop by our table once. There was 2 of us in a small table, so once we finished our first plate, we placed them to the side. We got up and grabbed some finger foods in the meantime since we were out of drinks. Our plates didn't get picked up for over 20 mins and our server was assisting his other tables but just ignoring ours. He looked at our table, which we thought was an indication that he saw everything and never came back. The manager walked by our table and picked up our plates. We finished our plate of finger food and I walked over to the host and informed him of the situation. They said they would send over our server and he again never came. We got up after 15 mins of waiting for our server to come, after we had asked, and left. The most frustrating part about it all, was the fact that other tables were being assisted and ours wasn't.   I spoke with the manager and in the time that we waited for the manager, our plates and drink cups remained untouched. This was well over an hour at this point. The manager said she would refund our buffets (1 paid for and 1 comp). It showed on my room charge that the one I paid for was refunded but according to the MLife desk, I couldn't get my comp back. This was very upsetting but oh well what can I do? We ended up going to a different buffet after this and had a much better experience. It was like night and day!   I will be returning to stay at Delano again. But I honestly am unsure whether I will be returning to the buffet after that experience. I will most likely take the time to walk to a different property to eat at their buffets to avoid another experience like this one.

_TrpoEi46xNv1jYiVkWH2g.text: This place has jumped the shark.  The food quality has dropped along with the selection.  The only thing that is up is the price.  Over $75 for two people, with out and adult beverages.  They swapped the snow crab for Dungeness crab.  The food is warmed over and overcooked.  Even the most simple things like ice cream is poor quality.  Time to find a new favorite buffet, as this one is not it.

MFeC4kffA_4VXQwM3G5_Hg.text: Went there for brunch and food was good! Great selection and variety of food. Staff was very nice. Loved the oxtail they served.

tHfp5B9e16qfO11YdourPw.text: We came back here yesterday for lunch.  The staff and the manager ( Mel Algre ) greeted us warmly and even escorted us in our table. Great part is they seated us beside the window by the pool area.   Server was so courteous.  Even they have full pack on brunch they still manage to see what we need.  The food is still the same taste i ate last time.  The osubuco lamb was perfect from the meat so tender and the sauce just perfectly right.  Snow crab legs or opillo they do have warm and cold as well.   The prime rib got an option if you satisfy for medium rare to well done.   Sushi platter is okay.  Desserr section is perfect too. They have my chocolate rasberry cake ready.  Will keep coming for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib only @ Bayside Buffet
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

0QCdqMX3dDGqSoqXlqo-qw.text: For the price I'd say this place was very disappointing.  It's on par with a Golden Corral.  Maybe even worse because some of the food on the buffet was really old.  The sushi was the worst sushi I've ever eaten, dry and no flavor. Only good thing was the dessert selection.  I would not go back.

N4bgh3G8QPMngcU-xml0qQ.text: Really solid buffet a clear four stars. Great crab and lots of fish options. High quality meats and sides. The deserts were fine as well. For an extra 10.99 you can get bottomless wine and beer.

LR1LuYGw1unwtfpjjgxhuA.text: Used to go to Bayside Buffet back in 2015 and the food and experience was great. Just went Sunday 9/30/2018 and was surprised there was no wait. there is usually a 30 minute wait. We found out why.  The food was not as used to be. Just thrown together an put on the line. The Cream Cheese was in hard to open packets instead of the normal serving pan. She smoked Salmon wasn't laid out as in the and NO CRAB LEGS OR CLAWS ANYMORE!!! 64.00 for 2 and extra for Champagne.  Never again!

dt3mWAjKEDjsGgOREwqdWg.text: The pasta station here is LEGIT. Amazing. One of the best. I would have been happy with just that pasta for dinner.   The dessert spread is one of the worst Vegas has to offer. I almost want to take away their buffet license for such a shitty dessert spread.   - 1 star for shitty dessert spread.   But the pasta on its own can save the night. Just get dessert after you leave the buffet. ;)

1_Vg2THxXBHXGke2LCILJQ.text: Pricier than you'd expect. We paid $32.00 per person for dinner. The reason why we selected it was because they have seafood most of the time. I had crab and shrimp and my boyfriend had steamed mussels and crusted salmon. The prime rib was just ok. Kids has the meatballs, dumplings and some sushi and Chinese food. They were both also just as disappointed. The corn was extremely soggy and the rolled tacos were stale. The chocolate mousse was good. We've been to a lot of different buffets here and this isn't one to write home about. Nothing food wise really stood out. The restaurant doesn't have much of a view, was dirty every where. The was crab legs on the floor next to and under a lot of tables, dirty dishes, dirty rags and dirty areas everywhere you looked. The waitress was very helpful and was as tentative as much as she could be for her area. Very nice woman. We won't be going back.

HFOPgZKoFGCfhgsd5iYgbg.text: First time and the food was horrible. Customer service was horrible as well. The food was all hard and dry. The workers don't bother to ask if everything is fine or if we need anything. They ignore you at its finest. I rather eat at the buffet in Excalibur hotel, their food is not dry and it's not hard.

aFC2CggAQ7MjjcfFaWJxsg.text: The worst buffet in Las Vegas.  Very poor quality food - Prime rib was overcooked and flavorless - "Sushi" consisted of some rolls with as best I could tell no fish, wasabi that was the consistency of soup, and some smoked salmon leftover from the breakfast buffet - Fruit was not fresh and was rind on for the watermelon with almost no fruit ... mostly rind - Shrimp looked okay, but when I tasted one bite I could not eat any more as it was not fresh  Poor service - I included a tip with the buffet purchase, but still had to chase down a server twice just to get a glass of water  Poor atmosphere - Giant area of nondescript tables ...  This buffet is overpriced and bland in all respects.  Go elsewhere!

jH1U4MgzReO8O8O3MxaDjw.text: My wife and I stayed at the Mandalay Bay over the Mother's Day. During this stay we decided to try out the buffet, thinking that it must be good food if it's here. Unfortunately, it couldn't be farther from the truth. Where do I start? 1..The pot stickers were harder than a rock. 2. The baked salmon tasted really fishy. 3. The ice cream tasted like crush ice with no flavor. 4. The chocolate cake was the opposite of fresh. 5. The cheesecake has been out for so long it was discolored and rubbery. BTW...I would have given this place only one star, but our server was exceptional.

eFA-JKvJa71yKqSO6tzl9g.text: Nothing spectacular but the shrimp was good. Mandalay could do a much better job. The sushi area said "assorted sushi". No names, descriptions and they didn't have small bowls for the soy sauce/wasabi.

R0ywOKJfYals3acLMx0qqg.text: Three (2 adults and 1 child) of us ate at the buffet last night and it cost almost $100...not worth it!  The food was fine, but nothing amazing. Typical buffet food, which is to be expected, but for that much money...we were looking for something special.  The highlight was the unlimited champagne, wine, and beer for $7.99.  That I do recommend!

qatNkoeSiSMqeqhH4fpTbA.text: Customer service the worse   we paid they set us our waitress took almost 25 to get to our table I almost star my plate  without no ketchup no Tabasco sauce. No glass of water  or orange juice but the hostess   & waitress was talking. About personal stuff I have to get up & ask her for my service.  She came & desapier again talking. Now to another waiter.  Not good at all until respect full

NcushHSyQE8w6evAfttwVA.text: I went with my hubby to Mandalay Bay brunch buffet $25.00 on a Sunday.  It's average buffet.  They make omelets, bbq ribs, roast beef, Chinese food, scrambled eggs, bacon, turkey bacon, sausages, rolls, crab legs, fruit,  oatmeal, grits, cerals boxes, desserts, etc. Our waitress was nice with good on refills.  No lines and they offer self online registers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dessert
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lUPH-hDdEXFAjSoh9fbbyw.text: "Once again I found myself on my own and going to my mother's annual turkey curry buffet. Every year she tries to fix me up with some bushy-haired, middle-aged bore, and I feared this year would be no exception." -- Bridget Jones's Diary (2001)  So disappointing.  Our last morning at the hotel in Vegas and looking for food before the flight home - a long day.  We wanted something in the hotel and easy, so the buffet seemed to fit the bill. It was a decent price and had a wide variety. They let us look at the spread before paying to make sure we were interested. The buffet looked good and we had just missed the cheaper price (breakfast). But, in 30 minutes the food would be changing over, so we decided to go for it.  We paid, came in and sat down.  Our waiter took drink orders and off we went.  There were breakfast items still and some lunch items were starting to come out - but some of the labels were wrong.  I got a plate of breakfast items and went back to the table.  The waiter brought coffee and waters (iced tea for one of us).  Unfortunately, the coffee was bitter - no amount of cream and sugar would help.  The breakfast items were pretty good - eggs, corned beef hash, bacon and blintzes. After I finished my small plate, I went back for lunch items - it was after 1130 - so the new items should be out.  Well, they were, but nothing was labeled. A chef was walking around and slowly adding the signs.  I slowly walked around and got items that were labeled (or were obvious).  There were items like lasagna and meat balls and then a large Chinese section (orange chicken, sweet and sour pork, fried rice, dumplings, stir fry veggies, etc) and char siu bao.  So everything I got was okay so-so. The steamed pork bun was good on the inside, but the dough was wrong on the outside. Never let the white-folk make the Asian food.  I can hear my sister-in-laws Mom telling me that I shoul not have expected much.  Anyway, the food did not sit well in my stomach the rest of the day and on my flight.  Not a buffet I would go to again and certainly not worth the price. But in a pinch, if it was your only choice, give it a shot.  My standards are just higher than theirs.

9HOkfnqgmSEp5DCK-vgylQ.text: Horrible, don't waste your time. Nothing to choose from and it all looks old. Omelette station sucks. Only meat they had was ham..... that's it. No fresh hash browns they had tater tots.... really? Tater tots. Surprised they didn't have pop tarts, really, it was that bad. Go to MGM buffet instead. It ROCKS, brisket, Tri-Tip steak, fresh everything and it's $5 less than this dump.

4Q1R9x_KmM1hes9VpL3_6g.text: Cheap. And for good reason. You get what you pay for. I had the new york steak, cheese lasagna, lamb osso bucco, swai fish rolls, sushi, trout in the asian section, pork carnitas, beans.... none of those mentioned were good. All fell flat in terms of taste, it was all just sad really. They couldnt even cook corn right. Tasted weird said my 3 year old foodie. The only thing that maybe was good was their pasta alfredo. Apart from that, just not worth the money. Go someplace else... drive to chinatown and get much better food for reasonable prices.

L28XXCzUhgC65NZ-rlhXbQ.text: Three star is a fair assessment for this Buffet.  $21 per person for lunch.  You can buy meal ticket with credit cards at the Kiosks at the entrance and skip the line of cash payment.  A wide range of selections: seafood, Italian, Mexican, Chinese, fruits and salad bar, breakfast items, bakery and desserts...  I like buffet because there's something for everyone.  And my favorite must-haves are: lox, shrimp cocktail, and cheesecakes.  This one had all.  However, lox and shrimp cocktail were a bit chewy, so were some of the meats.  The desserts were great though.  Decent services.  Drinks came right away.  Dirty plates were taken away fast.  I would probably come back on a very hungry morning, when the line of waiting is not unbearable.

ZV3QpVqVUXnQtVhV5lcBtw.text: I attended a conference at Mandalay Bay on Wednesday.  Two business associates and I were starving at 1 PM and needed a place to eat.  All of the usual places (Fleur, etc.) had a 45 minute+ wait.  Even the Food Court by the convention center was packed.  Bayside Buffet was dead quiet with plenty of seating.  Despite the fact that the buffet is $26 per person for lunch (WOW!) we chose to give it a try.  First I grabbed what they labeled tomato soup.  It turned out to be the worst carrot soup I have ever tried.  2 spoons of it and that was enough.  I then made a basic salad.  It was pretty fair and the options were mediocre to say the least.  My local supermarket has  better options.  I then tried some panko crusted fish that was inedible.  Service was tough as we struggled to get a drink for someone in my party.  The booth we chose was comfortable and the place was a quiet respite from the convention floor.  So I did relax and the food was edible.  Would I come here again?  No.  Even if it is a business expense I will never justify $26 for this again.

BPA44rio8gaP77y6-1qhng.text: Tried the buffet despite the mediocre reviews. We were hungry after a 4 hr drive and 2 hrs in the pool and didn't feel like hunting down something in the heat. We got there at 6 and not a lot of people were there, usually a bad sign. Turns out they had a great selection of food and everything was presented well. Service was excellent, again not crowded. Nice mix of expected food; seafood, prime rib, pizza and pastas were augmented with surprises like ossobuco, oxtail stew and pork buns. On the pricey side but we enjoyed our meal more than the reviews would lead you believe.

shUiSPE3F_SUDeVyUXVNdQ.text: You know at Vegas that a lot of Buffets are available and most of them are near the gambling floors so smoke travels thru but not at this place.  It was clean and the food was kept fresh.  The chief was on the floor sampling everything and was keeping the place up to his standards.  I like the fact that at your table you had a server to get you drinks and treat it like a restaurant.  This was a spot I would go back to with free beer and wine!

A3K5sq3VbFRMeQh3K8oyLQ.text: "This chocolate cake is amazeballs" "I had no idea that my champagne glass refills like magic" "These crab legs are fantastic but a lot of work" "The orange chicken is awesome. Like from China!" "Ew, I don't like painted food." The chocolate was amazing.   Clyde was an amazing server, making sure that the glasses were filled, the table was clean and very fun to talk to.

cACpEofjERoVTh4rlRAJuA.text: Food was good but not the best. Server did a great job with getting drinks and plates out the way. But wouldn't recommend going there.

gz2pDBrNVjKauOENZKZA_A.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. Don't come here !! WORST BUFFET EVER!!! No food choices, pans are empty & most of the food that's available is dried out and overly salted. Seriously for the price don't come here. Waste of money and time.

Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross food and not many choices. How can you dry out a dumpling and pork loin !! Seriously?!

bV5YcMFzDMLU8ueTgEb6zA.text: I sat here and drowned in my sorrows for about 2 hours. Really good food and friendly service. The biscuits and grave were easily the best part

-r0De2FPbubKb3D3b5KWZA.text: The selections of dishes offered have minimal variety, especially compared to the other buffets.   The quality of the food is basic :/. At best, it tastes like good cafeteria food.   However my biggest complaint is that both my sister and I got food poisoning after eating there for brunch/lunch. I think it was the crab legs (which were dry and salty) :( :(

J05RCtjSIb_C9USwSfuBBA.text: Great food endless mimosas had a great time with my family will defiantly come here next time

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wppi9U2jiNbnt3DMsHHkYQ.text: The lack of a line on a Friday night warned me that I probably was not going to happy.  If this were a $15 buffet, I would understand the limited selection but it is not $15.  It is $36 and not worth it.  I have been to many other Las Vegas buffets, this is proably at the bottom of my list. The selection for all areas was poor.   The food seemed to be old.  It was sitting in the serving trays for too long.  This is probably because their wasn't a large crowd eating everything. Therefore it didn't need to be replaced.

5lDWFx7EoV27ji1OwpLNrw.text: I wish I would have listened to these reviews! Loved our stay at Mandalay Bay and decided to give the breakfast buffet a try since we wouldn't have to leave the hotel and we were checking out already.  The one star is for the amazing servers that greeted us inside. They were awesome and they made the experience a little less worse with their warm greetings and smiles. Now as for the cashier at the front, she was extremely rude! I get that there are 2 separate lines for Mlife and non Mlife members but she completely brushed us off as soon as an M life member approached the line. I understand what she said about M life members having some sort of priority, but she definitely could have went about it a different way instead of screaming at us "they're VIP!"  I will never ever go back.  As for the food, definitely not worth the $70 we paid for a family of 4. The French toast was hard! I tapped it on my plate, that's how hard it was. I thank our wonderful server! I wish I would have gotten her name! She was amazing!  Mandalay Bay- awesome hotel. Buffet- needs work!

xH8kCk4APwP5Kzcv_W2z9w.text: This was my first vegas buffet spot many moons ago which made me come back once more. Their sunday bottomless mimosas are always a fave. Their dessert choices weren't as varied as MGM's but their entrees were OMGSOGOODIWANNAGOBACKFORSECONDS good. The downside, the wait can get to be RIDICULOUSLY long!

v4ScjnvmI1BCpSMvUbo1sA.text: Bayside Buffet's food seems better since the recent remodel. I wouldn't have given them more than three stars, if that, a couple of years ago, but they have definitely stepped things up in an apparent attempt to live up to the flash of those colored lights and automated kiosks out front. They do eggs/omelets very well, and the meat selection is good. Lots of crab legs. Desserts are hidden on the far side of the dining room, but they are worth the walk. Like most buffets in Las Vegas, they can occasionally leave foods out too long - they either continue to cook in the trays and get too hard or they don't get enough heat and get cold. It's a juggling act for the staff.  The dining room is tropical and nicely decorated.  Bayside is far better than the wretched MGM Grand buffet - within the MGM family it is on a par with the offerings at Mirage and Treasure Island, and a notch or two below Bellagio.

z0KWKFM4GSc9zM--kWW0ow.text: We decided to try the $35 - eat all day deal just for fun.  Not the best idea - very full!!  Breakfast was pretty good - the usual omelettes, waffles, bacon, fruit, etc.  Bagels were cold and hard, but the smoked salmon was good - wish they had a toaster!  Good pastries hidden in the back!    Lunch and dinner were very similar.  Mostly the same things, except more seafood at night.  Dinner (Saturday) was really busy - had to wait in long lines, just to see what they had.  Braised short ribs were really good.  I thought the prime rib was too salty for me.  Crab legs were good.  Fried shrimp, baked salmon were excellent.  Rolls were also cold and hard, and the butter was frozen.  They need to warm up their bread products!!  Sushi was so-so.  They also had pizza, asian food (potstickers were good!), various meats, Mexican, etc.    I would go there again, but NOT for 3 meals a day!! But it was a good bargain, so what the heck, right?

VYqtr1d60qbPyfBV2nJZPA.text: Went here twice for breakfast -- huge variety and quite tasty!  Almost all buffets I've been to have bland and boring food since they have to mass produce the dishes.  This one was delicious!  Highly recommend!

XGlNFvnPonhX6TNrAcvJpw.text: Food was not good at all.  For the price I'd rather eat at other buffets.  Should have known when there was no line to get in.

1JLAKCBo9G_yUzQf11puvA.text: We had sunday lunch here a few months ago.. I remember it like yesterday and i'd rather not. Nothing else in the Mandalay Bay appealed to me. Everything seemed so fancy and overpriced. Nothing called to me except this place. Eek. I was wrong. There were lots of meat dishes, few veggies besides the salad bar. lots of breads and even more desserts. I liked that they had sugar free options, that was nice, but neither SF nor regular desserts tasted very good, but it was pretty... just very pretty and bland. Seemed almost to have no taste? hmmm. I would not go back.  My bf went again recently but he coudlnt remember if he'd had it before..but he came home and said he'd eaten at a place that was horrible @ the Mandalay Bay. When we went to the strip recently on a fight night we parked @ Mandalay Bay b/c MGM was super packed and didnt even want to risk trying to find parking there and he recognized it like a becon in the night! "That's It!, That's the place that I ate @ that was horrible!" ....heck even Sam;s club and the Orleans had better food for much cheaper prices.

A7ea58h1v9ZZ4vW0ELDcyg.text: Dinner was better than lunch.  Crab legs!  Prime Rib!  Free beer and wine!  Everything I tried was yummy!  I had the tomato bisque soup, which was good.

ekreJj6akYaXcHx1Tz6OhA.text: We have made a few bad buffet choices on our recent trip to Vegas.   On our last day we walked by Bayside Buffet at our hotel (Mandalay Bay) and decided will give it a try. They have an all you can eat -all day- for $35 per person The food was very delicious and refreshing compared to the other 2 buffets we ate at earlier that week (Excalibur and Sahara-were a real crap shoot!!!)  The crab for dinner was awesome and super fresh.  It was definitely worth our money to eat there!!!  The only think I would say is it that the desserts were not as good as the buffet at MGM Grand. Although the ice cream and waffle cones were great!!! But overall this was a good experience.

oQAnjCtoFssRe7YzEgPEWg.text: This buffet...in the land of buffets....is pretty standard. Hubby and I were able to walk in and be seated fairly quickly for dinner. The dishes they had weren't bad...but nothing really stuck out either. The carved station featured both prime rib and turkey. The prime rib was a bit overdone for my tastes...but it didn't have bad flavor. The turkey was pretty good and the hubby really loves turkey. (He was deprived turkey as a kid at Thanksgiving and other holidays...as his family doesn't like it, so he goes ga-ga for turkey) They did have king crab legs as well as snow crab...I of course went for the king crab and he surprised me and went for the snow crab. The king crab legs were kind of mushy...and just not very flavorful...kind of a bummer for me. He was busy cracking away at his snow crab...and offered me a bite of it. Wow...stand out of the evening! I shamelessly ditched my sad, tasteless plate of king crab legs...and bee-lined it to the snow crab. So sweet, so flavorful...really melt in your mouth goodness in a shell. After indulging in more snow crab than I probably should have, we perused the dessert section. They offered a ton of items including sugar free items...sadly nothing was remarkable.  Service was kind of a miss for us that night. At first the hubby ordered pineapple juice and water...he got his water.....and it took 3 times of us asking for the pineapple juice before it finally arrived. I sat with empty water and soda for a while...but we noticed our poor server had the party from hell...(20 top.....with 15 kids) So we definitely cut him major slack for that and once we got refills and the pineapple juice the service kind of picked up...plates removed promptly enough given the circumstance. All in all it was just "a-ok" with only a few dishes being good-great and the rest kind of ....in the middle. I don't think we would return to this buffet only because the vast amount of food in Vegas...but it was cheap eats and a nice time with my guy.

plo0wwWAd6CzMhopuyTV_w.text: Is it me or does the set up and decor remind you of a Soup Plantation? I'll leave it at that and let you come to your own conclusion about the food and service here.

U0q7FK2_URfM_cF1O6NkMA.text: Will keep this short.  Back from 3 days and nights of Super Bowl  carousing in Vegas, seems like we wind up doing 2 buffets a day when I am with the guys.  We hit Bellagio, Paris and Mandalay Bay buffets.  All I can say is this one can be missed.  Two stars for the food, one star for Lena, a beautiful waitress who was the best I have ever encountered at a buffet.  Attentive to every need, kept it all moving, plates cleared, always asking what we needed, why is she even working there. I digress, skip this buffet and head for Paris buffet.

Z2TYR1_dOL1na-IFavjyBw.text: I'm a VEGAN and ended up here by accident one night, sure I was going to be eating lettuce. I asked the server if someone knew if any of the dishes were vegan and she brought me out the HEAD CHEF who gave me a personalized tour of the entire buffet and let me know what was in each dish. He was amazing, and I've never been able to eat like that at a buffet. Many of their dishes were made with canola oil instead of butter and there were loads of options, especially in the asian food section.  Yes, there's plenty of meat and sea food too.

8zSCVXTZxvmXtiLKv7v-Lw.text: Had dinner here tonight.  $26.99.  It was a nice buffet with a nice dining room and view of the pool area.  Everything I tried was good, but nothing just stood out as absolutely great.    They had both hot crab legs (that you crack yourself) and the cold ones that are already cut in half.  Many other dishes to choose from as well.  The deserts were very good.     I noticed that they close this buffet down between lunch and dinner times, so you can't come a little early, pay the lunch price, and have the dinner offerings.    I'd certainly go back if in the area, but I think I liked the Bellagio buffet a little better.

i_zYC08s3whTU8oLf-OUcA.text: Not very good. Went for lunch and didnt really like any of the food too much. Tried seafood, chinese, salads, breads. Chicken Kiev was ok. Desserts were of a higher quality than the food, not too bad. Service was weak even for a buffet. Unpleasant staff sat us and cleared trays.

OJk5_HHmEy9qyjoi0mZH9w.text: The all you can eat buffet is the best.  I love the hot all you can eat CRAB!  They don't have the all day pass anymore which was a disappointment.  Overall my family enjoyed it!   Thank you!

RwbDPU8hRJ23uejtbnMkfA.text: The food is right above average, striking just below the "appetizing" mark.  It's pricey to get in, but I guess it's fine.  For plate 1, I had the prime rib, the salmon, the shrimp, and the rice. I know it doesn't seem like much, but I had more later. The prime rib I had was thick. The little edges of fat gave the prime rib some flavor, but overall, it was a little bland. The salmon was well..... salmony? The shrimp is fried shrimp you know, just battered and fried shrimp.  Plate 2! I had the crab legs only. OK, I know I don't eat much at buffets, but the dessert is an exception. The crab legs were not chilled; they were actually quite warm. They were salty, but really delicious. If only I had the stone crab claws. I had sampled one and it was DELISH!  Dessert! I had the chocolate mousse cup, a chocolate chip cookie, a piece of passion fruit cake, and the sugar free strawberry cake.   Dieters beware! Every sweet indulgence at Mandalay Bay will gain you some weight! The chocolate chip cookie was THE BOMB. The cakes were...Meh. The chocolate mousse was heaven in a little cup. Savory, sweet, it's all you can ask for in a dessert.  A view of the Mandalay Bay Beach, nice waiters and waitresses, decent food, and somewhat decent prices make the Bayside Buffet a place you don't want to miss.

0ZVIo2gcL_r9P-eB7EA6EA.text: Not worth $30 at all...  Food was ok, not bad.  Dessert bar was like that at a cheap no name buffet.  I would rather pay $30 at the Flavors Buffet at the Harrahs and maybe $20 for this buffet...

R7SNZ0lDBv1rzcFmKOBosg.text: Came here for a free lunch at about 11am. There was both breakfast and lunch food available. No line to get in. Quick seating. Friendly staff. Huge pieces of tender and juicy prime rib, smooth and not too salty mashed potatoes, savory beef gravy, brussels sprouts, soft and creamy small cheesecakes for dessert. A really good meal. The only thing I missed was some shrimp as an appetizer.

hrURGD65Y3P226i0rQoX6g.text: Good buffet. THE VARIETY IS NOT TOO MUCH. I mean, there's enough. But it is not too much, agreed by my mother and father.  Good food. I loved their fish. Good range of desserts. Not the best buffet on the Strip. but worthy of eating there. I enjoyed it. You will, too. It is good. I liked it, but I wouldn't go to it a 2nd time if i return to Vegas. Try other buffets a 2nd time. It's good though. I did like it.   Nice looking restaurant. I just think they could have had more food. THe food tasted good though. I give it 4 stars. :-)

57Oc-uTlq5EcJKzuAhDQDA.text: Yay!  I stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay once every 3-4 months for a long weekend, and always eat several meals at this buffet.  I really like the fact that it has windows overlooking the palm-studded pool area, a rarity in this town of indoor, windowless restaurants.  The food has unfortunately been going downhill for the last few years, but I noticed on this last visit that the quality has been improved.  They have brought back the strawberries, and the larger, peeled shrimp.  The crab legs are also better quality than they have been.  The fried shrimp are also better, with less batter and a good dipping sauce.  Score!  If they would only bring back the homemade granola with pistachio nuts...

dPBZ39cp90dgzaGTsspfZg.text: Anyone who gives this more than 1 star is still drunk from the night before. EVERYTHING is pathetic. People think all you can eat is worth a good review? Please. Get some taste. The waffles were either hard or soggy and tasteless. The bacon was a grease pile of fat, everything else is dried out or overcooked or tasteless. (La Quinta gives you fresher waffles for FREE with a $89 room.) Home fries were frozen patties, and pastries were stale and store bought, you can see the boxes!  Save the $25 per person and eat ANYWHERE else. Trust me on this one, there is NO reason to come here. Go to Red White and Blue or Raffles or just anywhere else... nothing was fresh or worth the wasted time here.

9qVyrjMeBUERTOXwJztXdQ.text: Small buffet but it's decent. Wasn't too happy with the prime rib. Seemed more like overcooked roast beef. Liked the swedish meatballs but didn't want to feel up on them. I prefer how the Mirage's Buffet cuts the crab legs in half so you can easily scoop out the meat. Here you have to work at getting it out. The bread pudding was good. Husband loved some toffee cookie they had.

8AqtKu3e96xou85i019KTQ.text: Bayside Buffet on Mandalay Bay Casino really upgraded this buffet. We went a few years ago and it was terrible. We read they had changed it and decided to give it a try, esp since the line was not long. We ate the lunch buffet on a Friday and it was excellent. Granted there was not a 300+ item selection like the fancier buffets, but they had enough good food. Great carved meat selection, italian selection, and other items. Also, had a new dessert bar, not a lot of choices, with personal service and great selection. Very good! Definitely will go back.

o0cRJLJVBmwKonJrIZtqSQ.text: I would've given 5 stars if the crab legs weren't dry as hell! We went to the buffet with our in-laws (from California). Personally I had better crab legs at Santa Fe buffet for an additional $7.99!! They were so much fresher and juicier there!! I grew up with a massive lake on one side and the ocean on the other. I know my seafood, and if you're going to pay for seafood, it shouldn't be dry as hell!!

HZJQjheZLtDG9HskJcMCCQ.text: We had myVegas reward points to redeem at this buffet, so we decided to try the brunch/lunch on a weekday. The breakfast was okay and tasted like any other breakfast place like IHOP or Denny's. However, they do have delicious lox and crepes. The wait for the brunch was not too long and the service was excellent. The waitress for our table was very helpful and attend to our needs frequently. I would like to try their dinner buffet next time.

U_Rj_8PfdWBpTIwOd2GW-g.text: I was excited about trying a Vegas buffet I have heard so much about. I was beyond disappointed by the quality of food that I found at the Mandalay bay buffet. Every food item was basically room temperature. The food items were not labeled correctly and I almost ate pork which I do not eat for dietary restrictions because it was not labeled correctly. Even the basic desserts ( i.e. Chocolate cookies) seemed stale and/or with after taste. I would recommend spending a few extra $ and trying a better buffet place. The only reason I gave this place an extra star is because our waitress was very attentive.

iBVTgUXDiQ9c15a7TGqE4g.text: I was not overly impressed with this buffet.  While the price was good, the selections seemed really slim overall. The smoked salmon was the most memorable part of it for me as it as actually cooked/smoked salmon (not the raw sashimi style you see in most buffets). I'd never had it actually as cooked before until here.  The biggest foul for me was I couldn't find the deserts. I don't know if this is because I will still drunk from the Criss Angel show or if I was just not finding it. Usually the desert area is easy to find but alas it escaped me and I went without such.  Ambience wise, the place is really great if you get a window side table. It has its quality to add to the atmosphere.  In the end, not an overly memorable experience. Good for a one time sit down but next time you'll probably want to hit one of the actual restaurants instead.

rMG4keynK-l0I8K6gdk3IA.text: This is the only buffet I have ever tried in Vegas; I've been here 3 times and I love it!  I LOVE sitting by the windows. On a sunny day it's wonderful to feel the warm sun shining on your hungover, pounding head as you sit there, sans makeup, with your sunglasses on sipping a mimosa (or a bloody mary). Just make sure to guard the blinds/shades with your life or some family with children will come sit nearby and make the servers close them.  PEOPLE: If you don't want the sun on you or your stupid brats, sit AWAY from the windows. I understand when the place is full, and there's no place else to sit. Otherwise, sit in the shade and do not ruin my breakfast. I was here first, DO NOT TAKE AWAY MY SUNSHINE!!!   The food is good. Some of the stuff is icky (french toast, sushi is subpar), but a lot of it is VERY good (chicken fried steak, build your own omelet, all the breads).   Mon-Sat it's $15/person, but Sunday it's $25/person (not including drinks/mimosas). Also, during "the holidays" it's $25/person everyday which SUCKS....it was disappointing cuz really, that is the only reason I sleep in Vegas: it's to wake up in the morning and have MIMOSAS!!   Whenever I've been here the lines have not been very long at all.

waYdSv-RtjPwAodlA6EB3g.text: It's ok but awful considering the high price .  Mediocre food, not a large selection, and understaffed.  Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.

MhUZMk9In5zpfKYbju-fvw.text: Where do I start.  We have been regular patrons of this buffet on our trips over the years. We ate here several times on our last trip, however this will be the last time.  At one of our dinners, the place was pretty empty as it was about 8:30. So the few patrons they had they stuck in one section.  Into this section came a family with three very young children. Apparently its ok with the Management of the Bayside Buffet to allow parents to play their childrens videos as loud as they wish, over and over and over again.  That was for the child that was too young to walk.  The other two were allowed to run, scream and race around the dining area.   I have had more peaceful meals at Chucky Cheeeses.  The food is blah. Its the same thing, meal after meal, time after time, year after year.  Since I am a vegetarian I find the buffet grossly overpriced since there is only so much lettuce and bread I can eat.       Hubby does not eat seafood, so that is no enticement for us.  We always stay at Mandalay Bay, so its easy to eat here, and we have many many times over the years, but not anymore.  I am giving it a one star because for the money you definitely do not get what you pay for. Save your money, this Buffet has seen better days.

0d1WvNXBXSFWN69bXUAJ9A.text: Went to the Saturday brunch at 12 oclock. I was starving and ready to eat. The price was about 25 a person. Went I got to the buffet everything looked great. I stacked two plates and took them to the table. As soon as I started eating I noticed everything there taste extremely bland and cold. I tried so many different things and nothing was good. Horrible quality in food. Everything was put out fresh but it just tasted like it was old and been sitting for a while even though it wasn't. Will not go and waste my money here again. Stay away

KFXsQu3xeA2Fe2fTXXR6bQ.text: One of the better buffets on the strip that is reasonably priced. They even give a locals discount. Good selection of food, most of it was even warm. Would recommend this to friends.

Ahskgf-hdD2_Z7_k2GMu2g.text: I came to this Buffett years ago, sometime in 2007 to 2009?  Oh it was great, the food was colorful and tasted great.  There wasn't much service back then as it is now but the food now is deplorable.  This is now a local's choice type of buffet rather than something you would want to eat as a tourist:  you are expecting high grade food when you visit.  Don't come here unless you're expecting just a morning pick me up from a lousy hangover.  Don't expect service either, although you are waving your hand, it will take them some time to stop talking and playing with the coffee spouts to come over and give you a new napkin.

jRjA6uLm9gwdMbKfovpAIA.text: Zero stars, ya digggg. 1 star because i had to. This place is the shitter hole. I tried 2 other LV Buffets, and take my advice: GO STRAIGHT TO the Wicked Spoon Buffet at The Cosmopolitan. Best gosh darn food, ginormous selections, and great service. All the sites say it's the best, and hands down, it is.   Mandalay Bayside Buffet had the worst crap to eat + shittt service. So bad that we asked to talk to the manager, and she didnt do anything about our experience. NO one cleared our tables the whole hour we were there. When we walked personally to get the managers attention, she was snooty towards us. SAYONARA MAH DUDES won't be giving you a 2nd chance because of your uncaring restaurant presence. So many other choices, you should be on top of your game.  Waste of my hard earned Vegas money.

Q11cuyIosKgbBbdS6XKIjA.text: I consider the buffet at Mandalay Bay a second tier buffet.  It's good, with most of what you would find at Wynn's, including king crab legs and shrimp cocktail, but just doesn't quite measure up.    I think my biggest issue was the poor service.  We simply could not get our drinks refilled for the life of us.  The waiter had a tunnel vision and would not look up as he moped around.  I strained my neck from looking behind my shoulder so much to find him.  I usually like to have a cup of coffee w/ my dessert so I finally found him and walked up to him and asked him for a cup of coffee, even with a pleeeze.  I actually got an affirmation of my order.   So . . . 20 more minutes of frustration ended in defeat - no coffee.  AAGGGHH.  Needless to say, he was not compensated for the non-service.

v-dRikiVGJyyWYiyOkAdwA.text: Pretty good! We had the lunch buffet on a thursday at noon. Everything we had was tasty and flavorful (I can't remember exactly what because we tried a little of everything but I remember great roasted potatoes and brussel sprouts). The choices were pretty narrowed down compared to other buffets, but I think that's why they are able to bring in consistent tasting trays. The place was clean, the service was friendly and efficient, and the trays were well stocked and maintained fresh. The only reason why I gave it one less star is that some of the dishes were too salty. I can't really say anything about the price since I used MyVegas comps to cover the cost for two.

pphKeEbuD4gGRIwNGREzaw.text: Wasn't the best buffet. The shimp tasted like rubber, the Chinese food was overly salty, the sushi was tasteless . The crab legs were really small. Nothing like the king crab that were in the other pictures. Only thing good was the deserts, prime rib and open bar. Very pricey $30.

laj6SuVn8tkxl0-HriW_Vg.text: As good as it gets.  The stations are well kept and the food temperature is always right.  The service is fast and efficient.

9Xf8iY2-MTU1YluHG1M39w.text: I went to this buffet for lunch.  It was hit and miss.  For instance, I had a tamale that was excellent, but the potstickers were so dried out that I couldn't eat them.  The meats from the carving station were good, and the carver didn't scrimp on them.  I would go here again, but I would be very selective about the items I chose.  I would recommend it, with caution.

aKT6IA2cZaz68Rygd2vJZg.text: Not the biggest buffet ever, but they have a good deal of seafood and it's pretty tasty. A solid 3 star here, which would be a 4 if the price was a little lower ($26 or $20 if you do the Shark exhibit, which I did)!  Check it out, but if there's a line, don't feel bad if you keep on walking.

ziLGIWIel6kqY4dW7rGIeQ.text: Every time we stay at the Delano my husband always wants to eat at this buffet. The food is not great and the variety is simply just not there. After today though I will make sure that we don't come back here again. We all that money we had to pay I was surprised to see that they served me coffee with carafe that had water stain and broken. I took a picture because I couldn't believe it!!!! Simply not worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FKzhbiikdHuBPxpEUJD43w.text: Wort buffet I've ever been in. Long waiting line, all the food without exception was so dry, I didn't enjoy a single thing. Had to try and cut a dry steak with the butter knife they gave me. Horrible value for money, won't ever go there for dinner.

R0agcdOSmuph1k758ueR1w.text: This review is for breakfast, although I doubt lunch or dinner are any better. We originally scanned the buffet for dinner last night and decided that it was not worth $32 and that breakfast would probably be worth it since it was $10 cheaper. Nope. The eggs were powdered & terrible, the coffee was undrinkable, the pancakes looked & tasted like seats out of a VW bug, the sausage was pink/undercooked and the salmon & roast beef looked like dinner from the night before. I won't even bother describing the oatmeal but it was disgusting too.
