The omelet chef looked about as excited as someone going through an IRS audit and barely managed acknowledgement when we told him our ingredients.   Mandalay Bay should be ashamed. Retool or put this poor waste of square footage out of its misery.

ne6EhiTarfZSNfAZxm1JZQ.text: This buffet place has some great food! It is very diverse in terms of choice and tasty unlike some other buffet places. I really appreciated that omelets and other egg based foods were made to order instead of being premade like some other places.  I was a bit disappointed by the desserts. They were not very tasty and there could have been some more fruit options instead of just pineapple and cantaloupe slices.   The service was nice however, they seemed a bit rushed taking away our plates the second we finished even though the buffet was not full. But still very nice and amicable.   All in all a great place for lunch to get the day going in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stir fry
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some more desserts
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some desserts

aVzORNEoeIDbcCMXBxzIMQ.text: Not worth the $32.99, the food is terrible-just plain and boring just like the atmosphere. The service was also sub-par. Spend your money elsewhere. Just because you can eat all you want does not guarantee that it will be tasty and in a lovely setting. PASS.

uv-Ep-bomR8tJ0KSGMooMw.text: Pretty standard buffet. Cheaper than some other buffets on the strip but you do miss out on a few things. Loved that they had ox tail and lamb! Rib eye wasn't bad. Seafood selection is a little small, and they don't cut the crab legs gornyou which makes it a lot harder. The made to order pasta bar is nice, but ask for a smaller serving and definitely share. I'd come back if I were staying at Mandalay again just for sheer convenience, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

oVsec3ltTxG8tbbZDCNw9A.text: Overpriced, dried out, flavorless food.  Nina was the woman who served me root beer and water, she kept calling me "lady" which was odd.  The food looked great on the walk through, but it was awful!!    Dry and flavorless.    The only thing that was good was the mashed potatoes and the Spanish rice; everything else was awful.  I don't even want to say how much I paid for this hot mess of a buffet.

rerCD7WTaLit18vF0wzcDA.text: This is the best place on the planet to eat  if you are looking for the absolute worst food for the highest price in Vegas.   A family of 4, one of which was a 6yo paid 127 plus tip.   Crab legs that obviously were man eating killer crabs that had to be killed a second time with a meat clever into pieces that could be measured with a millimeter measuring device.   And of course let's not forget that the flavors of the world that were 187'd as the second, third, and fourth killings of the night coming in way behind the crab legs.   It's pretty sad when fine dining is cheaper than a quality buffet but, this was nothing less than theft of my time and money.   Please for the love of God avoid this place and maybe the market will correct this overbought mess.

WHVef5oY3CUGT8innutIow.text: I ended up coming to bayside buffet as a last-minute decision. We were walking through the Mandalay Bay and we saw they had a good deal on the breakfast buffet with bottomless champagne. We figured why the heck we could give it a try.   We walked in the house is very nice and set us quickly. The inside of the buffet was big not as big as some of the other Buffy is that I've been to but we were hungry so we definitely did the trick. We both got the bottomless champagne and I'm extremely sorry that I did because I ended up drinking at 9 AM and I ended up getting sick because I drink too much cheap champagne and I had to go to the room and lay down but that's my own fault.   About the food so for breakfast they had all of the necessities that you would need eggs bacon sausage Hash. I found it interesting that even though we went for breakfast they still had lunch items out. You could still get chicken fingers cheeseburgers even had to stay carving station at 9 AM in the morning I was extremely impressed by that. You can get for lobster and crab legs at nine in the morning it was really interesting to see people actually getting crap legs at 9 o'clock in the morning. Their dessert station was fully open they had cheesecakes and pastries in all sorts of crazy desserts.   As for the taste of the food everything was fine I have no complaints the buffet was just your average run-of-the-mill buffet there was nothing special that set the Bayside buffet apart from some of the other buffet is that I've been to in Vegas.   Overall the Bayside buffet was pretty good the bottom of champagne was a nice complement even know that I got sick but that is my own fault this buffet had everything that you would need to experience in a buffet although I would not say that it was the greatest or the most amazing buffet experience in Vegas that I have been to.  If you're looking for a cheaper alternative to a buffet experience I would def recommend coming here if not try one of the other buffets on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Still filling us up at the bottom of the champagne
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The buffet trays
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n9yjqZND46b_EfTFbPQw_A.text: It is just a tad better than your typical free hotel breakfast. Then again, probably not. It has more choices than a free hotel breakfast, but the quality is probably lower. There is a reason there are no lines here. I swear they are not even trying. I see no reason to ever come back.

rWWeRsOXroRI-A96WILsJQ.text: Unfortunately, the buffet at Mandalay is probably the least desired restaurant for me at the hotel. The food was just below average. The prime rib was quite chewy and most of the other dishes were all sub average. The only reason for the two star was the cost of the lunch menu, but I will pass next time...

IobifLEPpGgLQOF01IdjsQ.text: Food isn't too bad for a buffet, food is hot and plentiful. My omelette came out funky but taste iexcellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PU8FCTtLCHun-eaEKPkxUg.text: This was our closest option with crab legs so we decided to check it out.  I would try another place first next time. Crab legs were so dry, couldn't get a piece out big enough for a bite.  The only upside was the upgrade beverage plan.  A very good deal.  The only good part.  Deserts were ok but when asked what a unlabeled item was, he had no idea.

7Unvngzpji0nQ8hRzVt5uQ.text: Day 1 So far EVERY staff member has been friendly and willing to chat. Rice and kimchi at the breakfast buffet!! Heck's ya Mandalay Bay!  Fresh blueberries & black berries to go with your cream wheat. The buffet was worth the $21.00.

oqBq4io7wjTI3R2ORPTixw.text: So this is really a 3.5 star review. What you need to know...it's 100% worth $17.99 for a weekday breakfast buffet if you are staying at this hotel. Coffee and pastries in the hotel would cost more than this buffet which features outstanding coffee and the same pastries that we literally paid over 5 bucks for the day prior. The ambience here is nice and the service is perfect. Such a contrast from the Bacchanel Buffet that rates so highly.   We also had a buy one get one free from myrewards that made this an extra good deal. The choices are pretty good for a weekday breakfast. While they didn't have things like shrimp and crablegs they made a super tasty pizza with cream cheese, lox, capers & onions. Brilliant as you didn't have to mess with building something on a bagel yourself and this was probably fewer calories since it was on a thin pizza crust versus the caloric bagel. Not that I was watching calories as I finished with a decadent chocolate filled croissant. Tons of fruit and fresh berries on this buffet. I would definitely return if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty decent buffet.

dRRjvug9n6lyY6Qg8mbddA.text: Worst dinner buffet experience ever. What a dump. My wife even got a refund for hers. How can a nice hotel like this serve such junk?

jWysDDrI16YYHnSC6Xi_kw.text: Great spot for breakfast at a very reasonable $18.99/adult. Creating my own omelette was my best choice. Filled it with many ingredients. Looked like a feast to feed a whole family. But hey, I was very hungry and I did eat it all.   There's a wide variety of food to choose from too. From salads, fish, sausages, pastas, meats, etc etc  The service is great too. From the people up front to the food preparers to the bus boys. Everyone has a great attitude and that makes for a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P_AHQaBBhfsqygcT_K-DUQ.text: Overall: A perfectly good buffet. I don't know why all the poor reviews on here - it's way cheap for a strip buffet and lots to choose from. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Was going to give four stars but the low cost pushed to five.   We went for brunch and the food was good and fresh. Lots of staples like pancakes, eggs, sausage, etc. Yes - it not the same level as Caesars buffet which is THE bar for Vegas buffets - but for the price, cleanliness, staff being so helpful and friendly, and simplicity pushed my review to five.   If you're looking for a good meal and to do a buffet on the strip I would suggest coming here. If you want the extravagant buffet experience - and the price - Caesars is the one to go to.

8JKpMymL48AYlIQXCqZIgA.text: We checked out this buffet tonight and it was great.  About 32 dollars  a person. And  amazing food.  From the reviews i read befor coming here i did not expect much, but i was blown away.  Great fresh salmon, which i have not seen at the other buffets i have tryed this week. excellent prime rib,  and a very nice sushi  station. Lots of great food to try.   The service was excellent.  Our drinks were refilled befor they got empty.  I tryed this buffet about 3 years ago and was not impressed. But they have really stepped up there game.   So far best buffet i have went to this week.  And for 32 dollars. Its a deal compared  to others. I will be back next time i am in vegas..

T9QB6-vIvJAYjbC1adpa_g.text: Its decent here. I rank it #2 on my list of buffets we've visited in Las Vegas. I didnt think the sushi was great but there were other things to eat that were very good. I wasnt impressed with dessert. The little cakes looked like the same bland, dry ones they have at cheap Chinese all-you-can eat places. The chocolate ice cream was dark and gritty looking, like it was made from chocolate powder and crushed ice. Come here for a good dinner, but find dessert elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kkoUT5jv0UTxutz1BGIK3Q.text: Cold food is warm. Hot food is cold, dry and old. Desert is old and dry and nothing fresh.  Went @1:30 pm. 60% of the food belongs to breakfast, not buffet. Station is empty: both on food and chef. All 9 chefs/staff got together and were chatting away behind one of the station. See photo. Worst "Buffet " we've ever been to. High dollar like regular buffet on strip. We love the amazing pool of Mandalay Bay, but for sure not its buffet. Guess one can not judge a buffet by a name brand strip casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staff were happily chatting away instead of cook, prepare food! Fun job!

e-L3T8Qxl9m6pyFHGBsDFg.text: I've been to several buffets in Vegas and I gotta say, Bayside is probably one of my faves. We stayed at the Mandalay, so there was a bit of a convenience factor in our decision, but I have no regrets.   The food here is solid. We ate at least two meals here and I was very pleased with both. All of the dishes were fresh and very tasty. I loved the fact that there were plenty of crab legs at every single meal, including breakfast. The crab legs were well cooked, with plenty of meat in the shells. Crab legs are almost always a crap shoot because a lot of places buy the cheap ones with all shell and very little to no meat. Not the case at Bayside.   It is pricey, so buyer beware, but that is the case for all the buffets on or close to the strip. You can head downtown for a great buffet at about half the price. That said, you definitely do get what you pay for here, so know that going in, too!   I enjoyed it and definitely recommend it!

L67QU3kfqOBodcnyvxAKPg.text: I am never a big fan of buffets but this one is located in Mandalay Bay Hotel, where I have stayed for work a few days in a row lately, so I finally got to try it this week. It turned out better than I had expected! The following are what I tried and liked:  braised veal - tender and flavorful ox tails - tender and flavorful Prime rib - sliced to your order - the medium rare slice was juicy and flavorful chicken corden bleu - very juicy chicken meat with just the right amount of melted cheese and cooked ham filling Smoked salmon Seaweed salad Seafood cioppino (not spicy though) Braised green beans Chocolate cookie (one of the best I have tried to date: soft and chewy and chocolaty) Red velvet cake - moist cake and creamy frosting, not overly sweet Cheesecake - rich, creamy, not overly sweet Chocolate fro yo - good  What I tried and thought were just so so:  Crab legs - plain and no tools to help crack the shells, so I gave up on trying Mussells - found mostly shells and had to fish out the meat from the sauce tiramisu - too much cream, which was very bland, and not enough cake, which itself did not taste like much; no coffee syrup detected Bread pudding - tasted like a savory steamed egg dish and nothing like a dessert dish Paella - bland Salmon with panko coating - plain  What I didn't try and care about:  Chinese - egg rolls, fried rice, gai lan, stir-fried veggies, buns, etc.. The selection was small anyway and I had to save room in my stomach for other things anyway. Sushi - there were only two types of rolls and no sashimi other than the smoked salmon slices. Mexican - just some regular looking pulled pork, refried beans, rice, jalapenos, etc. Pizzas & pastas - not a huge variety and looked plain  There were much more items such as green and fruit salads, and way more desserts at the dessert station. but I could only eat so much in one meal...  $30 per person for dinner. A limited selection of wines is included.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf abd turf

cDwdX4BYwGtqQEtTBZz22Q.text: Everything I put on my plate was inedible. For over $25, that is completely unacceptable.   It may be due in part to the timing of my dining; buffets tend to be the worst between lunch and dinner as they're still prepping for the next rush but everything left over is hard, stale or soggy, depending on the item.   I would have liked to have tried them during a normal dining time, but I find it unacceptable to fail that miserably on an off time for their location and price.   Good luck...

qjbveHNOQr0N5ufM5WkXxg.text: I'm such an idiot. I didn't check Yelp before I went in. I'm Yelp elite for chrissakes - I check Yelp for everything.  If you're reading this, congratulations. You're making good use of this invaluable public resource. Now you can avoid my experience of spending like $150 on a dinner that was the equivalent of a Howard Johnson's.  How can anyone make pizza taste bad? And how can even the soft serve ice cream suck - how is that even possible??? Apparently, it is. Take my word for it.

hWZqu-w5omftgsmkvd8l6w.text: This buffet was pretty basic. We went for the $25 breakfast and the food was only ok. The real reason to go to this buffet is definitely the $5 bottomless champagne offer that they have! Since we were all a little hungover we just decided to stick with food.  The food was ok. They had almost everything that you can imagine including fruit, bagels, smoked salmon, pancakes, eggs, bacon, omelette station, salad bar, Chinese food, sushi, carved meat, fresh seafood, muffins, cookies, pastries and more! If you are looking to eat a lot of mediocre food without breaking the bank then I would recommend. If you're a foodie, I would skip.

1FImbYxLJeznv1RLdYNayg.text: I payed a total of $84 dollars for a dinner for two. If that's not bad enough ( I expect to pay a lot at mandalay), there were not very many options to choose from, every protein they had was fried of full of oils, no healthy alternatives except salad, and after the night was up, my girlfriend ended up with food poisoning. Mandalay Bay charges a $80 resort fee and doesn't tell you that they close the pool at 5 pm on a weekend. Long story short don't waste your time or money going to anything Mandalay. Food Poisoning!!

bywjQ9_D2O4hx1791JL4Sg.text: Decent hot food. Good variety and attentive service. Some desserts tdf    Nice Ossining buco

UtGyq_O7Hq5m-fTJlvRaEA.text: Stopped in for dinner one of the biggest mistakes I have ever made. First I saw that they had paella on the buffet that's why I picked it. Let me just say it was an offense to everything Spanish. They owe the entire country an apology it was inedible. There was nothing on the buffet that was even up to Sizzler standards. I had the buffet at Luxor the night before and it was 4 times the size for $10 dollars less and very good. With so many good options for food in this town I can not stress enough stay away from Mandalay.

Nmn4dwArNxdHrgTkvH7fTw.text: This was probably my least favorite meal in Vegas last weekend...I remember I got excited seeing the price was only 17.99 (around that) for the breakfast buffet but I was over it after one plate. They put the exact same food items on both sides of the buffet, so you initially think there's going to be double the options that are actually available. Also, I'm not sure if all buffets do this, but it's annoying giving a tip before you even know what service is going to be like. Maybe that's just me though.

N8QqErGXdMPC649p5puKHg.text: Everything was dry as hell. Bland.  $28 for poorly made food.  The only desirable food were the Cheesy scrambled eggs and the Orange chicken.   It did however, have a nice ambiance and beautiful decor.

77wDEpt5C-hgjr_owVxagw.text: Please don't eat here!!! We were in Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Mandalay Bay and happened to try this buffet .... I was so surprised how lame the buffet was ... it's like an ordinary Chinese buffet; I'm sorry for saying that but I was really disappointed. Seriously don't eat here, with the same price you can get the best buffet at the Cosmopolitan.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just like Chinese buffet, frozen dessert from the box!!
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z1eOso-3oIIyK89YYb_NoQ.text: Decided to try a new buffet and I would say this isn't the best however, the service was great compared to other buffets!   They have a variety of different types of food, however the quality weren't that great. They also have a Pasta Bar, but it was kind of a let down. Dessert is opposite sides of where the "hot" food was.   Everything was okay haha, but I rather go elsewhere.

8Bq5GZqvVllwytIlHvaU0w.text: Compared to other food establishments in Mandalay, I thought this place was pretty good. I certainly would not go out of my way to eat at any establishment at Mandalay Bay, but when you are staying there, it is a good option. Why? Well, breakfast is 17.99 a person and lunch is I think 23.99. The first time we got the champagne brunch for 25.99 (unlimited champagne a $5 add-on) and it was good. Crab legs and lots of seafood options. Was it the best? No, but I kinda like working for my food as I crack the small but really sweet crab legs. Shrimp are farm-raised, not good. My hubby concentrated on the yogurt and fresh fruit and the all-you-can-eat-bacon. When we missed breakfast, there was still oatmeal, grits, and fruit for breakfast.   There is a decent crowd here and when we got by one group of Latino Gangsters (not being racist, I'm just being real, my hubby is black), the staff we're willing to move us to a quieter more peaceful spot.   There might be better buffets, but when you don't want to go far, this is great.

rNCNRHQqGZxtRzGIQWWJ2Q.text: In A Nutshell:  -Warm (not cold) king crab legs! -Oxtail :) -$32.99 Adult/Dinner price. -NO LINE.  Overall, come here for those reasons above b/c those are very hard to find in any buffet anywhere.  I've been to the other buffets on the strip and they are more expensive, have super long lines and don't have the above....ENOUGH SAID, now go eat.

bzv0nFuwmFIJcBllrb2U0Q.text: It was alright. It never really hit the spot or really satisfied my cravings. Wish I had gone there for lunch or dinner instead. I went during brunch and it was more breakfast than lunch. Not worth the $25/person. Pay a few extra bucks and go elsewhere. The food was lacking flavor. Meats were rubbery and not very hot. Most of the food looked like it had been sitting there a while under the warm, not hot lamp. At least I can say I ate here, but the reviews are True. Unless you get a free meal here, pay the extra few bucks to get something that will be something worth telling your friends about.

nvFKR3AMBbf7cHO_x13I3Q.text: The moment I saw the food selection for lunch I was regretting my decision. $22.00 not worth it what so ever. Very small food selection and NOT a good place to grab brunch. The lunch buffet is just not appetizing. I put some things on my plate but still left hungry because nothing really seemed appealing. You would think since this is a nice hotel they would have a better food selection and taste but no. Not ever coming back

omomOHNOFakEEkGmSTvM0w.text: On our last day in Vegas, I made it my mission to try a buffet. My mom and I had happened to be at Mandalay Bay so I checked out the reviews and prices for lunch and I convinced her.   I loved the self-check kiosk and the opportunity to put the tip on the check right there. There was a ton of food options and everything was hot and refreshed at least once while we were enjoying lunch. Good selection, variety and clean!

5gxZ45nM8LtXyDmSVedmUg.text: If there was a negative STAR I'd choose it. We came for the seafood buffet that had maybe 5 things total even resembling seafood. Of those NONE we good. The crab legs were dry, brittle and tasteless..  Very disappointing for the caliber of hotel the Mandalay Bay is portrayed to be.

mvM3oiXc1rDnjSso9kfEDQ.text: I stayed at Mandalay Bay for a conference and ate at Bayside Buffet twice, for lunch and for breakfast. I'm not one to be eager eating at buffets when in Vegas but this offered good bang for the buck! Not the biggest or fanciest selection but it does the job with providing a convenient, satisfying meal. Compared to other buffets, I think the saying, quality over quantity, applies here.  The best part is that it was a quick option. Our team chose Bayside for both meals due to time restraints between meetings and this was the obvious choice without having to sacrificing time waiting in lines (or taking orders).

FzN6BgqpRx1Xnk_SSEgVDw.text: The food here was decent, though the selection for a vegas buffet was a bit underwhelming.  For the price though, $40 with tip for dinner, the selection is reasonable.  They had all the Vegas buffet staples, prime rib, shrimp, crab legs, etc.  Everything my group tried was good.  One bonus was that when we went on Valentine's day, they were serving complimentary champagne, wine, and beer.  The alcohol selection, however was not of very high quality.  The beer was bud light and the champagne was nothing to write home about.  For the price though, the return was reasonable.  Definitely worth it if you are not a foodie and are just looking to get your buffet on for under $50.

O4jVCNuEkrOib9-8hPdW3g.text: Eating at the Bayside Buffet is a "hit-or-miss" depending on the day and time. The last time I went, it was AMAZING. Our server was attentive, drinks always refilled and the food selection was exceptional. We had prime rib, freshly baked pizzas and extremely crispy fried chicken. After coming here numerous times, the salad bar hardly changes. I even found brown rice and whole grain pasta available (shocker, but I loved the healthy selection). Other times I went, the food was good and mostly fresh but the service was lacking. Drinks hardly got refilled and our server even walked by us and cleaned other tables not noticing that all 4 of us don't have any beverages. Another point of notice was that it wasn't even busy (defined as more than half the tables were vacant). Overall though, I love coming to Bayside Buffet. If the service was consistent, this would be one of Vegas's top buffets.

1IDN3cVKS-czVm_ZjOEQWw.text: We did both breakfast and dinner here. Each had their good and bad points.  Breakfast- Good: Bacon, coffee, apple crepes, bear claws   Bad: Scrambled eggs (tasted like they were made with sour milk), sausage, home fries (frozen triangle thingies they must have microwaved)  Dinner- Good: shrimp (cocktail and fried, both good), kung pao beef, coconut cream pie, salad bar, fruit, cold meats and cheeses  Bad: flatiron steak (looked pink and rare but was tough and chewy)  I'm also not crazy about having to wait for someone to bring my beverages. Self service is much better (like MORE buffet at the Luxor)  There are better buffets for the price, but we ate here twice because we were staying at THEHotel at Mandalay Bay. We don't plan on staying there again so I doubt we will be eating here again.

u3iomKEkiT2qNIoFM8mbXQ.text: This buffet is one of the best values for the price during the weekday. I can say I never go wrong enjoying a great dinner here with every visit to Las Vegas. The only disappointing things was to find out that beer and wine is no longer included in the dinner price.

24Cm24fMpQ8O8SFfP8Cu_w.text: Was not impressed with the buffet at all. Not to mention that I found a hair in my dessert! I do have to acknowledge that the manager was very apologetic, comped my meal, and gave me a free meal as well. However, I did not take advantage of the free meal given I was nauseous the whole night upon my first visit. Couldn't bring myself to go back again, even for a free meal!

-AfJGqx179IP6K0WY5PuHw.text: Very good!  Not quite on par with Bacchanal or Wicked Spoon but definitely better than most  LV buffets.  Free wine and draft beer (Miller Lite) a huge plus, just tip the server 1-2 bucks.  The pasta bar was nice, meat station offerings above average but the dessert station was underwhelming.  Dinner for two with tip was about $75.

B3ZuApY7y3d9ChncFftGWg.text: Breakfast- bacon, waffles, pancakes, hash browns, breakfast potatoes, bagels with lox, Chinese dishes, tamales, chillaquilles, pastries. I made a BLT and it was the best because I packed it with a lot of bacon. Yum!  Dinner- steamed crab, steamed rice, fried rice, orange chicken, crusted salmon, salads, pasta station, roasted chicken, meatball (delicious), taco, taquitos, Tom yum soup, bean soup, red velvet cake, chocolate cake, cookies.    I'd come back only if I was staying at the hotel.

cLc61UHcQfI8AZ7wZ9myBg.text: Really? This bad in Vegas. Crab legs smelled and tasted like last Monday. The only think that was not dry and bland was the pasta bar. However my shrimp needed to be cook longer. All in go anywhere else.  McDonald's or Arby's. Service. What service. I guess I didn't pretip enough. 15% for a buffet is generous. Wonder if Amex can take it back.

z3DeeLlH4TKY0ht4c__lOA.text: His is about breakfast only - if u like breakfast I wouldn't bother....too much money for what u get.  The waffles we saggy.  The cram of wheat was watery.   The French Toast was ok ...not the best.  The pre made eggs yuck.  They did have an omelet station I didn't try it...Overall I   Wasn't impressed.

YjI8CyaoFQjdAXoseDORNw.text: AMAZING!  By far the best buffet I've been to so far.  Excellent seafood selection.  Desserts were fabulous and varied.  Huge variety of delectible edibles.  Granted our friends paid, so I do understand it is pricey, but would love to go back.

420fNq_kB19g8SAhSR11EA.text: Not bad for a buffet! You get a variety of dishes to choose from, atmosphere was your typical buffet from kids roaming about to people jumping from place to place to get whatever catches their eye. Wait staff was good at getting your drinks and refilling them! Have been here twice! Ohh and the guy that makes your made to order omelet makes them pretty big!!

VUjKYRZeYEBCKhkBBFRc-w.text: Came last year, way better than this year!  Snow crab small and dry, prime rib medium done, pasta station not all that.  Last year wine and Stella included, this year, you purchase a $7.99 all you can drink.

h3NAmx01XczQJ0OZouv0GA.text: I was expecting so much more, especially because it's Mandalay Bay. Very disappointed. Food wasn't great and not much of a variety. I doubt I will give this place another try.

5av0PAGtX7kJmxfW95fyuQ.text: This has to be one of the worst buffets I have ever been to that has definitely been overrated by word of mouth and on different Vegas websites. I got a complimentary buffet ticket and decided to try out the Bayside Buffet. It was not worth my time, empty calories or energy to make the trip to Mandalay Bay for this buffet. Crab legs were dry, prime rib was poorly marinated and not tender in the slightest. The panko crusted salmon was very good, though.  I just returned from a recent trip with my family and ate her again strictly based on convenience and it was even worse than the first time. We also ate at the noodle restaurant at Mandalay Bay the next day for convenience as well and it was sooo disgusting. Mandalay Bay definitely needs to step up their game when it comes to their restaurants.  One star for the pretty view from the back of the buffet and one star for the all you can drink wine, champagne, and beer during dinner.

1JNBV4o9qJ7EQSToo7oocw.text: Went to lunch here after a 6 hr drive. Limited food selection and the sushi was terrible. Main reason I wanted to have lunch here. The pieces seemed old and the rice was dried out. Won't be coming back to this place.

zF6DRJXU_Jjbx1RUP0015g.text: A solid average buffet in Vegas. Decent selections although I found some food was borderline cold. Don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed. I was satisfied overall but it wasn't something to write home about.

-lF9QJGe6v24IoSLwIkNfg.text: Food was good and the swans in the lake down below really added the scenery. The bloody marrys were amazing and the unlimited amount of crab was exactly what we were looking for.

fT2OzoTsNSqMGPnmGv-oVg.text: ***Friday Brunch review*** Warm snow crabs~!!!  This is the first time we found "WARM SNOW CRABS" in Vegas!   We love the warm crab legs down in Biloxi, MS and always wished to find the same in Vegas.  Now we did!!!  Food:  The warm snow crabs just made our day hence the 4 stars....otherwise, we would have given this buffet 3 stars.  Everything else was just OK.  Very nice but OK.  The prime rib was very nice but I liked Bellagio's better for some reason.  From Apple crepes to fried rice, they were all pretty good.  However, the selections were very limited.  I was very disappointment with the eggs benedict...I guess it is standard practice to use hard eggs to keep the shape but hmm...   Price:  $25 I think...We had $20/person vouchers so not sure of the EXACT price...sorry.  Ambiance = Very nice.  Typical casino buffet style restaurant on the strip.  Clean and nice...nothing special.  Service = Umm...  Had to ask for straw, every refill, piles of plates just left alone for a long time.  I think they were short staffed???....not sure.

xNCHvrAtQyMcnS0i1PS2pg.text: I'm guessing because the word "bay" is in the hotel name, they deemed it necessary to have tons of seafood. NOT that I'm complaining, by any means...  First of all, it's pure genius that at the entrance of this buffet are fast-pay machines??? If the line is long and you don't feel like wasting away in it, jump over to the machine and pay for your meal tickets. You get to skip the pay line, and trot down to where they seat you. One of the things that really kills Vegas buffets for me are the longass lines, so this place immediately got five stars from me. Read on to see why I knocked one off...  Apparently there were at least three wedding receptions going on here (why the hell you would have your reception at a Vegas buffet is beyond me), because the lines to get food were ridiculous. My friend and I also got cut in line by five fat bozos who apparently thought a foot of space between me and the person in front of me meant "yes please cut me, cuz I'm not hungry either." Let me tell you, cutting two hungry, cranky asian girls in line is NOT a smart move. The setup wasn't very genius though. There were about three or four big different sections with food, but people were lining up in ONE long line. It didn't seem to matter if you wanted to go down the whole row of food, or if you wanted just one thing, because either way, people were not about to make room for you. After realizing that we were too small and kept getting trampled on, we sent the bfs in to get the work done.  On to the food!! Their breaded shrimp = AMAAAZING. I'm a sucker for breaded stuff (yea, sue me), and their shrimp was really good. The pasta station also made personalized pasta for you.. tasty as well. Crab meat yum, oysters I was told were yum, pork tenderloin yum... everything was pretty yum. After the giganto crowds diminished, it was way easier to go back and pick my faves out on my plate. But the way it was going when we first got there.. not cool.

_cb8gnL2Ll1wukdp2eK77g.text: First time buffet guy... I got all you can eat Alaskan crab, prime rib, lox and a tasty meatball plus desert and wine! Crab was great! No complaints about this place! Except for the disturbing amount of food tourists leave uneaten on their plates.

4nHL1AtJZ9xv5-86eX2aXg.text: This place was pretty good! It's not the biggest but they do have a good selection. Quantity is not everything when it comes to a buffet. We ate here for free which was also a plus! Got a promo deal. They have limited items but good for what they have. The salad bar did not have fresh produce mostly veggies that you can get in a can. The dessert section was good! My wife killed the tiramisu she was about to have another but I had to stop her. Good stuff for what they have.

CrR8pM2aBrhUAoiqbYGNQw.text: I came to Las Vegas this time (April 2008) prepared to pig out at buffets because my friend had told me about her trip and I was genuinely excited about all the good food I was about to consume on my trip. Bayside Buffet was the first buffet I went to and it did not disappoint.  My boyfriend and I got to this buffet around breakfast to lunch transition time. The breakfast options were definitely better than the lunch options because I remember seeing the lunch ones come out and not being as interested. As far as the breakfast goes, they have waffles, pancakes, eggs, sausages, vegetables, you know the usual breakfast stuff. I was a fan of this mainly because whenever I want breakfast, I want all this, but very seldom can you get both waffles and pancakes together along wtih all this other stuff. Not to mention, you usually can't finish all this, but they made the portions buffet size so finishing both waffles and pancakes along with other stuff was doable.   I'm not entirely sure if the coffee was free or not but we got it even though we didn't ask for it. So i'm assuming the coffee was free. I may be wrong on this.

_eeCj-OUcaUqUVRp6lRacw.text: This is one of my favorite Las Vegas buffets because of the quality and value. The new self-paying kiosks is genius! I can cut the people in front of me that decide to pay at the cashier because I have a receipt to show to the hostess.  The choices are plenty and delicious. Definitely scope out the place first and be selective. It'll be a waste of time and energy to try to eat everything they have.   I always go straight for the crab legs first. They're already cracked so I just need to pick the meat out and dunk it in clarified butter....mmmmm heaven....

c1XSxJCE5uZ41pH9lEpLXg.text: We decided we had to do at least one buffet while in Vegas.  Since we'd not done one yet, we made plans to hit the buffet at our hotel (the Mandalay Bay) for breakfast on our last day.  Since this was a Sunday, "breakfast" turned into "brunch."  Ok, so I hadn't really been planning on eating seared scallops at 9:30 in the morning, but sometimes you just gotta go with the flow.  Though I've heard this is not the biggest buffet in town, my husband and I both found more than enough food to keep our mouths and bellies happy.  I ate so much seafood, I thought I was going to grow a gill.  He focused more on the more breakfasty things and reported only good things.  My husband is diabetic and so was very happy to see several sugar-free options on the dessert table.  Service was good.  We took advantage of the champagne because it was included in the cost of the meal and, after all, it was Sunday.  The waiter kept our glasses filled.  I appreciated that, when I asked for more tea, he brought me a whole new pot of hot water and tea bag, instead of just pouring lukewarm water onto my already used bag.  (You'd be amazed how often I have seen this happen.)  The cost was $24/person and that is really quite reasonable for a brunch that includes champagne and this much seafood.   We definitely left happy.

souGXhF6o4x7rcOtXpp0og.text: Sorry, I have to give this place two stars for the food.   Service was good. The machines up front made it quick to pay and we got in pretty quickly considering it was around 7pm on Friday. The waiter was good too, getting us drinks and refills in a timely fashion. The setting was not bad either, pretty new-ish looking interior that was relatively appealing to the eyes.  However, the food is where it started to go downhill. I started with some seafood. The shrimp cocktail was relatively good, but the sauce wasn't very good. The crab legs (cold ones) were horrible, they tasted quite old. The rest of the food in that area looked messy and didn't taste all that great.   The hot dishes on the other side were alright as well. The best part of the meal was probably the roast beef; but then again, I have had better at the other Vegas hotels as well.   The dessert was pretty good, almost saved the meal. But all of this stuff seemed to be coming out of the refrigerator, instead of people actually making it. I know that probably doesn't happen too much in Vegas but just didn't add to the already hurt Bayside Buffet.  Overall, I will probably not come here again. I expected more, Mandalay Bay! I guess the half-empty dining room during peak hours should have been a sign.

vX11NN92JDmxVPp0btkmtg.text: The Bayside buffet, one of my favorites here in Las Vegas. Our family seems to mostly visit this buffet every single time we come to vegas (which is like twice a year it seems). Alright, here we go:  Being Asian in all, most of us LOVE seafood and here at Bayside Buffet, you will not be disappointed. You must not compare these delicate crab legs to the ones offered at your local Chinese buffet or Todai's, this blows them STRAIGHT out of the water. For starters, you are offered I believe Dungeonous Crab (SP?), Snow Crab and Alaskan King Crab legs. The crab is fresh an amazing and even more delicious when dipping it in butter (yes, I know I am clogging my arteries, ugh). The shrimp was shrimp, not too shrimpy but not tiger prawn status either.   As for their food selection, its not all that amazing. The hot/warm food didn't really catch my attention. It comparison to Bellagio and Wynn, they lack in a lot of offerings when it comes to international flavor and style. Though I will give them credit for their cook to order pasta station. The chef did however mess up on my order as I requested white sauce vs. the red. But I'm not THAT picky so it wasn't a uber big deal to me. The desert section too seemed lacking. Though I was quite impressed as their self serve ice cream was not the typical regular chocolate and Vanilla. It was a spiced up version of Vanilla and Chocolate and it was just heaven really. I believe it was a Vanilla Custard.  Overall, I give Mandalay Bay a 4 out of 5. Its not quite there yet but its pretty delicious when you compare it to a Bay Area Buffet (from Cali). Service was fabulous, food was delicious, and the atmosphere was just right. Hooray for Mandalay Bay!

QXHQrpV0mN95KcOz19QOVw.text: This is the buffet my husband and I ALWAYS go to when we hit up Vegas.  We've tried the dinner buffets at Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Paris, and the Wynn.  Mandalay Bay's buffet is the best one on the strip, in my opinion.  This buffet is one of the few (if any) on the strip that serves WARM/HOT/STEAMING king crab legs.  Who wants to eat these babies cold?  They also serve prime rib, pastas, and tasty Asian sides as well.  I think this buffet is the best bang for your buck.  We always leave happy and full!

t9z60Kb3rFOs4hY_GJ_zbg.text: Wow this place was a dissapointment.  Read the reviews before coming here and noticed majority of the low reviews were from breakfast. We went there for lunch so we thought it would be okay and wouldnt be so bad but man was it terrible!  The place is big but the food stations and choices are small and limited in my opinion. There weren't too much choices for lunch and everything i've tried tasted below average. I don't want to be so picky about buffet foods but nothing appealed to me and didn't take more than one bite, except the shrimp cocktail but how can you go wrong with that......  Save your twenty something dollars and go else where!!!!!!

aLmEmW5glCxqQ260Puy3vA.text: The Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay is one of the more under-rated buffets in Vegas.   It doesn't boast the largest selection or the most unique creations, but whatever they do have to offer, they do very very well. The food is usually very well prepared and fresh.  My wife and I traditionally like to go there for breakfast for they usually have a pretty good selection of breakfast favorites. Plus, a pretty decent selection of sweets and pastries to pick from if you're third trip through the main buffet wasn't good enough.  We have been there several times and have yet to leave disappointed.

m-0k2cLLA2VkqFg4zQA6GA.text: Buffets are not about quality, let's just get that right out there. Buffets are about QUANTITY and getting as much for your dollar as possible. Because of this, I'm generally not a huge fan of buffet style eating. But that aside, the Bayside Buffet isn't half bad when compared against others in Vegas. It has one distinct advantage for sure, FREE ALCOHOL. Yep, they have red and white wine and champagne and it's free. It's not high end but it's as decent as anything you'd be served on a plane. Every other buffet I've been too charged extra for alcohol of any kind. So free alcohol is a Bayside "plus". The food was ok, not tremendous but not bad. For seafood lovers they have crab legs, mussels, shrimp, Lox, baked salmon, baked swai (aka..basa) ,  a few different sushi rolls and cioppino (very spicy). The mussels were tender, not rubbery, and the baked fish dishes were both moist, not overcooked and dried out. The shrimp were a good size too. If you're not a fan of seafood, they have pizza (which looked decent), prime rib and chicken . For veggie lovers you'll find things like asparagus and corn on the cob. The dessert section is fairly vast as well with a nice assortment of fresh baked cookies, cobbler, tiramisu, bread pudding, carrot cake, chocolate cake, soft serve frozen yogurt and more. For the $30 entry price you will certainly get your monies worth. So if you're doing Vegas on a budget or simply don't feel satisfied by smaller restaurant portions, the Bayside Buffet just might be your thing.

ydQfyrepW-JY8M644PUXIw.text: What a disappointment. expensive, poor choices and poor quality of food.  Dont waste your time..The waiter was the only thing that i can say was great!!

qFLvmPNtYrCiYm5HPPyFrg.text: This buffet is the best buffet by far. Great service, fresh food, great atmosphere are the reasons why it is good. The pasta station makes their pasta fresh and right in front of you. There is a wide variety of food to choose from. I would recommend this buffet to people who have families or couples who want to eat something for lunch or dinner.

AgIAunOxdejASCqepqScow.text: I want to start out explaining that my mother was recently married, had the ceremony at the Luxor, and we had the reception at the Bayside Buffet with a party of 22 people, which they allowed us to make reservations. It was still $30 per person and since we had a reservation and a large party we paid a $150 fee. We decided to take the party there purely for the convenience of location and the fact that it is UNLIMITED, that's right UNLIMITED beer, wine, and champagne! With a party of 22 people, with the majority being big drinkers this was perfect! We had champagne to toast for my mother and her newly-wed husband. Beer for my uncles and wine for my aunts. Unfortunately, unlimited beer only included bud light. The wine a merlot and chardonay, which were light and fruity. I didn't have a chance to try the sushi, but my aunt (who usually does not like buffets) said it was pretty good and my boyfriend (another non-fan of buffets) said the prime roast was pretty good, but a little fatty. The dessert bar was also pretty good, dont' recommend the ice cream, which tasted more like creamy icee, but definitely do the German chocolate cake and cookies!  I also want to mention Barbara who was our server. She was very patient with us all and was on top of all our drinks and clearing off the tables. Good Job Barbara!

vOaUwsuwV2QFXcfWSiNrFQ.text: Yeah... this place is OK. I went back twice during my Vegas trip.   They have average buffet food...for dinner they have pizza, salad, sushi, fruit, roast beef, fish, crab legs, dessert, etc. For breakfast they have eggs, bacon, cereal, eggs Benedict, fruit, etc.   Is it reasonably priced and good, not great.   I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, if I wasn't staying at the Mandalay Bay.

vsQit_FJ6DlLiyy3tVrJFQ.text: I was in Vegas for a wedding and we had our "rehearsal dinner" the night before at the Bayside.  We didn't actually rehearse anything but that didn't stop us from stuffing our faces!  The layout here is neat in that you never feel like you are in a huge crowded buffet, but it's not so mazelike that you can't find your way around.  I actually skipped the salad which is a first for me and went straight to the crab legs.  They were a bit difficult to eat with no tools at all but they were tasty, not overcooked and horrible like I expected.  All in all a decent buffet, and I hear they have the "pay once, eat all day" deal going on here if you want to stick around the Mandalay all day.

_Be-h5KYv_awt3d4JPNcZQ.text: This buffet was alright for lunch. It costs $20 for a reasonable amount of tasty foods, but it didn't really "hit that spot" for me. The prime rib was juicy and flavorful, but that was the only thing that I really liked there.   I don't know what the hype was about it. Maybe I should try dinner?

Kbl1XHNamaLk7QH3eOJY7Q.text: Diverse selection, but just not worth the price. Unless, you can get your money's worth at the bar.

Ww31IkR7hN-zoNOrCUoJqw.text: Fact: I LOVE buffets.  Everyone raves about the buffet and The Aladdin and Wynn, but my favorite buffet on the Strip is by far The Buffet at Mandalay.  (Emphasis on "The" since they have "The" Hotel and "The Chapel.)  Breakfast consists of a create-your-own-omelet station, eggs benedict, french toast, and my personal favorite, longanisa (a sweet Filipino breakfast sausage).  They serve Alaskan King Crag Legs for lunch!  Already split open for easy eating!  Be still my heart...  Fact: Bay Side Buffet at Mandalay definitely deserves the distinction as "The" Buffet on the Strip.

qWjNBXpi4YaeidwZ-xfaxg.text: A pleasant surprise.  SO had  another freebie ( a relative term when you consider my crap table losses, almost offset by my blackjack winnings then big time loss on the ultimate gamble - the stock market ! )   barely made it in before they closed so i figured they would have slim pickin's, cold food.  Not quite  I tell ya, it's a catch -22 at a buffet when low carbin' - tons of meats to choose from, ok amount of veggies and yes, the salad bar and a smattering of desserts ( gotta scrape off the crusts on the sugar-free desserts) but you gotta resist the "real " desserts, the various startchy's - strong smell comin' from the garlic mashed bowl and the breads ( ehhhh, i usually avoid those when i'm carbin'. )    highlights - the scallops, the osso bucco, italian deli meats and cheeses, meatballs ( yeah , that's right THE MEATBALLS ! ), the turkey, braised short ribs ( very good ), carnita meat. service.  lows - limited veggies ( salad bar ok )   For some reason, i thought this buffet would be inferior to Bellagio and wynn.  I might just rate this above Bellagio but a notch below wynn ( gf still rates Bellagio's desserts the top dog )  cost ( if paying ) i believe $27 on a weekday.  Happy Eating !

jKvWiWsLSn657r0CO0wJKw.text: Waste of money if you're trying to find good food. It's a typical buffet. Low mediocre at best.

x99uSDcQX7lgFKtqoF2_Zw.text: Really good food and service,the cashier was really nice,he was from India im guessing dont remember his name,server was the best,he gave us really good service,love their unlimited champagne,good price as well...i recommend this buffet,one of the best in vegas

gSrI67_jgXxzvuxLo0x3uA.text: I went to the buffet for dinner after finishing up the Las Vegas Marathon yesterday and it was good. About $24 lunch and $29 for dinner including tax. I'll never forget that one pretty hostess there. I had a plate in my hand and I walked right by her. She's the fifth star...

Xd52KVqd7Brvlw0264HNRA.text: After experiencing the buffets at Bellagio Buffet, Rio Carnival, and Cosmopolitan Wicked Spoon, this was a big let down. It was no more than your average buffet but at a higher price. The food and servers do not reflect the quality I expect of Mandalay Bay.

ejJqemcB_pMJfvedMS9ykg.text: Overpriced mediocre food. It isn't God awful, but nothing to look forward to either. Save your bucks for more satisfying food. If you end up at the buffet anyway, the tiny Tiramisu and the cheese Blitzes are descent.

Ml9nQLhAhXlDfs4wnSvgrw.text: Prime Rib? Check!  Alaskan King Crab Legs? Check!  Pizza? Check!  Salad bar? Check!  This is a not-so-impressive buffet from Mandalay Bay. We picked it because we thought otherwise. "Everything else at Mandalay Bay is great," we thought, "how bad could this be?"  While it wasn't horrible, it just wasn't that memorable. Most of the offerings were the standard buffet fare. It's understandable because these sort of buffets need to be accessible to all people.    The highlight is their dessert offering. They had tiny lemon meringue pies, chocolate chip cookies, macaroons, bread pudding, soft serve ice cream, etc. They even had at least two sugar free cake offerings.   In the end, we got our money's worth, which is what a buffet by nature is designed to do.

wy3-rKJsdibPtic69jeeog.text: We came for dinner and paid $33 per person.  The food was okay, improvement can be made.  It can be expanded.  I've been to Bellagio's buffet which is 10 times better than Bayside.  I will not come back again to Bayside.  It is way overprice for $33.  Small selection from salad bar, main entrees to dessert.  I was unhappy.

lc_6_7XlxJcBcqqxImMSkw.text: Only if you are in Vegas on a budget would this place be acceptable.    Pros- - Cheap  - Lots of food  Cons- - Assembly line - Low quality food

AQOs_b8QHm2mif-lzrC_-A.text: Although this was going to be one of the highlights of our trip, it wasn't good!  We had eaten here several years ago and it was the BEST.  This time the food wasn't good.  Everything was chewy and tasted like it was left overs from lunch.  Even dessert wasn't good.  They ran out of everthing that was good, and said those items wouldn't be refilled.  The service is great!  Didn't have to ask for plates to be removed.  Great staff! Bad food!  Not worth your money!  Go someplace else.  I wish they had a theme for the night, so I could pick the night that sounds best.  You really just get a weird arrangement of food.  A theme would be nice, then you could pick the day you would want to go.

Ue5-oHy060zzuKbtKEN7NA.text: Not worth it. Only upside is there weren't too many people there. For such a nice hotel, the food was off. They did have crabs but everything else was alright. Servers were attentive but like I said, weren't too many people. Maybe since it was a weeknight and after the holidays. I'd spend the extra few bucks and dine at Aria, The M, or Cosmo.

BS3uzbdmttyUb0UNDmOA3w.text: This used to be my favorite brunch buffet because the food was always good and we always got seated near the windows with the great views.  I was shocked at how bad the food was on our last visit.  The crab legs were extremely dry and appeared to be leftovers from the night before.  Most of the food wasn't very appetizing.  We won't be coming back here again.

n2kCKhM3xBdjZwsMgaXY3w.text: Rating: 2.5 stars  We only came here because the line at the Wynn for brunch/lunch was ridiculous and we had a flight to catch. The place is not bad... it's just not great either. It's affordable though and well, you get what you pay for. It's not bad if you are on a budget. You still get a good selection of food.   The biggest noticeable difference for me was the dessert section. For those of you who have been to the Wynn, you know the dessert has their own ROOM. The selection is huge and almost everything tastes good. The selection here is very limited. I normally gorge myself with lots of dessert and none of it was quite that appetizing. I only took a bite or two out of a few items.   The salad bar is a bit lacking in ingredients. It seemed like there were more options for dressing than there were ingredients for the salad. The best part of the meal was the prime rib. It was very juicy and fatty - just the way I like it. They also had grapefruit in their fruit section. You don't find that often at a buffet. I'm not a big seafood fan and can't comment on the crab legs but my family seemed to enjoy them quite a bit. Oh there is also an omelet bar and the cook will make you an omelet with your choice of ingredients.   I would come here if you are on a budget and don't want to wait at another buffet. I think they are a bit understaffed though. There were quite a few tables that needed cleaning up. If they just cleaned up quicker, they would be able to seat more tables and shorten the wait time. One cool thing about the place is the kiosks at the front where you can just purchase your meal ticket instead of waiting in line to pay!

HZNGuJbUGr5vDkcqAqcQQw.text: Very good value compared with the wynn for dinner.  Fresh crab legs and high quality prime rib.  The service was great as well.  Fresh fruits and tasty desserts.  The seafood was very fresh.

zuTsW9FyQROHUdqQ42QMVQ.text: I think the buffet here is pretty good! the food is fresh! i remember the service being great.  So much food to select from, the price is right too!!

Q1rXl2g5Gc5SC7FHktdfuA.text: 8/13/2011 Long line slow cashiers but nice customer service.

_HzZT9_f5W7N_APdM8Eg2Q.text: Ok this is how it is. We were hungry and happened to be at Mandalay Bay so we decided this was the spot. Vegas is known for its excellent buffets well lemme tell ya this one is far from excellent. ALL the food looks soooo pretty so much so your afraid to eat it, but then you do and you have NEVER been more disappointed by an overpriced meal that you waited an 1 hr to get your hungry lil hands on. The food was so bland, even the desserts lacked flavor! YUCK I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL!

yIXyHq-pBy4CCd15O4e8yQ.text: What do you hate most about going to a buffet? No, it's not the guilt of stuffing food down your face and gaining 3 lbs. in an hour. Really, it's not. Ok, maybe for you fatties, but not me. What I hate the most is waiting in line to pay the cashier to get into the buffet. When you go to a buffet, you're already starving. The last thing you want is to wait half an hour (or more) in line while the people in front of you decide how they're going to split up the bill between everyone in their groups. Delegate one person to pay for everything for god's sake! Decide how much each person is going to pay later! Ugh. Anywho, the people who run this buffet got smart and set up self-paying kiosks in place of cashiers. Tap the touch-screen a few times, insert money or a credit card, take your receipt and show it to the hostess who will lead you to your table. Genius! Pure genius!  There's a great selection of food, tender and tasty prime rib, and delectable sweets. But man, those kiosks are sexy...

iuu63DHRh6VIffW4XI1nNA.text: We went for the breakfast buffet under the heavy insistence of the boys in the party with bottomless tummies. All I have to say is -- Lender's bagels.  oh ok. I'll say a few words more -- 45 minute line for the omelette station. crispy, but weirdly tasteless, bacon. hash that looked like ground-up dead person. stale tortillas.  the best things were the service (our guy came by about, oh, 1 million times to refill our juice/coffee/water) and the relative price (17 bucks for breakfast).

MYla7Iwf0aeplE_-vLi57g.text: The food was tasty and good variety. Food was separated by sections, seafood, beef, Chinese, Mexican, European, salads, deserts, etc. Drinks included soda fountain, wine, beer, and champagne. I am not giving 5 stars because I am very picky with food; however, it was a good tasty 4 starts buffet for me.

Gqt5Ap5a5QcV5V6t8osU3A.text: MB has a so-so buffet. Most of their points come from the decor alone--beautiful tropical outdoor setting to look out to. The selection is poor.  Too few food, too little desserts. Quality of the food is just meh. Certainly no where near what it costs. Excalibur, much cheaper and lower rated, tastes better. I agree that I would rather go to Mcds than Bayside. And I love MB as a hotel and casino. This is sad.

oOxF7AK-1aBsJx3kYPZcUA.text: The food is not good at all. Don't try the Japanese Maki/Sushi !!!. Just waste of more than $30.

_c_VC3hwhWsI2STaXg2QBg.text: Eww not worth the 20 bucks for lunch I would rather go to the Aria. Service was awful they never brought refills on some of our friends' drinks, never brought steak sauce we asked for twice, there was no chili of any kind even siracha And my chair was dirty and when i asked to have it replaced all they did was wipe it with a dirty rag and leave behind all the gunk.  The food was all mediocre there was literally nothing that looked all that appetizing. I heard one of the chefs tell the cooks to take out the chicken and throw in some scallops in sauce bc they were about to turn..... Problem is they said this in Spanish to each other....guess what everyone and their mother speaks spanish!  And last but not least they were filling the dessert displays with cakes coming from what looked like store bought containers... Not a single dessert tasted fresh or edible.

Do69l0sJc3llHCXrfJLxXw.text: Quality and variety of entrees are good. Something for everyone. Pay the small fee for unlimited champagne, it's worth it! Our waiter was very attentive and also kept the glasses full. Only knock was the crab, very tiny with little meat.

KkRjDsW6ZCxMuGDNh8p2HA.text: A pretty good buffet, actually.  I was used to going to the amazing buffet at Bellagio and it was nice to try something else.  Most of the dishes were good - some of my favorites included the Prime Rib and Cheese Stuffed Blintzes.  The prime rib was a bit over cooked, but it had a ton of flavor; the blintzes were soft and the cheese had the perfect amount of sweetness to it.   The other items were a bit hit-or-miss, but over all a great deal ($23.00 for a champagne Sunday brunch).  If you're staying at Mandalay Bay or Luxor, which is close by, and want a cheap, decent buffet, this is a good option.

O0_XCUPCGN7YRd2k-o5L3g.text: Great buffet!  Vegas has some of the best buffet's in the world.  They have 6 automated kiosks in the front entrance where you first walk in making the line waaaay faster than other buffets.  You pay and get seated in no time at all!  Oh how I love technology.  Plus they also have great service and an extensive selection of food.  The guy constantly came and refilled our drinks and took away our plates in a timely manner.  We came here for Sunday Brunch which automatically includes champagne.  Great deal for $23.99!  We got unlimited mimosas and champagne with our meal, along with endless coffee.  The buffet offered king crab legs, shrimp cocktail, prime rib, pork loin, eggs benedict, poached eggs, scrambled eggs, a make your own omelet bar, waffles, french toast, sushi, smoked salmon with capers, beef and broccoli, sausages, mashed potatoes, seared scallops, and more... I hope I didn't forget any of the important stuff!  They also have a nice dessert bar with a wide array of cakes, cookies, tarts, and even frozen yogurt with waffle cones!  Eat your breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert here in this fabulous all-you-can-eat Vegas buffet!

p8dP1jUZVVduId-88S8zsg.text: The WORST buffet I've ever had in Vegas! Spare yourself the money and go to ANYWHERE else! I tried many things and it was all awful! Should have asked for my money back; but I'll help you save yours-- PASS this place!

j895DrI01kJ0rF9BPSJvsQ.text: Since there was only a 1 hour wait for this buffet on Christmas night, we came here in lieu of waiting 3+ hours. I know that the shorter wait means the buffet isn't as popular or top of the top as the others, but Bayside Buffet isn't the worst. They have a decent amount of seafood available: crab legs (the warm ones at a different station are a lot juicer and better than the cold ones), mussels, shrimp cocktail, popcorn shrimp, fried calamari, and this medley of seafood in tomato sauce. They also have a custom-made-to-order pasta station and a carving station, but I was too focused on the seafood to venture there. I do have to point out that the desserts were not the same as some of the other buffets I've been to. The soft serve frozen yogurt came out slightly melted and because the bowls next to the machine were still pipping hot from being washed, the soft serve was 70% melted by the time I went back to my table to eat it. Their toppings could be better organized, such as having pumps for the hot fudge and the various syrups. They were available in open containers so it was very messy trying to scoop the sauces onto your soft serve when the serving ladle was caked with hot fudge that some previous child had carelessly dripped into the strawberry sauce. Even though it was Christmas Day and they advertised some Christmas specific items, I didn't see too many of the special items.   We got pretty good service from our server, who made sure our drinks were constantly replenished. They also have the actual metal crab clamps for you to wrestle with for your crab legs, different from those plastic fork looking things that other places hand you.

Id6GzmoNNNfcIRXuV1jl6g.text: I was disappointed of the quality of the food.  I ate here about two years ago and couldn't wait to go back since it was so good.  The menu remained pretty much the same, but the food prepared was not up to par,  The prime rib was really salty and tough.  The crabl legs was smaller and again real salty. Panda Express would exceed the quality of the Chinese food in that paticular section.  The sushi was chilled so cold that the rice cell apart.  Now I know why there was no line for this Restaurant.  The only reason I gave it two stars was the service was excellent.  Hope they improve on their food.

grwbxmTMqwUk3t065qjzUA.text: I can't fathom people giving this buffet a good review. Don't get me wrong, I know buffets are hit or miss but in Vegas I expect way more. We have been to the buffet in Treasure island a few times and it was great. This one however, we will not be attending again.  The crab legs were good, but that's about it. I would suggest you do not waste your money.

z8VjXEMpJzkwm4ewi0tdbg.text: Glad I didn't listen to the negative reviews and gave this place a shot since we were staying at the Mandalay Bay.  Roast Beef was quality and delicious.  Service was good and selection was decent.  Certainly 10x better than the buffet at Excalibur.  Will definitely pay the Bayside another visit when I'm back in Vegas.

h9YsryfwqlDuWyUx0YBUZg.text: The Bayside Buffet was really good the MB. Although the hotel customer service was not the best, I do think that the staff at the Bayside Buffet were great and the Prime Rib was the best quality

AlVtVKYwAqXVwcIogL4P4Q.text: Its hard to compare a place like Mandalay Bay with other low tiered hotel / casinos because there is such a diffrence in amenities, service, and quality ambiance.  Same can be said for this fabulous buffet, which for a reasonable price feature some very good food during all hours of the day.  The breakfast time is especially phenomenal, as the omelettes are delivered to each table after ordering and were in my experiences cooked to pure perfection.  The hashbrowns are usually a buffet casualty as they're butchered by the patrons to just mini sheds of potatoes, but at least here its been crispy and flaked to a way where its still perfect after many diggings.  Dinner is a whole new story as the prices are higher and the food is excellent.  The fish is of some of the best quality (halibut, salmon, skate) and so are the awesome crab legs.  I've seen the occasional lobster tail here even.  Its reminiscent of the Bellagio buffet but with less well dressed folks and a better view of the strip.

f5i86VwRaaMaARvthm6JTA.text: bayside buffet is not in the same category as wynn or bellagio's. I would probably rank bayside with Mirage. Although i think Mirage is still better than bayside.  I havent been to bayside buffet in a while, but from what i remember, their lunch buffet was not bad. it had a decent selection.  of the times i went, i always request to sit by the window, where i can see their pool. It's nice to people watch.   taste of their food, it was okay.. nothing spectacular.  desserts werent great though.

o1BYoYKa_bZyZ1wD-ZDDIg.text: I think 3.5 stars is about right.  We came here last Saturday night after narrowing it down to Rio and Mandalay Bay.  Mandalay Bay won out this time because we ate at Rio the last time we were in Vegas.  It's always good to try something new, right?  For about $30, you're treated to a better-than-average Vegas buffet.  I think for about $35, you can eat all day long. I'm not really sure if that requires you sitting in the restaurant all day and eating, or whether it means you can leave and come back to eat whenever you want.  Either way, it sounds awesome; I mean, I think the prospect of having a buffet be your day-long prison is a pretty sweet and ridiculous idea.  Anyway, here are some highlights: + Lots of seafood!  Crab legs! Many salmony salmons! White fishies! Scallops!  Big shrimp!  Yay scavengers of the sea! + Meats!  Chicken legs! Fried! Veal! Stewed! Prime rib! Other many meats for to eat!  Even though I've been trying to eat less red meat, I was like oh screw it, I'm eating well tonight! + The Asian foods:  not spectacular, but I still appreciate it being there.  Sushi, pot stickers, Chinese foods, etc.  All decent-tasting! + Desserts!  Many! All good!  That's saying a lot!  Because I don't have a sweet tooth! + And one of my FAVORITE parts of the meal: they had CHEESES!  I am a lover of the CHEESES, so when I saw the CHEESES I got all drooly and excited and piled all the CHEESES (they's got blue CHEESES, other hard CHEESES that I can't remember, etc.) on my plate, and that was my dessert.  Loved the addition and the tastes of the CHEESES.  I must also note that the dining rooms are very pretty, with dim lighting and a comfortable atmosphere.    So, overall, I enjoyed this buffet a lot, wasn't blown away, but would consider coming back the next time I'm in Vegas.  Although, if you're deciding on ONE buffet to eat in Vegas, you gotta hit up the Rio buffet.  It is KICK ASS.    Aite, and with that, I'm out.

1-s32H15xX5so23P3F52eQ.text: A decent self serve salad bar w a variety of ingredients, including spring mix, romaine & iceberg base, very vegetarian friendly! We came here for Saturday brunch, $25/person. Fruits & veggie items were great, cooked foods tasted similar but had more variety than Wynn's $45/person. The most important factor for us is to have some vegetarian options, which there's plenty here as brunch. The kale bean soup was a nice surprise.

-PYs3I8JnDJ3TKQou2YKKw.text: We were in Vegas for Thanksgiving and didn't feel like dropping $60 per person for the Bacchanal buffet (Thanksgiving prices), especially for a party of 12. At $30 per person, the food was not bad at all. We got there at 12 and they still had breakfast items available as well as lunch and thanksgiving lunch items as well. The food was not excellent but was pretty good and I more than had my fill. The prime rib was so tender, though a little dry, but was still pretty good. All the food was hot and I could see the staff constantly checking the food temperature to make sure all was well. There was so much to choose from but I was able to try everything I wanted. They have a good selection though probably not as much as Bacchanal or the buffet at the Bellagio, but you'll definitely get your money's worth. The staff is attentive and always making sure our drinks were filled and tables cleared. Also there was no line to get in to the buffet. Give it a try if you don't feel like waiting at the other buffets. It's actually not bad at all.

SSvNuCj4afT2xNbuUt_cvQ.text: I would have expected a little more from Mandalay Bay. The food was OK (prime rib and crab legs being the 2 leading items), but nothing compared to Bacchanal at Ceaser's. The wait staff made a lot of mistakes. I ordered an iced tea and was brought a pink lemonade. It was about 10 minutes before he came around again so I could ask him to correct it. I told him that I ordered an iced tea, not a lemonade. What does he do? He comes back with another pink lemonade, which I promptly sent back. They were also slow to pick up the dirty plates from the table. I would save your money and pay the extra to eat at Bacchanal at Ceaser's instead of this place.

TO5hZjrLQ60I9nf50ZyKcw.text: I finally got to try this place!! Thanks to the Yelpers who made it out for my birthday weekend in the City of Sin.   You walk up to the ATM type machines and pay for your party. Then you get in line and wait to be seated. It was quite nice of the hostess' that day to let us wait for the rest of our party (it was a rough, but fun, crazy night the night before) to catch up before actually seating us.  The food is typical of any Vegas buffet, with salad, and numerous proteins, carbs, and just about anything under the sun for you to get your grub on. It was a lot better than Bellagio's buffet.   I was stuffed and quite happy after going here. I can't wait for our next visit.

kqLw7W4Ot7BJHP9u-86AqA.text: Mandalay Bay is part of the MGM family and we got a deal when we stayed in Vegas to eat at a buffet for free each day which didn't include dinner. Okay so we took the tram and ate brunch here. It was terrific! After eating at Monte Carlo which was horrible, M. Bay made it look like Dennys and this was like, well, um, IHOP.. Okay, IHOP isn't much better but its a bit better right?  I digress.  The omelets were great, the bacon extra crispy and the crab was delish... I kept my pineapple juice going with some shots of Malibu Rum (thanks to my friendly ABC stores) and the day was looking brighter by the time I finished.  Since we didn't have to pay, I can't say too much for the price but would we spend $20 there for brunch again. Probably.  YUM!

N0CdO90ndnpBswMx1GCmsg.text: Good experience here! Party of 11 and about half of us were actually there. They got a table of 8 for us and a table of 4 right by us so we can all sit together. The great thing? When the rest of our party came I just walked to the front, grabbed everyone after they paid, told the hostess, and they walked right in. No waiting in line! Isn't that nice? :)  Bayside is another Vegas Buffet. Yes I know. BUT Why do they deserve 4 stars???? It is due to the assistance of Wes, Kolbe, and Mike. LA Yelpers baby!!!! They assisted in helping me get over being gross out or creeped out by crab legs. I actually had fun with them!!!! Crack them open, pull, grab the meat, dip a little in the butter, and YUMMMMO! Yes, sometimes it was still a little creepy whenever I saw the parts that were attached to the body, but either way, YAY! It was SO good! It wasn't the cold kind either. Warm and yummy.   O! Our server (the 2nd one, not the grumpy 1st one) was the SHIIIIT! He brought us carafes of drinks and was very attentive about taking away our plates. Good job dude! Too bad I forgot his name! :(  We also ran into a Washington DC Yelper there too! She had on a Yelp shirt and of course we all approached her. Too bad I forgot her name! UGH. I have a bad memory. More so after a long weekend.  Crab Legs. CHECK. Shrimp cocktail thingys. CHECK. Good coffee. CHECK. Stuffed beyond belief with food, dessert, soda, water, and coffee. CHECK. hahahaha :)  Note: Where's my Yelp shirt doodies!? :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xdrbzv245cYL00pQlVxJEg.text: Sadly their buffet, over my last three visits (one a year) has steadily declined to a level of mediocrity. Their price remains the same! A top notch price with a mediocre buffet.  Their desserts are quite average now and their once outstanding baked or fried chicken is now average. So goes for the other foods I like. I can find better buffets for a lower price than Bayside.   My visit to Bayside, on this trip will be my last. Unless I hear of an improvement. I have too many other good buffets and restaurants to enjoy. My reviews for them are posted here. Bye bye Bayside. I am disappointed to experience your decline to mediocrity.

2RS2AF9xHkdwN2Px3PaIFA.text: Solid three stars. Nothing too fancy and the food is good. Had good service and it was quick and convenient. Ok value for the money. Not one of the top buffets but not the worst either I've ever had. Went there for a quick dinner on a Friday night after tearing down a trade show booth. Just walked in and was seated immediacy and was given good service. Food was for the most part fresh and plentiful.

I7nYgmvSqu4MCrO6nTitbA.text: This buffet surpassed even what I've come to expect from the money hungry MGM corporation. Some of the most unappetizing food I've ever seen at a buffet. Low quality ingredients, everything dry and tasteless. Avoid.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strange yellow stuff floating on top of the chicken noodle soup.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poached eggs, anyone?
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham. Dry and gross.

u6TQrwPbbWQvmhMSnlVfPg.text: Half the quality of a cheap Chinese buffet, triple the price. The best things here are the restrooms close outside, so I can throw up before I get food poisoning.   I mean the "sushi" is hardly sushi, the only thing that looks like it would be sushi is a maki roll with a tomato inside made to look like a piece of fish. Unacceptable.  A Chinese buffet may have 20% of the real estate of this restaurant, but this restaurant has 10% of the choices.  The only time I've been half as disappointed, was when my doctor told me I had AIDS, because after eating here, I probably have cancer.  I can't even call this restaurant "sh*t" because at least I'm satisfied when I take a dump.  Also the waitress just stepped on my shoes.  While walking through the buffet, we saw one of the workers filling up the macaroni salad from a prepackaged box. Id say I'm disappointed, but really I'm not surprised.  1 star for reminding me of what crap tastes like so I can appreciate what normal food tastes like.

ZQ6EbsJdSG6j3u_By2WZeA.text: Used to love this brunch. Sad to say no more local discount and NO more crab legs at brunch. For the price it's just a bit above average. This always was the best brunch in town..guess things have changed.

1BLrwcxMInD1j_9QYdpZeQ.text: The food is good and the selection is good. What is bizarre is they do not give guests straws for their drinks -- even if requested. The service staff members were courteous and attentive to refills and any special requests.

NvGl6ljfVkZNNkP7MKnrTA.text: We loved it. The seating was comfortable. The staff was friendly. For around $20 per person for lunch we all found a wide assortment of dishes we could enjoy.   Peeled shrimp? Oh yes. This has to be one of the few buffets left that offer peeled shrimp. This feature alone is a star in and of itself for the time and effort saved.   We all loved the black bean breaded ball thingies...so good they could pass for a dessert.   And the fresh authentic dessert selection kept us all entertained for far longer than we liked.   Its not the Sterling, or the Baccanal or Wynn, but for the price I don't think it has a rival on the strip especially if you enjoy quality "staple" fare that is more about taste than presentation.   As an aside, we showed up about 45 minutes before lunch was to end and the food was still being served fresh. They keep smaller serving plates out which increase the turnover rate.

ggBP7UFHyJD59Q_BH9QW-A.text: No wait for lunch at 12:00pm!  We used a my Vegas offer but I get one free which was a great deal. There were many different options from sushi to a pasta station, Mexican, pizza a salad bar. Like many buffets the food was just ok!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TZ8u6SzpGztafcRfJxQYGA.text: We did the Sunday brunch buffet and it had lots of offerings. Some items were a little dry or hard (pancakes, French toast sticks, etc). Other items were delicious and I paid the extra to have the endless "Brut". The waitress was a little sarcastic when I needed extra orange juice to out with my champagne, so that was annoying, but she did eventually bring it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
