CS6xh1RXHhoaQ1RmLkkEaw.text: Horrible customer service experience here,our so called waiter never even came to ask us about how was everything going.I had to keep getting up to find someone for refills on our drinks and I have never heard of a place that does not use straws .The food was also horrible and it cost $26 a person and horrible customer service and food.Spoke to both of the guy managers there about our horrible experience and they didn't seem to care.The only thing they said is that they would speak to their waiters that's all.If I could give this place a 0 star I would.

J6EswUJThubN0no9JmqklQ.text: 12 years of visits to Las Vegas and most trips have a visit to this buffet involved.   The place is always clean and the food fresh.  I know there are cheaper buffets but you get what you pay for.  The only downside is the dessert selection.  It would be better if the carrot cake was more like home made.

1_xRdXM8YTf4nJHugvJNJA.text: Stay in this hotel for couple of days, the buffet is decent and the price is fair. You can eat different dishes without waiting for a long time.

LlnsT6PmhWZx-Irji1_-ag.text: Mediocre food for the price, the bread area and dessert area had bugs flying around the food and on the food. And to top it off there was a bird flying around and the wait staff did not care. Overpriced cafeteria food, I do not recommend this at all.

Aspb0tFrmn62V4CYmFjaIA.text: It's not the best but it wasn't the worst either. They do have a little bit of everything. They also do have sugar free options for dessert. I would not recommend the shrimp, took one bite and could tell that it has just been sitting there for a long while and it also didn't smell right. Overall I did enjoy my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t2JtsgkSXRedeJf6RbfHHA.text: We came here for breakfast and it was good. It was better then a Stations casino buffet.   I had flank steak, lox and capers, salmon pizza, couscous salad, panko salmon and an endless supply of blueberries and black berries. I'm not a fan of breakfast foods so I was happy they were able to cater to my taste bud dilemmas. If you want a fancy buffet go to Bellagio but it's was good enough for us

hQv1IYPY08GouRrkaHVMWg.text: Dear Seth and/or Brad,  Please work on your reading comprehension skills. I said one cookie was all right, not that the entire dessert selection was. The desserts, like most of the other food, was, as I said, meh, unmemorable. The dessert selection was just as poor as the other slim offerings.  And I can see how cleanliness escapes employees' attention with someone with your attention to detail at the helm. *slow clap*

aZ6qoGvb5duaN7LSgZ6bPQ.text: I came here because it was free with my hotel reservation. It was Christmas Eve and we wait for almost 2 hrs.  Prices are really expensive compare with the variety of food served here.  Bar looks long but it just repeat menu one side and other.  For free was good, but if you are paying, go and get a sandwich in front (Citizens), it is such better!

-SQKQx3KL2qIkIcNe7Ga-g.text: STAY AWAY!!!! Hands down the worst buffet in Vegas. They were out of anything that tasted decent. Most food was dry, over cooked, and bland. Service was crap too. We had to get silverware for ourselves. The first waitress only got drinks for half the table. We had to bus our own plates. The third waitress asked four times if my fiance wanted another Coke, but she never actually brought it. The only thing that will make my experience worse is if I get food poisoning.

rY5z0RtDEQiZF3pp198mgw.text: Had really great service.  Food was fresh.  Good variety. Dessert need a lot of help.  Salad topping we're good.  Soup was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1-FjoDvvZajzETndJaNBmA.text: We were excited for this buffet our whole stay.  I have only had the buffet at a hotel in Laughlin and it is AMAZING.  I thought Vegas would step even that up.    Oh.  Hell.  No.    As someone who is allergic to seafood and doesn't eat meat there was virtually nothing for me to eat.  Cheese pizza?  Cheese lasagna?  A crappy salad bar that school cafeterias do better?  I thought, "Oh well, I'll have some fruit, some rice for more carbs, and just head to the dessert side for more carbs because -screw it."  Rice was terrible.  Fruit was hard and not ripe.  Desserts were dry, not flavorful, and honestly left me wishing I had a McDonalds chocolate chip cookie.    I am so, so disappointed in the entire experience - EXCEPT the server.  She was very sweet.

iRQXFpX3gccAlxyiZGzn9w.text: My wife and both really used to enjoy this buffet and made a point of coming back here this year after three or so years. The food was mediocre at best.  Best that can be said is SOME of the food was warm ...... only some.    The service was lackluster at best.  Took close to ten minutes to get our water. It wasn't all that busy so no reason it should've take half the time.... Yeah yeah, I guess that should've been our clue that this wasn't what it use to be.

pESTTsMNcb-F_Oe2ho9QIQ.text: Went for lunch. $21.99. Everything tastes like it came from a can or a freezer. Generic, uninspired food in a city full of options. Didn't look forward to going back to the buffet. Now we're in a sad food coma. Skip this one!

oXLp3KpCDkrJLfBYIHD3Qw.text: Went here and the food was exactly what I read about from an article from 2017. I could not do the desserts.  The salad looks lonely and bare. The rest of the food was ok. I  think the service was excellent. The person who delivered my soda made sure I did not go thirsty. It was a one time visit for me. I m just sayin

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My bill
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_cBZ80hiibZxAXN_xwMXgg.text: This will be the last time visiting this buffet. All of the food quality was poor, cold, and not many choices to choose the menu from even though its a BUFFET. Maybe 6 different menus to choose from...and we paid $33 per person. It will be the last time comin to this place.  The only positive thing was..the server was friendly. Thats about it. Wasted $70...DO NOT COME TO ANY LAS VEGAS HOTEL BUFFETS...MGM IS A RIPOFF NOW

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is the ripoff receipt from Mandalay Buffet...it applies for all other buffets in the strip!!! Stay off!!

-qv1JdWBAwx6ZEqmPS7cMw.text: Save your money unless you like  or  I can't think of anything else was good. I felt waste of money & time. Pizza was saggy, Lausanne was stale, all Asian food was kinda weird coz was not fresh. Worst thing ppl serving are not friendly at all, they don't answer simple question about what's inside this pasta or Lausanne.  Not worth unless you have a free buffet lol

Hx2-CQxHdTTJOWebDj-iDg.text: Great buffet with excellent choices. It did not open until 7 am but was well worth the wait for breakfast.   Every breakfast food you could think of including but not limited to...eggs Benedict, waffles, pancakes, salmon, desserts, sausage gravy, omelettes to order, turkey, pork chops, sald bar, fruit,  and the list goes on.....forever.  The cost was $18.99, however a normal sized meal at another restaurant on site at Mandalay may be another 10-15 dollars more a plate. Well worth the price.

VQHnnLv0UGWJQ5zuxDdslA.text: This buffet is unfortunately poor in variety and quality of food.  Considering its location within Mandalay Bay and the cost. Dinner is 32.99 it appears clear there are much better choices to choose from while in Las Vegas. For breakfast, lunch and dinner the selection barely changes. And each day the food is the same.  Fried chicken consisted of only legs !!!  Carving station included small pieces of meat of turkey and beef with sausage. Meats were only warm and sausages were dried out and over cooked. Vegetables also over cooked. Salad bar also not much selection with shredded lettuce as if it were cabbage. Come on Brad Weinstein makes this place better and read the sad reviews your receiving.

ynReAiIQOTAmeInnUWHt4Q.text: I have barely anything to say about this buffet. It was...meh...food was forgettable. Juice tasted unusual.  Cookies were stale. Potatoes were ok. Wait in line for the luxor buffet. Same price but better quality and more options.

iBw7a63dLkUuGtGBuYELLQ.text: We frequent MGM buffets due to being MLife players so on a Thursday night we chose to return to Bayside Buffet after a few months when we previously stayed at Delano and loved Mandalay, the buffet all of it but let me say... wow this was more than disappointing & borderline disgusting.   Upon arriving I noticed the floor in the entrance to the buffet was noticeably dirtier than the casino floor, littered with trash, cigarette butts, etc. Which I found odd not something I'm used to seeing at any of the other mgm properties.  While paying by card, the cashier put her hand in front of mine when I went to tip and hit no tip on the computer... why I have no clue when I said "wait I was trying to tip" she sighed as if it was a bother she had to restart the transaction she messed up. Idk about you but I tip my servers  so whatever she fixes it sends us to be seated... the hostesses were in no rush to finish their convo before choosing to seat us and proceeds to walk us through the busiest section of the rest and attempts to squeeze us into a small 2 seat table in between two large parties of 6 or more...Did I mention this a buffet? So obviously it would be uncomfortable for not only us but the two other families we would squeeze by each time to get food, she relocated us which was fine. We order drinks they come, we grab food come back, I ask our server for straws he informs me that they don't have them for the environment... I said not even upon request, he said no the only straws are cocktail straws and he would have to go ask a manager if he could get me one.... so I told my fiance enjoy I have worked at a casino I know the types of glass washers that are used im not putting my mouth on those glasses. A few moments later he returns with two straws not cocktail straws appearing Starbucks straws...   Needless to say at this point I had already decided I wouldn't be back the food was good but selection slim and the server was nice but definitely they were understaffed and he bore the brunt of it.  So yay I have a straw I can actually eat, drink, enjoy my meal..... NOPE go to get food come back to dirty wine glasses on our table as if someone walked by and left them. I disregarded but did take note of the large table next to us drinking red wine it wasn't until the clearly drunk guest stood up and loudly stated who's table should I put glasses on next when we had enough. Clearly over served, no one intervened as this man proceeded to return to the bar every few minutes to get new drinks. Mandalay has a responsibility to all patrons to provide a safe environment and that was not it. Seems to me Mandalay has a management or lack of supervision issue. I went from loving the Delano and Mandalay property and now I will never return. I addressed all my concerns with Carmelita who offered to move our table.  like I had an appetite after that no apologies no implication that any action would be taken to ensure other families could enjoy their meals..   I won't be surprised when Mandalay is the next big property to close down the reputation is already tarnished and you guys definitely are not helping in the customer service department.

GOfx49Pwe770kp7is3-UbQ.text: My friends and I had free vouchers to eat at the Bayside Buffet for lunch/brunch for two days (Saturday and Sunday) and even with the price being FREE, we didn't think it was worth it. Calling it mediocre might even be overstating the quality. The selection isn't that big and isn't exciting at all. The carved beef was for the most part insanely dry and overcooked. My friends asked for the rarest piece the guy could shave off and it was still disappointing. The shrimp were either low quality or over boiled.  Most infuriating for me, was that on weekend brunch, they didn't offer whipped cream or creme fraiche for the waffles. This is a buffet at a major hotel in Las Vegas ... I expect extravagance and to be able to  overindulge in things like creamy sugary goodness on my carb loaded plate!   Being that we had free vouchers, we returned on the second day and all agreed that that was a mistake. The few food items that we found suitable weren't there the second day!!!! And the beef was even dryer on the second day!! If you are visiting Vegas and love food like my friends and I do, don't fall for the free voucher that Mandalay Bay occasionally offers for their buffet. They use it as an incentive to stay at their hotel, and you think, hell yeah, I'm saving $30 per person per day on a meal! But if you love food, this is a waste of a meal while staying in one of the funnest food cities in the country! There are SO many other great buffets and restaurants in Vegas. DO NOT waste stomach space (or god forbid, your money) on the Mandalay buffet. It's disappointing, depressing, and if you paid for it, a rip off. Mandalay execs should really go take a walk and look at their competitions' buffets to get some inspiration for a face lift.

Ey_DgxJ90MDvZK_6F1966A.text: You know, for about $15 more you can actually enjoy your dinner in one of the fine restaurants you, just NOT this one. If Denny's had a buffet it would be better than this. Four of us dined "a little" differently, and none of us had much good to say about anything. If food can insult your intelligence consider yourself scammed. The ONLY FOOD that I found hot, and decent, was the fried chicken. The rest, well......even the desserts, boring, super sweet, and very little that was inventive. For everything else MB does well, this is one big disappointment.

mJzsZIVp8VW7JlKUuszo8g.text: So glad we went to Bayside Buffet for our Thursday evening dinner. Arrived around 8pm and the food was great. Family of 4. Two adults and 2 teens and everyone left feeling satisfied, full and highly recommend. Wait staff and all employees we encountered were fabulous. They had cold and warm crab legs/claws and your usual selection of American, Latin, Italian, Asian, carved meats, salad and desserts. They also had their seafood selections and drinks of course. Awesome dinner and we will be back when we return to Vegas

8Tc2MBsKLHXCsnAhNzb9iA.text: It was alright but I expected better. I was a little disappointed because they didn't have roast beef at the carving station. Maybe it was because it was during lunch on a week day. Service was great and I really enjoyed their bread pudding.

-Rkg3GVtIKVSQfoMtAXyIg.text: The buffet is 32.99. They have a limited selection. Although they have crab legs the rest of their food is garbage. The only thing that was good here was the cookies that I'm certain were not made there. Skip it. Golden Corral is even better than this place.

eWetf7ircaVaxb2y92tJBg.text: The cost is $25 with tax and add on comes to$ 27 and a few tips ... The Brunch I attended had almost most foods. Got a omelette made with veggies and that was enough to fill me up, then tried their salmon, bread pudding and salad. The items were all good.

u062dMB9rR0wrUi5KjQCCQ.text: In town for a couple of conventions and the wife wanted a buffet so we looked at a couple and our hotel had a shuttle to Mandalay Bay so we decided to give this one a try. Arrived about 415pm on Saturday night and expected to wait a few minutes for the buffet to open for dinner, however they were still seating from brunch (which is also a couple dollars cheaper than dinner) so we get seated right away our waited got our drinks right away and kept the empty plates cleared.  While the chef was putting out the dinner selections, I heard her tell the staff to make double of everything because they were expecting a large party, (looked like about 200 people when they arrived) and while the wife and I were almost done by the time the large party arrived, I appreciate this forward thinking by the chef and management to make it a great experience for everyone.  If you are looking for a lot of sushi, king crab, oysters or a days worth of food for under $30  you might be disappointed but if you want a reasonable selection of menu items to satisfy different tastes then you will probably be happy with this buffet. It is not the top buffet in Las Vegas but it is a very good choice if you are hungry and don't want to spend $$$$ on dinner.  Some of the highlights BBQ ribs - very meaty Lamb Osco Buco - Super Tender and Full of Flavor Dungeness Crab - Wife Loved it, large meaty pieces Bread Pudding with Vanilla Sauce - Very Tasty Vegetable Soup - Full of flavors Swedish Meatballs - Almost as good as Ikea Panko Breaded Salmon - Super Good Asian Spicy Beef Orange Pork  Highly Recommended

Qf-cwSJsYm6c30FXCnyqOw.text: For $35 buffet, it is priced right for what they offer. There are some varieties you don't find at other buffets, like oxtail, cioppino, or Salmon Wellington, among others. There is not much sushi variety. But they don't lack meat varieties. We got there early enough to get some chicken noodle soup. But they ran out afterward and they brought out tomato soup instead.  As far as freshness is concerned, some people might give it a bit lower grade.  They are not fancy. You won't find the kind of food display you get at Wynn or Caesars. But you will get a bit more than what a $35 buffet should offer. There is no long line. But it has a good crowd at peak dinner hour. Staff is nice.

YzFAB5FDE2KpE2bZ9xyR1g.text: Like my other recent review of another spot at the Mandalay Bay hotel...this was a very average (and expensive) breakfast / brunch / lunch buffet spot, but an extensive selection of food and dessert items to choose from.  I chose a made-to-order omelette with a side of bacon.  The chef prepared my egg dish as planned, but it came out kind of runny (not fully unexpected given the number of dishes he was making simultaneously).  The bacon was crisp, but more on the chewy side from sitting around for some amount of time.  I did sample a few desserts, and while they looked good their flavors were on the bland side (a chocolate chip cookie and a piece of oreo cheesecake).  I've gotta believe there are much better alternatives within reasonable walking distance that don't cost nearly as much...but for convenience and quantity this place could certainly fit the bill.

D8TXK9P-msrVk6g_KqM8Ig.text: We went to the brunch buffet and for the price you absolutely get your monies worth!!   Brunch serves delicious breakfast options: pancakes, eggs Benedict, country fried steak, biscuits, gravy, eggs, ham, bacon, sausage, made to order omelets, yogurt, fruit PLUS all the lunch offerings: caved NY Steak, Chinese selections, sushi, salads, American sides, soups and tons of desserts!   Brunch is where it is at!!   I would highly recommend the Bayside Buffet for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DHL0AzX7c1bXwrSdLSLoJg.text: Great service!  Wonderful staff.  The staff was very helpful as to how to get around to the tram. Our server had a few tables, but always kept our glasses full and checked back habitually.

5wFUF_nOiOBfDXV7AMEysQ.text: So no Vegas trip is complete without a trip to a Buffet!  We came here on Friday morning as were leaving for home.  There was no line to get in which was surprising.  We paid at a self service kiosk but if you didn't want to do that you could pay a cashier.  We got a nice seat by the window and were promptly brought out our coffee and orange juice.  The breakfast selection was O.K.  They could have had some more egg options and potato and/or hashbrown options as well.  We hit up the omelette station and they guy manning the station did such an incredible job we gave him a tip.  I also found a nice salad bar too and made a nice salad and the fruit selection was really good too.  Overall, it's just your standard buffet with some good choices...nothing too special but I would go back again.  It was a fair price at $14.99 per person.

bqVanJOwVY1MyLOQZLsk3w.text: I feel bad just giving this place 3 stars, because the selection was fantastic, both in terms of quantity and diversity.  Lots of delicious choices.  We went in at lunch.  It wasn't dead, but wasn't swamped either, but it took us awhile to get any water with our meal.  I had to chase down a wait her to get some!  However, he was quite attentive to us after that and even brought us our own caraffe.  The thing that really pulls this buffet down to 3 stars for me was all of the seafood that I tried.  I tried the cioppino, the panko salmon, and some sushi rolls.  I am a seafood fan, but this fish tasted TOO fishy, to the point where I only took a bite of each.  I love sushi, but by no means am a sushi snob (I will even go to a higher quality conveyor belt place and enjoy it), and the bite I took of my roll here made me feel sick to my stomach.  Sushi, in my opinion, should NEVER have a strong "fishy" taste, but this sushi did.  If you steer clear of the sushi, though, there is SO much to choose from, and all of it that I tried is fantastic!

_ynsLU9DOOvV2MPYWq5arg.text: $23 for lunch. Plenty of seating spaced apart. Wednesday around 12:40pm no wait whatsoever. Their sushi selection is lame (four grocery quality rolls) but they had a better Chinese selection (fried rice, show mien, sweet and sour pork, orange chicken, tofu, pot stickers) than MGM Grand. They offered a pasta station where you chose the items and they cook for you (marinara or cream sauce; I chose Marinara and was less than impressed with the taste) Their Italian option is Bleh. Cici pizza looking slices, cheese ravioli and wrapped pasta. The carving station only offered beef or turkey. Shrimp cocktails were on the smaller side and not fresh ice cold. A pretty impressive selection of protein: oxtail, veal, pork chop, ribs, different types of chicken, and fish. As I was staying in the Southside, coming here was easy using the tram from Excaliber. Not sure I would bother venturing here otherwise  unless I was already around here. It's really not that bad of an option, I only came because I had a complimentary pass. It turned out better then expected after yesterday's disappointing MGM Grand Buffet experience.

dp36yq01C1T0Ya3Pt3phrw.text: Absolutely loved this place. Great for a big group of people, would highly recommend the crab legs as I found them very easy to throw and stayed airborne the longest out of all the other food options. I would not recommend the meatballs as a catapult worthy projectile as they were poorly shaped and weighted. Also the 18% gratuity was a little steep.

q-uKRz_d8HuxBBHIFH9KPg.text: Golden Corral is a 5-star experience compared to this buffet.  Crab over cooked, sushi dry and terrible, and choices limited.  We could only tolerate a few plates of mashed potatoes, after trying almost everything, looking for a diamond in the rough.

QQeO4nPsjv8C89PqzgHLaQ.text: Poor quality. I got the "rock" as the say in my stomach. Not worth the$20. Rather pay at the restaurant a good quality meal for same price.

hDeRporvhlXemt9uCItbdg.text: This was absolutely one of the best buffets in Vegas. Very clean, high quality food, wonderful service, and outstanding views in the windowed back rooms.   If you're looking for a top quality buffet, this is it.

FM9LyZXQr5s6_p_aOmle4Q.text: This is one of the worst buffets in Las Vegas. And they have extremely high prices for the quality of food. I have now tried it about 4 times and every time I say NEVER AGAIN. This time...I mean it. Unless they show some serious transformation, I will never return. I like to try a buffet every now and then in Vegas. I have been to some exceptional ones. This isn't one of them. Try Caesar's Palace, Wynn, or Bellagio. This place is horrible. Trust me. I stay at Mandalay Bay every time, and am so disappointed by the quality of this buffet. The food is almost inedible. I wouldn't spend $5 to eat here. I would rather go to Golden Corral.

dCK2iahIgoRKdds23k4CcA.text: My husband and I took the long trek from Caesars on a 103 degree day. It was sooo not worth it. I believe the buffet was $22 per person. Thankfully, we got a buy one get one free coupon from the MyVegas App. I would have been pissed if we paid full price! The service was great but the food was just....not good. I would have been happier at Old Country Buffet or Golden Corral. Everything was bland. There wasn't much variety. Also, the meat at the carving station scared me...everything was bleeding. I basically ate steamed shrimp and cheese. At least we got to walk around the hotel, which needs to be renovated. Womp womp

slaopfN2Pn0FdIvuj08lFQ.text: My family and I were really disappointed in this restaurant. We have visited there in the past and it's not up to the caliber we have come to expect in the past. The plates were dirty/gritty and had a weird fishy smell to them and there was a musky/musty smell in the restaurant throughout. I am mostly vegetarian and didn't find a big variety of vegetarian options, which was a big drawback for me. A lot of the food was meat or seafood based. The food I did get lacked the taste it used to be known for and the service was lackluster. My family and I all had queasy tummies that day/night and are thinking it may be from this buffet since it started after eating there. The decor and ambiance is really pretty and reminded me of being in a tropical resort. Other than that, however, I wasn't impressed with dining there.

TZSjgK0Kw5xKSMF62zut3Q.text: From the bad reviews I had little to no expectations when I came here. I stayed in the luxor and since it was a million degrees out my bf and I didn't want to go outside to find a decent breakfast buffet (luxor is connected to mandalay). After yelping a few places we decided on Bayside Buffet!!  It was a little expensive because of the Labor Day Breakfast Special which was $25/person which included all you can drink mimosas and bloody marys. I think usually its less than $20/person.  The food was actually pretty good. They had veal (DELICIOUS and sorry to those I offended), chicken fried steak, crab legs, make your own eggs station, prime rib and all the usual buffet options.  One of the main reasons why I think this buffet gets 5 stars is the amazing view from the dining room. It overlooks the part of the pool so you get this very scenic almost tropical feeling when eating here. I think it was worth the price.

7H6Nm88w0n4b3HVa5WWZMg.text: I have several bones to pick with this place.  1) The cashier really talked up the fact that you get free beer and wine with dinner.  Yeah, there are TWO wine choices and just ONE beer. 2) When I did get my beer (which happened to be a Bud Light), the guy at the drink station said that he didn't have limes but that I should ask my server.  I asked my server and the entire buffet did not stock limes.  WHAT KIND OF RESTAURANT DOESN'T HAVE LIMES??? 3) There was a Mexican food station and I got some taquitos (which ended up being crunchy but bland).  I ask the chef behind the neighboring station if they had sour cream or guacamole.  He looked at me as if I had asked him the meaning of life.  He had to call 2 other chefs over to confirm that no, they did not have guacamole (bummer!) and that the sour cream was likely in the salad bar. 4) I asked the lady at the dessert station if she could point me toward some desserts without nuts.  The only ones she pointed to were the sugar free ones.  At the time she was plating some type of chocolate cake and she held one piece of to her face and said "This one probably doesn't have nuts either."  And then she went about her business.  I am so sick of people not finding out for sure or just brushing off the question. I don't ask for fun...I ask because I will literally stop breathing and die if I eat nuts.  They did have some killer garlic mashed potatoes, so it's got that going for it.  Honestly, I love food and I am not that picky, but this place was just not good at all.  Just don't go here.

M_K50r-aEjTgeojw30g21w.text: Staff is very nice. The food was so so. Looked as if it had been sitting out awhile. Just over all kinda run down and old. Could use some TLC. Same with the food.

WQIIPUlA-ySJAe43M5dNUw.text: $17 breakfast buffet, and it's worth it.  Delicious, fresh food, and comfortable setting.  It's a great middle ground between the cheapo buffets at Luxor and Excalibur and the  wallet killers at the high-end places.    Looks like brunch runs a bit more at $25 but I'd still hit hit.

KjP0-L2FhC8l2FyzjuAW9g.text: What a major disappointment. Don't waste your money. Not worth the $34 per person charge for dinner.  No prime rib, something called Steamship beef. Read it was one of the cheapest cuts of meat. Lamb had been sitting for a long time. Fish was dried out. Panda Express has better Chinese food. Desserts were a major disappointment with nothing special. NO ICE CREAM, only soft serve. Had lunch at the Orleans for $11 and they have ice cream. In fact, their lunch was 100x better than Mandalay Bay dinner for 1/3 the price.

ABQnvusnIYWSiE_hJqj01w.text: I must say that Bayside buffet was the nastiest Buffet I have ever eaten at finding a fingernail in my omelette which was in my mouth what's the nastiest thing I've ever ever had experienced I would recommend no one ever eat there.

77gezvO7XEHnHtJyLfpwvA.text: Pretty lack luster spread, not sure if it was because it was a Monday lunch thing or if thats the quality that the put out all the time.  Worst buffet I've experienced in Vegas.

VcRuCRshFqyAzvtPlh0HtQ.text: The Mandalay buffet has gone downhill since I first went here many years ago.  It was once a grand seafood buffet with abundant alaskan crab.  Now its just kinda sorry.  The line for the crab is super long and everyone is waiting for the small stash of crab legs that the staff slowly (strategically) stocks.  The primerib was salty and tasted like one of those "cured" wrapped primeribs you get at the supermarket.  The naan bread was more like pita bread, hard and crunchy.    The only things worth getting here was the salmon, pizza, and watermelon.  Unfortunately, thats not why I go to Vegas buffets.    Good thing the entire buffet was comped or else I would have been more upset.

Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rMDDpFiKUvpdvkWIG6jmBg.text: Not worth the money and the food sucks! Prime Rib was fully cooked, food was not flavorful and small selection of food.

V05vkbszkXj2zme_rHu-hg.text: I'd give this place a solid 3.5 stars. Its not a terrible place but isn't "the best". Food quality is decent and service is okay but nothing to complain about and something you would normally expect from a buffet. Atmosphere is nice as well as the many stations you could choose from. This will def be one of the locations we return to on our next trip.

6glwUayE2SdrjB0WKAXrrQ.text: i had to school mia on the art of the buffet.   Rule: You have to walk around first. MUST. Why?   Because sometimes you are fooled by your hunger and start piling on your first plate. It's delicious and filling but then you walk around and say, "hey i didn't know they had (fill in the blank) here!" and then you try and gorge but you can't truly enjoy because you filled up on scrambled eggs or some wack ish like that.   Food that Ronnie likes: Seafood Paella, Prime RIb, Grilled Steak, Lamb, Cold Crab Legs, Shrimp Cocktail, Smoked Salmon, Veal, and apple juice.  You should really book mark this. Not this restaurant per se but my likes and dislikes. It's good for reference when we go out on a date.   Just trying to help YOU out kid.

rY53aQ0Msr7TYZFKaubGZQ.text: When someone says brunch, I'm expecting a combination of breakfast and lunch items.  No such luck here.  I found no breakfast items awaiting me.  The only redeeming factor...prime rib.  You don't have to wait til 4pm when the dinner crowd start to wander in.  You can have it early.  And you can have it the way you want it...rare, medium, thick, thin, etc.  Pair this with the spicy fresh horseradish and you've got a clear brunch winner.  Or have it with a side of bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and a grilled lamb steak...I did, along with a plate of peeled shrimp.

tx0ocW04c_RcU4D2QN95wg.text: I would pay the $19.99 (lunch buffet) for the prime rib and the vanilla custard soft serve ice cream alone. The prime rib is consistently excellent and service is always spot on. It is one of my biggest pet peeves when all-you-can-eat buffets have dry, tasteless meats at their carving stations because hello?!? That's the reason why we're there! Their prime rib is one of the best I've ever had...it's so moist and full of flavor. I'll make a trip or two or three...:)  The other food options are very decent, sweets fruits, and tasty desserts. I always feel like a giddy kid towards the end of the meal because I know I'm just gonna fill my crispy waffle cone mile-high of that vanilla custard deliciousness! It is just heavenly...

bjTekkTUtmucFreny3hMxw.text: Ya know... I think they could bo a better job. I've eaten here 4 or 5 times cause we always stay at THE Hotel. I'm vegetarian, so I kinda shoot myself in the foot going to buffet unless it's Indian... but I don't want to line up for a chef a prepare my pasta... just let me get it myself. The cheese was days old clearly (on my cheese and olive plate I prepared). I found enough stuff to fill up on but  it could be better.

K0Vee0RXqmvl1BO5vm0BNw.text: It was a decent buffet but nothing spectacular.  It's very nice that there is no hour long wait in line to get in this place at any time.  Your options span the basics.  There is italian, asian, american, and mexican dining options.  They don't serve any breakfast items after 12pm which really sucks.  The prime rib was ok.  The carnitas were pretty good.  I enjoyed the fresh fruit and yogurt.  They had a very good dessert spread but I didn't try anything from it so I can't comment on how good any of it tasted.

9-XNdS97Fy_CTKh1IV3Itw.text: It's not often you see Eggs Benny on a buffet menu but they do a great Eggs  Benny here. Impressive breakfast buffet people.It's my last few hours here in sweltering LV and I'm pretty bummed about it. The food was pretty much excellent as well as the service. If I could dock the place a star for the incredibly rude customers who feel the need to push  and prod their way into the buffet line whenever they see something they like I would but it just doesn't seem fair to the establishment. It's called a buffet LINE fucktards. Not a buffet your fucking  over sized ass into any spot that strikes your fancy. Fucking waffles aren't going anywhere you fat bastard in the Las Vegas Speedway t-shirt.  Hit the line knowing that ignorant fucks are going to be jockeying for position and you  will have a great time.

SfgamB58x3-HuyO1nMJNgQ.text: I like the place, but the dessert is not as good as the other buffets. The selection also leaves a lot to be desired. However, if you like crab meat, this place is excellent. There is also a shorter wait. The people who work here are fast and efficient. Very good crabs, excellent fried shrimp. Excellent short ribs. Good fried noodles. There is also a person who cooks your pasta. Overall I have a positive view.

5xrhIkfttuFivbz8TkZbHw.text: Awesome. Not too pricey and the food is good. Grab legs are all way to rubbery. Takes forever to get the grab meat out. Decent for a Vegas Buffet.

aB3L53x1yTXa1fZrxDxyeA.text: This USED to be the best buffet in town.  But that's clearly ancient Vegas history now.  Still, the made to order egg and omelets are very good and the pastries.... well, THERE'S their magnum opus, I think!

kckBNb_RXQfHLkWpqsn2ag.text: We arrived early so decided to get a bite to eat at our hotel.  We paid for the all day meal, breakfast lunch and dinner.  Really wish I hadnt.  The service was slow, the place was packed and the food really was not that good.  It was the only thing we ate that day and let me just put this as nicely as possible...my stomach did not react well after breakfast.  Thats putting it mildly.  If you read my other reviews, then you will know my buffet recommendation is the Wynn 100%.  When we go back to Vegas I will definitely be going back to the Wynn.

X2vEH-3tqQzxB4ir_o1Xqg.text: The breakfast buffet is a great value; I had salmon, blue and raspberries, grilled steak w/mushrooms, croissants, cheese blintzes, grits, and a bowl of cheerios.  Where else can you get that type of variety?  The dinner buffet is usually wonderful as well, but this last time, the crab (which I didn't have b/c it was heated) smelled really "off".  The shrimp was juicy and sweet and again, had their wonderful baked salmon.

wvEPqF1Ujiw1ByUgQjdkPQ.text: I know what your thinking, they must have a good buffet at Mandalay Bay considering how nice the hotel is and how you drop a little more green on the rooms here. I was definitely shocked after eating here for breakfast on one my days here on my trip.  The breakfast has your standard stuff (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, bagels, fruits, cereal, etc etc) and only a few extras like smoked salmon, omelets, and waffles. I usually get a little of my standard "you can screw this up breakfast" like eggs, bacon and sausage, and then I try the "extras" they provide. One thing I always try, if they have it, is the smoked salmon and the reason why is you can tell how good a place is almost entirely based on this item. I love all types of foods... foods that are spicy (almost over the top spicy), subtle, punch you in the face with different flavors that work well together, and salty... but not over the top salty.... and this what happened to the smoked salmon. I can appreciate salty, like a good Shio (aka "salt") Ramen, but this salmon was like someone let it sit on a salt block for 10 years and then accidentally poured the entire contents of the salt shaker on it because the cap wasn't screwed on all the way. Wow! Just horrible. I tried several pieces to make sure it wasn't just the one piece, but it wasn't. Pretty much at the point I was done with breakfast and stopped eating. If you can't execute a good smoked salmon, don't even serve it.  I hope it was just a fluke, but to be honest, it would take a lot to get me to come back here.

_R65qYVKSr_BqE0L5-fMZA.text: Dinner Buffet:  This is one of my favorite buffets in town.  It's small, but good.  I love their crab legs, meatballs, the salmon was really good.  I was really surprised, really moist.  I like that the lines generally aren't too long.  I've only been to dinner, always go when my parents come into town.

i34AZ9MzxFA2qxVcDOqJOw.text: The buffet was pretty good here which surprised me since I really haven't heard much about it.  A good amount of cold and steamed crab legs.  The lines keep on moving.  A good selection.  The desserts weren't anything great except the soft serve ice cream which I would've thought is like any other place, but it gave childhood memories.  The servers were especially friendly, always cleaning out your plates and seeing if you had enough beverages.  The place has a nice, clean feel to it.

IFY63EOpW9-ydUTp1Jw0Vg.text: Stayed at Mandalay for Christmas.  We had 16 family members there.  So many people we were limited on the choices of restaurants so we ate here.  Luckily my sister (casino invite cust.) got us thru without waiting in the 1.5 hr line.  Where to begin.... the fried shrimp-bad, prime rib-salty, ham-fair, crab legs were oka-not too salty.  There was nothing to eat, the spread was thin.  Disappointed...

6hFWTtIXDDsMzZk6_UXc2Q.text: Not a premium buffet, but there's no line and it has some good food.  I like the fried shrimp and turkey+gravy myself.  I think there's only crab for dinner though.

Hj5OBUakNQnLjR4U302bEQ.text: Without any idea where or what to eat, we decided on buffet.  Since we were staying at the Mandalay Bay, it would be the most conveniet to have lunch here.  We were starving and saw a BIG poster advertising their EAT ALL DAY LONG for one price deal.  Wow...for $35 bucks you can eat breakfast, lunch and dinner.  We went for it although we already missed breakfast.  It was still such a good deal...the food was above average for buffets, they have 2 types of crab legs for dinner and their desserts are very yummy.  Totally worth the price :)

q7oxyac4seLeP-UWV8gBTA.text: Food was okay, the variety was not worth the price.  Typical American Buffet food.  Again I wouldn't pay $25 for the food that they had here.  We went during lunch time and not sure if dinner would be any different but if you were to go to a buffet in Vegas I would recommend the one at Ceasar's Palace.

72Hv6pUyDdx6qqsyxVvOkw.text: My family and i hit this buffet for dinner and it was to my liking. Shrimp is always on the top of my list so i was in the right place for that. Its pretty standard buffet assortment, salmon, assorted lil sushi rolls, pork loin, chow mien, pizza= ALL DEE-LISH. Dessert was the highlight with the carrot cake topping off a great dinner. The price was fair, so i had a few dollars to throw away on a full stomach and didnt even miss um.

GQQWAT0Ns06_podnqkpI4w.text: It was pretty crowded. It reminded me though of being in college but the food was better. I got sick of waiting in a line though after awhile and the hole thing was kind of barbaric.

SwKOAY6lxu9oS4-QBaPLrQ.text: Was here on a Tuesday for the breakfast buffet, and for the $18/person price tag this place was pretty decent. I judge buffets by the quality of how they prepare their bacon - so 5 stars for bacon that's crispy and not over-cooked! The Panko-crusted salmon was also a pleasant surprise: moist and perfectly prepared, with a satisfying crunch from the crust. Deduct a star for lukewarm chilaquiles and chorizo (and because this honestly isn't quite a 5-star buffet). But hey - there were chilaquiles and chorizo, which shows the variety of stuff they offered at the buffet. I didn't try the carving station, so I can't speak to that. But I did partake of the chicken-fried steak, which I topped off with country gravy. I didn't try the omelette station either, but there was a big line for it and people seemed satisfied.  The service was good - quick refreshment of beverages, which is more than I can say for my experience at Bacchanal the other night. I think place is a solid 3.5-star place. And you can't beat the price!

ZEpS1GJdRjLvjhq6gL861Q.text: This buffet was ok, $23ish for brunch, no wait in line. Good selection of food. Decor wasn't anything to rave about, just a no frills buffet. Service wasn't great (hard to get someone's attention for drinks) but good worth worth the money and no wait.

XM7Km9yWYKJuA1hdPlfy0A.text: After visiting the buffet a few times I must say it was pretty good. I realize that in Las Vegas there are many better places for breakfast or brunch. However, the buffet was reasonably priced, a good selection of American Classic foods, Luis it's a buffet so in True American fashion you can eat all you can ;)   The selection of food is quite decent, there are the usual so like scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, home fries, coffee, cereals, and so on. So it is a nice American style breakfast.   I would certainly be back, as it's such an easy choice to make in the morning it's breakfast and it's a buffet what can go wrong?

TyHuA5YKSUZvfplJNg0r5Q.text: During our recent trip to Las Vegas, we went to the buffet at the M Hotel.  However, there was a very long line and the lady in front of me said it would be at least a 2 hour wait.  My hubby suggested that we just dine at the Mandalay Bayside Buffet since since we were staying there...I immediately agreed.  We arrived at the Bayside Buffet for Sunday dinner which cost $29 per person and there was no line...sweet.  They have kiosk stations where you can pay for your dinner buffet and then get seated.  The buffet area is not as large as I expected but included the following:  (1)  Open Bar Unlimited champagne, white and red wine, and beer.  This was a pleasant surprise, especially since the champagne was pretty good.  Either get your drink at the bar area and/or just ask your server.  (2)  American Section: Baked chicken, steamed and hot crab legs, braised oxtails, ribs, mashed potatoes, potato wedges, vegetables, a carving station for roast beef, turkey, and pork.  (3)  Italian Section: Pasta bar, lasagna, chicken parmesan, sauteed vegetables  (4)  Asian Section: Various dim sums, fried rice, noodles, stir fry veges, orange chicken, etc.   (6)  Mexican Section: Taco Bar, Tamales, Rice, Beans and the fixings.  (7)  Salad Bar: Very limited and messy.  (8)  Cold Seafood Section: Oysters on the Half Shell, Shrimp Cocktail, and limited Sushi  (9)  Dessert Section: Various types of desserts.  My dinner consisted of the steamed crab legs with lots of butter, braised oxtail, vegetables, mashed potatoes, dessert, and lots of champagne.  I tried the roast beef, shrimp cocktail, and some of the other Italian offerings but they were just average....nothing special.  The Bayside Buffet offers a great dinner value that includes your alcoholic drinks during dinner.  I would return for their crab legs and unlimited champagne.  3 Stars!
