-w5TgO8baJHDhMGUg9DHPQ.text: Decent food at a decent price. Servers are nice, not too long of a wait, even on the weekend. Good selection of global foods. There was nothing that really wowed me but also nothing that I thought was terrible.

nF6_O8-OmG60ZuJSl-Gy5g.text: Don't waste your money or time it's tiny and not worth the $60+ you'll spend the good is mediocre. Go to the encore,or caesars for qualify

Bn3GDwxJzEWQKX2LMx-4pQ.text: Stayed at hotel so tried this one night. Food was great I had a bit of everything and everything I tried was really good. Carving station was my favorite. I will definitely come again. Also they offer you bottomless beer and wine for $11 on top of the $35 (dinner buffet) loved it! Servers were super friendly!

6qMaH4nHR7m_fQHmYD6low.text: Really disappointed this time around. Not too many positive things to say. The bottom line the food was below average for a Las Vegas buffet. Much better off choosing one of the big name restaurants.

U7_3xRqMcFGEVYquP6rhFA.text: This is a very poor excuse for a Vegas Buffet. The food is mediocre. The service is average and by 8:30pm they pretty much stop putting out fresh food and most of the desserts were gone. Save your money and go anywhere else to eat. Including the tip it was over $40 per person. Last time I will ever waste my money here.

k9GSA3sWXqv-NmjF8aIvhw.text: This was just bad. Saturday afternoon brunch, and the food was so dried up and tasteless I should have asked for my money back. Please go to another buffet if you have a choice, you will be glad you did.

u4IcFoHxONERtwyGsU_22w.text: This was NOT worth the money! It was just a typical Buffett - nothing special at all! I was so disappointed to take my daughter to her first Vegas buffet and the food was mediocre and felt cheap. They did have salmon, but the salad bar was weak, the food seemed prepared quickly and some of the cooks seemed annoyed and unfriendly. I would not recommend this to anyone. WAY overpriced!

TfKAgPZ3YSx8tAKR4wCoXA.text: Service was very friendly. It was a little bit of a maze to get back to and from our table. But the crab legs were good! A little salty sometimes, but there was always plenty to choose from. There is complimentary wine and sparkling wine. I think it's more affordable than other buffets? Roughly $40 with tip!   Sorry, I can't review any of the other foods. Crab legs are pretty much the only thing I eat at buffets.

A_yX2fvC5YdtVYHuRMDGHQ.text: Mediocre at best! Not a lot of options. They only had one tray of assorted sushi and dungeon crab legs which were gross and dry. Everything sucked to be honest!

z3ge8aj8kdjSw5Xwe2KGiA.text: This buffet is awful. Small and you can tell the quality is crap. We did the Cesar's buffet earlier in the week and that was fantastic. You get what you pay for.

jcz-AG1ByYbM0cR9U7IlyA.text: A little bit better than most buffets in Vegas due to the fact that a) it's never that busy b) they seem to have fresher food than other buffets. It's one of those buffets where sure if you are in the casino and you are hungry then yes you might as well eat there. But don't make any special arrangements to go there - you would be quite upset.

9_U7neJpyQ-PEp446CXL7g.text: We always loved going to Mandalay Bay Buffet.   I can not believe all the stars under a 4/5!!  The food is always top notch here, You can tell it is top quality with whatever you eat and noting like some of the casinos that have lousy buffets.  This was the place we would always go to before leaving Vegas because after we ate here we would say we couldn't wait to come back and now that we live here we come whenever we are at that end of town and and some good crab legs!  There is so many different foods to pick from. The desserts are always fresh as well.  The service we receive has always been good too. They are always on top of refilling the drinks as well as cleaning the plates away.  We never had a bad dinner experience here! We have even brought friends here who have really enjoyed it too. We are looking forward to the next time we go.

mRq3BQSCFjUSUKrSJRoY2A.text: Either the reviewers here have never seen a king crab leg, or they stopped serving them. The site's menu says Alaskan crab legs, but its missing the "king". Food had a cafeteria appeal to it. I expected a bit more from Mandalay Bay, epescially for the price. I'll append this in detail in a few days I hope. 3 stars for food minus 1 for price.

fHsLNZxQUxclnwCSGz0GZg.text: Pizza and pot roast, really for $ 35 Wow, huge disappointment  Pasta eh OK if you don't want to leave casino.  No waiting is a clue.  Did I miss something? Should have ordered room service For $ 24 hamburger

p5zOfciu2h2UOa5-ssiHfQ.text: My husband and I ate here before the Cirque One show at Mandalay Bay.  I was hesitant when I read some of the comments but was pleasantly surprised.  We were able to get one Buffett free with with the myVEGAS app which was a bonus.  We also took advantage of the all you can drink beer or wine for 10.98 per person.  The crab legs weren't the best I've had and the selection isn't what I've seen at other casinos but what they had was was very tasty.  I enjoyed the Asian fare while my husband had Prime rib and lamb.  To top it off, the staff was very friendly as well!

B73PY-bqtUAQdyaXzpQn-Q.text: How do u mess up breakfast.  I know money has little value in Vegas but $25 for the his crappy breakfast is beyond ridiculous.  Eggs tasteless, Taylor tots hard and cold, just not good.  Very hungry and did not enjoy that at all. I remember it being much better or at least decent... no no no no!

8pzSQ_CtkKEhJsw0b3By9w.text: Decent buffet for the price.  Priced better then upscale bellagio or the wynn with similar foods.  The drawback is drop in quality is noticeable.

8Se3jaM4sCUUung0hNFOtA.text: Oh...goodness. Like many of the hotel buffets in Vegas, this place offers the "Eat All Day Long" option. My family took up this challenge, mostly for the deal. It's a pretty good buffet, but eating all three meals here is a bit...much. I totally regretted going for it. But eating one meal here is not so bad.  The dessert section was definitely the highlight, but isn't that always the case? I liked the fruit tarts and mousse. They also have a small cylindrical cheesecake sample that is the perfect size. All cheesecake portions should be that size...seriously. The evening of my battle with this buffet also happened to be the same day that the GameStop convention was being held at the Mandalay Bay. This meant many, many hungry gamers in the hotel. It was extremely annoying to have to wait in a super long line for food at a buffet. I don't even understand why people were lining up, but in fear of being accused of cutting, I joined the flock. But even with the insane amount people (most of them gamers), the service was great.  I don't know if it's worth the price for one meal, but eat enough crab meat and blackberries and you'll probably get your money's worth.  Love, A Recovering Stomach

_zSgyK-MOnWphgxtiWht6A.text: One of the worst buffets that I have visited in quite a while. Snow crab legs were overcooked and the exterior appeared diseased. Definitely not first quality. The other cooked items were all marginal. For such an outstanding hotel otherwise, this place was a dissapointment and an expensive one at that. Never coming back.

llbKQh_qw5SuQnVVcGLwCA.text: I had a group dinner here on a Wednesday evening and it was $27.99 per person; plus $125 fee to place the reservation....for 35 people.  The food here was delicious...but I must take away a star for the lack of price negotiating from the group dinning and the small dining area they put us all in.  We would've been better off coming in separately (and we would've paid less).  Although we were guaranteed tables in the same area; so I won't complain much about that.   It wasn't busy when we went, there was no need to even pay the $125 to make an early reservation, but oh well.  Better safe than sorry.  I would've been fine with placing a refundable deposit, but I thought it was a bit of a rip to charge money to make a reservation; I'm guaranteeing them business from a large group of people - we shouldn't have to pay extra for that. Again, though...food was great.  I would definitely eat there if/when I am in the area.

xpEbjHNz1BW18eFWSS1Gwg.text: I went with two friends on a spontaneous weekend trip to Las Vegas and we ended up here for lunch. We were not sure about the price at $20 for lunch, but we decided to take a risk and try it out. We ended up eating for over three hours because everything was so good. The food is great quality. We enjoyed very tender prime rib that melted because it was that good. Also, we enjoyed the coconut butterfly shrimp, lamb, mutton, two types of salmon and many different sides and dishes. The desserts were the best part. There were various individual sized pies, cakes and pastries. We tried them all. We especially liked the coconut cream pies, fresh fruit tarts, raspberry chocolate cake, and tiramisu. But the best part was the vanilla custard soft serve in a waffle cone topped with fresh blueberries. We received outstanding service and had a nice window seat overlooking trees and the hotel pool. A definite must to revisit.

hGsQQ8at-pYEEznDpAnrPw.text: Had brunch here on Easter Day and was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience.  $24/person and got in at about $29+ after tax and tips.  I love buffets but never eat enough to make me feel good about paying for them.  Although the line was long, we only waited about 20-30 mins.  The staff was very attentive and friendly even though it was quite busy.  I had a lot of crab legs, loved the prime ribs and grilled steak as well.  I must also compliment them on their dessert selection, huge variety and taste like heaven.  It was the best buffet I've ever had and I must say I might have gotten my money's worth.

hKt_pZshZnFVxFdlImIvjQ.text: The price of the buffet was hefty considering the blandness and non-variety of the food.  I've tried almost every buffet on the strip, and this one is almost at the bottom of my list.  Right after paying for the buffet through a kiosk I went up to a male worker and told me to walk into the buffet to meet a female worker.  The female worker took my receipt, but rushed to place me by a table as if she was in a hurry.  She was not very courteous.  She failed to ask me if I would like to sit in a table or booth as I noticed she would randomly ask other guests that.  In fact, she failed to say anything and placed the receipt on the table and left.  My waitress on the other hand was quite the opposite.  She made sure we were taken care of.  As for the food, there was nothing great about it.  The food was pretty much slightly below average to average.  Yes there was king crab legs and hot butter, but the king crab legs were terrible and I'm a huge fan of crab.  I will not recommend this buffet to anyone.  The rundown buffets in my area taste even better than this and for a fraction of the price.  I do recommend the Wynn or M Resort Buffet.

OIPd2-28yyZ6J0WUzdbTgg.text: lets see.  yesterday, my wife and i decided to try the buffet at mandalay vs taking a taxi to the rio.  mind you, we stayed at the luxor and its a short walk to mandalay.  well, we arrived there at 2:40 and the buffet opened at 2:45.  PERFECT TIMING.  We were the first ones in and were seated as close to the crab as possible.  We were lucky to be the first ones in, because after we took 4-5 pieced each, the other people dining all filled thier plates with as much as they could possibly take.  the bin was gone in 3 min max.  Having dined at the luxor buffet the day before, the Mandalay was great!!  Everything had its own taste and the service was great for a buffet.  The slice of prime rib i had came right from the middle still alive!!  awsome!!!!  My wife and I were glad we didnt go all the way to the Rio because we were more than satisfied at the Mandalay Buffet and it was cheaper.  We are already looking forward to another visit when we are in vegas again.

ksziKHbnatzAAb_4RPULgA.text: Went for dinner first weekend of June. My first time at this buffet and I wasn't disappointed in the quality of the food. They have an ok selection to choose from but I would've liked a little more... loved the pasta station and was good too. They did serve things I didn't expect to be there, so that was good. Overall, I enjoyed this buffet and would visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cRXWBgVFP8Z7VpcCl9WcLw.text: A good place to fill up on some decent food, but don't expect to be wowed by anything. My boyfriend and I decided to have brunch with his aunt and uncle and since a majority of places still weren't open yet, we went with Bayside Buffet because we figured they'd have a decent spread of food so none of us would complain!  This is one of the buffets you can use to redeem your MyVegas points on, however those are usually only available between Monday-Thursday. Though I did not use my points on this trip, I was originally planning on doing so as the offer wasn't too steep.   They do have a dedicated entry for M Life members at the Pearl, Gold, Platinum, and Noir tiers on the off chance that the buffet is actually busy, but since it was a Monday morning we didn't need to use this line. You can choose to pay via card, cash, or room key and you do get points for dining here so use that membership card!  The spread itself is pretty small, offering some Asian and Mexican foods, breakfast items, and a dessert table as well. My favorite selections included the seaweed salad, crab legs, pistachio creme dessert, and the brownies (which were sealed so I took them back up to the hotel room).  You do get a server who can offer you drinks that are included with your buffet, such as fountain beverages, coffee, orange juice, and the like. You can also opt to have a small selection of beers and wines if you want.  Overall, Bayside Buffet was an alright place to dine but nothing I would come running back for.   (56/100)

X7SsvoQDRWDTBPFo6ZOhPQ.text: Two stars is pretty generous for this review. For the price you pay, this buffet is not worth it. Two adults were about $71. Plenty of steamed crabs but the overall variety was very disappointing.  The sushi selection was limited, the seafood selection were crabs, shrimp, mussels.  Orange chicken and roast beef were way over cooked. Flatbread pizzas were not very tasty. It was just so disappointing.  To top that off, our waiter didn't even come by to check on us and we had to flag him down for water refills. It wasn't even crowded. We will definitely not come back or recommend this buffet. Out of all the buffets on the strip, don't waste your money here.

sfy_5UdidQ2L72pH3NH63w.text: We came here to redeem our myvegas BOGO offer on a Monday. Can't say there was a thing that put this place over the top for me. I could have simply stayed in our hotel and probably have a better experience.   Our server was maybe on break and the time we were half into our breakfast, he finally came around to take and give us our drinks.   The food choices weren't anything special. My husband really loved his "make it yourself" omelette.   Besides that? Eh. I'd pass next time.

lA3RccNifFzwtH2yF8G8Tw.text: First off I have to say this is a buffet and my rating compares buffet to buffet land or cruise. I seen the low reviews. It tried it anyway. There was a lot of choices, food was hot and filled. Waitress was attentive and friendly. All in all it was a good buffet meal. They had roast beef, crab legs, lunch and breakfast options.  Use the my vegas app to save.

R7beU84JgjdODVGTPigD0g.text: Sheer slop and more slop which is grossly overcooked and or near cold.  Not worth half the price they charge.

ONb7GW9anyYgCmQl_jafjA.text: There are not a lot of food stations compared to other buffets on the strip, or buffets in general. So the food choices are very limited if you are not a massive seafood fan. There were not even any tomato's to put in the salad.   The food is also very average.   If you are looking for a good buffet and go here chances are you will by disappointed.

l8E7bXoza_iQ9nHdPjESzA.text: THis place is hands down the best seafood buffet i have ever enjoyed in my life. I have been coming to this place for 10 years and love it so much. it is the best quality and variety of seafood i've ever had presented to me in one place. for the price, it is such incredible value. the line is kind of long sometimes but it moves faster than you think. come hungry because you will want to try everything! you also can pay 15 dollars and you get unlimited alcohol too! The deals are amazing!

y424bsYjVEBRKf_xqDC6jA.text: I'd like to give this place 3 1/2 stars but can't do that. Typically I round up, but I'm trying to rate all buffets equally and since I rounded down on the Bacchanal review I rounded down here too! Really, though, for the price this is a decent breakfast buffet. Well especially since it was free with a myVegas reward!  Nice ambiance, bright and airy. Great coffee, and excellent service. Typical breakfast buffet items, scrambled eggs, omelet station, miscellaneous other items. Nothing standout but nothing bad either. Given you would pay at least $5 for coffee and $5 for a pastry, this place really seems like a bargain.  Not something I'd go out of my way for but if you are in the area it's not a bad breakfast deal.

XzJ5yKrvZFqub4HA0W30UA.text: Use to love the bayside buffet. Hit it today and it's horrible I don't have anything good to say I tried everything to say a good thing still none. Sushi is like a rock, meat had a lot of chewy pieces. I mean maybe the potatoes were good. Either the food is old or bad chefs Whatever it is they need to change use to come only to this buffet when in Vegas, now need to go somewhere else.

x4PryJB-KF_3eigpemgQiw.text: Blah. The buffet is super expensive and is not worth it. The food was not amazing. Best word to define is mediocre.  I wouldn't eat here again. Even the kids couldn't find something that was delicious for them, other than the cereal. We hoped the dessert table would make up for it but their assortment was disappointing.

cLV1TG6g4sW6mcQyuQiNdQ.text: We went for lunch and maybe that was the problem. The selection wasn't as large as I would have expected. On a plus side it was only $20 plus tax per person which is cheap for a nice hotel like this one. My party was all M Life members with gold status and as we stood in the M Life VIP line and the women at the register helped four other people we were confused. Then the points from the Mlife help desk that we had just left to set up a buy one get one free for lunch didn't transfer so it was a bit of a "starting off on the wrong foot from jump." The waiter was nice and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruit
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even more dessert
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More dessert

E2CsMkz9EusoFg9sz297wg.text: No straws no stars. Food was good but the no straw buisness is bad buisness and the rude remarks from the waiter about not having straws does not help.

MufurwiYLdUAgA9gUvo9qw.text: It's not best in Vegas. It just okay buffet. Nothing stands out. I would not recommend this one. Go to Paris or Bellagio for best buffet experience if are in to buffets. Service lady was best part and was great.   Cashier was terrible it took over 30 minutes and only one person was there and line was like out the door, before I jumped out of line to use automated machine.

oMrP6p1rcnw_xe9Ff6Qrzg.text: Wife got food poisoning there. The price too high. The pot stickers were too hard as was the fried shrimp. It was disappointing. I wish we had gone some where else.

JcxMNbItYgCKNQtXbx3o4A.text: Food was t that good. My fiance found bones in the shredded chicken and couldn't stomach to eat anything else. My family said the seafood was very good but I am allergies so I couldn't try it.

huEj36KHY0z_mL4QVEJF8A.text: Very basic buffet.  This was comparable to the buffets at harrahs, Flamingo, and Mirage. It lacked luster but nothing was bad. The food was fresh and hot. The variety was minimal. A little disappointed only because everything about our stay has been very above average from our check in at Delano, fast and friend service on the casino floor and a top of the line suite.  The only part of the buffet that isn't deserving of the 3 stars was the dessert and beverage section. A couple choices of tarts, a few cookies and soft serve ice cream and does not have self serve drinks.

jK7tuRB0Ssw5rc3Nsx3SAw.text: Whoa this place was worth it! It was $25.99 for the weekend brunch. Brunch goes all the way until 4:30 on Saturday and Sunday for people who stayed out too late the night before. We wanted to go to a fancy buffet, and we had planned on going to bacchanal brunch for $50, but I read some good reviews about this place for half price. I'm so glad we gave it a try!   The decor is really fancy and we sat overlooking the garden like pool area. Waitresses were attentive and the price included juice and coffee. Me and my friends are still talking about the food days later, this isn't sizzler or hometown buffet quality food- it's unlimited restaurant quality amazingness. Usually when I pile my plate at a buffet I only enjoy a few items, but every single thing I put on my plate was delicious.   There was a section for sushi and seafood, breakfast foods, salad bar, bagel bar with lox, meat carving stations, wok station, omelettes made to order, desserts, and traditional dinner classics.   Unlimited applewood smoked bacon in itself is worth $25 to me, but my breakfast side favorites were: the French toast with pecan syrup, runny poached eggs, and their house made corned beef hash. Dinner side was beautiful, first and foremost there was NY STRIP STEAK (rare) at the carving station. I was super excited about this. The ribs were spicy, sweet, and perfect. We all agreed that the mashed potatoes were our favorite. Super rich and buttery, definitely an elevated mashed potato. I thought I was so full I might die, but then I had a bite of the carrot cake and had to get a piece it was so good. Definitely try this place out, worth $25 because you'll never eat again that day haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weekend brunch: NY strip, ribs, corned beef has breakfast. YUMMAY!

GVVh76zIbSQLcEhRaFcv4A.text: Loved the assortment of fresh food. Staff was friendly and great about checking on us throughout the meal. Bartender was fast and remembered our drinks. Food was tasty and the variety was perfect. Thank you!

zUNTr_SOYA_xMhzyjCfexg.text: Meh. The only thing I enjoyed was the clam chowder. Other than that, everything else was bland, including the desserts.

NLuGvJpafYmSc0ns33MlVA.text: Came here on a Saturday for lunch and some brunch items. Although the cost is high, in comparison to many of the other choices in the resort the value is a lot better. Our server was very nice, and even gave us free mimosas! The bacon was actually very good which is rare at a buffet. They also had a really good selection of food, from lunch, breakfast and dessert items. Everything I tried was very good, especially the mashed potatoes and gravy. A good choice for the money.

qt1ev_geCl2-PWtwZ5EfQQ.text: Food was eh. Not a long wait on a Friday night at least. Why does the prime rib taste like ham??

7fOdAULkD8G92TZH1iEcDw.text: My friend made me promise we could go to at least one buffet while we were in Vegas.   Buffets aren't really my thing, but this one was decent.   Food was pretty good; and I thought it was pretty cool that they had tamales.   It wasn't overcrowded, but on a Saturday night I would think they should have more then one cashier.   I tried a few things I didn't like, but that's just my taste buds. Except the rolls, those were rock hard.   Our server was nice, and helpful when we had questions.

bFubdJttqKFpPh-g3_4BTA.text: Low quality food and not really that great of a buffet. Ok if you don't feel like leaving your hotel, but next time I will make the walk to a better buffet. I hope they improve it soon. For a nice place like Mandalay, this buffet is a letdown. The others with me all agreed some of the food was almost inedible. Their turkey bacon tasted and looked like a dog treat. Disgusting.

wx1Tx4Dt0W5sIWQKdQBs2A.text: Mandalay Bay's Bayside Buffet was my first Vegas buffet ever back in 2004.  Eversince then, I've been to the Carnival buffet at Rio, Wynn buffet, Mirrage buffet and many other buffets and was very disappointed that I was not able to enjoy buffets anymore :(    I came back to Bayside Buffet this past weekend and they did not fail me!  I loved it :D  They may not have much of a selection, but Bayside is quality over quantity.  They don't serve crap just to have a huge selection.  Besides, when there are too much to choose from, I get too overwhelmed.  I loved their oxtail and braised beef.  And of course shrimp cocktail and crab legs :)

M8tvwVIVJM0MxTInDpxssg.text: Dinner buffet was nice. Free alcohol.  Get your prime rib cooked on the grill! Tastes great! Friendly staff.  My only con is that the bathrooms are outside the buffet.

sXMKU_NZRNTps0yctUo4-g.text: Forgot I had drafted a review for this place while I was eating breakfast there. My draft didn't have much info...  -----------------  -15.99 per person for breakfast. -rice and salmon for breakfast! It's like they know asian people don't eat cereal and waffles for breakfast! =D -homie making my omelette is so serious... Whoa look at how fast he's going! I need to learn how to cook...oh crap that's a lot of cheddar. I forgot my lactaid... What's your name buddy? Iggie...k if my omelette sucks I'm putting you on blast on yelp... ......  OMG IGGIE! BEST OMELETTE EVER! NOMNOMNOM... ----- I don't remember the specific details as this was a while back but for me to use that many caps it must've been a damn good omelette...

z-1whPsoJKNT2A1S7Jj_cA.text: Really?  Anyone who gives this place more then 2-3 stars literally has no taste buds.  We came here for dinner...$30.  I was expecting at least decent food and this was no where near decent.  The crab legs were grey...not bright orange/red like they are supposed to be, dull, smelled so fishy and tasted horrible.  I tried as much as I could, here was everything that was disgusting...  Mashed potatoes - Fake, potato flakes, blah. Meatballs All the chinese food - cold, could tell it was sitting out there forever! Salad - No dressings were labeled, the toppings were things you would see at Sizzler, but worse. Broccoli - Cold and no flavor Pasta bar - watery sauce, no flavor Braised short ribs - MSG all day Ice cream - Non fat frozen yogurt, disgusting All other desert - Tasted like it came from a factory  The only decent thing was the prime rib and the fact that you get wine at no extra charge, that is the only reason it get's 1 star.  Not worth the money and not worth the stomach ache later.

fla01vMYzWHQ6n5RpDT8Sg.text: This very decent buffet filled us up quite nicely before the start of the Rock-n-Roll 1/2 Marathon. Expect the typical long lines for the omelette station and lots of people hovering near the pastries. The food was above-average for a buffet IMHO and we ate plenty. Service was a bit scarce but our juices and teas finally made their way to our table. OJ was fresh and tea choices were good enough. I would definitely go back if I needed a BIG breakfast.

ggF9L1qtLI_vY-QES2zWCA.text: One of the worst buffet in Vegas. Meat is tasteless & even the fruits are tasteless. I'm very disappointed.

EnNOvySkuOINskAJcQf2sA.text: This gave me and my father food poisoning. I have been throwing up for 3 days!!!! It's 2:53 am and I'm sitting on the bathroom floor feeling like I might vomit!!!!   It was way too expensive, although the staff was kind, and refunded the whole buffet for everyone because of the food poisoning.

6p5kDlRmxBCAo6n0E8KghQ.text: Paid for all you can drink out of beer only had wine.  They gentleman at the bar kept saying he would have some there soon . I did notice at the end of the meal they had some.  Food was under seasoned over cooked. My husband and I kept going back to try anything that was not dry overcooked. The root beer he ordered was flat.. Had a very difficult time finding anything that was palatable. Made a salad. Very disappointed. Service was nice that was the only positive I could come up with. This is our second time at this buffet we thought we would give it a second chance. We will never make that mistake again.

QNEENs3deOjPbPq_hzmScA.text: Paid 30 dollars for a good buffet... I say good and not great... I guess the average meal in Vegas is pretty pricey but a buffet??? The hotel and food court is really nice and close to everything in the hotel but I guess that's the price you pay...

KA1b5uUxJbZYgWymHWyqJQ.text: Great food and service. Went for breakfast and lunch. Drink service for memosas was slow. Great selection of food.

8L2dV535tuI9Dns3bv2MJg.text: One of the worse Vegas buffets I've ever had.  Ended up being lazy and staying at Mandalay Bay the whole weekend so bought the "All-Day Buffet pass" for $43.  Had the Sunday Brunch, nothing great.  Dry prime rib, minimal selections, dessert selections limited to muffins, cakes and cookies.  Hope they would redeem themselves for Sunday dinner...I was wrong.  Same dessert selections.  Saw same ingredients from the brunch buffet used for dinner items.  I can't say weather if it's True...but...I saw sausage from brunch was seen in dinner's paella.  Not a lot of changes from the brunch menu to dinner menu.  Definitely not worth the ~$28 price.

FVaTz9KQgC12t0sWOdxCrQ.text: Bottomless mimosas. That are truly bottomless. As in we were here for two plus hours, only one of them eating.  Lots of food buffet selection- I made the mistake of thinking both sides were the same, but they are actually different so I did not pace myself well.  Favorites were the shrimp, prime rib, corn, and they even had sushi. We also saw lots of people loading up on crab legs.. I guess I should learn to like them!  For us, it was included in the room charge at The Hotel, so definitely worth it. Surprisingly great service too for a buffet- we always had a full mimosa and clean plate.

rpR79G7zmm3H8z4zQOVl3A.text: Went for lunch.   There was only a small percentage of items that even looked appetizing for me to try.  Also this buffet did nearly nothing to try to separate itself from even low end vegas buffets which is a shame considering its one of the top MGM resorts in Vegas.   No crab legs for lunch, no made to order waffles or crepes, not even a gelato station.  They did have a made to order pasta station but I found the options of what could be made there half hearted. On a positive their flank steak had great flavor and their carved new york loin roast was well above par as far as buffet carving roasts go.  Also you couldnt go wrong with the large cocktail shrimp.

zz2SayauEX9dOSFX7rwfKA.text: Food = good.   Desserts = blech.   They don't have a lot of selection like the bigger buffets at other hotels like Rio or Bellagio. It'll be good to go maybe once or twice during your trip. Our deal was free all day passes with our hotel reservation. So we ate at the buffet 4 times and were all buffet-ed out after that.   The service was awesome although they need to organize themselves a bit to make the lines go faster when you pay.   The selection of food might have been small but everything was well made. Crab legs were awesome as well as the braised oxtail, stuffed pasta shells, beef tamales, posole...etc. etc. The only food that tasted bad was the sushi because it was cold like pre-made market sushi.   Tried the desserts and have to say that nothing was worth getting seconds for...except for the chocolate chip cookies.

CXtQmMwc_1RR-jfF10r7JA.text: Ate here for lunch yesterday. Food was cold and didn't have much flavor. The chicken wasn't cooked all the way. I only gave this a three star because the waiter was great. The selection was alright.

ocb7b7nBfRZV7C47EqmYaw.text: A little spendy and a decent selection of buffet style foods. The gentleman at the carving station for the prime rib obviously has mastered the art of deli thin slices. Steamed snow crab legs were good, but the partial pre-cuts drove a lot of shell into the meat on a few pieces. Service was attentive and kept the ice teas full at the table. Nice variety of desserts. Not very conveniently set up. The ramekins for the au jus were on the opposite side of the carving station. The steak knives for the meat dishes were not close to the meat stations. Watching people right now grabbing their food and then searching for condiments or utensils.

PDNxbb1sPX00d_dRL7KfVw.text: This place needs some much stricter quality control. Two of us went there for brunch on Saturday around 11 AM. Paid $60 with tip for two people.  Food was not very good. I wish I could say that something was extraordinary - - I can usually find at least one exceptional item at a large buffet. This place was full of mediocre to poor selections.  The prime rib - - and they gave us a very large portion - - was inedible. I've eaten prime rib for many years and this one had an off taste as if the meat were bad. It was the one item that I asked the server to report back to the kitchen so they knew how bad it was.  Other notables: The orange chicken and the dumplings in the Asian area were cold and doughy and hard. The scrambled eggs had a strange taste; The poached eggs were cold. The large glass of orange juice tasted worse than Tang (if that's still on the market).  Save your money and eat brunch elsewhere would be my suggestion.

8nG4NprG1KX2J_kbOe1_6Q.text: Not good....like, way not good.  We ate with a group of 10, and most of us weren't feeling well the next day after we ate here.  The food was bland and didn't taste fresh at all.  For $37, you can do better.

tXqwpnnFD6b4v2Vo91SEQw.text: The buffet was pretty good. We got a special offer when we booked our room for a free buffet per person per night. We are here 3 times and it was good (once for breakfast, lunch, and dinner). It was kind of pricey for dinner. It was $90 for two people on a "Holiday Dinner" with one of the unlimited alcohol packages.

EoC1g1Ecdz4yOd2VdsJqpg.text: Came here to claim our free passes at this buffet (myvegas). There was no trouble getting in and was seated right when we got in. There's actually a waiter that gets the drinks for you (never had that before). We were instructed to order our drinks before we went to grab the food.  The food selection was not the worst and was not the best (since it was lunch time). I'd say the best selection out there was the prime rib. The drinks, however, was NASTY. I ordered the rasberry tea and it tasted like TAP WATER. I ordered another drink, a sprite and hoping that since it's soda, will not taste bad. I WAS WRONG. Again, it had an off taste.   I think the waiter got annoyed that we never finished our drinks (and kept ordering) and clearing our plates that still had a lot of food.

s0MsZCTG4mkj6qt6Y8Rh0Q.text: We went here because we had hotel credit from a stay. We went for dinner on a Sunday night and it wasn't too busy. It was $35/per person and the buffet was fairly large. There's a pasta bar, sushi (CA roll and salmon rolls), meat station, comfort foods, beer and wine, seafood, & Mexican station. The food was just ok but nothing spectacular. My favorite dish was the veal osso bucco & asparagus. Everything else was either really salty or lacked flavor. Service was fine but I didn't like how they sat us (party of 5) in a table for 4. I need room when I eat crab legs!

fLJ2R9gHve1jkMgvBDO9Ig.text: Good buffet for breakfast.  Ate there twice during our stay.  Only complaint would be that they didn't seem to refill the buffet.  A few times there was no biscuits for biscuits and gravy or limited options for the omelette bar.

nsjtwK55hKrjZV6vxUqzIg.text: A-OK. Absolutely A-OK.  Since I had a $40.00 Breakfast/ Lunch/ Brunch Buffet Voucher from staying at the MGM brand hotels, my boyfriend and i decided to give Bayside Buffet a try!  Total was $43.28 ($19.99 + tax per person), so we had to pay only $3.28 out of our own pockets!   Foods were just okay. nothing impressive. nothing spectacular. Smoked salmon was good, and the made-to-order pasta was delish!  however, the prime rib was so freaking dry, and no crab legs for lunch.  The desserts were decent, but dont expect to see fancy desserts like those at Wicked Spoon or Aria Buffets!  Service was average.    I would not go back if i had to pay the full price, but 2 adult lunch buffets for only $3.28....What a Steal!! hahaa

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet at Bayside Buffet :)
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts!! Not too fancy but pretty decent :)
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italiano!

qubW4qlFgt4sT41hYgu34A.text: We stayed at the Mandalay Bay which was the primary reason why we ate here in the first place. Cost was only $17.99 for the breakfast buffet and I'm not too sure if it was worth it.   What I did like about it: There are Kiosk available to pay, helps with the line. Coffee greeting you at the table, and a Friendly & Helpful Staff  What I didn't like about it: there wasn't much of a selection, and from what was available the food was so so. I really didn't care for the corn beef hash (in fact don't get it), the hash browns were not fresh, pasta was bland. The pancakes, steak, and baked salmon were so so. The Omelette station was a disappointment.    Hotel was great, but the Buffet was not; I won't be coming back.

mrIllwYidUNSrDOebojpEw.text: Worst buffet in Vegas. Stayed at MB for a conference and was not impressed with food offerings. Buffet had just opened and food had poor flavor and was lacking with thought and taste. The best thing here - the cold glass of water with lemon. NEVER AGAIN. Mandalay Bay refunded our buffet on our stay.

HC5u-R42pSirCWePN1rRcw.text: Food was bland, took 10 minutes to get checked in and sit down and there were only 8 people in front of us in line.  Poor selection of desserts.  I wont be going back and it cost 110 dollars for 3 of us.

bC1MddaZVRvrRACKItRKYQ.text: Worst shit ever combining the price and shitty ass food, fuck this place, fuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuk

THF91B7xUIAHJjYrW3sjgw.text: We went here last night for dinner. I didn't expect to wait for a long time; then trying to calm myself thinking maybe it's worth waiting. The place was decent. But the food was very cold including the chicken noodle soup! Paying for $35.00 + tip; we should just stop by at a Chinese fast food. Most of their entrees are Chinese food ;where they add old stir fry beans  to the new ones. The fried chicken was harder and the only one that was warmer was the lamb. There were only 3 sets of fruits. Nothing else. The steak was colder but you will have to wait for the server as he was doing something else.  This is ridiculously bad. We will never come back here again.

pdBbyUVojyGIMHwnnEVbMQ.text: Got a free buffet at Bayside from MyVEGAS and stopped in this evening. The good, desserts and a few different selections. The bad, really felt that the quality was low. The meat I got off the carving stations was cold. The fried chicken was good as was the meatballs. My server was attentive and my cup never went empty. If I had paid for this I would have been disappointed but it was worth what I paid, free.

PQ6RGNWu5uiCg9cmRHejJg.text: Some of these reviews are not True. This place is pretty good. Super flavorful. And the staff is amazing. And they have peeled shrimp.

-0HAHdxwA8wemwOEWlC0dA.text: Came here for Sunday Brunch on father's day. 3 people told me a different thing regarding bottomless bloody Mary's including one manager saying it was free because of father's day. Well she was wrong and when I confronted her about it, she denied ever saying it and said she was talking about champagne...  ...champagne is always included as a bottomless drink...  Our server also wouldn't bring requests I made, kept forgetting, even after asking her 3x for a cracking device for my crab legs.  Food is mediocre at best... over all this was an awful experience and a waste of money.  Happy father's day, dad!

l_sv6rccsTbCQyoeVt4YiA.text: Since we were staying at the Delano, we figure to try the Mandalay Bay Breakfast Buffet.  Beware, on the weekend the breakfast becomes Higher Brunch Prices.    Breakfast Selections were ok, but the taste and quality of the items are less than impressive.  One type of breakfast egg has no egg taste, sausage has a very strange taste, the ham was over cooked and tough that I could'd cut into.  Lunch Selection, prime rib was too well done, fried rice was pasty, corn was very chewy.

DVujUCQq8WPG_nxghUrdfg.text: This was the worst buffet i've ever tried. We got two free buffets per day of our trip as a promotion through the mandalay website and it was not worth it. Felt obligated to eat here to save money but it was terrible. Food was dried out no matter if we came early in the morning or for lunch. No soy or almond milk for non dairy milk drinkers. Not much variety and poor quality in general. There are many other good buffets on the strip but this is not one of them. Do not waste your time and money.

SVT2xuPAfC3kVEnj2pa4sQ.text: Ate here for breakfast before heading to Zion. Breakfast is $17/person. For the price, I think there is a good selection of breakfast items... and everything I had tasted good. The service here was very good and the waiter brought the orange juice and coffee before we even asked while we were getting our food. They have salmon for breakfast... and even steak! There are a variety of breakfast crepes, pancakes, waffles, has browns, bacon... all the typical breakfast items. There is a selection of pastries and doughnuts at the desserts area. I had some and they were very good and I wanted to try more but I was stuffed. There is also an omelet station and you can get eggs that are not scrambled there as well.   I would come back here for food again... but it is far from the main areas of the strip. The view while eating is beautiful though... overlooking the pool and waterfall.

gtbH3uTWzA2PvVzzIzR7ug.text: Had their brunch. It was decent. The french toast sticks were good quality.

4zMWkVJXrv1gfUFerUYCaw.text: It's just an OK buffet.  More Asian food than many places and not that big.  I would have given it a three star rating, but I totally got sick after eating here.   I liked that they have sugar free desserts. I don't think I will go here again.  There's some terrific restaurants in Mandalay Bay so it's really silly to go here and take a chance on food poisoning.

j6nKch1u_j7do1ZZ2fCkmQ.text: It's worth the money for the Sunday brunch buffet. They serve hot and cold crab legs my champagne glass was never empty, excellent service and I never saw any of the buffet items empty. I would highly recommend this buffet for Sunday brunch!

P8WKnYrQZf3NxwnOVUF0fg.text: It's worth it's money. The brunch was good. The corn beef and hash truly delicious. The dessert bar was also yummy. Had sugar free desserts. I would come back.

7-szVtyUUudfCNGhkWJr8g.text: Great food, the steak is so rare and the chef suggested if  they can cook it more for me and I said yes please. Very professional chef's. I'm coming back again next time to this buffet restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x4-mvonwzK6fEoC1i0OfZA.text: Simple line of food but most of the food are great.  Although I came at 9pm,  all the vegetables were still fresh and crisp.  The pasta, made by the chef,  had to be my favorite because they had a good mixture of ingredients to fulfill any of the pickiest of eaters.  I especially loved it when the chef made it his way and knew just how much spice is needed to still keep the flavor of the pasta rather get it overwhelmed.  Most buffets has dried up pizza or some of flavorless stale bread,  but it tasted like it just came out of the oven!  I would definitely recommend  trying this buffet at least once while visiting vegas

NrpUvai_MgdEgc_F2ZyoBQ.text: For the price it is horrible.75.00 for 2 and you think it would be okay, but it is not. The food taste industrial at best. Spend another 40 bucks and go to 6 or 7 good places within the resort.

TS5g-zR9o1YW4pjeYebrdQ.text: We used MyVegas comps for the Aria and Mandalay Bay Buffets.   I have both at 4 stars here, but Aria is a bit better, I'd say Aria would be 4.25 and Mandalay a 3.75, rounding both to 4.    Plenty of seating area available, we were in a room by a large window.  While Aria's buffet had a wider selection, there was some cool things to try here that Aria did not have, like the veal osso bucco, the oxtail, and the panko breaded chicken wings.  Nice carved meat station, and I really liked the cioppino soup.  Crab legs weren't as good as Aria though - here they are not pre-split.    Nice variety in the dessert area - wound up getting several of the little cups of tiramisu, they were that good.  This is a very good value for the MyVegas points we used, maybe a bit expensive for paying in cash.

sMMHSlgUf1kiJGMe_3-HDQ.text: This place is not bad. But the thing is... It is not great either.  For the breakfast, I could see only limited choices of food that are not impressive.  I used the reward from myvegas game, so I paid half price. That comforts me.

jx8cvH8Bltc-fsWhMVuPpQ.text: I came here for lunch and it was great. I am gluten free (celiacs disease) and the chef himself came out and gave me a tour of all the food (before I paid) to make sure that there was something I could eat. He also offered to make me something that wasn't out due to my allergy. Great customer service and the food was good.

pLM7EYnLlJs6BkGdsTOyQg.text: This buffet sucks. Horrible variety, no sides, only thing that was good was the roast beef. Save your money and eat somewhere else

1_Ba6MzAbCos_yKuYPL0Tw.text: This used to be my go to buffet because they used to serve piping hot steamed huge crab legs. I've been back twice in the last year and have been sorely disappointed with the size and quality of them. Seems like they are purposely ordering inferior cheaper crab legs to keep costs down. Big mistake! The dessert selection is weak and basically the overall buffet is not worth the price if they can't serve at least one stellar item to want to come back again for. This buffet needs drastic changes for improvement.   Now, on the positive note, i personally can not make a dinner spread like that, so, if i am nearby and starving, i may try it again just to see of any enhancements. Two stars on the vegas scale, three and half if you come from out of state with no vegas type buffets at home.

12v-vyg9jlLFEAz4IGiqlA.text: i usually don't write reviews but i just HAD to this time. my experience at this buffet was extremely disappointing. the workers were nice but that didn't make up for the low quality food being served. there wasn't a variety of food and everything tasted pretty bland. i only spent there for about 30 minutes despite other buffets where i spend around 1-2 hours. the worse thing was that it costed $35 per person. it was a complete waste and i could've gotten a better meal for $10. i strongly recommend not going here.

-XPbE9OQyv_ZwuK7T9mWhQ.text: Meh~~~ Been here once during the 4th of July Weekend There are better Buffets out there. Pricewise, it is okay, compared to other buffets and prices.  Quality of food, pretty low, and not that great.  Mexican/"Latino" (Paella, 1 type of empanada, tacos, fajitas etc), Pasta (you can ask to be made, 2-3 options of noodles), Seafood (a bit fishy, but okay), "Chinese" Food (not that great, noodles soggy, and fried spring rolls soggy), Prime rib steak (it was great, not too dry, or hard), pastries/cookies/ice cream.   Servers were a bit laggy... but not that bad. very nice servers, working so hard.  it takes a bit to take away your used plates.

___tiHHnNV42l-Bo8edxIw.text: Another great buffet on the trip. Great selection and very tasty foods. Waiter kept our drinks supply on point. They have more selections than the nearest other hotels' buffets. The desserts were really very good and tasty too. Seems like people just like to complain about anything, but it's a buffet not a 5 star restaurant, so don't expect a $70 type quality from a $22 buffet

XjUsHieVBNYIRxTq_zVZEg.text: The desserts are good. Definitely not one of the best buffets Vegas has to offer. Food was below average. I won't be back. Go to the Rio seafood buffet

GZWKA3QJdOksYcFI74LPPA.text: So we ate here for our last breakfast before we left. Tuesday morning, we caught the end of breakfast, and then got lunch. The food was mediocre, but for the price wasn't too bad. $21.99 for adults. They had the basics pizza, meat, mash potatoes, fruit, Asian, Mexican, etc. Not a lot of choices for the vegetarian, at least I didn't think so. And many varieties of dessert, all you can drink is extra, we didn't opt for it. This was fine cause we were their, but over all we won't be back.

okFwXpZo6Vk8_YVxGMNz-w.text: Great selection of seafood, but dont pay full price! Download the myvegas app for coupons or check groupon. I had a buy one get one free from the myvegas app, so i paid $60 for two people. For $60, I say we definitely got our moneys worth. Great crab, fish, and sushi. One of the better buffets on the strip.

9pFI0lKpslWPQBxPnMR9RA.text: I've only been to / in comparison to buffets at Aria, Cosmo & Bellagio, this was the smallest spread (but still plentiful, with a good variety). I don't recall anything that seemed to be a "specialty" to the buffet. However, the food itself was good and priced well. To me it's a buffet off the list, wouldn't plan to go back but if the group was going and / or in the area I wouldn't be upset or mind going back.

REmIxFbAoWFxDXBieHcbsg.text: What a waste of money. Save yourself some time and money and head to a real Vegas buffet. Very small selection and all of the food was cold. I arrived 20mins after they open at 4:30pm for dinner and most of the stations were not even set up. Everything was tasteless and selection was very limited. Not even an area for bread...

HMDUG5jxEDUO94S1Vqe7zA.text: We woke up Thursday morning on the verge of keeling over from starvation. What better way to cure this than a buffet? My friends were looking through the magazine reading reviews on the various buffets on the strip but I suggested that we go to Bayside at Mandalay Bay. Lunch that day set us back only $19 per head! They had a sign outside that said lunch was $38 which is awfully misleading. I think there would've been a lot more patrons if that sign weren't there. We paid at the kiosks out front and then got in line to be seated.   My meal consisted of: baked chilean sea bass paella cocktail shrimp squid salad calamari potstickers baked halibut smoked trout california rolls spanish rice cream of broccoli tiramisu soft serve swirly (vanilla & chocolate)  The service could've been a little better but I'm not really going to complain. I was happily satisfied with everything I got. The cocktail shrimp probably stood out the most. They were big, fat, and juicy. My friend and I literally stocked up on a couple bowls each. The worste part of the meal? Probably the cream of broccoli. It looked like oatmeal and I could not detect any hint of broccoli in there. My friend said it tasted like instant cream of broccoli. I had to brush the bowl aside after two sips.  We walked out beyond stuffed. We booked it to our room after so that we could change out of our tight jeans and lounge around in sweats. Not only was I happy with the buffet but I definitely think I ate more than $20 worth. Bayside, we shall meet again.

_1WL-etTpkU-0Ebw1c0uVQ.text: Went here on a Saturday night with the family.  Overall a good buffet.  It was $22 for adult and $14 for children so it was relatively cheap compared to some of the other seafood buffet.  It is not the Rio buffet but it is also about 50% the price of the Rio Buffet.   I would go to again.

JJvt_5bBIl0D_7gQ-i6zzg.text: The food taste cold and old like it wasn't eaten for hours,  the place was dead and workers look like zombies or robots. The ones that were talkative only talk in groups, I think it was gossiping. Worst $90 we spent. I would rather eat at McDonald's. Please don't eat here the 3 stars is good reason to avoid. Now I'm sitting on the toilet , my stomach doesn't feel well

uujksxEzFya38DffJSNQ2w.text: Been coming to this buffet for years, never disappoints. It's clean and the food is delicious. Only been for dinner, but I'll have to try the brunch sometime.

0iI8hkKf0DtuVhvvc6fv7g.text: Eh, this buffet was alright. We ate here three times to redeem a couple "free" meals included in our stay: weekday breakfast ($19.99), weekday lunch ($29.99) and weekend brunch ($25.99).  I felt that in general, they cooked and seasoned their meats pretty well, but unfortunately I found many of the vegetables and some starches overly salty. Both the lunch and breakfast selection was pretty extensive although I thought that the options at breakfast tasted better overall. I'm normally a super light breakfast eater since it's my least favorite meal of the day, but I liked the variety here. They had your typical American breakfast fare in addition to a Mexican selection. I enjoyed their French Toast sticks, Chilaquiles and was addicted to their crispy tater tots! During brunch, they even offered quite a few meats like turkey, steak, salmon and kielbasa.   As for lunch, my expectations may have been too high, but I was a bit disappointed. Again, all was fine with the meats as one highlight was their lamb Osso Buco. Sadly, I didn't find anything else too special among their American, Italian and Asian selection. There's a station where they'll cook custom made-to-order pasta, but they serve up HUGE servings so be sure to request just a small plate if you want to sample all the other offerings. (During breakfast, they cook fresh omelettes here instead.)  As for the dessert counter, there were various cookies, simple cakes and other sweet bites. I heard their sticky buns were amazing and a must-try!   For the most part, during all three of our meals, service was consistently good and friendly. We received our drinks quickly and the staff constantly came by clearing our empty plates. The buffet appeared clean and well-kept overall, but unless I was given another free meal, I would choose to dine at a different buffet with hopes of better food quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert bites
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampling the breakfast selection

CJV3uZOVdlzxUddxE6KS8A.text: I think before coming to this buffet place, my girlfriend and I were playing this game on our phones for discounts or something. I believe we won some things and came here for our buffet.  I believe we came here around lunch time. Usually when I'm at a buffet, I go for the crabs which I'm a sucker for. I don't ever get rice because rice makes me full super fast and so I try to eat other types of food. If I still have some spots left then thats when I get some rice in me. I like to go for the chow mien as my substitution for rice and thats always a good choice. Whenever I am eating, I have to always get my vegetables because eating food without your veggies is boring. Since this place is okay and I don't know what to recommend you guys, I only tell you what I like to eat and its what I normally get at any buffet place. I have to say that if a person says they are full they are wrong. I have read studies that says theres always room for dessert. So if you have room for desserts then definitely give theirs a shot.  The thing with me giving low ratings to restaurants is that I always give them a second chance. So when I'm in the area again, I will give them another shot. So hang on tight for an updated review in the future!

VROVmdzFrHpXpe0p_qS73g.text: We had the breakfast buffet. It was okay the price wasn't too bad. But they didn't have too much of a selection and they didn't have straws. The service is not that great but can't complain about the food it was okay.

9iYav-BJ0o6l9vBkDag_fA.text: Went here for dinner and did not enjoy a single bite of anything. The pasta bar had zero flavor, not even salt (I got chicken penne alfredo). The rice in the asian section was all undercooked and crunchy- fried & white. Everything seemed as if it were made with the cheapest ingredients & foods that they could find. Very disappointed being that I am staying in an expensive MGM hotel and after dropping over $40 for food that would've been more valuable elsewhere

CHkMGJ_JCyyZtLvGNkdsEg.text: I can't say that I care all that much for many of the buffets in Vegas but I just admit that I was pleased with a few different things about my last visit to the Bayside Buffet.  For one, the hostess was very nice.  I had asked for a seat at a nice table where there was plenty of natural light.  She sat me in an area I'd never been before.  There were tons of windows. Immediately my spirits were lifted. It was great.  I could picture myself in a breakfast nook with light beaming in. I can't even begin to tell you. it was so beautiful. Anyway, moving on to the food, the food wasn't bad at all. there were many different types of fruits and breakfast beads and pastries. I think I ate a little bit of everything. I was glad that I could get eggs prepared to my preference. I was happy to find there was a good selection of fruit but also that they were bringing out some other add ons like salads and fruit items.  I was not impressed with the wait staff at first.  I guess I felt like they didn't realize that I was there or that I was a newly seated customer or something. I think after they realized that I'd just started dining they were much more attentive. They were much more on top of my drink refills, bussing my dishes, cleaning my many many soiled napkins, asking if I needed any other condiments, etc.  So, things started out a bit rocky but they ended on a good note. I had a nice meal, a very leisurely one in fact.  I liked that things came together. I hope the next time I come I have an even better experience. (Let me tell you, my 1st experience was a complete and utter disaster. HORRIBLE!)

wl6wNwa71zrwiGbNRQWYAQ.text: First time ever eating here. It is not a very large buffet menu wise compared to other buffets.  They have a wide range of the usual buffet items but not many item wise.  They have a small assortment of sushi and fruit.  The fruit I did not notice my second pass as it is a little pass the sushi.  Some unusual items I noticed include oxtail and lamb.  Lamb was good. Did not try the oxtail.  Beef from the Asian section was really spicey.  Dessert is one the other side of the room and overall it was ok.  Nothing spectacular.  Regular drinks are part of the buffet.   They also offer an all you can drink alcohol package.  Price point it was a little high.  I might eat here again if I was staying here.  I would not go out of my way to eat here though.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. first plate
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef

BVk2ARwhuv8kOCQRFn5uhw.text: Wow! We had dinner here a couple of weeks ago after visiting the Mandalay Bay Aquarium.  The buffet price was very reasonable.  Not to mention, a great deal for a few extra dollars you get unlimited drinks (beer & wine) from the bar. Excellent service, delicious food & dessert selections & a beautiful restaurant.  All the food was fresh and delicious.   We'll be visiting again soon.

Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Uvb48d1NDmCY3_87RrHiA.text: I don't understand why our table was a quarter of a mile away from the food it was like walking a half marathon just to get a plate , every time ! so next time I'm going to ask for seating closest to the buffet that being said it was just so-so,,, it was just your average Las Vegas buffet, Nothing at all spectacular nothing mind blowing or out of the ordinary catchy. For the same price you could eat at a little bit more edgier Las Vegas buffets, It was nothing special to distinguish this buffet from any other buffet of this type in fact there are other buffets at lower price points with better options (palace station, Studio B, red rock, etc...) That being said this is a chance for Mandalay Bay to really kick things up a notch I'll come back again someday but bot with bated breath. For how much space is actually in the entire restaurant I wish they would do a remodel and really refocus on a central dining experience.

70oMnVzwJIM241fdct-4lg.text: Quite possibly the worst breakfast buffet in all of Las Vegas. "Make your own eggs Benedict" consists of soft English muffins, eggs floating in water, processed ham, and Hollandaise sauce from a can.  I've had better breakfast at Best Western, where it's free.  Save yourself the disappointment and money.

e6IzeNct2OTo5taXStMZUQ.text: Now, this isn't the BEST buffet in Vegas, but it is definitely at the top of the list for me.   I came here on a weekend at dinner time, so it was about $35 per person. That is a fairly basic price for a buffet in Vegas. I'll tell you now, I've tried almost all the major buffets in Vegas already, and this one was probably at the top of my list.   I'll tell you now, Bacchanal Buffet at Caesar's is my favorite, but price wise and taste wise, this buffet is probably my favorite. It had your basic American food. I'm going to list the different types of food they served, but be warned these are like all the Americanized versions. It was still very good though.   They had: American, Italian, Mexican, Chinese, and Japanese. They also had your little basic seafood/salad section. The cold stuff. Dessert wise, it was whatever. They didn't have a lot of great options, but they tasted pretty good for the most part.   Staff wise, I pretty much never got a refill. Basically after getting there, we were never checked upon again. That is the only reason I'm docking a star. Don't get me wrong though, staff there is pretty friendly.

dLjaleEzZCien00ovY3oEA.text: This is a pretty nice buffet. Good selection. The Bayside Buffet is located right off the Mandalay Bay's gaming floor. I've been coming to the Mandalay Bay since it opened in March of 1999. My wife had never been there so we decided to try their buffet. We did the lunch buffet on a Sunday morning. It was reasonably priced at $25.99 per person.   Here are their prices:  Breakfast Buffet: adults $18.99                               children $12.99 Lunch Buffet: adults: $21.99                         children: $14.99 Dinner Buffet: adults: $32.99                          children: $21.99 Brunch Buffet: adults: $25.99                           children: $20.99 Children are considered between 5-12, 4 and under eat free. On holidays the price go up just a bit, figure about five bucks more per meal. This is the one thing I hate about Las Vegas Buffets. They all jack their prices around holidays.   During dinner you can pay $10.99 for unlimited drinks however, this does not include mixed drinks, only beer and wine which is still a great deal.  This buffet has plush surroundings and some of the sections afford a view of the pool and gardens. The pools at Mandalay Bay are amazing and they have crazy pool parties.   The items on the buffet are quite extensive and always fresh. To much to list here. But we did brunch this time which is a great selection, because it has the breakfast and lunch items combined.   The dessert area is nice but not quite as big as some of the other buffets around Vegas. It's great though. They have an ice cream section too.   I have been to tons of buffets in Las Vegas and the Bayside in Mandalay Bay is a nice one. The service is good, the quality of food is good and the customer service is good. Nice buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G-D0oAAAjsPblvl_hZ5Epw.text: Decided to check out Bayside Buffet at the Mandalay Bay tonight, so I went into "My Vegas Slots" and picked up a free dinner buffet, normally as of this post (10/25/18) a weeknight dinner buffet here would be $32.99 (Sunday-Thursday).  So free is always better as far as I am concerned.  But you must have an mLife players card to get the free rewards.  The Bayside Buffet is located on the main floor of the casino at Mandalay Bay, the buffer itself is not huge, but there is a ton of seating, very comfortable.  Try to get a table towards the back near the windows would be my recommendation, you will have a nice view and be far away from the smoke from the casino, although they have pretty good ventilation inside the casino so not that bad.  This buffet has all the usual suspects, carving station, salad bar, Italian, Latin, sushi, deserts, etc.  along with a few items you may not typically find like Chickpea Masala or Oxtail Stew.  They also have a custom pasta station, made to order while you wait.  Everything was very good and tasted fresh, good quality.  I just wish I had more room to try a few more items.  I alway fill up at the carving station and the crab legs and then not much room for anything else, except carrot cake of course.  Servers come and bring you drinks, napkins, extra plates, clean your table, etc.  You can also pay an extra $10.99 for unlimited beer and wine if you feel it is worth it for you.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to Bayside buffet
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruits
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruits

6uNKhokc4Df32mffEYfMVg.text: Quite possibly the worst buffets I've ever been to.  And that includes many filthy Chinese buffets.  I would say even worse than a Holiday Inn Express breakfast buffet.  I mean this place is bad.  I kept tying to find one thing that was ok.  I never found it.  Nothing and I mean nothing in this place is worth your money.

oq3UD56T34BrvoymTPiiEQ.text: Not a huge fan of buffets but nevertheless gave the Bayside Buffet a try since we were staying here. Wasn't impressed with their spread. Plenty of different variety of foods but still your typical "assembly line" buffet food. Service was nothing special (saw our waiter 2x during our 1 hour visit). Prime rib was dry and dinner price was $32 per adult.

LPNzG9ILqJLc-Lso2mRLdg.text: Food was not impressive. Prime rib was raw and tough. Buffets were dirty with spilled food. Just not impressed for the price.

n0GY37TbDG_j3_VcB2Xx1Q.text: Reading from some people that this is one of the best buffets at Vegas I was very very underwhelmed. For 30+ per person you can do way better even at the strip. Usually at all buffets there will be at least 1-2 plates I will like enough to go get again. Sadly that was not the case here. Carved beef was very cheap cut, couldn't chew half of it. Turkey very dry. Salad selections very limited. Service was horrible. Waited for 15mins for someone to pass by to refill my drink then after I waved to a distant waitress she was like "oh you know this is not my table but I will do you favour and get you drinks." So much for the 18% tip they basically push you signing at the entrance. Never again

8p0yDXThviAecPHcaCRCEQ.text: Absolutely delicious brunch buffet! So many different choices and everything was well stocked and fresh! Only thing was you had to order drinks do you couldn't get several drinks by yourself. Service was great and left with a full tummy.

8ZtsTeIjvm8th0aEAnorbQ.text: Given the many options readily available within the Mandalay Bay casino, Bayside Buffet really should be the last option on the list. My husband and I wanted to get out of town before the noontime returning to LA traffic begins, so we thought this would be a quick meal since all the items are ready at the buffet stations. Well, this seems to be the only pro for the establishment.   Sunday brunch was $25.99, including non-alcoholic beverages.   Food was just average, offerings were typical American breakfast items. Waffles, pancakes, French toast, scrambled eggs, sausages, baked salmon, English muffins, mashed potatoes, potato totes, fried chicken, greens, a salad bar, an omelette station but be prepared to wait about 5 minutes. Carving station offers baked ham and strip loin. Really nothing exciting which is fine given the price point but if the items are done well, it will really be worth while. Most items were dried and overlooked. Berries and watermelon were the selling points. The dessert items were uninspiring so I didn't even want to bother with it. Instead we went to Citizen Kitchen, just left of the restaurant on the casino floor, for coffee and a donut; that hit the spot!

fmjhhkDWi8HS0oGInZzxSw.text: There is not a lot of food selections which came as a surprise to me and the food quality overall, is not that good. We came here for brunch and there was no line which was kinda alarming. We paid $32.99 per person and that does not include mimosas. I asked the cashier a simple question and she didn't know the answer but she also didn't even try to find out the answer for me. There is a $7 added cost for unlimited mimosas and i just wanted to know if there is a bar in the buffet that we have to go to everytime when we wanna refill the drink or the server can take care of it and since she didn't even bother to ask her coworkers to figure out the answer I didn't get the bottomless drink option. They didn't have that many choices for breakfast or lunch. I was looking for fruit and they only had melons and grapes and the fruit bowl was almost empty and for the whole hour that I was there, they didn't even refill the bowl. Not a pleasant experience and I won't be coming back here.

8K5ZisR8aV2LOqEaQlRrHQ.text: The dinner buffet here was my favorite! The selection of food was very intriguing and the staff was helpful. Its located inside the Mandalay Bay hotel near the casino areas.   The thing I loved about this place was the wide variety of foods. They do a great job dividing every little island into separate sections. They had Asian, Mexican and American. They also had a salad bar, a great seafood section and a desert section filled with all the goodies you want. I couldn't make up my mind with soo many good options. So I started with some healthy chicken and a cesaers salad. I then got some orange chicken with chow mein and a slice of pizza. After my warm up, i had a very large plate of shrimp cocktail. Im pretty sure i ate over a pound of shrimp by myself. At this point, I couldn't eat anymore, so I sat down for a while and waited for a good 15 minutes before getting dessert. The dessert was delicious. I started with a carrot cake and a cheese cake. I did notice their dessert section had candy decoration, so I asked if I could get candy but they advised it was only for display purposes.  Overall, this buffet was ,my favorite in Vegas. They had the largest variety of food along with a nice setting and helpful staff. I love Shrimp, so this was paradise for me. I highly recommend this buffet in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h7Eymho4498Ri7M8zxIZow.text: The food quality was very typical of a buffet, just average, nothing great. The amount of variety was a little above average but I'm sure you could find a better buffet in Vegas. Price wise it is only $25 per person, for brunch that is, I'm not sure how much for dinner. I don't see us coming again or recommending it to friends/family.

sPnq1MeJpKJUbcvUMy_eVw.text: We stayed at the hotel over spring break and decided to give this buffet a try. We went for breakfast on two separate days during the week. The buffet is large , clean and well organized. The price is what it is and as with all buffets, it is up to you to get your money's worth. The omelette station is always the choke point but was never an unreasonable wait. The selection of different food from different regions was nice with plenty of condiments and sauces for each type of food. Another truth for buffets in general is that the more often you eat at them the better you will be at navigating the selections to create a meal that represents a value for you and your family. The service met the high standard that I found consistently at all of the Mandalay restaurants.

UMUdmZVyme9S3NE_-ommMw.text: Ate at the bayside buffet last Friday (4/28/17), I'll preface we went to the buffet only because we had two free passes with out room reservation. Good thing it was free because we were very underwhelmed. The selection seemed small for a Friday lunch. The sushi selection was just a few rolls, the rice was also hard so I got the feeling it had been out for a ling time.  The prime rib and cheese blintz were really all I ate and found enjoy able. Pretty sad for a buffet and someone who loves food.  Given free passes again I'd more then likely pass.  If you are looking for a good Vegas buffet I do recommend the Wynn.

tH1CACjGd7E6tjf5ML28yg.text: This is a buffet; don't expect gourmet food. That being said this is a good option if you're a big eater and hungry; also I should mention look for BOGO offers (MyVegas rewards).   We came here for dinner on a Thursday evening and there was no wait and plenty of food options. There is something here for everyone, sushi, pasta, Indian, Asian, meat and potatoes, salad, dessert, and more. Was there anything that just knocked my socks off? No. I did enjoy the Korean bbq, lo mein noodles, and fresh shrimp. We came here with a BOGO offer and it totaled $52 including the drink package (unlimited beer and wine) for two. If a drinker, this is where you get your value, we ate till full and ended up drinking a total of 8 beers including to-go beers. Where else on the Strip can you get a meal for two and that many beers? Please tell me because I'd like to know.   As long as you understand this is a buffet where food is prepared for literally thousands of people on a daily basis, aren't too picky and have a discount it's totally worth it.

_FXYKvLTvWDZbOWMb0tKsQ.text: Arrive at 11:00 ish a.m I was showed to our booth great server! Wife and I proceed to buffet bar and it was 75% empty I asked cook what was going he said in a a deamenrer: can't you see we are switching from breakfast to lunch! Well excuse me ahole!!! So I proceed to the front end where a 2  gentlemans where the I believe restaurant Mgr and d other kitchen Mgr. They stated we are transition from breakfast to lunch  in a rude way. Instead of the kitchen Mgr standing around just talking you should get ur ass to the prep area and proceed with the transition as a team... 1 and last time. Sincerely, Rich

fPOK-KNuBL2xXTyDUdD5eg.text: This was one of the absolute worst experiences about my entire Vegas trip, food was horrible, poorly cooked & prepared, the only nice thing I have to say about this place is it had a nice view of the pools.   Do not suggest for anyone who actually wants to enjoy their meals

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horrible food, but not so horrible view... But then again I could&#39;ve gotten McDonald&#39;s and enjoyed the same view from my room

jp61RvJXzpIPV-4orG-dwQ.text: I just paid $24 for a lunch buffet and got only slightly better food than Golden Corral

1Ur5LoYRTSXTZy_K71iWmA.text: I came here for breakfast because it was free with the MyVegas points. There was some convention or something because there were a lot of Asian guests practically everywhere on the strip. This buffet was crawling with screaming children, so I actually almost left.  The views from what I saw weren't as beautiful as some other reviews state, so maybe I wasn't in the right area. The french toast, sausage, most desserts, orange juice, and coffee were excellent. Their eggs were gross, especially the "cheesy" ones. They have an omelette station that I wish I went for.. From all the great reviews, I did expect better quality food, but it was all mediocre and some foods didn't taste that fresh (which is expected from a buffet). I spent a good chunk of the morning on the toilet after this meal... I don't think I'll be back.

h2v5_hGoUn1fEhzHzMDaHA.text: I ate at this buffet to use the hotel credit that I received as part of a package. So I decided to try their Saturday brunch. It was not worth it! Everything tasted like it was either overcooked and dry or like it had freezer burn.   I am not kidding when I tell you that the highlight of the meal was the soft serve ice cream.  The Mandalay Bay brought me in since it is a very nice property. Do yourself a favor and skip this one.

ZDC9cSogFU7dL3CJlbAkQw.text: Food choices aren't too many but service is good. $7 more for mimosas. It actually has champagne. Lots of other places taste like oj

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

di0DIByuP1Ci_lxMfqbhWw.text: It didn't feel like a seafood buffet at all. Price was also really high but the food was ok at least.  Definitely recommend other buffets over this one

vtjgralDXeiRiQHuKG2PXg.text: Free wine and beer & great prime rib... Epic, come here :)

CBQV7F4yUBOMmzUwdnOvcg.text: $30.99 for brunch during Memorial Day weekend. A little expensive but I think we got our money's worth! They had just about everything - omelet station, pancakes, French toast strips, crab legs, fresh fruit, a whole slew of things for lunch and dessert. The desserts weren't anything to write home about and the coffee wasn't hot, but I felt pleasantly full for the whole day. Go early though, they get busy!

RZ8LLH1LCE-F-W6P-ne2Cg.text: Very few buffets get the rib right. These slid off the bones and were juicy. I went back for more and more. Crab available but didn't try it. I'm a sucker for bread putting and this place perfected it. The sugar free dessert I wasn't impressed but the chocolate mouse was really something.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweets!

i6ipuU5xFYHYCYyK_QW2dw.text: Stopped by for lunch before going to the shark exhibit. It's nothing special your average Buffett style restaurant. The variety was the same Italian, BBQ, Asian and Mexican. The food  was good but not excellent and the service was typical of a buffet.  It was good to stop by but I am not sure if I will go back again....

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hlad84Ci5GnnCvw-M3a8hg.text: I'll preface this by saying I'm not a fan of buffets in general.
