They had some flank steak out which was delicious and I have to mention the watermelon. Bayside had some of the juiciest most flavorful watermelon I've ever had. The only knock is the omelet line. Obviously a very popular station, so if you really want one you are going to have to wait.

vddjx1pVbJN74V2qKbEQOA.text: Service was as good as ive ever expirienced at a resturant.  We went for sunday brunch though I ate more lunch food.  They had a good selection of fresh fruits, solid suishi, made a delicous omlette, the lox and shrimp were A+. Not as gourmet as some of the other more expensive buffets around, but in its price range it was plenty good.  Get the bloody marys/mimosa they will refill you as much as you want and let you take a full drink to go!

Pw-nzzF3-WDEjM4YBloaYA.text: You pay $24.99 for a "so-so" buffet. There wasn't much for us for brunch. Granted they had a omelette station but we've been to Golden Corral's with more selection then this place. Being in the Mandalay Bay hotel/casino, I expected a lot more. We had to wait a while in line but we left with frozen yogurt soft serve in a waffle cone. yum!

sTjdpLO3TTTb6uA2rfkUmQ.text: After a day of walking, the family and I came in here for some eats because why WOULDN'T you go to a buffet while in Vegas, right? :)   The layout of this place was spacious and fancier than any other buffets I've been to. It was okay as far as food variety, and it all tasted fine. I think we came here close to dinner time, and I thought the cost was a little much. However, it included unlimited champagne so not a total bummer ;)  If I was near by, I may come here again. However, I've been to a couple of other buffets where I enjoyed the variety more and would most likely pick over this one.

oU0vkcxZmoSN9uZSXHfBNw.text: While the hotel itself is nice, this buffet is lackluster and the food is nauseating. I sat through our evening show in pain and went back to our room only to throw up constantly. Wish we had gone elsewhere.

JGlxHXs-GvH6sVuIcx5r5Q.text: I can't believe the great ratings this place has. Based on our brunch buffet experience yesterday (10/26/13) if I were running the food service at Mandalay Bay, I would immediately terminate whomever is responsible for this "restaurant." I don't expect amazing food at a buffet, but (especially for $26 p.p.) the food to be edible, tasty even. The only things that were edible out of the whole thing- the pastries and fresh fruit. How do you mess up eggs, waffles, and bacon? They did. I can t say enough bad things about this buffet. Horrible.  It was garbage. We left hungry because every single thing we tried was terrible. Not only the worst food I've ever had in Las egas, but some of the worst food I've ever had.

XqIFlNmjFbR9apdE5AF5Qg.text: This review is for breakfast only:  Twice, I had breakfast here as the price is fairly reasonable for Las Vegas. The food is mediocre, but good for Vegas. With tip/Tax the buffet is about $17.50. The selection is fair---very Denny's like. Not much in the way of juices, coffee is average and only a few types of fruit. The egg station features a really unhappy dude, who rather bitch about his job to co-workers than focus on delivery.  Our table service was generally good, though the waitress to table ratio is real low.   One tip: They open at 7AM and if you get here early, it's much better as the place becomes a zoo.

KrGPpXSel6q5q0HR3OV24Q.text: In hindsight, I really didn't like this buffet. There wasn't much of a variety in the food offerings. Eggs, bacon, fruit, cereal...eh. Everything looked tired and heat lamp scorched. There was no flavor in anything I ate. They had delicious cookies but I really didn't want to eat cookies for breakfast. I did because they were kind of the only decently tasting thing available. It's a hard knock life.  The price was right but the selection was too limited for a Vegas buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

utnzL36a9pfOEPQB_Eu_Kw.text: Went for breakfast this morning. Service was great. The food, not so much. I'm not a picky eater in the least, but some of the food was actually gross. The biscuits were so dry they were inedible even after drenching them with some bland gravy to go with my bland scrambled eggs. The hot food was cold and the cold food was room temp. Definitely won't be doing anymore buffets in Vegas. Barf.

5wYuzYRzKC2WsrscmdH8MA.text: Use to be one of my favorite places on the strip. Food quality and preparation has degraded. Roast beef had grisel and was tough.  The stir fry cooked the food till it was burnt while attending to other task. Save your money at these prices try Wolfgang pucks restaurant.

TGqTy87XEBIUFDIdd7LnDQ.text: I really had higher expectations for the buffet at Mandalay Bay. Tiny crab legs, mediocre desserts. Try the buffet at the Luxor instead.

BN1rhUJSWyqrajNzWXF4ZA.text: Unlimited wine, champagne, and beer! Need I say more?...  Food - 9/10 Tasted great and freshly prepared.  Service - 10/10 Waiters/Waitresses were very attentive and polite.  Variety - 7/10 Was lacking in this department in comparison to some other casino buffets I've visited.  Price - ~$30/per person Very good price considering the free unlimited alcohol, great food, and excellent service.  Had a good experience overall and would definitely recommend visiting this buffet.  *September 2013

1O_apLTNf5_9cCQ-tWpdyQ.text: I feel sorry for the poor cow that baca me the prime rib. This place is downright awful. Avoid avoid avoid. Shame on you Mandalay Bay/ MGM Brands.

3tTKTEXQF6TLtsXMooDAPw.text: I had been here before it's an ok buffet for dinner in Vegas. It's a good place for when you just get off the plane and are ready to eat.  Atmosphere is not really a good thing for Vegas was hoping for  a little more atmosphere for the price.

SAHnJdRfJjQOs1GRh3TE1Q.text: For it being Mandalay Bay I expected more boy was I wrong! Options are verrryyyy limited! To say even Excalibur one is better. Wish they would add more items to the menu, even the fruit was limited.  won't be coming back quite disappointed in what they had to offer.

hzqPIj0TsW6o2JGHX9O2Zg.text: This place is a typical middle of the road buffet (think Hometown Buffet) but costs about $35 for dinner. Hey, it's Vegas, so that's to be expected. I'm being extra tough on them solely because of the "sushi". I can't believe how terrible the quality was. The rice was the shape and consistency of a Tootsie Roll - how did they even pack it that tight?!? I'm guessing it was machine made with some kind of high pressure extruding machine. The fish on top wasn't much better - it looked glazed and dried out, as if it spent the night in the cooler uncovered and all of the moisture was sucked out. The absolute worst item was the unagi. Freshwater eel is always cooked (in the case of unagi it is grilled). I'm not sure anyone informed the cooks of this buffet how this should be done. The unagi was tough and rubbery. I've never actually experienced this at any other restaurant and had to spit it out.   In summary, skip this place and spend your money in the food court.

W0AklziCA1T51IgXvm23Zg.text: We visited this buffet for dinner last night. The food was good. The server was terrible, we only drink water and we always had an empty cup. Our table of 4 guests had about 10 cups in the center when we left and we stacked our empty plates on an adjacent table.  For the $142 price tag, the overall experience left something to be desired, but I am happy the food was good. The crab legs were excellent.

MhPfzYHCJAZbd18Jb4TtxA.text: Okay this is going to be short....4 adults and 2 kids $200.  Worst food ever!  The food at soup plantation is better quality.  Complete waste of calories!!!

Rwf-ggKzwLdPvgEh8D5QzQ.text: Would give less than one star if it was available!  We ate at the Mandalay Beach Buffet on June 18th - a Saturday evening.  The buffet selection was horrible.  The food had absolutely no flavor and was totally over cooked.   The entire experience was very disappointing especially considering the price we paid for 4 people!!  Save your money and walk across the street to Subway!

KLAPeysMGGFz3J7ue05Pog.text: It was alright.  The sushi was like chewing gum. The pizza was  made with real cheese so it was really good.   The smoked salmon was fake; It had  way too much smoke flavoring added. The panko salmon was good. But I really just ended up eating mostly desserts. The chocolate cake was so good and I  ate 3 slices.

Ww5MZvDm1soAfnG90CEkLA.text: Their brunch buffet will set  you back a few thousand calories. Lots of eggy, hot things.. Pastries, good coffee...but a pretty penny. Oh.. and ready self for the queues.

KD6Nrr_gHAFbIc-F9A0jNQ.text: Maybe they make the food and selection suck so that your forced to eat at the more expensive restaurants inside the hotel.

pR5-8zDA-8-rFpteOyYQ-Q.text: Oh this Buffet was ON!!!!.  Only after having my girlfriend hassle me about coming here because she was told this buffet was good, I finally buckled down and we took the trip to Bayside buffet.  This place did not disappoint. The was a great selection of food, and the price wasn't shabby considering we shelled out $50 plus on Rio's buffet( thumbs down, later on that review), and they included beer and wine in the price of the buffett.......CHEA!!!!  So I am a crab leg eatin mutha sumthin..... And I was completely glutenous with it. The crab legs were good, not overcooked. The salmon with cracker crusted on top was awesome.  They even had ox tail, which I was surprised, and they made it better than some of the Caribbean restaurants I frequent.  The shrimp, pizza, etc. For the most part everything was delicious.   I wasn't a big fan of the sushi, but who the hell cares, BRING ON THE CRAB LEGS!!! we came back here the day after next, and  it was just as good. The service was great. The food kept coming, nothing left empty, clean. I'm a fan   Thumbs up to Bayside.

RfM7uTI69_y9tSCLyS9xiw.text: I think a lot of the people who are reviewing this buffet are not being fair. I read the reviews and I ate there anyway. I don't feel disappointed in any way. I'm sorry, if you are paying $20 for a buffet in Las Vegas and are expecting the ultimate dining experience, you are simply not being realistic. Is it the greatest buffet in vegas? Not by a long shot! Is it worth 20 bucks if you don't feel like leaving the hotel to eat? Yes.   They had a good variety of food that everyone should be able to find something  to eat there. It's pretty much what you would expect for general buffet fair- a little bit of everything from around the world. Everything is pretty good too. Actually I had some marinated skirt steak that was unusually yum. Check that one out. But yeah, sliced meats, italian, sushi, Asian, latin, etc.  The food itself was pretty good. About as good as you can expect for a buffet. People here seem to expect their buffet foods to taste like it was cooked to order. That's not how it works at a buffet. Reality check, you probably just don't like buffets. Leave the buffets to fatties like me, you're holding up the line anyway.  Bottom line. I paid 20 bucks to eat here. I got as much food as i wanted, several cups of coffee, dessert... it's a solid deal. 20 bucks barely would cover the coffee at the coffee shop or Starbucks in the hotel.   All that said, if you want to spend a lot of money on a killer buffet, check out Planet Hollywood. Have fun going there from Mandalay Bay, though.

48DO1a__FdpdoWgde9dOQw.text: I think some reviewers are missing the point of this buffet. I've seen complaints about the salad bar. Really? You're at the buffet; why are you making a salad?  For starters, the shrimp cocktail here is pre-peeled. Many buffets have "U-Peel" shrimp, but here, you just pile it up and eat it, and it's good.  For your main course, there are crab legs. Unlimited crab legs! Plate after plate of them. They're steamed, whole--many other buffets only have them chilled and pre-halved, which isn't nearly as good.  Perhaps you'd like a tasty beverage to wash it down? Well, beer and wine are included, too. Not just some fixed amount per person, but as much as you want. FREE BEER, you guys.  At this point, everything else on offer starts to look like a waste of stomach space. Unlimited shrimp cocktail, crab legs, beer, and wine? Sign me up.  UPDATE: They've changed the pricing so it's cheaper now, but beer and wine aren't included any more. Naturally, they didn't reduce the dinner price by the price of the beer/wine package, so the combination is now more expensive. But the beer they had was only good if it was free, anyway. Now it's thirty bucks for all-you-can-eat crab legs and shrimp and prime rib if you want it.

qUPJIeJ18zoH3AtGi7x53A.text: 5 Stars for the crab legs and shrimp cocktail.   I haven't had this buffet in years, so I was pleasantly surprised to find that what I loved about them before -- the crab legs -- is as good as ever.  I'm sure other items were delicious, too, but I honestly can't remember. My friend and I were having a crazy huge craving for crab legs and had a less than satisfying crab legs experience the night before, so getting them here (so fresh!) AND finding plump, perfectly cooked shrimp cocktail, was pure gastronomical joy.  The service was excellent, too -- everyone smiley and happy -- even though we made a big mess. Yes, I can't believe I became one of 'those Asians' that had plates of crab legs in the middle of their table to share. I swore I would never do that till I was at least in the my eighties...but that's how good those legs were...  A must go again.  FYI: We also had the breakfast buffet here the next morning -- the food was fine, but the morning service was lacking.

jlWMd84_r2ujviFV7OTQaw.text: This buffet USED to be a "must try" but now is just average. The service is average and quality is average. The per person price is definitely not the highest among other buffets.  The wait is also not as long compared to a few years back (I visit LV almost every holiday).  I did notice that over the years, they brought in more "fillers" like pastas, rice, etc. but what buffet hasn't taken that route? The dessert selection is still pretty good but that might just be my sweet tooth talkin. :)

p9Sq_fTXPtIBxNNPjs32nw.text: I had won a comped lunch buffet off of the MyVegas Facebook game. I'd never been to Mandalay Bay so I figured it'd be a good excuse to come check it all out.   After having to go to the mLife desk to have the comp loaded to my card, I headed over to the place around 1pm on a Friday.   There was plenty of food...no doubt about that. Nothing really stood out to me, though. I did enjoy the sushi but thought some of the meat was drier than it should've been.  Drink service was good though...the guy kept filling my glasses up faster than I could gulp them down.   All in all, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to visit again.

Bpw9MI5PGTFXmQFa0pS8og.text: It's... okay.  It's a standard buffet.  Nothing is great, nothing is bad.  For dinner, there's a nice salad bar, a turkey and beef carving station, a pasta station, Asian, Italian, and Mexican sections, some indifferent-looking random California rolls and variants, and a dessert area.  Service is okay, sometimes prompt, sometimes leaving glasses unfilled and plates lingering (despite the place being largely empty).  It's an average buffet, fine if you're staying at Mandalay Bay but nothing to go out of your way to try.

1t0MYrC5J1xe__NNviHGGA.text: Save your money. This was awful. They had quite the variety and none of it was worth eating. From the stale pastries that tasted like something I would find at a gas station to the cold eggs and tasteless salmon. I spent $20PP on breakfast and left feeling awful. I tried the stuffed crepes and they were a rock. Even my kids turned up their nose at the buffet. I expected much better for he resort and the price. I wish I could give it 0 stars. You are better off going hungry!!

dkerlraNBEldUImrUFXyXw.text: Meh. Not too bad, but nothing to write home about, many other buffets are better than this. Still, reasonably priced and a good option for a brunch.

tW31lb8zRh747UI7F8qUuQ.text: We went for their christmas brunch at $29.99 a head, with champagne provided for free. There was a decent selection of food, including crab legs, smoked salmon, prime rib, Korean short ribs, cocktail shrimp, and other quality items. There was even a section serving Asian entrees such as chow mein, kailan, orange chicken, etc. I felt the crab legs, kailan, and a couple other items were too salty, but the rest were quite good. The dessert was very exquisite; there were several mousses and cakes.  Overall, it's a pretty good buffet, but doesn't offer too much over a buffet you can get for $15.

JRgMLe3kNcJX85nbDsZuYw.text: Brad, the Manager, is so personable and great! He really made my experience so enjoyable! We had a minor issue that he took care of very professionally!

uql80hNborqfuUoN1yYh4g.text: Looking for Lychee? Bayside buffet has it for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee

3XJv12tJWFUfP90AdVFpQw.text: The meal and service was outstanding. Margaret and especially the manager Jordan were exceptional. I'm so glad i came in with my friends and will certainly be back!

NU3veLTxEylsCQnQa5Yo8Q.text: This Buffet is LEGIT! Came on a Sunday around 230pm and the selection was insane!   The food tastes good and the staff is awesome!

tPCf-6OTKD2Pv2CgnzjUwQ.text: After reading several reviews on Yelp, we decided to try this place out. I'm not too sure what the people on here like in food taste but this place is absolutely disgusting. The food is bland...there's dust on all the light fixtures which mean they do not clean them regularly and the variety is marginal. Would have been better off at Denny's and I do even like their breakfast. I have given this place one star because I can't score it a zero!!  Buyer beware save your money and time!!

v7y6ETRBz2kvwNrbtIDsYw.text: Based on one visit. Service was terrible, and the food wasn't good at all. I do not recommend this place.

JiallJhQrHE4WYNZPgXGuQ.text: We went for brunch at 10am is walked right in. They were not too busy and the room and seating was comfortable.  Selection was ok and the food quality is what to expect at a buffet. Nothing unbelievably great but everything was good.  We added the unlimited champagne for $5 and it was good.

yCm4YApDXJaBclI4ofGT0g.text: We came here after a day at the pool and before a concert. Everyone we encountered were very friendly, welcoming, and professional. Our waiter Todd was phenomenal and constantly checked on us and the other tales assigned to him.  The food assortment was pretty good. The jumbo fried shrimp were very good as was the stone crabs/claws. The seating area was nice and had a good vibe. We would come back in a similar situation.

eiPHM6CJI91CpDbQthZPvw.text: A few months back, I stayed at the Santa Fe Station Casino on the outskirts of Vegas. Honestly, the buffet there was better and less expensive than Mandalay Bay. Seriously. For breakfast on a Monday morning, the Bayside Buffet was crowded, the food was cold and mostly inedible. Tons of country gravy everywhere, but not a biscuit to be found! And someone needs to tell the folks at MGM that cold Tater Tots don't make people want to come back to your buffet. This was a bad breakfast that cost a lot of money.

UU84rLRIYF8_4v9P4t0Y2g.text: Went for dinner because of crab legs but they were cold. But they have a cook to heat it but, unfortunately the crabs were taken out of the water to soon and all of them except a couple legs were hot. Looks like the waitresses were over worked, but still did a good job.  Other than the crab legs every thing else was good.

_p7B5Z82upO1kdktml6Fng.text: Monday morning breakfast.  $20/person.  Food was pretty mediocre.  Not terrible, but I would definitely not go back.

9y1bVbuZDZIAypqOZ45xww.text: The Bay Side Buffet is deserving of extra stars for excellent food and absolutely no lines at lunch.  Most of all, Bay Side Buffet is awesome for having the biggest damn waffle cone I've seen at a buffet and for having vanilla FROZEN CUSTARD to fill that cone with!  That frozen custard alone is worth going to this buffet, though there are other great foods here.  I liked their make-your-own pasta bar, which is probably the make-your-own omelet bar for the breakfast buffet.  Nothing beats piping hot pasta with Alfreado sauce, chicken, mushrooms, and shrimp!  I also liked their Mexican foods section, which featured plain tamales, beef barbacoa, and pork carnitas.  The foods aren't amazingly good, like you might find at taquerias, but having some Mexican food is great when you've been eating nothing but creme brulees and prime rib for a few meals.  I still managed some prime rib here, which has good flavor and tends to be about medium rare, which is exactly how I like it.  The dessert bar, which has the great frozen custard, also has a good variety of sugar-free desserts.  Overall, a very pleasant buffet to dine at.  The buffet is situated above the awesome Mandalay Bay swimming area, so if you get a table by the windows you can gaze down at the pools and at the palm trees swaying in the breeze.  It actually makes you feel like you're in a tropical resort!  I'm a little surprised at how few people were there, but I'm glad it was pretty empty, only because that meant no lines to get in and no fighting over crab legs and cocktail shrimp.

I2mQONLQJE6OPxLxMEc-Mw.text: Mandalay Bay Hotel has been one of my long time favourite casinos to stay at in Las Vegas.  The rooms are nice, the casino is clean and relatively smoke-free, and the restaurants are all good; or, at least that is what I used to think.  The Bayside Buffet does NOT stand up to the reputation of the Mandalay Bay experience.  For a group of twenty-one people, they required an eighteen percent gratuity to seat the party together.  However, we were not seated together.  They were going to seat us in one of the main rooms spread out over six tables.  Mind you, we arrived early enough that they only had maybe three other parties in the restaurant.  When we complained, they refused to even push some of the tables together; we pushed them together, to consolidate the group into four separate tables.  That was the best that we could manage.  The service was slow.  And, mind you, this was a buffet.  So, slow service was kind of puzzling.  All they had to do was provide us with drinks, at an almost empty buffet.   And the food, well I guess that's what we get for going so early.  It tasted like they served us yesterday's food.  A lot of it was hard and chewy, stale.  And avoid the weekend omlette cook, he could only manage two omlettes at a time, barely.  The Bayside Buffet service belongs at someplace like the Tropicana.

Ugy4AMyLnpOUYr2AteIkRQ.text: I felt ripped off after my visit here. The line was too long (40 min wait). The stuffs were not friendly (I don't blame them because they seemed overwhelmed with the crowd). And for what they had on the buffet menu, I did feel like it was not worth $35. The food taste level was ordinary at best.

icep2KoctDiZeJQw27hktg.text: Ehh...it was ok. Nothing special, and way overpriced.

cQx2OV7caTkAwXE7C2H7Tw.text: Soo we stopped here for Sunday brunch.  I hadn't heard anythinga bout the buffet at Mandalay Bay but we figured we'd give it a shot.  My friend just made it clear to me that we HAD to have crab legs before leaving the lovely city.  So we stopped in around 9:45am on a Sunday and pigged out!  We had mimosas, eggs and bacon, and plenty of crab legs!  I then continued to stuff myself with shrimp cocktail, a lilttle bit of prime rib, and other miscellaneous deliciousness!  It was $23.95 for Sunday brunch.  By the time I got to the dessert part of the meal I was stuffed.  I looked around anyway, but nothing really caught my eye.  Not sure if it was because I was overly full or if it just wasn't as appealing as the rest of the stuff!  It was good. =)  And at a pretty reasonable price too!

EGk28JpEmokU6fIlC7fuoQ.text: Went on Valentines day and was major disappointment. Extra long wait for food that was very tasteless. We were shocked. Desert was also a disappointment.

tSOg1L9sY34urh-trTk5PA.text: The Good: I came here for dinner and it was so good!  A lot of different foods, nice decor, and reasonable prices.  The Bad: They need a bigger salad bar.  I love salads and I was disappointed with the variety of toppings.  Try: the steamed crab legs.  I think our table had around a hundred.  Don't Try: the pizza.  I find it too doughy.

O9O6ORJAQrjVY9ECJJoI7g.text: This buffet is OK -- but nothing special at all.  We ate here because we had a resort credit to spend, but wouldn't have otherwise gone here.  Not much more to say.

GaLkFMWIxvT_rRdLvaGKXw.text: Why this buffet has been getting great raves baffles me, b/c from my own recent dining experience, there was nothing extraordinary about Bayside buffet's smorgasbord; True, crab legs/shrimp cocktail/lamb/sirloin and/or filet mignon are served, but so do other better buffet places the likes of Bellagio, Rio, Wynn, and Paris.  Paris buffet, in my opinion, still has the most flavorful spread.

Rl-aCqWYhQG9Mcuz6m_kfQ.text: Not impressed by this place, and I've been to several buffets in Vegas. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great. I can't say that I will come back. It was just convenient because we had watched the 4pm showing of The Lion King at Mandalay Bay.   The service was horrible and the food was just mediocre. The dessert selection was sad. The prime rib is a good choice if you enjoy it...  I wasn't as impressed with the cleanliness as a previous poster stated. But maybe it was because we were there for dinner around 8pm after they had a busy day? Who knows.  I wish I had better things to say. Won't be going back!

KYlW15T1lD5rFRHQt1hdZQ.text: So this is the kinda place that every casino needs to have..... a food-oriented outlet for the glutton to go with the greed.  So here's another amusing story of one of our trips here.  I go with my friend and his little brother... a couple years younger than him, but in his mid-20s, is about 5'6" and weighs about 135, soaking wet.  Older brother :  hey.. I bet you can't eat 4 slices of prime rib  Younger brother : deal... yer gonna lose  OB:  fine... have at it..  So we all go get our food, and:  OB:  hmm that's a pretty thin slice(it was about half an inch thick) YB:  dude.. .whatever..  So he packs away the first slice....    round #2 comes up  Me: man... this is messed up...  he doesn't know this is a no-win situation for him does he.... he just doesn't get it. OB: yeah... but its funny as hell  younger brother returns with his 2nd slice...  OB: dude... wtf.. that's another small one(another half an inch thick slice)....  go tell the dude who you are, and get a real slice YB: fine... whatever... but this one counts OB: fine  so the slice #2 completes and he goes for #3  OB:  wow..  see... now that's what I'm talking about (slice comes back about an inch thick) YB: yeah...  no problem... I got it Me:  you sure?  how you feeling YB:  yeah dude... no problem Me: *chuckling* alright dude... whatever  so... after a while.. slice #3 goes down...  Me: dude... you know this is a no-win solution for you...  are you just dumb?  you are gonna eat short of 4 pieces, lose, and owe him $20, or yer gonna eat all 4, he'll give you $20, and you'll feel like shit for the rest of the night. YB: yeah.. whatever.. I got this one... OB:  oh yeah?  well don't come back with another one of those wimpy cuts... you better get a real cut YB: whatever... yer just getting scared  So he goes and gets his 4th cut.  by this time, the rest of us are pretty much eaten out, so we're just sitting and watching.  OB: yeah dude....  you eat that one and I'll gladly give you the $20. (he came back with antoher inch thick piece) YB: yeah.. this one is a a big one OB: heh... yup...  so he starts on through it... granted, a bit slower than the first 2, but he's kinda going through it...  the first quarter goes down.... the second quarter a little slower  Me:  dude... just stop.. any more and yer just hurting yourself. YB: nah... I think I still go it  2-3 bites more...  YB: ugh.... this isn't gonna happen OB: yeah?  you conceding? Me: dude.. I told ya...... YB: FUCK!!!  I thought I had it  heh... so he loses his bet.. .goes home... and has the shits all night...  THAT is comedy...  but ... guess what.. .  the next night... we went to Red Rocks Club and had the buffet... and guess what he had.....     The food here is pretty good... granted that it's buffet food, but it's still pretty good.  People hoard on the crab, which is kinda stupid.  I guess people really do view these things as binges of gluttony.  I kinda just view it as another meal with a great selection.  I'm done with the days of eating a ton, and then suffering through it for the rest of the night or, like in "Go" eating too much shrimp with iodine and suffering for the rest of the trip.  go.. enjoy it... don't overdue it and you'll have a better experience.

AIEuSqnTVDpNETuC0ajaQQ.text: Our favorite breakfast buffet in Vegas!  Not the cheapest of buffets but certainly worth the price.  I have been here mostly for breakfast and a few times for dinner but we agreed the breakfast seemed to have the most variety of food to offer.    The buffet has huge floor-to-ceiling windows that overlook the spectacular pool area of the Mandalay Bay with swaying palm trees.  The decor is Tommy Bahama meets Vegas.  Slightly tacky (it is Vegas afterall) but with an air of tropical elegance.     If you are a buffet snob like like us this is a good one to try for breakfast.

ov-UDNhu_scnsHK6KpAtGw.text: This isn't going to sound very eloquent, but I like alliteration, so here goes-Bayside Buffet Blows!  The food and service are mediocre.  Nothing about the place is memorable.  I would recommend walking a few properties over and going to Wicked Spoon in the Cosmopolitan or the Bellagio buffet.

0fss4bCDSg0W6weBfBsk1A.text: Second stop on my trip across the country! A friend of a friend works at Mandalay Bay in Shark Reef and we decided to go do Shark Reef and then go eat at the buffet.   We paid about $27 for each person, a little pricey, but totally worth it. We ate fish, snow crab legs, warm and cold; shrimp cocktail; prime rib; make your own pasta; Mexican food; tons of different options. The only real way to make up for having spent that much was the amount of crab we ate. I definitely think everyone ate $30 worth of crab.   We had an awesome time with dinner and you have to do at least one buffet while in Vegas!

QiRNO1Bx8BMSmrOCYCzixQ.text: Came here for breakfast. The food was cold to luke warm. It made an impact on how well the food tasted. The coffee is already sitting on the table, and because it was sitting around, it was cold too. Lots of food to choose from but nothing extravagant. Omelets, french toast, pancakes.    But overall not really impressed since everything was cold.  Perhaps lunch and dinner is better?

kAmpR-xCq7Q1351QwhtWTA.text: I do not like buffets at all, but you can't come to Vegas without trying a buffet, right? So on our way back from the Shark Reef, we stopped in to get some food. Paid about $30 at the kiosk, and were immediately seated.  Service was great. Food wasn't bad, and there were plenty of non seafood options to choose from as well. For someone who doesn't typically enjoy buffets, I definitely ate my money's worth.   My only gripe was that there were no bathrooms in the restaurant, and you had to walk across the hall of the Mandaly Bay resort to get to one.

khmB_0mLciAcs0c9uRnMLQ.text: We recently visited Bayside for a late breakfast, early lunch. The food was a mixture of both, so I can only assume they were in the process of changing over. The line wasnt bad and I liked the electronic payment kiosks.   I was unimpressed with the selection of food, but soldiered on nonetheless. I had pizza, flank steak, biscuits and gravy and chilaquiles. The pizza and flank steak were good, everything else was just, ehh.  This leads me to believe that the lunch and dinner selection may be better, but that is only an assumption. The service was okay, our waiter never came back to our table after bringing us our first round of drinks. As good as most Vegas buffets are, I expected more from the Mandalay Bay.

uD71imu1Z_tdKmBnVkRl0g.text: My family, relatives, gf, and I go here for dinner every Thanksgiving. That means wait in line for 60 - 90 minutes. As for the food, there are lots of great selections of meats and seafood. The only downfall is their horrible dessert selections.

Rov_XZzk2JUxyPUb3-WJUQ.text: I was satisfied with this buffet, entrance was around $20-25 each for my lady and I.  We enjoyed the food and we were stuffed, prime rib was good and so were the shrimp cocktails, they were fresh.  They have a little assortment of sushi.  We had a nice view of Mandalay bay and the backside of Vegas.  Didn't really enjoy the desserts and lines would get long but was worth the wait.  The look on some people's faces at the buffet like they havnt eaten in weeks.  Overall decent price for a decent buffet, gets crowded and service was fair.

nkJaV1DkMN_LHAa3rPdkew.text: Our family went to the buffet on a Sunday around 1:00, there wasn't any wait.  It seems a little over priced at $29 for what you get.  The upside - hot crab legs and prime rib, the prime rib seemed to be hit or miss on the cut, some were OK and some were very fatty. The kids loved the breakfast items and the dessert bar, waffle cones were a big hit.  The down side, the service.  Our waiter came back once to refill drinks then was MIA. At some point another server started taking our plates but we ended up having to stack them on another table.  The kids loved it.  I would have rated it a little higher for $20, but not that great for $29.

jV9Of3AOyZJZsqYDwAKlBw.text: This is my first trip to Vegas.  My friend and I did a lot of research for a good brunch place with bottomless mimosas.  We were advised of a lot of good suggestions but all were in the $45 range.  We were hoping for $30.  Our hotel helped us find this place.  It deserves more than a 3 star rating.  The price, food, service and mimosas was awesome!  You have to go!  We'll be back for sure!

fXTLDSLdgw2kh35c9_5OOw.text: It's not the biggest nor does it have the exotic selections of some of the other buffets in town but Bayside has my vote for the best breakfast buffet in Vegas.    The food is always good, service is attentive and we've never been disappointed.  The dessert bar is hidden on the far side of the room so be sure to seek it out if you like pastries with your breakfast.

ZrReso-OE7PqrMCVEGE7RQ.text: Meh.  Went for a weekday dinner, and this buffet is just not worth $30. Yes, they have crab legs, but they were lukewarm and a little watery. Meat tasted ok, but the crab on its own couldn't save this meal.  Salad bar was short and pretty uninspiring - couple additions like artichoke hearts and baby corn, but all very obviously canned and prefab. The weirdest part was that the obligatory salad bar sneezeguard was so low and close to the food that it was almost impossible to reach the ingredients on the line! Crazy! Guy I was standing next to tried to get a piece of corn then just walked away disgusted and muttering swear words. Hysterical.  Chilled shrimp were mushy, watery, and cocktail sauce had a strange, bitter aftertaste.   Hot line was a total mishmash of stuff, none of which had much flavor or even looked appetizing. Tried a couple ribs which had a sickly sweet sauce, mashed potatoes tasted real but pretty boring. Gravy was actually good. Paella looked so mushed and overcooked in the pan I didn't even try it. Panko crusted salmon was mushy, lacking in flavor, and the panko was wet and not crispy.  I'm saying mushy way too much for this buffet to get anything but 2 stars.  I will say that our server was really sweet and nice and efficient - a good improvement on service upon arrival, when we had to wait to be seated and then the woman waves her hand behind her and says "just walk over that way, Jose will find you." Um, ma'am, you just waived at a wall. Also, we weren't told about the wine and beer and because we were directed to the right when seated and approached the buffet from that direction and the booze cart is on the far left, we didn't know about it until we were leaving. The $30pp price tag (and mediocrity of the food) would've been much more palatable if we were, ahem, medicated.   So yeah. Won't be back. You can do better, Mandalay Bay, really.

Q-ADQRhVifzqvwY6G9DzoQ.text: Huge variety of food nice staff good deal

UTBm_wSKJ_MpByPUgzSvsQ.text: Completely underwhelming.  Seafood wasnt fresh, meats were overcooked, everything was underseasoned. Would rather spend extra $15 to go to wicked spoon or bacchanal

aiHGUOp_gMWXvhpfJlfEkg.text: With all the new upscale buffets in town, this one is not worth your time.  We sat for a weekend breakfast (which now they all call "brunch" so they can charge an extra ten bucks) and was disappointed.  I can make eggs at home for about 50 cents, and wasn't about to wait on line for 20 minutes for an omelet.  Had lately been craving fried chicken so was happy to get a few pieces only to find that it was so dry it must have been cooked last week.  Giving up on the breakfast and lunch selections, I figured I'd hit the desert section-  only to find more dryness in the cakes and lame selection.  Nothing looks homemade.  Never been to a buffet where in total I ate less than one plate of food.  There was nothing here to desire.  Cost for 2:  $54 plus tip.

wr4boz8bLTMiTZhQ7BZlLg.text: Champagne brunch was bad , bad sparkling wine, bad food, bad service .... Just plain bad !! Spend a few more dollars and get stuff you would eat.

2Xpr7kY9-oSx5IG8SP9RiQ.text: I was staying at THEhotel at the Mandalay Bay with my parents, and we had lunch at the Bayside Buffet.  This buffet was lacking in a lot of things. Very limited selection. The steak, while looking like it was cooked nicely rare, it was tough. I'm trying to think of what I did like.. Yeah, there wasn't a whole lot to like. I didn't get sick, so that's good.  Oh, funny story. My brother got raspberry iced tea. It had the normal amount of ice to begin with. When the waiter came by to refill his drink, he added a bunch of ice. My brother and I started laughing a little. He finished what he did have, and while waiting for another refill, we joked that the next refill would fill the glass entirely with ice. Well, that exact scenario happened. We lost our sh*t laughing.

lFdlclepEKHGEjV8llmPnA.text: Much like ANY BUFFET ,it's going to have positives and negatives,I like the self  pay kiosks and our service was excellent. I did not  care much for the prime rib, I thought it was tuff, but the crab legs and the sushi and shrimp and mussels made up for it. Tried several salads and they were also very good. I have been eating here for years and dinner has always been very good, I think the weekend lunch at 27.00 per person , is a bit pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4n8zx3jROGBkNCLyGDiPDA.text: The selection for the dinner buffet was pretty small and the food was just average. The servers were friendly and the all you can drink beer and wine was nice too. For a 30 dollar dinner buffet, the bayside buffet is just average.

E4wejTcPUhCE9rFGQt0TWw.text: This buffet was a quite a surprise. I came here due to default; however, I came out feeling like this meal was the best meal I had during my stay in Las Vegas. The crab legs are one of my favorites at the buffet. If you guys are craving seafood, specifically crab, CHECK THIS PLACE OUT.  Totally under the radar because this is not expected. But i'm letting you know. Don't just give this place the cold shoulder because it's the Mandalay Bay!

GgmF2WjW-wDK6iXxJ6B3zg.text: One of the better buffets I've been to in the recent years (haven't been to too many). Their steak was good and there were a lot of choices; I ate a lot more than I could handle. I wish I could remember more, but the whole weekend is a bit blurry right now drinking all those shots...good times.

IU_RFj9MzZdUzna6i27mcA.text: Decent standard buffet, not really any complaints! We went for breakfast since I had a MyVegas reward for it and got in very quickly. Our server brought our drinks out right away and was very friendly. The food was pretty standard but nothing was bad either. The layout was very strange though. For example, the entrees were not marked correctly and they had breakfast and lunch mixed together. Scrambled eggs were next to meat balls and I was so confused. The french toast, bacon, and fruit were great and I was left feeling full and satisfied so that's all that matters. Was it outstanding? No but it wasn't bad by any means.

qJ30Pj--2GlXr3DEIQSdlg.text: I am not a fan of buffets. Had brunch here while visiting my family.  Really average all around. Nothing memorable. Just lots of boring food with little taste.

6EF3mMFgFnC283HHmtqPuA.text: Terrible buffet. Food was overcooked and was so dry. Almost like it's been sitting under the lamps all day. At 6:45 pm there should be no reason for the food to not be fresh. The sushi tasted old,  the fish was grainy and the sushi rice was almost frozen. I tried the lima beans and they were undercooked and crunchy. The pork buns have been sitting out for a while because the outer layer of the bread was rock hard. The only thing I enjoyed was the fresh pineapple and iced tea. This was a complete waste of money and not worth the $35.68 they charged. The only reason they are even getting a single star is because our waiter was super friendly and attentive. Spend your money elsewhere.

q7D645UvSI0ENF0COGXHYg.text: I see a lot of people here bashing this buffet, but you get what you pay for. If you want a top tier, 5 star buffet you can have one at the Cosmopolitan or Bellagio, but that's not what you're paying for here. I thought their brunch buffet was reasonably priced for the selection. I believe it was $64 with a 15% tip added. They had crab legs which were decent. Not all of the food was amazing, but again, it's about what I expected. Come here with mid range expectations and you'll be fine.

NR5t8QC24fIPiR__49WeIA.text: Food was cold, selection slim compared to Belagio. Tons of fish for some reason. Meat was fatty and tough. Bread was cold and stale. For the price, which again is the same price as Belagio's, it's just not worth it.  I wish I wouldn't have wasted my last buffet meal this trip on this place.  The value is definitely not there.

hg0NZME58-vCAz6Ov1XKKQ.text: We eat here often when were in Vegas since it's consistently good and close to where we usually stay. Today's lunch may have been my favorite visit so far. The fruit/veggies were so fresh. They had orange chicken, BBQ short ribs and sliced sirloin steak that was amazing! I alwas love their carrot cake and my partner is obsessed with their cookies.  Keep in mind they are cheaper by $6 for lunch m-f. Sat and Sunday's it becomes $25. M-f lunch is currently $19.

FE3-BHePmjShAdwudEGyOw.text: This buffet for me was just eh.  I came here for Christmas dinner and they had a different menu than normal.  In general, most of the things I ate were pretty overcooked.  The prime rib was dry as well as the turkey and other roasted meats.  The crab legs were okay if you got them fresh, but many of them were smaller and didn't really have much meat in it.  I saw the section of the buffet where you can customize pasta and they'll make it for you! I was super excited to try it, but unfortunately the pasta was bland and flavorless.  Salt made it slightly better.    The pan fried scallops looked great, but to my dismay, they were very overcooked and not tender at all.    Maybe I just came on the wrong day and most of their food happened to be overcooked.  Although I would expect the Christmas dinner to be of better quality.   The line to get in was pretty long as well and it seemed to be long most days that I walked by the buffet.   A couple good notes were that the service was decent and they have pineapple juice!

EREJIuosUTTw7o7nEx-TNg.text: FLANK STEAK & TIRAMISU is a gogo place at Bayside buffet. I've never tried such a juicy steak in my life. But to be honest, we got a vip ticket for this buffet, so I'm not sure if I'd wait in line for hours just to eat here. It's good in selective quantities, but the buffet as the whole wasnt the best quality. It's worth a try though in Las Vegas since they do have wide selection of international foods and they do serve seafood too, which is hard to find.

b7uYL09tbgyKhUEYW-EFrw.text: The Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay was not bad. For starters, it was my first ever Vegas buffet (I am on vacay with family. I enjoyed the brunch as today was a Friday. The selections were good. They have a large seafood variety if you are one who enjoys seafood. I have more of the breakfast-style food as well as the desserts. It wasn't horrible but definitely was not my favorite meal that I have had here in Vegas. I wish I could say it met all my expectations but definitely did not. It was enough to fill me but for $25.99 a person I will definitely not be coming back anytime soon. My family and I could've gone somewhere else for cheaper and received better food. The service is great here and the staff is very helpful and attentive. They are the reason for the 3-stars instead of 2. Won't be coming here again but it was alright! Price is not worth it!

c58oMlTiVNcRzhJt-k8Kfw.text: Buffet is really good. But parking fee?????? That is it not worth..... No chance to come back! Then I would rather drive to an other free parking casino.....

p5_kDI8M6RJrIfRjIYnYEg.text: Not bad for a buffet. Server was consistent with refilling empty drinks. Food was good.

faZlQSeKyPk8N1uR9eGxlQ.text: For $30.27/per person for their dinner menu, I would have expected a better food selection in a hotel that is charging me over $250/night!  No French fries, no chicken nuggets, no boiled egg on the salad bar, no tarter sauce, no fried fish, no French dressing, no brown rice.... (You get my point.)  Not to mention that the cashier line is SUPER slow. It should not take that long to ring up two people for dinner! It felt like they were all new hires who have never used a computer before.

YUrhfPj1h8hJeg1fWpxtEQ.text: We ate here because there was no line and it was in our hotel but instantly regretted it. Price is cheap but food is really more like instant and tastes cheap.

5aqZbvVrJXJRWctTxN-onA.text: The buffet was ok at best. They have decent amount of option. Th interior looks a little outdated. Friendly staff. Sushi sucks. Dessert was ok. Good fruit option.

QrW-ICtb3EPxjD_j61CzjA.text: What I Loved:  Vast selection of fresh seafood choices  Braised and slow cooked meats like Oxtail and Osso Buco.  Abundant veggies and sides  VERY CLEAN  Ethereal Salmon  Comfortable seating  Quibble:  Overall layout of food and signage

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I would stay here for the vibe..ART
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet disk.....cheesecake (10), chocolate marshmello thingy, and MACA ROOOOON
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring Lamb....baaaaaaaa Osco Bussio, Oxtail. Flank steak...veggies

ViFE7-x6w1eQRQ0cCg-zDg.text: Interior: pretty and clean. Not as pretty as the buffets like wynn but still ok. If you sit next to the windows, you get a nice view of the beach.  Exterior: inside of Mandalay Bay. Pretty nice.   Service: not the best at all. There was two people working at the cashier and there was two lines that combined as one once you get to the front. So who goes first then? Well, common sense wise, customers should take turns like the family in the left line goes first, then the right side, then the left side. When it was my family's turn though, the family next to us rushed in front of us and the people at our line were annoyed at how the other family did that. When we finally got to the cashier, the woman's attitude was not the best. Won't complain much since it was dinner service and she must have been tired but still...? A little smile or something would have been ok but all we got was an annoyed tone. Water was refilled often so that as good. The friendliest people here were the chefs.   Food: for the price, I would say it's not worth it. Places like wicked spoon or the buffet at wynn charges a high price for lots of food. This place charges a slightly cheaper price but for a less amount of food. Not much variety and the sushi are terrible. The salmon sushi had no crab meat. Only hard rice and a cucumber. The tuna was somehow almost dark purple instead of red. Other food were average. Limited amount of desserts too. I'm a huge dessert fan and I have to say, the desserts were not the best either.   Overall, Mandalay Bay is a nice hotel and the chef at the buffet made the experience nice. But the overall food quality and first impression at the cashier line didn't leave the best mark for me.

LTvpAcRER0Vdpjth5d_cZA.text: I grabbed lunch at Bayside at Mandalay and I was very unimpressed with my meal. I perused all of the tables before deciding what to get, but I was underwhelmed with the options and started trying all different foods, none of which I liked. The salad bar did not have very many options and did not have jalapenos, pepperoncinis, bacon bits, or many of the other toppings I usually like. The pizza bar literally only had pepperoni and it didn't even look good... honestly, how do you mess up pepperoni pizza?!? I tried the mashed potatoes and gravy, but the gravy was too salty for me to eat. Gave the mac and cheese a try, but it was not flavorful. Attempted the sushi, but it was tasted old and not fresh. Even the desserts, albeit pretty, tasted boring. When I left, I basically felt like I had gone to an expensive, but poor taste in Golden Corral. Don't waste your money.

kxgRe3yU2lxXhGwkQFjuTA.text: Lamb tails, ox tails, salmon, pork buns were delusions. The prime rib was excellent staff was helpful and quick to respond to your needs. I would defiantly recommend the Buffett.

lffiLTlA2S3XEJXkLwiiRg.text: Awesome buffet. The most impressive spots at the buffet were the desserts and the pasta bar. At the pasta bar it was a one man show making huge portions of customized pasta for everyone I definitely recommend it. The desserts were very fancy. And the atmosphere was comforting. The only reason i gave it a 4 star was because of the steep price of 33$ per adult

soLS4diJqf-UnKO-nFjqEg.text: Such a disappointment!   We went to the Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay several years ago and enjoyed it.  Sure, it wasn't the best buffet ever, but it clearly ranked near the top.   But it seems the buffet has changed over the past few years and now I'd have to rank it near the bottom of the list.  On a positive note, the price is only half of what the better buffets charge.  So it just goes to show you that you get what you pay for.

Dib1Kdv_-Mb-5b30zleypw.text: The Mandalay Bay never disappoints, the food and the service is on point. I tend to stay away from breakfast as I I'm not a fan of it however their lunch and dinner are excellent

T46qlDQgqdS2lHXgF4yp-w.text: Ughhhhh totally not what I expected! Friends suggested I try this buffet while in Vegas! I'll never go back . For $30 you get crappy food, nasty coffee and watered down OJ! The only thing I did enjoy was the champagne.

CaPtT4uVNhG9VLYO-6YSZg.text: Paid almost 80 bucks for 2 adults & 2 kids for breakfast. Lots of food choices. Everything looked clean & fresh. Great omelette bar. Waitress was on it with keeping our drinks filled. Kinda pricey but we were pleasantly satisfied in the end.

pT2ORtWoYJW71dMv6guGWA.text: DO NOT GO HERE! The food was bland, overcooked, terrible. After paying the $32 we complained and the manager offered to comp us one dinner. None of us even at a full plate of food. From the minute she approached us, Carmelita, was rude and unfriendly. Told us we had been sitting and eating for an hour when we had only been there for 20 min before asking for a manager. Told us that "many people love the food." Well, the Yelp reviews tell otherwise. I tried to get the GM Brad to make it right the next day and even he did nothing. Told me I would need to come back the next day because he wanted to speak to the manager first. Not a customer-centric place AT ALL.  I will say that the server Lina was friendly!

SKuQNziUTpOsUnM4cCY7VA.text: We ate here last night & it was probably the worst food I've had at a buffet. The decorations inside the facility were first rate. Also, the table service was excellent. There was no wait for refill. The problem was the poor quality of some of the food. Instead of slicing off a nice piece of beef, the server just plopped a chunk of dry over cooked meat on my plate. The large piece in front of the guy was no better. For $35.00 each, I didn't expect the same quality as the Bellagio. I did expect a good meal but was disappointed.

AolQ5RlyPXrj19LsJNjTGg.text: Pretty standard buffet because you better be hungry to get your monies worth. Only small piece they could do better we're to post allergy notices for anything that might contain shell food.

O5BcWxepX6XVK2WFO2CZDQ.text: The breakfast and lunch buffets are decent but the dinner buffet is pure garbage. Their meats were  dry and tough and the rest of the items were junk. I have eaten at many buffets in Vegas and this is by far the worst. Save your money and eat elsewhere or for nearly the same price go to the Aria buffet. Whoever put this buffet out should be embarrassed.

xlIvXP2jdlmye2miX9X30Q.text: If you are visiting Vegas and need to do a "Vegas Buffet" to complete your experience, don't put this one high on your list.  For starters the spread and quality of food does not justify a $32.99 price tag (add another $8 for unlimited beer/wine which used to come free not too long ago) and you are looking at a $45+ meal tax/tip which is comparable to the buffet at Red Rock (perhaps $14.99) or even Silverton (same $15 ballpark).  What went well:  -You can take the already peeled shrimp up to the pasta station and have them make scampi for you. -Service was efficient.  What was off:  -The dessert section was a huge miss. Low quality desserts made to look nice and the worst quality soft serve ice cream on the planet...that icey "ice milk" you would find at a $5.99 bad Chinese lunch buffet. -The crab legs were extremely dried out. There was zero water in the pan keeping them moist. Huge disappointment as this is my go to item to save a meal when a buffet doesn't have too much appeal elsewhere. -The prime rib was well done. My biggest pet peeve in life is well done meat.  -The lasagna had cheap unmelted mozzarella cheese on top and was 97% thick noodle 3% ricotta, tasteless sauce. Pretty bad.  If I took a family of 4 here and spent $160, I'd have kicked my own A$$. Spend a little extra and go to Bachannal at Caesar's for a True quality feast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried coconut shrimp- really good
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turn your peel n eat shrimp into scampi straight up at the pasta station

Ler2NjiGpZQqpadPWQLo2w.text: Visiting from LA with family and friends.  + Probably one of the best bacon I've ever tasted in my whole life. LOL They were so crunchy and not too oily! + Affordable price for a buffet in a hotel. + Cookies were so good! + Pretty easy to get in. Not much line considering it was a weekend lunch.  - Limited kinds of dishes and not much variety. - To be honest, food was okay. "So-so" for a buffet.

-1XPJMdgRD2r27QZHm5ifA.text: Not worth the money. Each person is $26 plus you have to now pay $10 for parking. The food was just ok... nothing amazing. We were here for the brunch. They have a mix of breakfast and lunch. Many of the food items were missing. The sides were dry as card board and the eggs were so nasty made Dennys look gourmet. Server was nice. Atmosphere was nice and quiet. Much of the food I just passed on. At the meat carving station there was no employee to cut the meat for 10 mins. The seafood bowls were all empty - the photo on Yelp shows it overflowing with shrimp but Im staring at an empty bowl with 3 shrimps floating around in slimy water. No way worth what they are charging.  There is no excuse for a property like Mandalay Bay to have such bad food/buffet.

611zX6QctIf7ZZgLvSGV7Q.text: Hands down BEST breakfast/Brunch buffet in Vegas!!!! From the cinnamon French toast to the NY steak! Best of both worlds! Eat here you won't regret it!

-2Ml8rfG8EChtfjEolgDeA.text: This buffet was horrible! I was surprised that this even got 3 stars. There was a wide variety of food but it did not taste good. The only thing that was decent was the pizza, smoked salmon, and shrimp. The rest was either too salty or just downright disgusting. The salad was old and the tomatoes seemed rotten. The kung pao beef was the worst I've ever had and it should be renamed king pao beef jerky. The fruits were very fresh but it seemed that they did not wash their plates or vegetables correctly. The bottom of my plate had a few pieces of rice on it and my vegetables still had dirt in them. Never have I had such dirty food! I almost had hope when I heard there was dessert. However, I was even more disappointed because the ice cream machine didn't even work. After five minutes a nasty tiny piece of poo looking ice cream came out. The cookies were also very dry and crumbly. I'm only giving one star for effort. Definitely will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hard Kung pao beef
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty vegetable
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amount of ice cream that came out after 5 min

hw9Lbw2J9AfnCPozVL5o3g.text: I can't believe I'm going to say this, but I enjoyed the buffet we had at Excalibur yesterday more than I did today at Mandalay. All I can say is bland...the food was so bland! We went for the lunch buffet at 11am. Half of the food was breakfast items and the other half was lunch. It think this is great for those who want breakfast foods, but doing it this way does cut down on variety. From the penne pasta, to the potatoes, sausage, and everything else it was all bland. I was glad we used MyVegas for two free buffets because it would not have been worth the cost.

eiOuS37hC8ypwcoQ9y4GWA.text: This was my go to buffet while in Las Vegas, but not anymore.  After the past few years visiting here, I found the food to be rather ordinary to boring and bland.  Years ago this was the best buffet on the strip.  Now, not so much.  The buffet itself is aging and desperately needs a makeover.    The food itself could compare to an average Home Town buffet or strip mall buffet.  Much of it tasted cheap, using cheap ingredients.  Some items were good, like the carved Turkey or the egg rolls, but everything left a lot to be desired.  Spend 20 more at the Aria, you will not be disappointed.

4dFRkRhVIzd-7WRyAIIioQ.text: My people ate breakfast here three days in a row in mid-May, with no complaints, so it must have been good. My experience was for the dinner buffet on a Thursday evening. Our server was attentive with drinks & clearing plates. But the buffet was the star!  I really have zero complaints about the food on the dinner buffet. If you know me, that's a bit unusual. Sometimes buffets *phone in* common dishes, but I didn't notice that here. Literally every single thing I tried was delicious. While I do love to be critical, my only *note* would be to include more vegetables &/or non-meat entrees. I only say this because I noticed my plate was nearly all meats. But, I'm a picky eater, so...   This was my only buffet experience during my most-recent Las Vegas trip, so I may be slightly biased. With that in mind, know that I'm not a buffet fan. Bayside Buffet was an excellent buffet dinner, and I actually *almost* regret missing the breakfast spread each morning, except that I enjoy sleeping.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dessert plate.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My initial pass on the buffet, mostly meats.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My salad from the buffet

m9BOuswWNdFoYdP5NyMpIA.text: The breakfast buffet is nothing to write home about. For the price you pay here, you might as well pay an extra $8 to go to Caesar's. They don't offer much except an omelet station and the usual sausage, eggs and pancakes.  For their carving section they have a chicken and a small ham. I had to wait for a worker to even notice that I wanted a slice of ham and he looked displeased to do so.  Save your money, don't go here.

SS0xRYa8M-8bmAQ_iAxS2A.text: I'm a big believer in you get what you pay for.   This couldn't be more True at this spot. Cheap buffet in Vegas... probably not the phrase you want to say. So, here are the high and low lights:  Mimosa bottomless $7 and not a bad sparking wine  Fruit.... not ripe or good. Watermelon was awful, skim selection overall.   Eggs over cooked.   Meat items were plentiful and decent.   Desserts average  No real WOW items like crab or lobster. Thus the price.   So, if budget is the deciding factor, hit it up.   Service was efficient and nice. Quick on mimosa refill. Tables were quickly cleaned but not real comfortable.

zEA5d9-ZsPOccrUe_MP-qQ.text: First off.... wayyyyyy overpriced. The food makes airplane food look like the four seasons. Literally the snow crab was still frozen, the mussels were rotten, and the prime rib was solid black. The desserts tasted like cold Betty Crocker mixed with sand. Meals are nearly fifty dollars and I strongly suggest going to the Bellagio buffet instead. It is cheaper, and better. And of course, a little cleaner. It was a mess of incompetence in the workers and crazy tourists. The sheer amount of food is the only reason I give this two stars. I only recommend it to those who are heavily intoxicated.

3Cs8gdUyAie3VrTIJnf4EA.text: I was told to stay away from the buffet. It's overpriced and underwhelming, they said. But I was drawn in by the convenient location (I happened to be nearby when I started feeling hungry) and the appeal of variety won me over. Bad idea.   The food was mediocre, at best. The shrimp was slimy...I don't think it's supposed to be like that. And the selection was only ok. I've seen more options at Chuck A Rama for half the price.   I didn't listen to the warnings. Don't be like me. Eat somewhere better.

XYZGFAmLYSSEUzb_FKiV7w.text: I was underwhelmed. With Mandalay Bay being far from the rest of the strip they really need to improve this buffet to compete with the likes of the Bacchanal at Caesar's, the Bellagio Buffet, and the Spice Market at Planet Hollywood.

CDOEGdsqWYVPrWAmx0-HOw.text: Fabulous place!! My mom and I had a free buffet with our myVEGAS points we came alittle after 10am and got. A mix of breakfast and lunch. I really enjoyed the offerings. My mom raves about the waffles and strawberry sauce they had, if my mom had two servings of waffles "which she never does" they must have been really good!  I really enjoyed the service , it wasn't super busy but she pay close eye to all her tables and anything we needed she got us right away. Refilling our drinks and giving great service!  I will come back to this buffet for lunch again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i_xnpKGI0A3-2I-HuEzBXQ.text: I'm not normally a big fan of buffets but we decided before hitting the road to go home after volleyball was done,  we'd have a family meal.   The food selection was great,  something for everyone.   The buffet is clean,  well maintained.   Loved that they had some sugar free desserts, and they tasted great!   Our server was very prompt at getting drinks and removing used plates.   I was pleased with the experience and felt the cost was reasonable (21.99 for lunch).

X9vTdNvq9oGWTw-OTI5psg.text: This Buffett is reasonably priced. It's has a large selection of breakfast items and a smaller selection of lunch. We went at 11:30. The quality isn't anything special but we had a large group and everyone was able to find something they liked.   The omelet station is the best part or the buffet. The portion was massive and it tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TggDy2s8qtZDvCIeFBgerw.text: Skip it- get breakfast at Starbucks instead. A buffet is always a tempting option in Vegas but trust me this one is a waste of money. The food tasted stale and flavorless.

MRxAKTiB-j3TxX6WPOXdzA.text: We expected a very good experience for dinner, we were very disappointed. The baked chicken was so tough you had to cut it with a steak knife and even  then was nearly impossible to eat. The stew dishes were poorly seasoned the fish was not fresh the steak was extremely tough.  We would say most of the food was a good idea but executed poorly. We should have known though as the line to get in was very small, even at 5:30 PM on Friday night. Mandalay really needs to fix this! It is supposed to he high end it is not.   Mandalay Bay = Terrible Buffet.

VV4J8fz0mclfDz2QgYCWxw.text: With so many choices of places to eat not just in Vegas but at the Mandalay Bay, there is no excuse for serving such terrible uninspired food and charging $37 a person for it!  Long gone are the days of decadent buffets for low prices.  Vegas no longer needs to bring in the masses with a promise of a great meal for a low price. That's fine, then charge a little more and make the buffet half decent.  We were staying at the hotel, the beautiful 4.5 star property for a business/pleasure event. The dinner at the buffet was a part of it and I would say the most disappointing part of the entire event.   The food was uninspired, unattractive, and unappealing. The saving grace would have to be the prime rib and the good service we received.  The pasta station was ok.  The salad bar was so sad. Seafood was terrible. The hot foods were overly salty.    Someone needs to give this place a serious makeover. From the drab look in the dinning area to the food. Seriously dissatisfied.

q1qNsPCl-U4g0L_81A_cQg.text: A Big Mac meal at $28 would've been better value.  And our server thought it was funny to tell us a racist joke. But at least she was nice about it...

j-xv0qYwnutAv1ed1KVsYQ.text: Would not recommend this place at all. Food is awful. I told the manager how disappointed I was and he could care less. Very few staff speak English so I couldn't communicate well. I didn't find anything on the buffet that was satisfactory. Crab was impossible to get out of the shell and tasteless. I think it was several days old. There are a lot of places to eat in Las Vegas but this isn't worth your time or money.

v4abCLF-zorUAQApBdHT1g.text: Mehhhhhhhh is all I have to say about this place.  I'm here on a Saturday brunch time and the place is kinda full but the food? I can say 95% of the food was bad. And the other 5% was DECENT. My goodness. I even went for foods that I normally don't eat in hopes that they would taste a little BETTER than the rest. Nope. Bad decision.  I tried to give them another chance and went for the dessert section. I am a MAJOR dessert person, and there is no way that you can mess up COOKIES. yup. They did. Never stepping foot into here again. Even if it was a comped meal.

QPMhP4QWppKzfXBAuk-AHg.text: OPEN BAR  This review will start and end with these two words.  I have never been to a wedding (with one) or any kind of function for that matter with such a glorious opportunity.   We arrived for dinner somewhat late according to their hours.. and so little did we know, we didn't have much time to waste.  We took our time to peruse the goods for food options. They had a wide selection from pizza, to seafood, to prime rib, to ham, to Chinese, to Mexican to Middle Eastern (Yes I am working from visual memory here) and a selection of salad options.... then we found it...  The bar, manned by my newest best friend (and it only took a few seconds) David.   At Mandalay Bay, you pay for dinner (we used one of the girlfriend's discount coupons from MLife's app, MyVegas and got bogo admission for dinner. So $33 dollars for two.. not that bad at all) but if you are not as wise to use something like the app, 60 dollars does feel like a lot for a buffet.  Anyways.. we came to discover.. you get what you pay for. My best friend David (and I can't stress enough how awesome this guy was) informed us it's an open bar for both beer and wine. Well the Canadian in my leaped for joy and I asked him for a beer or two.. and let him know he'd see me soon.   The food (probably aided by the liquid I was consuming) was some of the best stuff we had the whole trip. There were some low points. The Corn on the Cob was soggy and bland.. and the Alaskan Crab legs were impossible to get into (our fault for not looking for or seeking out a solution for this)  My best friend David was amazing to go around and ensure every table got their fill of the bar as he was closing down an hour before the actual buffet closed.   I did have 5 beers with dinner, and took a 6th for the road. Because when in Rome.. OPEN BAR

Woxgze_oAfMSsBCbWbd8LA.text: Last week, my co-workers and I were in Vegas for a conference and visited Mandalay Bay on Tuesday, May 17 to enjoy dinner and then go see the Michael Jackson One show.    Since many of the full serve restaurants at MB were at capacity, we went to Bayside Buffet.   I have to tell you, this was possibly the worst meal I've ever had in Vegas.  The smell inside the restaurant was putrid, a combination of dirty dishes and mildew.   It seemed to originate around the desserts, where it appears the dishwashing station was located, but permeated throughout the restaurant.  Right then, I wanted to leave and request a refund, but we were out of options since the show was starting in an hour.     The food selection and quality was on par with a low-end Hometown Buffet.  Most of the food looked like it was sitting out for a good while, and whenever I ventured to try something, it was bland or just tasted terrible.     The best thing there was the soft serve ice cream, which is sad to say.  But to be honest, I never got over the smell so even if the food was decent, I'm not sure I could've enjoyed it.   Normally, I would have shrugged it off but with a price point of over $120 (incl. tax and tip) for 3 of us, I feel like I was truly robbed of my money.  I would've preferred to blow it on Blackjack and gone hungry.   None of this is something I would have expected for a high end resort.  The staff was friendly but I can't imagine their heart was in it considering the quality.

DDjrMqg_CyqilNVCrl7wqg.text: Have to agree with the trend. Years ago the Bayside Buffet was fantastic. Now it disappoints. Tiny snow crab over cooked and salty, runny alfredo sauce, no more prime rib, over cooked asparagus, and so on. I too am sorry I didn't check Yelp first. Won't come back.

Ks7YOCxhnZ0OkrT7O10I3A.text: Had this complimentary from staying at the hotel. Food was alright, had a lot of different varieties. We had lunch here. For the price I don't think it's worth it so I'm glad technically it was free for us. Wouldn't go back though. We did leave full just eating pretty much eating what We liked the most. Staff is as friendly and everything seemed clean. Deserts weren't the best either. Even the ice cream was bland.

x6esu9aHTkiLRd8OZqmwrw.text: Self check-in kiosk is pretty cool, definitely helps speed up the line. There was no line at all anyways when I went, but I still insisted on using the kiosk.  There were a few standout items here in my mind. Prime rib was decent, and oxtail was good. Everything else was just okay. They did have king crab, but I'm not a huge fan of it.  Unlimited beer and wine included with your meal. Totally awesome aspect there.

PWwNMKmHAO8NGsztFv5vnw.text: Very good food to be a buffet. Me and the wife were very skeptical about coming here, but it was a very pleasant surprise! Very good bang for your buck on the strip. There were no lines or people which probably helps with the experience, but the food was very good and the waitress was a plus. I understand it's a wed at 2 in the afternoon soo.. I guess we can try to come back when it's jam packed to give it a diff review

syvbFu-mQFj45aX6zaT0Pg.text: One of the best buffets in town, it's a bit pricey but you will see why when you try. The food was great, everything is very well presented from starter to desserts. Has a vast selection of fresh seafood choices.

GfGERCEENEBeGZ1zhyyizA.text: Ok, so this place was not good. Customer service was good but the food was horrible. I tried some orange chicken and it tasted like cardboard. Their desert wasn't good either and they didn't have much variety. Don't waste your time or money.

MZEbXqa-R6Bn22JBRe_w2w.text: This was an excellent breakfast buffet, I don't know why there are so many picky reviews!  For $18 a person, this is WAY cheaper than going to another breakfast spot on the strip. They had everything from meat, seafood, bagels, a dessert bar, quiche, pancakes, french toast strips, eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns with corned beef, and unlimited beverages. You could even add on mimosas as well if you chose.  It's a beautiful dining area and Mandalay has such a nice summer resort theme.   If you are staying in Luxor or Excalibur I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this buffet!! It's great!

tIv3h6I1wbyiLALfD1RVuA.text: DISAPPOINTED! I had previously read a lot of reviews talking about how great breakfast was here, so when I found myself at MB around dinner time thought I would pop in and check out the place. The price was $35 for dinner, which is average for a Vegas buffet. HOWEVER, this has to be one of the smallest buffets in town. Despite being disappointed in the size, I was hopeful what food they did have would be amazing..... WRONG. The only thing I really enjoyed was the salad, and I made that myself. The only saving grace for this place, the staff is super friendly and the dessert bar is pretty tasty. Definitely won't be returning. My suggestion, if you are looking for a good buffet take your money elsewhere on the strip.

lyHCzpSrMwPwEEasWL13RQ.text: I don't understand why the bad reviews!  We ate at the buffet tonight and it was pretty impressive, especially for a Wednesday night. I tend to gravitate toward my favorites, so when I saw a beautiful prime rib and a huge pile of crab legs, I knew where I needed to go!  The prime rib was perfectly cooked and really well seasoned.  The crab legs tasted fresh.  Other than that, I only really ate dessert.  I took two cookies and two small pieces of cake.  The cakes were disappointing... Really dry.  The cookies were good though, and service was great.  I don't see what all the fuss is about over at the Wynn.  The prime rib was better here, the crab was the same, and the price is twice as much at the Wynn.  I would definitely come back, especially now that I know there are coupons out there!

0HKZuo082P2u_Z2hMC7KqQ.text: Mediocre buffet at best. I stay and play at Mandalay Bay quite frequently and the buffets usually come either complimentary or they come with the stay when I book a reservation. The last stay I completed with Mandalay Bay I received the two buffets and when we arrived there was nobody at the host station. Odd.. especially for a peak busy weekend night. I started at the pizza station where I found most of the pizza burnt with the lack of tomato sauce. Pepperoni pizza that had about 3 and a half pieces of pepperoni lol. The Italian station was just as bad and I think I was only impressed with the meatballs and kept it moving. The carving station usually is my favorite and even that was off. Meat looked so dry and just not even appealing to eat! The service was actually good and our waitress was very attentive with keeping the drinks filled. I believe that if they could only improve on the food quality that would help the foot traffic of this buffet. You have to ask yourself sometimes why are they offering the buffet for free with certain promotions on the room. It's a marketing strategy that obviously helps increase the number of people to visit and eat. But it's going to take more than just an offer to come eat comp'd for me.. I need the food to improve.

kub_jCdpeLLKKLHx4fJmdg.text: I thought the brunch buffet was great! We were afraid that being it was 20 minutes until it was over we would be left with scraps but nope! They were still putting out fresh eggs, bacon, etc.   The server offered mimosas which were tasty and the best part is that it was free since we stayed at New York New York. Well $60 was free we had to pick up the extra $4.64

VuhVwXRAM199Vl5BZwxF5g.text: Enjoyed the food here.  Seafood was not as luxurious as you would expect for $35 per person.  The steaks and chicken were great and the selection magnanimous. Also the buffet is layed out to handle large crowds, making for short lines.  Ulimited beer, wine, champagne is a huge plus.

vSjHb6H6SeKGfdax71_t0w.text: The food here is mediocre.  Not bad, but not super good. If you're a foodie, you will have to choose wisely. Not everything in the buffet is good, but you must pick and choose. There are some diamonds in there.  My husband and I came here on a Friday for lunch a few months ago. We had scored BOGO tickets for our meal. The meal was a GREAT deal! For the two of us (for a lunch buffet), we paid $23 total. I would definitely come back to this place in a heart beat. The value was phenomenal for the price. But of course for the next time I'd do the same thing, pick out the delicious things (and trust me, there are some- including yummy Lox!) out of the sea of mediocre food.

9sGtb1sC0QIkixSQn-7J0w.text: My friend and I decided on Mandalay Bay for the buffet, lines didn't appear long, and the price was decent for what you got at $33 per person. My friend praised the prime rib to the skies, and to my trained eye, it did look perfectly cooked. For myself, I found a decent selection of grilled and roasted veggies, some mediocre cream of mushroom soup, some decent desserts, and plenty of wine that I had just a bit of... decent wine, not the greatest, but a couple notches above two buck chuck.   The service was pretty good, refills came often, and plates cleared quickly. This buffet was just one of many I plan to try in the upcoming year, and it was by no means the worst, but there are likely more sumptuous buffets out there :)

U0In3Qp37tdV9tHQYjIn7Q.text: Decent! For the price I'd typically expect more but it was not bad  Good selection of food. The carved meat was kind of dry but the sushi was on pt.
