Ok dessert selection, but no waffle cones or cheesecake today (that was a downer...I come here freq, & usually this is here)  My team & I had a good time, so I can not complain.

3KjpBsiF4mcPHX-IJTrGPw.text: I was so impressed with the buffet at Mandalay Bay. The price is extremely reasonable. The selection of food and the variety of food is great. The ingredients are absolutely fresh, and the best is that the food is not too salty which differs from some of the other buffets in Vegas. I would highly recommend this buffet. We ate there twice. They also have a great selection of food for kids. They also have a incredible breakfast and if you go around 11 AM you could do a fantastic brunch.

qA55LElsAQpbSPE2bGD2yQ.text: I stopped by again for Sunday brunch this past weekend with my family.  Yes there are bigger and grander buffets, however this buffet is clean, spacious and their brunch menu is very decent fir the price!

Lr3tDH9fNK2YL1TAzoVInA.text: Not stellar, just meh. Quality has gone down in the past years. But then again, all of the buffets on the strip have gone down (economy?).  The buffet at Mandalay Bay is probably on the lower tier of buffets compared to the Wynn and Bellagio. They made a addition of having both snow and king crab legs, which is always a plus in my book. The snow crab was a pain to crack though, the shell was very soft. Then again, I'm not really adept at opening crab legs. The king crab legs lacked the sweetness and briney flavor of good king crab legs.  The rest of the dishes were all forgettable. They had a Mexican, Americanized Chinese, "Spanish", and some really poorly done American foods. Throwaway junk food basically. All the vegetables were cooked to death (mush and brown). They were sitting in the holding cambros for too long (trust, I work in food service and this always happens when they cook the vegetables too early and hold it in a hotbox for too long).  The filet and prime rib were decently cooked, not the best, but they weren't rubbery like some other places. The proteins lacked seasoning.  All and all, go to the Wynn or Bellagio buffet, which my opinion are way better than most of the buffets on the strip.   P.S. they really downsized their selection on deserts, the selection is meager compared to the full gelato bar and bakery of the Wynn buffet.

MJFE9Tc4ydHiVlXgg_UKQQ.text: This was pretty awful for $25. the food really did taste like it had been sitting there for hours. I stayed away from the seafood, my co-worker looked unpleased, but thankfully wasn't too miserable later on.

LXZpjCJLfNJiNCSmKxOkLw.text: For the price this was not worth it. We much preferred the buffet last night at Le Village located in the Paris. That buffet actually cost a few dollars less and was much better. On our first walk around here we were surprised at how few things looked appealing to us. After eating some of the food we were even more disappointed.

9wvU1JcuW817HdGm9bg33g.text: The Sunday Champagne Brunch was good. Unlimited champagne for an extra $5. I think I ate my weight in crab legs too. My friends and I also enjoyed the desserts. There's not as much selection as some of the other hotels, but it is less expensive. The self pay machines at the front are simple and fast. And I liked that there wasn't an awful line for brunch. It goes until 2:30. I haven't gone here any other times, but it was a good brunch.   Tip, ask for a table in the corner by some of the big windows if you want a nice view while you eat.

H73RZ_EeCTMSCcVvEh2MZw.text: While my wife and I only had breakfast and brunch here, we did go twice, so I feel this review is representative of the kind of food and service you should expect.  The hostess service that works the line after payment takes longer than expected to get you to your table considering it is a buffet.  I guess there are still server sections, so maybe this makes sense.  I was glad to see a hot carafe of coffee already on the table as we sat down.  The server will then take your drink order for nearly any other juice or hot beverage.  The first thing I'll mention about the food selection is that the prime rib was surprisingly good, I mean really good.  There was a nice salty, herb crust on the outside which was quite satisfying.  The omelet station was very busy, but the cook was quickly working 5-6 omelets as once, while dealing out Las Vegas and Mandalay Bay anecdotes.  Nice touch and better than staring blankly at him while he cooks.  The cheese blintz were quite good and very addictive.  I'd recommend throwing some strawberry sauce on top.  If you are a carb-ovore, you will be pleased with an entire bakery selection on the opposite side of the dining area.  Overall, a nice breakfast, but nothing that will be memorable outside of this review.  It's relatively inexpensive at $17 for breakfast and $24 for brunch (in terms of Las Vegas anyhow.)  It is also convenient, especially if you are coming from THEhotel or the Mandalay Bay hotel rooms on your way to the convention center.

14_CH1SyNSPgHvT0IQrGqg.text: Bayside Buffet is what America is all about - the bland, mediocre food, and lots of it.  This might be great if you have a tapeworm, but there isn't much on this buffet that is remotely edible.  Even worse, the confusing layout and slow moving lines will leave you annoyed and frustrated.  But the worst part about this restaurant is that there are no bathrooms inside.  You have to leave the restaurant and enter the casino to go into the bathroom.  I don't know why this is?  Perhaps they are afraid guests will go to the bathroom to purge in order to "get their money's worth."  Regardless, in a restaurant where you spend more of your time wandering aimlessly and waiting in line to find out whether that hot plate is filled with crab legs or chicken fingers, you'd hope they'd at least have a convenient bathroom available.  Save your time and money and eat somewhere that brings the food to you.

Th5LplNiRUhqqGu026U81A.text: Kinda pricey for two people at dinner and the selection is not overly abundant. They did have some good lamb chops, prime rib, and crab legs when I was here. Plus they had an unlimited wine and beer bar. I am not sure I will be back

yeQUnj3PFgf4itU27dAKsQ.text: I'm not usually a buffet fan, but even I liked this one.  Some friends and I went here for brunch, and we left full and happy.  It's at the Mandalay Bay, so you can go in with expectations that it will be high quality.  There is a large selection, and you can bet that there is something for everyone.  They have a great dessert selection (for those with a sweet tooth), a lot of fruit (for the health nuts), and just enough greasy food (for those with a hangover).  I don't eat very much in general, so I typically do not get my money's worth at a buffet.  I'm not positive this time either, but I still feel like it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aHrt-m_BjvGaPn3ElvzH_w.text: Ok, I'm just going to cut to the chase on this one...   The review is based on Sunday Brunch only.   PROS:   1. The wait isn't bad. The line isn't that long and moves well.  2. Not quite as expensive as the buffets in comparable Hotels (Paris, Planet Hollywood, Aria).  3. The food itself wasn't too bad.   CONS:   1. Organization - possibly the worst laid-out buffet I have ever seen. No obvious organization. Lots of confusion.  2. The choices seem a bit limited compared to the above mentioned comparable buffets.  3. The lines for the made to order omelet station moved VERY slow. And, your choice of omelet fillings were very limited.  4. Even for a buffet service was poor.   Bottom line: If you are staying here it's convenient. If not, no reason to make the hike to the extreme south strip.

c4Jz6lKZ8R_jRbglKH5kgw.text: I was expecting too much since it is Mandalay Bay. As elaborate & wonderful their hotel looked, their buffet sucked. It's not even worth your 20.00 for lunch. No wonder the buffet is way out of sight so you pay first & when u finally get to see the food, you would have no choice but to eat it. The grilled steak was salty & the server acted like he does not even want to serve it. The choices are not much. After going around the buffet table several times, i only had half a plate- there was nothing. Don't go to this buffet. It is a waste of time & money.

5peDr5a1pji0i2CbvYWpGA.text: Ate brunch here and I liked their selection of food.. not normally a fan of buffets but after eating at MGM buffet, it made this place look good.

l_wSD3-YUWM7BVwvUmmdZA.text: i was there with four other people friday night.The worst food experience ever.The food selection for what they charge was very limited but that was not the problem all five of us agreed that it was the worst buffet we all have been too , terrible selection and very bad tasting food and deserts.Do your self a favor and dont go to the buffets they have great other restaurants there.

vm1NRCBm1CyHT0V8Dp5vCA.text: Buffet Dining.  See also: Furr's, Sizzler, Golden Corral  At about $20 a head for lunch, this place is reasonably priced by Vegas standards.  There is an old adage that says you get what you pay for.  I was initially impressed by the staggering array of choices.  Nearly every cuisine invented by the various cultures around the world are represented here, all the way from the dry and arid climate of nearby Mexico to the venerable art of pastries from France.  I delighted to be able to mix my Indian curries with my pork tenderloin.  Yet somehow the very first bite teleported me back to the cafeteria at my college dorm.  Hangover and all.

CxummuBUlBVJo3Kegg6dCg.text: Ill be honest.  I wanted breakfast.  But we planned the brunch for noon, so noon it was, and apparently its not a breakfast all day kind of buffet.  That's just too bad I say though because my three mimosas would have tasted much better with a do-it myself omelet or a waffle bar.  They were good regardless, but the delicious bacon wrapped pork, or the fried shrimp just didn't do to my belly what i had wanted to happen.  I wanted magic.  I wanted taste explosions.  I wanted my stomach to thank me personally.  But all that happened was a too full belly, $20 i'll never get back, some wasted food on multiple plates, and some nasty gas.  Three stars for each of the mimosas.

uYMQ2ubxZDUiQuw2uZT5fw.text: Now the excess of fat on your American bones Will cushion the impact as you sink like a stone -Crowded House "Chocolate Cake"  Now I know Vegas is king when it comes to excess in this country but I gotta admit, I was a little put off by the amount of food I saw people stacking on their plates at the buffet. Seriously, 32 crab legs on one plate?  Are you eating all that because you're hungry or because you can?  Ok, stepping off my soapbox for a minute, the food at the Bay Side Buffet isn't bad.  The layout is a little weird though-think Kung Pao chicken next to French Toast, fried shrimp next to eggs benedict. And at $25 a person for champagne, all you can eat brunch on Sunday's it's a pretty good deal.  Maybe I'm just being a bit cranky because I wasn't wearing my stretchy pants and got full after two servings?

nYEucghsrz1W5koot5Yn_g.text: Ate here a few times for breakfast and dinner during my stay here.    Overall, not bad, but the Wynn still holds the key to my heart in the buffet world.  There was never a wait during the times I went, however, I did go later for each meal, 10am for breakfast and 8pm for dinner.  The food was all very fresh, mainly because of the volume of people that travel through the place.  The price was very reasonable, $16 for breakfast and $27 for dinner.  The service was good, always keeping the drinks filled.  The omelette station ALWAYS had a line there.  I never got one because of it.  That was a downer, but the prime rib they had sitting out because of the lunch changeover satisfied me enough.

QHJguhUuELlLcc1ZGzvblQ.text: Prior to this experience, ate at the Aria Hotel Buffet and the Bellagio buffet  on the same week and a slew of other cheap buffets in Las Vegas in the past and I can say this one is just OK. Nothing fancy, nothing out of the ordinary. Food is salty as hell. Ambience is ho-hum. Selection wasn't as impressive as other hotel buffets.  Bathroom is OUT of the main area....which means you have to walk out of the buffet area to the casino area to do your dirty work. Sheesh. Buffet w/ no toilet? What's up with that? When you come back you need to have your receipt stub with you, but in all honesty, no one checked, so technically you can just sneak in and start eating (in line, no doubt).  We paid around $35 for dinner. Go to the Bellagio buffet if you want better.

Ap3GrEkKIjgknNjDMt9Cow.text: After eating at the Buffet at Wynn the previous night, Bayside Buffet cannot compare at all.  My family and I came here for a quick lunch which cost us about $20/person, which is relatively cheap.  Dinner is only $28!  Limited menu items, and only about 50% of the food actually tastes good.  I had about 3 plates, and had the waitress take away the plates with most of the food remaining on it (I know, it was such a waste, I felt really bad).  It just wasn't that good...  I mean the food is still edible, just I'm spoiled when it comes to good food!  The only plate that I actually finished was the fourth plate, which was made-to-order pasta, which was mediocre.  I also didn't like that the desert bar is all the way across the other side of the buffet.  Me being a fatass, I was too lazy to walk over to the other side, so I can't comment on the desert.  I remember back when they first opened and their food was really good.  It seems to me the buffet and overall quality of the hotel has degraded extremely in their standards over the past few years.  It's a good place to go if you're on a budget and not expecting much.  Otherwise, stick to the Wynn!

-OX5eqQrRXw_kmoOqlMfxg.text: As per my usual leaving Las Vegas tradition, I indulge in a breakfast buffet before I go. I think I may have to start a new tradition.   I was really disappointed in the selection here. Only one kind of sausage? Greasy bacon. Canned fruits. So-so waffles and pancakes. Was the scramble eggs made from real eggs? Eggs Benedict that weren't as good an egg mc muffin. The only thing that I really ask for of any breakfast buffet is shredded hash browns. It's not much to ask for, but the last couple of times I've had breakfast buffets in Vegas, they were nonexistent. That trend continued here. Diced potatoes and Jack-in-the-Box style hash browns. Boo!   The good. They served salmon. The omelets were good and popular. I liked the strawberry syrup for the waffles. Decent pastries and desserts. That's about all that stood out to me.  No beverage bar. I hate having to keep asking for refills and waiting for it.   EMTs were working on some dude who collapsed.   A dull end to a productive trip. I should have gone to Denny's.

orM8GHIVlPaVyyK4a9oVjQ.text: Their cocktail sauce is the best I've ever had, been here before and they used to have rock crab but they didn't this time so I settled for their shrimp but their steamed crab and butter are to die for! Their sugar free deserts and cookies were great and their coffee is the best (even better than the Bellagio). Their Chinese food was gross, like most buffets and their sushi looked old but their smoked salmon and roasted tomatoes were the freshest and most tasty I have ever had! Their baked salmon was also fantastic. Their pasta made to order was nice and their pizza was only OK but the service was excellent. I ate so much I was about to burst and I have never had that problem at any buffet!

EwUtM2-kZIp3XYXk5CqFpQ.text: on every trip to vegas i HAVE to do at least one buffet!  this past holiday weekend i went to the bayside buffet at the mandalay! we stayed at the four seasons at the top of the mandalay so we decided to just go downstairs and grab a quick dinner. the line was long but that was expected-- no surprise there. however they do have these really cool walk up payment machines that allow you to purchase your buffet with card or cash. pretty cool-- except for the fact that you still had to wait in line with the other folks that were paying at the register-- kind of lame. like whats the point? oh wells, the buffet price for adults was around 30 something and i felt that it was worth it. the service was fast with drinks and the place was pretty clean for the amount of people running around in that place.   a hot carving station with prime rib and turkey, a "make your own" pasta bar, crab legs and shrimp galore were the MVPs of this buffet. i know i know, youre probably thinking "of course the asian girl would point out that there was tons of seafood"-- haha yeah dont act like you havent been to a buffet in las vegas and havent seen the groups of asians with a plate in each hand full of shellfish. usually im not a huge seafood person-- like five shrimp and im good, but this weekend i lived up to the stereotype. the only difference is that i wasnt pushy, sneezing over the food or cutting in the buffet line, na mean?

80s9TaGLKBh83pNusj1CSA.text: Went here for dinner and it was less than mediocre. Only decent food are the crab legs and prime rib.

A0f7qDZ16Cp8yiSx2UZIHg.text: No very impressive with regard to spread. Price is comparable but there was nothing to specifically draw your attention to this buffet. It's full of standards like eggs, meats, and pastries that are found at any other unimpressive buffet. Further, the dessert section was anorexic with regard to selection. There's just no wow factor. Lastly, after you sit down, the waiting staff is done with you. No coffee or water refills unless you hunt someone down. There are better buffets for the price and wait time.

K02vrNXC59qc0WKnI0u-mQ.text: Came here for breakfast one morning with our group of friends.  My man isn't a buffet fan, so we rarely go to buffets.  There was a long line, but we went to the front and used the touch screens to charge to our room and head right to the front of the line.  This breakfast buffet had a decent selection. A bit of a line for the omelets, and I didn't want to wait, but my friends said they were good.  I had Eggs Benedict from the buffet... not good because none of it was hot or even warm.  It's my favorite dish and I should know better than to get it at a buffet.  I liked the pastries and the coffee was good.  I really liked the BREAKFAST EGG ROLLS and ate a lot of the fresh fruit.  3.5 STARS.  Vegas Trip 10/20-23/11

mRJtD1-r8_5s96YWGrFaBw.text: Wow!  I had to come see for myself...trust the reviews...so sad.  The only items on the buffet I could eat were the prime rib and rolls.  Don't waste your time going for anything but the cookies...the bread pudding has no taste and the vanilla sauce tasted like wall paper paste smells...yikes!  The decaf coffee was ok and the macaroons are to die for...I snuck some out in my purse ;-) for breakfast. I don't want to make a habit out of paying 40 dollars for some really good cookies.

Ctr8t1mHaFxR-PyUzgexoA.text: Had brunch here and wasn't really expecting much. But dude was I surprised! First of all, the waiter gave us free champagne with free refills which my dad and I quickly capitalized on. Getting buzzed with dad yields some fine quality father-son time indeed!  Onwards to brunch. The selection was pretty standard fare. Some pretty neat create-your-own pasta selections. Was very impressed with the squid pasta. Had a very potent taste and at the same time was very delicate and fresh like seafood should be. My dad single-handedly destroyed Mandalay Bay's supply of crab legs as that is his absolute favorite food.  I think the highlight of the visit had to be the MOUNTAIN OF BACON. Yes. In the breakfast area, there was a heaping pile of bacon sitting under a heat lamp. I kid you not. Never before in my life had I ever seen such an unquantifiable amount of bacon ever. I think my heart melted from the sight... and then had its arteries subsequently clogged because SO MUCH BACON MMMMM.  Also had a couple bagels, very cold and creamy cream cheese with that, and handfuls of smoked salmon. Awesome treats. I'd give this buffet 5 stars if it weren't for the desserts. Bloody hell, those desserts were outrageously bad. Had to spit a good majority of them out. Most of them failed to rise above supermarket freezer standards. It feels like such a wasted opportunity.  People always seem to complain about the heavy price that comes with these buffets because they always seem to forget that these places are all-you-can-eat! If you feel you're being cheated, just grab another plate! It's a buffet after all so eat your fill! If you're not hungry, then why are you even at the all-you-can-eat buffet!? Go eat your girly salad elsewhere! =P  Anyways, it's definitely not the best buffet in Vegas. Check out Bellagio or Wynn for that kind of fine dining and whatnot. But if you're in the area and you're unwilling to drive to the center of the Strip in that hectic traffic, Bayside Buffet's definitely worth a look! (at least for brunch)

WfJSV5zrGGtSaJ0X2ioxbg.text: Mandalay Bay's buffet introduces nothing new or spectacular. The reason I chose this buffet was because I was staying at the Mandalay Bay and it was cheap and convenient, plus I got to use my express comps to get a free meal. This is just your run-of-the-mill buffet that is on par with the Le Village Buffet at Paris and the Carnival Buffet at the Rio, only not as big in selection and price. For $25 you can get a brunch buffet on the weekends, and brunch is my favorite time for a buffet. You get free champaign and there are endless crab legs, shrimp cocktail, and prime rib. So by eating those 3 and drinking champaign, you more than get your money's worth, and you don't have to leave the buffet feeling overfed and gross. The desserts aren't nearly as fancy as the ones at the Wynn and Bellagio buffets, but those are in another class all by themselves.  There wasn't a line to get into the buffet, but there was a pretty big line at the customized omelette station and the breakfast station as well so try to either get there before 10am or after 12pm to avoid crowds. The buffet also has a great view of the pool- to make you feel even more like a fatass compared to the beautiful bodied sunbathers. Definitely not one of the best, but it is better than average, so check it out if you happen to be in the area.

QMtIN4aBqZaPSCEBmDmlAw.text: Great buffet for the price. $30 includes wine and a nice selection of salads, Italian, Asian and American type foods. Quality is good with no complaints with any of the offering. I've had better and worst but this is a great value buffet.

q_v14NIxYWyJ2V4TnyidVA.text: Definetly not a typical buffet that you would go to in boring Ohio. This was the only buffet I went to in Vegas but I was duly impressed. A huge selection of food and all of it was rather good. Especially the prime rib, I recommend you check that out. I went around 11 so it was still breakfast and some lunch.   Kind of pricy though..I think I paid around $20? But the server was very friendly and funny.

SC42csMSXVt7X8d0PF6MHw.text: love love love!   best service out of all 4 buffets we tried on our trip! the entire hotel feels like your  at a beach side resort and loved the feel of it! i absolutely loved their selection and everything was quality, tasty, and the right temperature!!!!!!!!! amazing fruit!!!  (horrible ranch dressing though)  my favorite buffet yet! will be back!

ytNyyvj7fFtNEC96VIVl1Q.text: Food is great here! Quality of food is amazing fresh and you can taste the greatness I am a big MGM property follower and this is definitely one of there best buffets. The only downfall is that it's not a huge buffet. Very limited amounts of food but it's amazing! They have made some small changes to the buffet and they are amazing!!

vpFTvkxFwHHbkKy7blltnQ.text: This was my first Vegas buffet ever and I must say that I loved it!  The atmosphere was great and the view of "The Beach" pool was awesome.  The service was really good and our waitress kept up to speed with our party of seven.  I also loved the payment option, which was by touch screen computers.  We went around 2 p.m. so we didn't have a wait and it definitely wasn't crowded!  I loved all the different options on the buffet.  They ranged from American to Asian to Mexican and all the in-betweens.  Their salad buffet was pretty decent and fresh.  And I absolutely loved their made to order pasta bar.  Delicious!  Now, on to my favorite!  The dessert bar was great!  Ice cream, cakes, cookies, cheesecakes and so much more!  It was all very delicious!    This is a must must must in Vegas!  I will definitely return here when I come back to Vegas.  Hopefully I will staying at Mandalay Bay instead of Flamingo anyway :)

atqqilZncuuopbLYrTu-Ig.text: Okay first of all, I must state for the record that my review might not be that helpful because this is the ONLY buffet we went to while in Vegas so there's not much comparison. We came here because it was connected to our hotel and we didn't want to go outside...  came for lunch, it wasn't too crowded.. didn't have to wait for seats or anything and we came with a pretty big party too...  it was kinda cool that you can pay ahead of time at these machines (like those things you buy movie tickets from)   the food selection was AMAZZINGG!   mostly american food, steaks and stuff but there's also chinese food that tasted pretty authentic...   Idk if it's because it's lunch but there's not much seafood....   The dessert table was AMAZINGGGGG and there's froyo too with waffle cones :D  theres really big red juicy strawberries and there's a bunch of those sunflower seed/nuts/walnut/wholefood stuff too.   Sirloin was juicy and there's au jus and gravy to go with it.   very good meal. I mean there wasn't anything AMAZING but the food they did have all tasted good. I came VERYY hungry so i feel like i got my moneys worth :D  kinda wish we tried a few other buffets but didn't have time and it was difficult with a large party since not everyone is always hungry...

XboG8HOZx6NdtdlVjEmHuQ.text: I personally feel like with all the great restaurants in Vegas, buffets aren't that great.  I mean what do you expect? They're buffets... For the price it's great.  But for my last dinner in Vegas, I was just saddened by it.  I first headed over to the crab legs and prime rib since they're pretty much the most expensive things out there.  The crab legs were alright, but man, when they're lukewarm to cold, they just aren't as good.  Some of the meat stuck to the insides of the legs too.  The prime rib was chewy and again cold. Blah! At this point I keep trying to tell myself, "it's a buffet, it's a buffet..."  Got the pasta station next.  LOL, maybe this is insulting but it reminded me of the pasta station at some dining halls at UCSD. *flashback moment* okay, it's over. Yeah, it has some flavor, but haha the pasta was already par cooked so it kind of came out overcooked when they put it in the boiling water.  I tried to stay away from the asian section, but i mean got to give everything a try right? I don't know why I got fish. Fish = dry at buffets. I'm stupid, just don't get the fish. and YAY for coconut shrimp, can't screw that up!   I actually really did like the seafood cioppino.  I don't know what it's REALLY supposed to taste like, but I liked the flavor. Spicy and tomato-y and got lots of random seafood things in there.  Desserts...kind of sucked.  Cobbler had maybe 2/3 crumb topping and 1/3 canned fruit.  Cakes were meh. Frozen yogurt was like...ice-y vanilla paste? Cookies were soft, and not bad.  Honestly, I think they could do the desserts a little better.  Why am I being so picky for a buffet? I don't know, it's a buffet.  Come here if you want crab legs 'cause that's pretty much what I saw everyone else getting.  But I'm not going to buffets when I go to Vegas

d6x2aYrSFT6k-Z3LJI7N0A.text: I have to say this is by far the best buffet in Vegas!! Holy crab legs...yummmmmmy. Unlimited beer, wine, and champs for $8...heck yes!! The bartenders were super friendly and knew all about the wines they were pouring. The prime rib was off the hook! Will definitely come back!

3Imc7gLTKaaby2HSjxatkQ.text: This place is definitely not worth it to go. We had gone to the wicked spoon which is located in the cosmopolitan and that place was absolutely amazing. We stopped at this buffet for our convenience, since we had to fly to go back home. The food just wasn't great, some of the entries were cold and it just didn't seem appealing. It was the same price as wicked spoon and there is no doubt in my mind that I would never come back to this place.

41aB6Hhgnf2yX0Iob_HiHA.text: Have to say that most of the food this trip to Vegas was on the fence and between a 3 and 4 star rating.  This place, I will bump it up to 4, as it was the only place we ate at AGAIN that we visited 4 months ago.   This is a solid buffet and a great deal for the price.  I liked it much better than the spice market and I believe that one would have cost us more before the discount we got.  I only did one plate of crab - but that's because I had a lot of company with and I was trying to eat politely.  Last time, I got down on about 3 plates full.  The cold shrimp and the fried shrimp were excellent.  Love their salad station with all the toppings and the pizza right next to it.  I think I might have liked the deserts at spice market a TINGE better, but the cheesecake and clafoutis I sampled was super yummy.  I think if I was going to take advantage of an "pay once, eat all day" it would be here.

IFQ5oIMSED4wPJm7o-aYnA.text: Bayside Buffet @ Mandalay Bay was ok but very pricy, not very many options to choose from. Went for dinner and had Prime Rib and it was way too pink for my taste.

noXLbr-xS8nIQIWIUq2Pgg.text: Food and service were quite good. I would give it 5 stars but I think its a bit overpriced. But I don't eat at buffets often so maybe im wrong.

3fdYMzdhRnM-Unx2EyfxbA.text: I went last Friday for lunch and maybe I came on the wrong day, because I wasn't that impressed. It might've been that I was hoping to catch the tail end of brunch, because after a fun night out breakfast sounded like the best idea ever, but all that was there was a interesting mix of indian, asian, and some american dishes. However, I still managed to eat the food, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. The prime rib was pretty good, but it's pretty hard to go wrong with that.  If you can avoid this place, you should--there's a lot of other buffets in Vegas that are better.

l0R7u7FBRqktr7XvNHF1Mw.text: We tried this Buffet  today, unfortunately the food was cold, salmon dry, meat dry, sushi is cold and stale...the only good thing was the pasta station cause made fresh to order pasta!

pXS-IFMZx9CCqRKhJ-mQMQ.text: I enjoyed a comp breakfast turned lunch at the Bayside buffet.  Thanks to myVegas rewards I got a lunch buffet...FREE. That's the only way I will eat a Vegas buffet. And it's been that way since back in the 70s when a breakfast buffet was $1.99 and a lunch was $2.99. The casino pit bosses handed out free buffet coupons like the strip "card flippers" do today. I got a breakfast buffet at a 18.99 value since I got there at 10:30 am. Lunch started at 11:00. Being 30 minutes I got to taste the breakfast fare. It's about the same as the Excalibur and Luxor I had earlier in the week. Plenty of breakfast items plus pizza and most Mexican items are out for the whole day. The Mexican Chilequillas a Mexican enchilada casserole was exceptional. At 11:00 am most of the breakfast dishes were replaced with lunch items. Fried chicken Italian sausage and peppers swedish meat balls and stuffed shells were all pretty good. The carving station made the buffet worth it. The bbq beef ribs were excellent. The deserts at the Bayside were about the same as the Luxor and Excalibur. I cant imagine the dinner buffet gets any better so unless it's an Mlife or myVegas rewards comp get the $18.99 breakfast and show up at 10:30 and roll into lunch at 11:00 and save 5 bucks.

vCvM2VF4pHekgdlyF-588w.text: Eh - the food was cold - service was average - in no way worth the money - I had a two for one coupon and it wasn't even worth that.  Unimpressive.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold breakfast with hard English Muffin

Owu_wSGP_uG2bwkrqYmkLw.text: Though I understand that this is by definition a place you go to eat away your feelings, it struck me as an extra melancholy version of this sort of place. Neither the staff nor the customers appeared to have felt any joy in recent memory. The food itself was not great. I had an almost inedible slice of dried out brisket from the carving station. The sushi was just simple rolls, veggie and other cheap varieties. Typically at a buffet like this (which I promise I don't frequent regularly) I end up feeling a little disappointed that I get full before I get to try everything that looks delicious, or have seconds of the tastiest items. Here, I ran out of things I wanted to eat before I was full. Desserts were disappointing. There were lots of little cakes, dry and tasteless. There was a soft serve machine serving the kind of ice cream cone you can get for 69cents at a gas station. No way I'd choose this buffet again.

mjp98HDKh2lqsKVjoVy2bw.text: 2.5 stars  Las Vegas is chalk full of buffets so I can only imagine how difficult it must be to stand out  Bayside is good in terms of price point but execution of the food and variety matches as well  Nothing was truly offensive nor was anything special   Keep in mind, if you get lunch elsewhere in LV, you'll easily spend $20 just on one entree and drink, at least with Bayside you have a lot more options   Overall Thoughts  It'll get the job done without breaking the bank

5DNcGqJXv-FpJwcHoiGVpA.text: I mean, it's a buffet so I'm willing to let a lot go. But as buffets go, this one just wasn't very good.   Made the first pass and out of about 10 things maybe 2 were with going back for. Ended up getting full on very salty prime rib and char sui pork. Guess I expected a little more from Mandalay bay.   Set your phasers to disappointment.

zkYqGNvlVjc0qw4sbM77hA.text: This place gave me food poisoning. i will never go to this buffett again even if its free. the menu has to change and the food needs to be better. also more items on the menu and make sure everything is prepared and in safe keeping!

PXuZFUkd-ZYxq5baDpXAog.text: We stayed at Mandalay Bay for a fun getaway and ate here out of convenience on the day that we left. Well, that and the fact that we had a Free voucher to eat here compliments of MLife. We also had a B1G1 Free voucher from MyVegas and wanted to use it for our kids. (Well, because they're cheaper). However, under no disclosure, the kids price was not honored to use for the coupon.   Anyhow, if your kids are over the age of 4, they are $22 and change for the Friday champagne brunch. None of my kids drinks champagne nor do they eat more than $5 worth.   As for the food, I noticed some of the meats (ie. Flapmeat) was terribly dry and had burnt marks. Not char marks, burnt marks, there is a difference.  I'm only guessing but I would say this tasted like food from the night before.  There were also many other meats similar to that effect on our morning brunch.   Other selections included oatmeal, salad bar, breakfast food like waffles, bacon, poached eggs, omelet station, and even crab legs. .  Selection is very limited for Brunch here, I would probably come later in the morning hoping they would have more choices.   I would say for the GOOD, the cold food like Lox, Cheese, and Cold Cuts were excellent. The fresh blackberries/blueberries were fresh, though when it was out, they replaced it with Strawberries instead.  The kids got their milk in plastic disposable cups.  The champagne tasted quite good, though I just had 1/2 glass and had to drive after breakfast. The pastries like the croissant and some desserts (ie. bread pudding) were excellent as well.  I would say $30 for breakfast is a tad on the high side but unfortunately, we came on a Friday instead of a Thursday morning and that was the only choice available.   The service here we had was quite good and we did leave our server a deserving tip. (Unlike other reviewers experiences)  Since we stayed here, parking (the new fee)  was already included in our bill and thought we would make the most out of our stay and try here.

tE0U8Mla7DeGYtxXqR55bw.text: The worst part of vegas. The food was disgusting! Tasted like bottom like quality food.  The dumpling was rock hard. With a group of ten people, we all agreed, the food was disgusting. The service was pleasant enough when it existed... We had to get up to find waiter for more water.   This is obviously bottom line food in mass quantity. Never again. Plus it was expensive for entry. Not worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert was the only edible part

7yGAxDKzgTUKhV6hIdJkmQ.text: Meh. Golden coral with crab legs. Nothing special. We went early in the evening on a Wednesday so maybe they up the game during peak times. Not impressed though, my first Vegas buffet. Maybe my expectations were too high of what I envisioned of Vegas buffet being different from other buffet layouts.

8K_Ge3otAO2-Jzgy_jnnkA.text: I'm a little iffy about buffets to begin with, but my party agreed on it so I had to give it a try. Food was okay, not hot just lukewarm, but a little greasy and bland. Had eggs Benedict and roasted veggies with breakfast potatoes. Lost my appetite after seeing flies around the dessert section. And the service was mediocre. Waitress used another full glass of water to top off my water (found that kind of odd, usually it's done with a pitcher). That being said, probably wouldn't come back here again.   Also a side note: sad to see people's kids grabbing food with their bare hands - have some common decency and etiquette.

f7shmfQQtCZgCf_X-tjD2w.text: We just had breakfast here and I liked it very much. Compared to other buffets we went to during past couple of days, it was the best, food is not as salty as Aria's buffet. I recommend it for brunch.

jK0mc69WaCJMcOO0v4RFBQ.text: What more could you ask for from a buffet? The food is good, they have a huge selection and the service is great! It's also very fairly priced. We walked over to the cafe next to the buffet and for a omelette and OJ it would have been 20 dollars. Why not pay a few bucks more and get a big variety?  Everything was really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat crab legs!

Ro5bCmSL216PMrR3c0OLOg.text: Lunch buffet is not impressive. Carved meats were Turkey and sausage. Deserts were cookies and soft serve and mousse. Seafood consisted of peeled shrimp and salmon filet and mussels. Harrahs is better than this. Not a great variety. Will not return.

r48xkf7qqgFoFVqKx7fxxw.text: Bayside Buffet used to be a no brainer for me. I came for breakfast on Friday and made the mistake of eating "last nights" prime rib. One word, awful. The breakfast foods were great.  Tonight they were featuring "chain saw" new york strip. If you had titanium teeth it would have been ok. Ox tails were horrible as were the desserts.

gmjXsRDaPdDA37RTkndXvg.text: Brunch was very good with slow service and I would give 4 stars. Lunch was disappointing with only the crab legs and roasted turkey as tasty options. Food options for lunch tasted and looked like a $8.99 roadside buffet!

iCRROENZWvGU4lh7tQmeOQ.text: This place is pretty below average. The food was not good at all. The poached eggs were harder than hard boil eggs. The other food was just as sub par. The wait staff was less than attentive. It took 15 minutes from the time I ran out of drink to be refilled. My advice to anyone that reads this, save your money. McDonalds has better food than this place. $25.99 for adults....ridiculous for crappy food.

5SYd88hk5Fp4owbHFK6Wuw.text: If you want it, you got it. I enjoyed the Bayside Buffet for two breakfasts while staying at the Four Seasons, located atop the Mandalay Bay. The endless selection was overwhelming and fun for a first time stay in Las Vegas. Whether you want breakfast, lunch, or even dinner, the Bayside Buffet will have something for you at 8:00 in the morning. I tried a bunch and enjoyed everything. I wish I would've been able to try some more of the desserts though, they looked delicious.

EKz84ELU7Atj84KFgPxncA.text: Came here for breakfast since we had a gift card from staying at this hotel. Nice selection of food although I noticed a lot of the food was cold. The herb crusted salmon was cold which wasn't good at all. The bacon was super greasy. The hash brown was good, but cold. The fruits were yummy and sweet. Some of the meat was too dry. Food was a miss for me but service was great.

cCOv2jYirD3UkKyS6OUAlA.text: The food was mediocre at best. For the price I would say it is not a good value. I did fill up on food but it wasn't great. Did have a problem but it seemed our concern was ignored. Ordered chicken Alfredo from the pasta bar. Took first bite and definitely not Alfredo it was way too sweet. I expressed concern to our server. Her response was yes it is a little sweet just put pepper on it. Finally when we got to dessert we found out what sauce it was. We found the sauce called vanilla sauce on the dessert bar. Same sauce same flavor. Told the server she said so sorry I will let the cook know.

cNGZURJZfD1zkz9FbPmujw.text: My sister is a fan of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay. Me? not so much!  I only went there to join my sister for brunch.   Weekday brunch ($25.99): decent selections of food. I honestly don't really care for anything here.  The hostess was very nice. The waiter was OK  3 stars!!  Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay is almost yummylicious!!

oG4-HPaoUyAdSL6XET5Hxg.text: Hadn't been here (or Vegas for that matter) in probably 10 years.  We came cause it was close to where we were, cheapish for a buffet and we had a bunch of kids.    Food was pretty lousy.  It was all edible and it wasn't disgusting by any means, but it was very Hometown Buffet quality.  The snow crab legs did not have any taste.  The top sirloin was almost impossible to cut with the knife they give you.  The dessert section was generic pieces of cake and the vanilla ice cream was yellow.  There are no big ticket items here.  The sushi looked like the stuff you could get at a gas station and there wasn't much of it. Mostly generic California type rolls.  I only saw one type that had actual fish in it.   Overall selection was average, but nothing to write home about.  You're probably better off just going to a fast food place and save a few bucks.  If you're not too concerned about money, there are plenty of other buffets you should go to before this one.

waEDb6QemPfu1xrd7vaceg.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review about the Bayside Buffet!  Back in the late 90's when I use to go to the body building & fitness expos. in the Mandalay Bay hotel, hitting up the Bayside Buffet was automatic, as it was da spot for ono buffet grindages!  It's been many years since I last hit up this buffet spot..........I wanna say the last time I ate here was probably back in 2012, or 2013? Can't remember the exact year.  I was pretty happy to make a return visit to the Bayside Buffet..........upon looking over the buffet grub, not much has changed, as they still offer an array of buffet grub like - American, Asian, Mexican, & Italian fare. They also offer lots of different Seafood items too, if you're into that.   Of course if you have a sweet tooth like me, the desserts served here won't disappoint you, the only problem for me is that I can only eat so much desserts! Aiyah!  The Bayside Buffet area is pretty spacious & clean. Service here is outstanding, and the buffet price per person for dinner is pretty reasonable at $32.99.   The only bummer thing about coming here is that the restaurant doesn't  validate for parking, so depending on how long ya wanna strap on the feed bag..........after rolling yourself out of this buffet spot, keep in mind the parking meter is running, and you still gotta pay-o-la for the parking fees.  I'm hoping that one day the hotels in Las Vegas will loosen up the parking fees for guest that spend money here at the hotel, & restaurants.  Check 'em out gang! No can go wrong!

-d7VYodSUklOkhp4UggHoQ.text: Read a few reviews that made me not looking forward to this buffet using MY VEGAS points for a free dinner.  Whet the heck it's a free buffet [$32.99 otherwise]... Went there early, they open at 4:30.  Got a nice table, First round started with snow crab, hot and chilled, [the chilled is tastier] tried the buliabase with mussels and shrimp, skip this, mussels  shriveled.  Went back for more crab till I had my fill, got to the desserts, icecream cone was super crunchy, they had ice milk vanilla and chocolate, Decent selection of desserts but  hit my limit.  Baked salmon looked good but over cooked for my taste buds.  The meat selection looked good but I filled up on the snow crab and shrimp cocktail.

ODusXql7uXLmdD1SdQ4jGA.text: Who says you can't win big in Vegas...  I have made it a necessity to visit the Buffet at Mandalay bay, even if we're not staying at Mandalay Bay.  We like the large selection and different variety of food available, particularly the Ox-tails and lamb shanks. Everything is cooked very well, spices are a bit reserved but I guess they have to appeal to a lot of different taste buds. Price is good for what you get and the service from the staff is exceptional even though it is a buffet and I know most people rarely tip the staff since they figure they are serving themselves (I always tip extra at a buffet). Overall I have always been pleased with our dining here and until that diminishes I will keep coming back, Aloha

6XouEAsRDg5HMnvx9WzHHw.text: Our family is pretty happy with the buffet.  For the price, it's good! Kids loves it. Has meat, veggies, ice cream, and fruits. My parents and our kids ate a lot. We are happy! For $130 for 4 adults and 2 kids. Great services from our waiter! Thank you Mirschel

htz3jbPm0TYX9zmsksQ8gw.text: Man oh man  Should have been 0 starts.  Food is sooo bland.  Not a big selection  Old atmosphere with poor food.  Please don't go

yDNGM-a-QmzW36DfXX7ZwQ.text: Meh!  The prevailing theme here is quantity not quality.  During my two visits I found several empty, or near empty food bins.  They do have a wide variety of food options, but nothing struck me as really good, just average.   I did enjoy a Seinfeld-esque moment with the omelet lady who continually got upset with patrons for not standing in the right place, or being ready when their omelet was done, she was flat out awnry, which was fun to watch.  I came her twice but only because my food was comped, not sure I'd pay face value for this experience unless I had not eaten all day and I wanted mass quantities of very average food.

Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I know the buffet line is all about timing, mine was not ideal based on this picked over selection. Boooo!

vHUT24iSEO8UJCczPEw6ag.text: Ate lunch at the bayside today after a trip to the aquarium. Was cheap and no wait. Restaurant seemed clean and not too Smokey. Waiter was attentive and kept empty plates cleared and glasses full. Overall for $22 per person there was a decent variety. Salad bar, bagel bar, pizza, fried chicken, turkey and mashed potatoes, taco bar, Asian potstickers and noodles. They opened a pasta station as we were finishing where you could customize it made to order. All food was warm. Not overly flavorful but what would you expect for $22. My wife tried a piece of shrimp which was slimey. They had a nice dessert selection with cookies, cakes, and soft serve ice cream machine. We were so hungry it worked for us but we will work hard not to eat there again unless the other restaurants in Vegas are for some reason closed.

awpzJaiRPAiZuNs95tkJQA.text: For Dinner on a Saturday night last month, my husband thought it was be convenient for us to eat at Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay is located by StripSteak. We arrived around 6 pm, with only 1 party of people ahead of us in line.   We were seated at a booth and had our drink order taken and then free to get our food. For the price, Holiday Buffet Dinner Price $35.99 prior to tax, per adult ($77.92 after tax for 2 adults), also the same price as general dinner pricing. Unlimited alcohol (beer & wine) is $10.99 (prior to tax) if you want to add that to your meal, but only available during dinner service.  The overall rating for this Buffet is 3 stars, out of almost 1200 reviews. I can see why since the food here is just average. Just like any other buffet and Vegas buffets, there is numerous of selection here, with choices including American, seafood (shrimp, mussels, clams and salmon), Chinese, Japanese, Indian, Mexican and a touch of French and European food. But just didn't think a lot of the food that I had was most memorable and must have.   There is a make your own pasta station where you can tell the chef what type of pasta you would like and what sauce (choice of 2 sauces and 2 types of pasta) and also if you would like any added vegetables. That may appeal to those that are into those type of food options but the pasta was just average to me.   The dessert station (in the back of the restaurant, opposite of the other savory buffet choices mentioned above) was just average. Being that we came a few days before Christmas to dine here, there were some desserts decorated in holiday fashion. But again, there wasn't a whole lot that blew me away with their desserts. Some choices you can find here included mini pecan tarts, self serve ice cream with toppings (sprinkles, mini m&m's, chopped nuts, etc), brownies, popcorn, cake, cinnamon roll, rolled cake, bread pudding and cookies.   Our server was good for the most part at removing our dirty plates and bringing us hot water and refilling it when requested.   My husband and I were both full after eating at this buffet but we both felt that we have definitely had better.   Please note that there are no restrooms inside this buffet and so you will have just go out to the casino for the nearest restroom (not a far walk).

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holiday desserts

4sEVSnDlJy_vGefXdpU_gg.text: One of the cheaper buffets in Vegas at $21.99 per person for lunch. I played the MyVegas slot game and was able to get the buffet for free (with the purchase of one other person).   My favorite there was probably the corn and the orange chicken. Sushi itself was okay and nothing special.   The dessert was pretty good. I really liked the Tiramisu and the Cheesecake!

Sc6oA3JebYE4mqPB1inPZQ.text: Well, I guess after reading all the other posts I set my expectations a little too high.  This review is only based on what I actually ate.  So far, the bagels were stale and the carnitas was very dry and overcooked.  The very little fruit they had was acceptable.  The cream of wheat was pretty standard.   The salad spinach tasted like it was not washed and I do not believe the table water is filtered, or at least it doesn't taste like it is.  When I came back to the table with another plate of food, I found a little extra at my table I didn't order.  Very unfortunate.   I was looking for the positive in this place but came up empty handed.   Hopefully,  they can up their game at some point in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little extra treat on my table when I came back to it.

LIEYlPwICCnhoRBomJVKyA.text: Honestly I've never been to a buffet where I had to pay first and the ladies at the front desk were really rude. She literally said "pay first or go inside and see if you like what we have first?" I wish I chose a different spot for my friends and I to eat or actually checked what they had first. The food honestly sucked and so did the service. Not only were the front desk ppl were rude but the lady grabbing plates and getting our drinks were also rude. She would just walk away when we were trying to ask a question, even the table next to us were getting mad.   The food there was so limited and half ass made. The sushi was literally one platter and it was trash. The rice had a weird texture and was mushy. Sushi from Fred Meyers is better. The only thing I enjoyed were the crab legs. I would recommend finding another hotel to eat at or even a fast food place. NOT WORTH $37.

vIyQEZXgDSF_i7mb9_XVtg.text: My mom is a fan of all buffets and since we have never been to Bayside until recently. It was during dinner time that we ended up here. No line and we literally just paid the lady and got in without any problems.   The server wasn't at the table just yet so we decided to get our food first. Now the hot foods all had heating lamps underneath them. Which made some of the thongs and things to pick up the food super hot. Overall it was just outdated of a style and the heating lamps were extremely hot.   I don't believe the food was worth $32.99 per person. It almost seems like I was eating at Sizzler or something like that. The soup was overly salty and it was boiled and over cooked.   Most of the cooked meats were also all dried out and weren't that appetizing. I'd say skip this buffet for sure.

kXp2p54F1XIa2HNcsAp8xA.text: First the food is not that good. I can go on and on about that this complete post. Second today they raised their prices. See receipt. 11D-wvXuSI7TCI_Eh9MBlA.text: Checked this place out before heading to the shark reef, and absolutely regretted it. My whole family wished we went to McDonald's instead. The only thing that was slightly enjoyable was the vegetable lo mein and the fried chicken and some of the fruit. Other than that nothing was good at ALL. This buffet costs $40 per person and it's probably worth $10 if that. Please do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else.   We tried eating the pasta that they made fresh for us but even that was a fail. Will not come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tried to eat dessert, but our raspberry looked like it had mold on it.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sushi, chicken, and sirloin steak. Took one bite and threw it away.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fresh pasta that tasted terrible.

PI60vzTfxi0TlefEErkCLg.text: Wow, this buffet was bad! I did not leave full. My advice would be that if you're looking to eat big, skip this buffet and just treat yo' self to two entrees from a good restaurant because it'll cost you the same.   The lady at the register was not very friendly. Didn't even say anything to me after running my card, just looked out in the distance behind me even though no one else was in line back there. I stared and smiled at her for a minute before realizing she was done with me.   The server and bus people were much nicer, however I gotta be honest. It's awkward when they all discuss how to serve you in a language you don't understand and then turn to you and say in English "right this way". I mean I'm sure they're not saying anything bad, but it feels unprofessional to discuss the customer's service in front of them in a language they do not speak. Especially when they can all speak English clearly. It's just uncomfortable.   All this would be water under the bridge if the food was good, but holy crap was it NOT!  I came for Sunday brunch, and it was $25.99. With tax and tip it's over $30 for this meal. I'm expecting some nice things, at least nicer than Golden Corral right...? Not at all. I wish this was as good as Golden Corral LOL!  This food was impressively flavorless. They had Velveta shells and cheese, and it was less flavorful than when you make a box at home. Alfredo bow tie pasta just didn't taste. Breakfast sausage had a whisper of sausage flavor.  The fried chicken seemed completely without spice.   The star of the show here though, and the reason I decided to write this review, was the "orange chicken".  Picture orange chicken in your head...  Now tell me, are you picturing McDonalds chicken nuggets with a drizzle of orange sauce on top?  Cause that's was it was here! I laughed out loud looking at it once the surprise had passed.  I had to try it, and I can confidently report that it was no good.   I would never come to this buffet again. The Seasons Buffet at the Silverton is cheaper, and the high quality of the food there blows my mind.  I could never justify dining at the Bayside Buffet again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Chicken
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Chicken

gAPoS5i1WniY6Et_m-faBg.text: It's the perfect place to bring a picky kid because he can try a little of everything. He ate tons of fruit, corn on the cob, broccoli, a couple bites of steak and a dinner roll. It wasn't as great for the adults. The roast beef was kind of chewy. The crab legs were super tiny. My dad and I thought the sesame balls were the best thing we ate so that's kinda sad. I am a huge lover of desserts but found them all to be lackluster. There were little tarts almost like pecan pie but made with walnuts that was pretty good. I only ate one bite of the chocolate mousse cake. I had some sort of bite sized cheese cake in a shot glass but it tasted more like mousse. Luckily we had two for the price of one entry and my son was free. That was the only saving grace.

6zrsTZETUBoQoWMA_TFGYQ.text: We got to the buffe early morning, 8am or a little bit prior. All the breakfast items tasted old. Pancakes uneatable, bacon fried in old oil, scrambled eggs might have been from the day before. I do not know if it was that we were one of the few very early guests and food stands out there longer in the morning or if they really serve old food, but we remembered this place as a beautiful and exceptional place (from some 5+ years ago), and not the food was disappointing, the walls, chairs and floors dirty, wood planks missing from the shutters.  Waiter and hosts were exceptional thou. Really really kind and professional.

fgXf7cOx73OwVUmyPKcg_A.text: Amado is the best server we've ever had! Made our experience so much better. We will be back just to see him.

rgNlsUOQYWNLuoUyS3uc2w.text: This is the worst dining experience I have ever had in Vegas. The food was cold, bland, and just did not meet expectations for the price. It was like pulling teeth to get management to do anything about the poor quality food. Would give negative stars if I could.

x6_SVjRBO1jn1ck8LWZ_sA.text: When you think of Mandalay Bay, you think high end. Lots of great restaurants, shops, etc.. So when we were in a hurry and wanted a buffet near by, we chose here.   I always regret not looking at Yelp first, but there is no way that a nice upscale hotel like this would have a bad buffet, right? WRONG!  The place was about 2/3 full, yet we waited for at least 15 min to be seated. The food selection was minimal, and you could tell that it wasn't turning regularly as many of the dishes looked over cooked, and old. As expected, taste was the same. Cold once out from under the heat lamp, soggy, or hard.   With such a small amount of choices, you would think that it would be easy to keep the name tags in front of the proper food, but most items had the wrong tags and many had none at all.  The short of it is don't eat here. Go to one of the other restaurants at Mandalay, or if you want a buffet, find a different one down the strip. Very strong chance any of them will be better.

ipr-4KtMf8Io5eTMSgrLyQ.text: Basic buffet.  Food isn't bad.  But it's not awesome either.  Came here for brunch. There were a few surprise items (i.e. oxtail soup and chilequiles), but otherwise it's your basic buffet fare.  Food was good, but there was no wow factor.  Actually, that's a lie.  Their COOKIES-- mmmmmm... They're big and soft and oh so divine.  The white chocolate cherry is my favorite (whispers: I took some home).

uCgrQAUWMcXAfYeLYzrnYA.text: unfortunately all the bad reviews lived up to the hype...being that it was my first time here it certainly will be my last, let's just say sizzler has a better buffet than here, the only thing that probably saved my not so great experience was the chicken dish and that was it, everything else was just screaming  cafeteria! Please don't waste your money

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only thing worthy on this plate is the chicken covered with white sauce (forgot the name of it) everything else sucked hard!

z4ybqc3kI7amhGuCeMfMvA.text: Food was ok. I am not a fan of Buffets but when in Rome... The service was fine. The restaurant appeared clean. I would maybe go back for breakfast.  Not recommended for vegetarians as most dishes, even the beans had meat in it.

kop7QBY8-38ywjJJRTSxzg.text: This had more stars than the buffet at the Luxor where we were staying. The place was clean and staff was nice but the food is like any other buffet food...nothing spectacular. For that price they should have a lot more options! I was honestly more impressed by their dessert choices than food choices.

tCHIdLCHaj07LFRrYLlO1g.text: Terrible food. Service was ok, took a while to get our drinks and the pasta station cook was on his phone in plain sight.  Won't return.

iF37XVkkI7yGLiqimhBBng.text: This buffet was extremely disappointing. I went to it due to seeing a show there and figured we'll eat at the buffet for dinner.... there was not one item I can say was great or even good. Food was tasteless & carving station was a joke. Ice cream machine dispensed a watered type ice cream that pooled in bowl immediately after serving. I recommend you go to any other restaurant at Mandalay Bay should you go there for a show.

qJFEKxhKhRPRl7CdYI2ujA.text: Not a large selection.  Chef would not make me an omelette at 1130am as it was time for pasta even though he had zero pasta customers. Wont come here again

dK4DM-riamP08FHY0J9HLg.text: What a great buffet!  They have pretty much anything you could ever crave to help make the hangover go away. Once you get past the line (we had a 15 min wait) there is plenty of food and table space to seat 2-10 people.   Crab legs and seaweed salad was my choice for brunch.  I think for an extra $5 you could get all you can drink mimosas.  Catch your server as soon as you sit down, they don't come around all too often so if you want something special to drink let them know ASAP.   If you are on the hunt for a good buffet on the strip, check out Bayside at the Mandalay.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

osaz6sD9KHf8ZJ9oUdNfqw.text: I think I enjoyed this buffet more than Le Village in Paris. Matta fact, I did.   I walked in with little expectation. Reasonable price so I expected a reasonable buffet. I believe it came out to $23.95 per person.   This buffet didn't specialize or cater to one specific food (i.e. seafood buffet).  Unlike other standard mediocre buffets that try to have cuisines of the world to appeal to their diverse customer base, Bayside indeed has a little bit of everything.  But, done in a tasteful way (pun intended) unlike other buffets that try to offer too much leaving quality and taste fall flat.   Truly - a crowd pleaser for all the girls with different taste buds. *Want cereal, grits, cream of wheat at a buffet? Most people won't eat cereal, but it's a nice option to have. I love brunch and hotel breakfast foods, so that is a total plus for me. Their fruit is surprisingly fresh and chopped in glorious, huge chunks.  *Fresh Seafood for the seafood lovers.  *Plenty o' Meat for the meaties.  *Plus, Italian, Asian, Mediterranean. It really will cater to all.    Also, leave it to me to eat the food at buffets that most people will bypass to get to the good stuff, but I can report that the bread rolls here are Enji approved. The bulgar wheat cous cous (peep the pix) that comes in a small bowl that is placed next to the hummus and baba ghanoush section, which  was completely ignored by the masses. Tsk tsk tsk. I could've eaten a whole plate of that and gone home happy.   Desserts - solid.  Was a little bummed out that they didn't serve soft-serve or ice cream though.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h6upUlDCF_ACX1Lo5TcvFg.text: My family started our day with high hopes for our first family vacation but was quickly thrown off when the cashier at the buffet after seeing our military ID (for the military discount) charged our card with no discount. After noticing it & asking for it to be credited & being told they would they then charged the card AGAIN (we didn't even swipe the card a second time so their system apparently has the capability of charging you without swiping so BEWARE that your card may be on file). Coming to vacation as a family is more expensive than ever so our trip was meticulously planned which included our funds and let's just say two unauthorized charges were not in the plan. Now at this point our breakfast is completely ruined as the Assistant Manager Michael Greene refused to apologize, empathize, or even take ownership for what they did wrong. Instead he continuously talked over and interrupted my mother as she spoke. He even REFUSED to give the general managers name! If this is how the Mandalay Bay treats the military families of America then they truly need to rethink their customer service model & morals. P.s. the 1 Star is for our nice & kind server Pam. She was the only pleasant experience of the morning.

yrGT_KhJOi7Bydg6sszckA.text: I think that this buffet is A-Ok but it gets 4 stars because it has good seafood.

zYoGsJ_pNKqRXxrCmixxbQ.text: I visited during the holiday season, so we paid $32.60 per person for their holiday special, which lasts all day. If you're coming here for interesting food options, then you're better off at other buffet places on the Strip, like Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan. Lastly, if you're dining during the day, ask for seating next to the windows; you can bask in the warm sunlight. That's the beauty of being out in the desert in the winter.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum. Breakfast.

nRfp5VxwhZvnTihgEz-0mw.text: Another typical breakfast buffet restaurant. Service was excellent, server was very attentive not a large buffet selections but it is a quality not the quantity that count for me. Fruits were sweet and fresh. Ordered omelette just tad overdone than I like but it was tasty.  Would I go back, yes for breakfast.

Qb8E0akkYZkklsu-6_xg6A.text: Terribly overpriced. Nothing special. Bubbly was good and worth the 8 bucks you pay for unlimited drinks upon entering. Overall, a disappointing buffet for $33 pp., but at least there were no consequences (phew).

7OpVKKyv5aIOMNytxKnQWQ.text: The crab legs and prime rib were delicious!  This buffet has a decent Mexican and Chinese food section.  I was really bummed that the dessert station was out of caramel sauce for bread pudding.  . We got there late at 8:30pm, so I guess it's understandable.  However, for the price, they should be stocked on everything.

-Aws-DUCSiIO5rtKiaPXiQ.text: Mediocre. Not worth $33 dollars. Some of the dishes are ok while others are completely horrible. Nothing really stands out so I'll have to give it one star because of the price compared to quality.

f5uzZ56yjADJpUYLE3O01Q.text: Pretty good buffet for breakfast alot of selections! Not very crowded for being a week day so im guessing the weekend is more crowded! The waitresses and staff are nice so thats a good thing!

vBhoiYE5tWB4FpHCd1tTUQ.text: Sad, sad, sad experience from an otherwise great hotel. We had a 2-for-1 deal or it would've been $22 a head. The decor is dated compared to the rest of the hotel and virtually empty when we arrived half past noon. The server was nice and came around constantly to check on her tables for drinks, condiments, clearing plates, etc.  The food was abysmal. The sushi section consisted of two trays of poorly made cheap rolls that looked like it came from the grocery store. The salad bar was small and cold section was limited to a handful of items. There was a made to order pasta bar. The rest of the hot food items were sitting under the lights for too long, making it dry, overlooked, and visually unappetizing. Selection was mainly American with pizza, pork loin, and ribs and Asian with fried shrimp, spring rolls, and general tso's chicken. Oxtail was tough and had no flavor. The dessert section was larger but it was obvious that they had been offered for the last several days. Even the cream on the tarts were hard. The filling of the crumble was okay but the topping was no longer crispy.

b6HwhIzro9AxuUPPi3X32w.text: We were starving after arriving and checking in to the hotel. We walked around the casino stopping to look at the menus posted outside of the different restaurants and so many entrees were $20-$30 for just a salad or a sandwich so when we saw that the all you can eat brunch buffet was only $25.99 we were sold! My husband who loves his meat dishes was in meat heaven. He loved loved loved the korean flavored marinated steak. He also enjoyed the prime rib, oso bucco and oxtail. I'm more of a seafood fan and was not as impressed with the selection. My go to dish at any buffet are the crab legs and the crab legs here are by far the scrawniest crab legs I've ever had. They also had shrimp cocktail which tasted fine, mussels, and a small selection of sushi which was more rice than actual fish. I saved a little room for dessert and thoroughly enjoyed their oreo cheesecake and soft serve ice cream in a waffle cone. Overall not a bad deal for the price, I don't know if I'd go out of my way to come back, but if I was already staying in the Mandalay or Delano, I'd be willing to eat here again.

vvaWtyz_iZb84zp84dm9Kg.text: Funny thing about Mandalay Bay - you get up for breakfast, and you go to the small restaurant that serves, and by the time you get eggs, a side, toast, OJ, and coffee, you're out $25/person.  Makes WAY more sense to hit the Bayside Buffet, where you get all the above, plus a gazillion more items, for the same price.    It's an interesting breakfast buffet.  All the typical things you'd find for breakfast (including omelets), but all the things you'd find in a dinner buffet too.  That aside, great choice, high quality items, and a reasonable price.    Note - the person seating you doesn't tell you this, but pastries are on the opposite side of the restaurant from the rest of the food choices.  Weird, and easy to miss.  Overall, recommended.

cWYMFIeDTjRD4fiILlSECg.text: Back in the day, I remember this buffet being really good, but it has gone way downhill since then.I should have known something was wrong when no one was in line for this buffet.  My wife and I were very disappointed. The meat was dry, things tasted stale, the desserts tasted like something out of the frozen food section at the grocery store. It was definitely not worth the money. With so many great food options in Vegas, including many great buffets, this one should be skipped. You can tell the management is skimping, and that's very disappointing for what was once a great place.

ZPgySShdVh5y7QYPc11o5A.text: The thought of the food we ate there still has me Drooling. One of the best buffets in vegas

tbBN4YpalVCIuQZsTeQxEA.text: The food was okay, pretty average. I don't feel that it was worth the money. There is free alcohol but it's only a few select wines and just bud light. There is a decent selection of food, and what was available was good so no complaints.

bzZd2sHYgp-Z0ajn1pDmfQ.text: Not to be some snob, but we ate here out of sheer convenience because Vegas was exceptionally busy during New Years and every restaurant was slammed for dinner.   It was not good and some things such as all the salads were beyond sketchy.  I can't think of anything that I enjoyed when thinking about it now.  There was a good variety of options, but the quality was pretty low.  The decor is kind of old grandma style and the only saving grace was the service.  Also, it was Holiday pricing, so we paid something like $40 each.  I would think $15-$20ish is fair pricing for this spot.  I say skip this place if you're ever here during a special holiday pricing period because it is absolutely not worth it.

x5CJ2ma1sK0su7qZAa873A.text: Taste: 3 Creativity/Authenticity: 3 Atmosphere: 3 Service: 5 Bang for your buck: 3  Im on a quest to find the best prime rib in all of las vegas who would have thought that my quest might have ended here? now before you question me and say there is NO F*%King way a buffet would have the best prime rib... let me tell you ive eaten at Lawrys, ellis island, buffets in caesars to the rio... and so far bayside is by far THE BEST!!! WINNER WINNER but as far as the other food goes ive had better, way better. But i will come back and pay 30 just for the prime rib! and the crab claws who could mess up on that

z_AFufktCdnPRgyEHmq_2Q.text: While we really enjoyed the Swedish meatballs and the red velvet cake, the dated atmosphere now leaves a lot to be desired. The furniture showed considerable wear and was uncomfortable. The server was extremely pleasant but we had to constantly ask for water refills as well as coffee refills although we always tip 20% even at buffets. .Did not like cookies or German chocolate cake or their soft serve ice cream, but loved the Red velvet cake

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Swedish meatballs were delicious
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobbler, bread pudding, pecan pie were just OK

DGEAbXTsw78MOZaqLPMvgQ.text: Very MEDIOCRE Buffet  ! It was probably the worst Casino Buffet I've ever had in my life !  Everything about it was so cheap and not flavorful at all .  And no variety ! Not going back ! Argh!

CIZadD0DFKJPfF94nJ9mvQ.text: So, it's been a few years since we've been back to this buffet, despite staying here at least once a year.  Yup, we've avoided this place like the plague, since the last time it was a complete waste of time and calories.  It's been 3 years...  Nothing has changed.  The food was exactly as it was 3 years ago.  In fact, they probably made it 3 years ago and kept it in warmers in the back.    I'm sad they still haven't changed the way they make their food here.  They make everything well ahead of time, place it in warmers, and bring it out as needed.  This means it's been sitting there long, long, long before it ever reaches your plate, and you can definitely taste the difference.  Dry, dry, dry.    They even put some of the food out in the warmers with the plastic wrap still on.  People had to peel the saran wrap back themselves and risk 2nd degree burns.  Not worth it just to get a few dry eggs.    Last time the service was just about the only redeeming thing about this place.  This time around, even that was terrible.  Our server brought out our drinks at the beginning, then, that was about it.  Not a single refill.  Not one.  Not to mention this place was a incredibly dirty.  Food was everywhere on the ground.  I know there are more kids at this hotel, mine included, but there wasn't anyone doing floor cleanup.  Just nasty.  Yeah, since they really don't give a hoot about the quality here, I'd say take your money elsewhere.  Anywhere else but here.    $18/ adult weekday breakfast $13/ kid weekday breakfast  Still not worth it.

BcamIHGiNnGZIjISrlFYLg.text: I loved this buffet!  I was more than pleased with the variety of foods they had on-hand, everything was fresh, tasty and clean.  I will not hesitate to go to this buffet again the next time I'm staying in-town!

6-5gEDiV1RA6CPnQWEtccQ.text: I came here for the breakfast during our stay. So this review only applies to the breakfast portion, not sure how the dinner is in comparison.   This buffet was disappointing. The food options weren't as extensive as I imagined. There were the typical options, like pancakes, waffles, eggs etc. But nothing extraordinary. The regular eggs were actually pretty unappetizing, the omelet station looked good but the line was so long that no one from my party tried it.   The fruit selection was really weak too. They didn't have strawberries or raspberries for the pancakes. The only fruit I found was in a small section and consisted of melon chunks and something else (I forget, but it didn't look good regardless).  There was chicken breast that I believe was supposed to be Mediterranean. But it was SO dry I couldn't finish it. And it wasn't like we arrived toward the end of the breakfast portion, it was 9:00 a.m. so there should have been plenty of fresh food.   Overall it was really disappointing, don't waste your stomach space on it. Go over to the buffet at Caesars instead.

Vxrpmxtomvn5YFS_4NFeKQ.text: Ah, yes, here we have a place that combines two of the things I hate most: crappy buffets and long lines. This place has them both. A line to get in and pay. Then a line to be seated. Then lines at anywhere that has food, except for the standalone areas that most people seem either not to notice or notice, but want no part of.  The decor and interior seems like a really large family diner-style place, like Perkins or Elmer's or Denny's, etc. It's basically acceptable, but not much more. Drinks will be the only things served to you, but not very quickly. It doesn't matter. If you have discriminating taste at all, it will take you a while to find something that's above substandard. The prime rib seemed to do pretty well. The chile shrimp-in-the-shell was good the first time, but they clearly did not shock them in cold water on subsequent batches and all of the chitosan was fused to the meat. Fun. (Not.) I looked around for the crab legs and never did wind up finding those.  That was about all that was interesting on the lunch menu, including the dessert table. The iced tea, however, was one of the best I've had anywhere.  For breakfast, it was marginally better, with some omelets and so on being available. Tea served was a cheap one. It took a lot of digging, but the ham-based stuff seemed to do pretty well and everything else was mostly a misfire. The smoked salmon, in particular, was one of the largest disasters I've ever seen and equal parts woeful and shameful, with a dash of pathetic.  I know Vegas is known for its great buffets, but this is not one of them. This is a place that is expensive, with food quality ranging from poor to mediocre. Not only that, it is slow and I've never seen it without a line at the entrance, even when the place is only moderately full. Take a pass on this one. You can do better.

4x9T1y9Q0peof35vYH4mnA.text: This isn't an amazing buffet but as far as buffets are concerned, it's a good one!  Breakfast is whatever but definitely better to come here for dinner!
