Like any buffets, there are some great parts and some really crappy parts. The salad bar, which seemed rarely touched was great. The vegetables were crisp and you could pretty much make any salad imaginable with all the ingredients.   The pizza I never touched, it looked good, but I didn't pay $29 including tax to nosh on pizza. The highlight of the buffet were probably the crab legs and the prime rib. Who doesn't love prime rib?   Definitely a lot of carnivore options!  The stuffed chicken was pretty good as well as sides such as mashed potatoes and gravy. The short ribs were succulent.   The Asian/Indian part of the buffet was pretty pathetic, and untouched. As was the spanish/mexican part of the buffet. Sorry looking beans, tikka masala, paella etc. I probably wouldn't go back.   They have some table by the window to look out side or more comfortable booths. The desserts weren't all that great looking, I had a fabulous chocolate cookie, but otherwise. If it weren't for the delicious prime rib and great service it would be 2 stars.

napDn0hDwHdW3UiqkyJyMw.text: *really dang sub par to average quality of food *the shrimp/prawns are decent, also liked the custom omellete *spendy but what person can eat more than 40 bucks worth of buffet food (except Joey Chestnut)

9As2IgSh50epzMpcPYqr_Q.text: Hey, when thinking about buffets on the strip, most are about the same. Bayside was literally right in the middle. The selection was, of course, huge. Quality of food was spotty, but they literally had a little of everything. Not a particularly pretty restaurant, but they have unlimited beer/wine/champagne. At $35/person, it's not a bad deal if you're hungry and wanna get your drink on :)

Y9se19jH3lowd6HyZTI-HQ.text: Yuck.  We were directed here by someone on the strip since the have the best seafood buffet around.  Not even close.  As you walk in, you pay at a kiosk instead of a person.  They request a tip at that point which I thought was strange, but whatever.  I walked up to the counter to give my ticket, and the rude hostess stated that I, "needed to take myself over there."  Ummm....okay?  The hostess who sat us was pleasant.    We sat and waited a few minutes and a lady walked by and told us to go eat with out taking our drink order.    Walking up to the line I was excited to see all the seafood, and there were two different selections of fish.  Thats it!  No shrimp.  No crab legs.    The rest of the food was mushy or lacking flavor.  Basically I paid $25 for boxed mashed potatoes.   From reviews it looks like breakfast is decent, otherwise I would stay away.  Plus its freezing in there.  My friend had to use the restroom (which they don't have one in the buffet) and they almost didn't let him back in because they were "closed."

o_iCXieGETuHF8ZZj1-tcA.text: Had dinner in here before the Michael Jackson One show my first night in Vegas.   I'm not big on buffets in Vegas because I'm a tiny person with a fairly tiny appetite and these buffets are expensive so I feel like I need to pack it in to get my money's worth.   My travel companion wanted to eat here though so we did and it was delicious.   I had all kinds of goodies. I remember having a salad, some sushi pieces, some Mexican food items and a few different small dessert bites.   I asked to be seated in a quieter area away from kids and they obliged seating us in the back glassed in room to the far part of the buffet. It was very pleasant.   Our server was also pretty good.   I had a good experience here I just wish I could've eaten more because I know my food intake wasn't anywhere close to the cost per person.

vRaFcFUQtsBdfl2bO6r3Vw.text: This buffet is not worth the money. Thankfully I did not pay for it as it was included in my package through expedia.   The food selection is ok at best, sloppy, flimsy looking food. Does not have a delicious aspect although the sushi was fine. The food is just there and not very great selection either. I ended up choosing the pasta prepared by the cook directly.  The dessert has different cake choices, cookies, ice cream, bread pudding, and brownies.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made to order pasta.

16OBMSpho2n0fVv4xkn23Q.text: We came here because we had a conference and was staying in the hotel plus my wife loves buffets.  It wasn't the greatest buffet in Vegas but it definitely had one of the best customer services of the buffets we have been to in Vegas.

5dpS6rP-wSoB1NcNvauhVA.text: Worst buffet I've ever been to. Over $71 for 2 and NOTHING was hot, NOTHING was flavorful. Ended up filling up on 3 glasses of tea and some bread pudding! The pieces of prime rib were the size of a 50 cent piece and they only lay out 2 at a time, Seriously, nothing was good! Wish I had opted for McDonalds (as nasty as they are they are at least cheaper)!

JmZCBhHODB3yX32cIUEwug.text: Vegas should be called the land of the buffets. You will probably pass 5 more on your way here from your room.   This particular buffet is good. The brunch (which is what we came for) was decent enough. There were lots of breakfast options mixed with a good smattering of lunch dishes. Traditional breakfast things like eggs, french toast, breads, fruit dishes, & oatmeal can be found in abundance. They also had a number of seafood options including crab, sushi, and one other white fish which I thought was particularly unpleasant. There are also plenty of options in terms of desserts. The little tiramisu cups are a favorite. I was happy these seemed to be ubiquitous in Vegas.   The atmosphere is fun. I was particularly happy that this restaurant wasn't outfitted with a superfluous amount of gaudy flourishes or decorations. It was simple and to the point while still fitting with the resort-style feel of Mandalay Bay.   The waitstaff was quite phenomenal. The lady who helped our table was funny, warm, and very amicable. I REALLY liked her. She was, without a doubt, the highlight of our experience here.   For the price, there's plenty of food. If you're a vegetarian though, you're pretty much stuck with eggs, bread, and oatmeal (which I heard was very good, actually). For most, it's a great option if you're staying in the area and don't want to go far.

ZfM0eEl-fQdzW7MtEziKeg.text: Absolutely disgusting. Every hot entree I tried was room temperature or colder. They cold desserts were even room temperature. When we complained to the manager he looked at us like we were idiots. Terrible customer service! The only good thing I ate was the salad I made myself. Waste of money and waste of time. Go to Golden Coral instead.

kIgNXzpq7A6D8lcEcW2s3g.text: Terrible, terrible buffet. You would think the Mandalay Bay would turn this place up a knotch considering the prices of the actual hotel, but nope. Not very much food to choose from. All the food that was there was so messy and unappealing. Everything I got tasted like it came from a box in my cabinet at home or the freezer. Usually when I come to buffets I am immediately rushing towards the dessert section. This area of the buffet was honestly so dissapointing. Nothing bought little mini dry cakes, some cookies, and an "ice cream bar". Step it up Mandalay please.

9tlrtK9RtWMDrGpiTqBmKg.text: I always try to stay at the Mandaley Bay hotel when I'm in town. And eating at their buffet makes even sweeter vacation. yum yum yum

mwdCs9qy-WYQbOMe9PEjqw.text: The food was okay here. Definitely not the best buffet in Vegas but good if you don't want to have to wait in line for a buffet. Not very crowded and easy to get into. Small variety of foods but pretty views of the pool and outdoor lounging area.

DR9en4DXPzolLq371jJ2ew.text: I took one star away for the so so food.  I realize this is a buffet, so I shouldn't expect much.  Our service by Todd was so friendly and punctual that it was one of the most memorable table service I've ever gotten!!  As far as the food, for the price it might be worth it to try wicked spoon or somewhere else for a few dollars more.

KvxqF07lJ1g8KzTaZ_9kIA.text: This buffet wasn't terrible, it just wasn't all that appetizing either. There's a very short line. Process was quick, you can  even score a free meal if you play enough MyVegas. Staff was polite and our dishes were cleared quickly. Their food just seemed mediocre. I usually love desserts, but I only picked a few and I wasn't too excited. I would come back using MyVegas, probably wouldn't pay for it though.

KcoXznT5aUdvmbM61DUyeQ.text: Came here for lunch. This buffet was alright. Nothing really stood out but it wasn't bad at all.  The best item here was definitely the Prime rib and the crab legs. The prime rib was a perfect medium rare. It was super soft and tender. The crab legs were sweet and juicy.   They surprisingly served breakfast items still (maybe it was brunch) such as bacon, scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, sausage, ham, and others. They also have sushi selection, carved turkey, fried chicken, pastas, mussels, shrimp, salad bar, fruit bar, and desserts.  Overall, the food was fresh and tasty. Good selection to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b4JakcXSHvu8Dfz0m9nVZw.text: What a time to be alive!?   Ah yea yea it's always great but hey this Mandalay Bay buffet is a great bang for your buck I must say! From the elegant entrance to the fact that they cook your steak the exact way you want it (had to add that I'm a well done guy). This is a great choice in comparison to the surrounding fine dining options.  My wife and I came here for dinner which costs 32.99. We were greeted by an older man named Lee who let us actually browse the buffet before purchasing the meal. He was very clutch for that I might add, being the fact we were kind of on the fence about paying 32.99 for "just another buffet". Our server was a really sweet older lady named Gloria and she was on her service in top fashion which is always greatly appreciated I think we all can agree on.  My favorite food choices were the tamales ( tamale lovers will dig ) the sweet n sour chicken, pizza, steak, fried rice and any of the chicken. There's also solid dessert selection worth cheating with a little bit.   Only few things that I have to say that I would like to see is maybe a burger / beef patty option along with hot bread / rolls because the breads are just in a plastic container at room temperature to get at your convenience.   All in all the Bayside Buffet is worth it! Especially since it kinda has the exact or remotely similar food here in relation to the surrounding fine dining options. From the customer service to the atmosphere to the food quality you get is absolutely worth the money. Come check it out.  I hope this helps!

5aHFiJZhXNHhHhu604j2qw.text: Best omelette we've had in a long time.   Didn't take a photo of the omelette but I did of my second plate from the pancake, French toast bar. Delicious!!

a3WmYayi6prisecX1tyH9w.text: $20/pp for lunch was way too much for this buffet. My family and I were very disappointed with the quality of the food we had here. The customer service by the waitstaff was sorely lacking, and the dining area was dirty and not well maintained. Save your money, there are much better options in town.

P2cKa1VToR5h4lA1YnSYQg.text: Came here with the family for dinner on Sunday night. This buffet definitely one of the worst buffets I have ever went to. The selections are small, the food is very tasteless and dry. There desert options are very small and everything was very unsatisfying. We paid $154.53 for a family of 5, and the food was awful. The service was good though. Beware before coming here and spending a lot of money for this restless dry food

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Driest chocolate cake ever and I think this is suppose to be carrot cake... Yuck! Only took one bite, and spit it out.

LwIt6P-5plMaXWmWQcXmcA.text: Stay away!! I read the reviews and thought to myself it can't be that horrible, but it was . We decided to try the breakfast buffet, I mean how bad can breakfast be. Well where do I start! Eggs were disgusting, no flavor at all, salt and pepper did not help, they had a nasty rotten flavor. Desserts were bland. Went with my kids and usually I have to monitor the amount of desserts they put on their plates. Didn't have this issue here. All they grabbed was a chocolate chip cookie and didn't even finish it. They wanted some ice cream but the soft serve machine was not working. The only thing I did enjoy were some cream filled crepes they had. Those were actually pretty good, which is the reason I think this place deserves one star. Please, save your money and go elsewhere.

oUxh_PTkpnQEhqpa_cXhaQ.text: Food was not good. Heard all the great things about the buffets in Vegas and this was the first place I went once landing (as it was in my hotel). Food was mediocre and there were little flies flying around the bread area and some of the meat. Just not impressive. Then I tried Bacchanal Buffet in Caesars and that was amazing, head over there for that review.  Visited September 2015

aU5ea2Nl3KPh5MkwI-W7YQ.text: If you want typical buffet food, semi warm this is your place. Had a good variety of pizza, salad bar, Italian, Chinese, Mexican and Spanish food with a dessert bar as well but it was all just ok. Definitely was not worth the $32.99 a person. We won't eat here again during our stay. On a positive note our server was very friendly and attentive to our drinks.

5YQwZ_Ojf69icIYVTOov4g.text: The service at the cashier was horrible!  The person was so slow and lucky it was later In the evening and a short line started to form.  We waited twenty minutes as this cashier was slow and kept taking other people walking in after us.  We finally left.  Can you imagine what would happen if there was a long line?  Bad service ever For 32.99 per adult and 21.99 per child.  I rather go to Le village at the Paris hotel with better food for 29.99!

aTkYAKTEWUmzs2xxIHNyzA.text: I personally think this is one of the best buffets in las vegas because it's not too crowded, no line or small line, reasonably priced, fresh food and good service! Lunch mon-fri is 19.99. A wide variety of foods, with my favorites being the prime rib that you can ask to put on the girl, omelette or pasta making service, lots of shrimp and seafood selections.

I26IUKIqBfS1jOkfTwMEmg.text: I am a big fan of the breakfast buffer.  Swipe the darn card, get charged $16 bucks, and you can eat forever until your hangover is gone and then you are drunk again.  Omelette station, great options.... I made myself a full mexican fiesta type of digs... tortillas, salsa, scrambled egg, chorizo.  The first time I ate there was great.... with some friends and just a table full of tired guys telling stupid stories and tired rambles.  The second time, on work, I was sitting there for HOURS with nothing to due but eat slowly and drink coffee while working like a nomad consultant at an internet cafe.  They were totally cool with it, and really friendly.  I know I will go back.

wXf_AtxV75wGpu5PUTv6ZA.text: The dessert station compared to the Le Village Buffet's in Paris is much better here. I had the best macaroons here compared to Paris' and they had some awesome cookies. I was flippin' out! Of course, they don't have the crepes and other fancy goodies, but the spread is really beautiful. The miniature cakes and pastries looked so delicious!  In addition, they're Italian meatballs are divine, and the fried chicken was good enough to eat a whole bucket full. Those were my favorites! This buffet isn't as large and full of variety like most, but I believe that they put out good quality, fresh food items. I was surprised to see blueberries and strawberries as vibrant.  Tip: on your way out, grab a couple cookies, pastries, whatever or a cone of ice cream because this buffet is pricier than the Paris buffet.  Good For: coconut macaroons, fried chicken

4849D1NCLe-MOS9g-dMCpA.text: I have been here several times over the past few months with colleagues and friends. It pretty much has the normal faire compared to most of the better buffets in Las Vegas.   They have an excellent assortment of seafood, meats, breads, and desserts. The always keep a bountiful amount of king crab and shrimp cocktail. The size of the crab varies time to time, sometimes they are big. meaty, and sweet while other times they are small with little meat.  The service here is excellent, especially for a buffet since you mainly serve yourself. The waiters always make sure your glass is full and/or you need a new plate, etc. If you want more selection with about the same quality I recommend going to the buffet at Plant Hollywood (Old Aladdin). Enjoy.

Tq-nU9rfIrUBIeZSv15rfA.text: A stinker. You know, I'm having a hard time trusting people's review, especially when a user's average review rating is four to five stars for several hundred reviews. Does that mean the majority of buisnesses are winners? I guess I'm gullible.  Bayside Buffet is a prime example of why I shouldn't be so eager to try a place recommended by Yelpers. And yet, Im writing one, too! Double standards am fail.  Anyway, bitching aside, my lunch here was super meh. 20 dollars paid at the kiosk, then briskly seated facing away the window (wut?), and then hoarded to the buffet line on both sides of the room. Immediately, I had a nagging feeling the experience would be super meh. How? Oh, let's see...the buffet selection is hella small! My college cafeteria offered more food than this -- and at better quality!   So what did I get?  Meats, a few starches, but mainly stuff jammed with protein.  Lambchops: Ugh. Below super meh. The lamb was gamey and foul tasting, an instant spit-out-of-the-mouth-and-eat-somethingelse-to-purge-the-mouth type thang. Minus points. Pork ribs: Wow, surprisingly soft, but lacked flavor. This was the best entree at the buffet. Turkey: Eh, thanksgiving turkey cut in your choice of dark or white meat. The carver was very nice, but the meat quality was very poor. Braised beef: This better be soft, or else I'm leaving! Fortunately for me, the beef was soft, though a weird aftertaste soured my mouth. Flank steak: Worst meat. I couldn't get steak down my mouth, because the texture was way too chewy. TOO CHEWY. Inedible. Even beef jerky is softer than this flank steak. Mash potatoes: Wait, yelpers, you like this crap? Buttery? Yummy? Uh... I give up.   Dessert Forget the banana pudding, the fruit pudding, the cakes, the brownies; the best dessert is the frozen yogurt. YES. Better than McDonalds frozen yogurt, the barometer for tasty, creamy, consistent goodness. The vanilla custard yogurt was by far the best part of the meal...  ...and the saddest part of the experience. Deserts over meats and entrees? Bayside Buffet, you fail.   And, oh, your service sucks.

4mm6RYQZ25aEmtxZv5sBKg.text: The food is good... maybe like 3.5 stars.. Sushi selection is pretty poor but the other food is pretty decent.  Bellagio is definitely better in terms of food and a million times better in terms of service.  I think we saw our waitress once the whole time... we even had to clear our own tables :(

s_KuuBGa2oMbIfFTl6IjOA.text: The prices here are good. Approx $20 per person. The food is okay. Its fresh and that matters most. I had the prime rip and it was nice and medium rare. The other dishes were not spectacular but better than simply edible. The service was good but the waitress thought we switched out a person. She asked my husband if he was the same guy that was sitting there a moment ago. I guess people try to cheat in these places but c'mon....It was over halfway through our meal.   After I thought the waitress forgot my request for a steak knife (she didn't say anything about it when she was serving the table next to ours) she really didn't. It just took her a while. So I felt bad for mentally berating her for her ignoring my request.  The dessert section was probably the best. Nice chewy cookies. I had an oatmeal cranberry one. They also had a really good peach cobbler that went excellent with vanilla frozen yogurt on top.

-tmWK0tJ11bEoMSUHikSzQ.text: Ugh....I was expecting so much more, especially for the price tag.  But it was just OK for me.  Granted, the red velvet cupcakes and prime rib were pretty scrumptious...the rest of the buffet was just plain disappointing.  And not to mention...50% of it was deep fried.  Now...being the fat ass that I am, everything being fried is mostly fine by me, but it was just plain overwhelming here.  I actually really enjoyed the make your own pasta bar.  It was like Mongolian BBQ for white people.  I kid, I kid...but honestly it was one of the best things this buffet has got going for them.  We had them mix the marinara and alfredo sauce together, and what resulted was a pretty good concoction for the taste buds.  If I were you, I would try and skip it.  But granted there were about 40 of us here for a family reunion, it was OK I guess.  Not only do they lose stars for the food, but they were just RUDE when we tried to move the tables around to just sit closer together.  Ummm...excuse us!! We haven't seen each other in YEARS! Forgive us if we want to be close enough to hear each other talking to catch up.  Hello...you don't give a family of 40, 10 four person tables...

J8Jb4V9eCnplkam3c9E-yw.text: It's a decent buffet but lacks the "wow" factor when it comes to presentation or varieties of foods offered.  Quality of prime roast was good and like many other Vegas buffets, had a decent selection of Asian dishes.

oOgfsnj9a2sSldG231Rccw.text: Underwhelming compared to other buffets in town. Almost surprising that a hotel as nice as Mandalay would run such a dinky buffet. Go here if you are short on time or really tired. Otherwise, get out of Mandalay and try the Bellagio buffet or Wicked Spoon Buffet at the Cosmopolitan.

1sYZLMOR9otSbTzxGDmcLw.text: Good selection for a Las Vegas buffet - quiet environment and good views of the pool area.  Breakfast selections were awesome - meats, breads, steak (yeah) and exotic fruits.  A little pricey for a Vegas buffet

FcZwHR76kZ-Gp_eSfxLydg.text: Ate here late at night, food was simply not good, meat was dried out and there wasn't much of a variety. You can find much better buffets for only a few dollars more.

FWRAy8ZxutqgfwBtFzjTQg.text: Okay - I am an adult and should know not to eat until I am sick, yet this place tests my ability to put down my fork and walk out.  I am not a breakfast person really, so I can't speak to the breakfast or brunch they serve, but I love me some lunch/dinner options.  Of all the Vegas buffets, I think this is the best quality (albeit, they have a smaller selection of food than other buffets - but you know quality over quantity yadda yadda yadda).  Things I love here: - the already peeled large shrimp cocktail - cracked crab legs (these are better than anywhere else, I could eat my body weight in them...I may have in fact) - Prime rib, they rock the cashbah on this one - Chinese fried shrimp - the antipasti bar  - your drink glass will never go empty (especially if you tip when you pay) - they have the best views of the tropical pool area  Things that suck here (and every other buffet you'll ever go to) - the desserts, I don't know why, but NO buffet has good desserts! - made to order pasta (what a waste of time and stomach space anyway!)  Overall- great buffet!!

-VMNmgaDfBZjeuKYwQcHyA.text: I went to the buffet at about 7 oclock and the wait was okay. The cost was about $30 for an adult on a saturday night which I was pretty suprised about because I remember this buffet as not being as great as others but i thought it would mean that the price would be cheaper too. The food is decent, but not the best. If you like pasta I would suggest that you go to the pasta bar where a chef handmakes your pasta. The crab didn't taste nearly as good as the crab at Bellagio. The salmon was dry. I mean...if you want average food then this would be the place to go. But if you want higher quality food then I would suggest going to the Bellagio Buffet on Sunday night where the price is $30 as well but includes so much more selection.   P.S. There is no sushi at this buffet, no creme brulee, no cheesecakes. The dessert selection is limited.

bONBlYQStSbLSqAQLK21Rw.text: I thought this buffet was pretty solid considering its relatively low price, but I went during a holiday weekend, so it might've been better than usual. The crab legs were fine, prime rib was tender and juicy, there were delicious, piping-hot tamales, and they had the most amazingly fluffy yet custardy bread pudding! None of the other dishes were really memorable, but nothing was truly offensive, either. Our server was particularly thoughtful about disposing of our discarded crab leg shells and supplying us with seafood picks and wet naps.   For the price you pay, you can definitely do worse in terms of Vegas buffets. Bayside Buffet  may not be in the same league as Wynn or Bellagio, but it costs half as much!

6XzulUBWPeW-KbuQBNRK0Q.text: Wow.... You pay the same for the Wynn buffet, but you get So.much.LESS.   The food was disappointing after having eaten at other Vegas buffets... the food didn't taste fresh or anything. There wasn't anything too special or amazing. The sushi was worse than what you'd get at a grocery store. Ate one plate and stopped there... sad.

xaXrtFKfQ75eFlO4_u2Xrg.text: For $29 including tax + tip, I enjoyed the brunch buffet this past Sunday.  I don't think I enjoyed it $29-worth, but since I was with a good group + I ate my fill, I'd for sure say it was worth it this past weekend.  The crablegs were delicious -- good texture (firm, not mushy), and although they were a little sea-tasting, I dug the flavor (perfectly salty!)  Macaroni rocked. As did the potatoes croquettes.  My friend's egg-white omelette looked delicious :D  I could list a whole bunch more random foods -- I'll summarize and say there was a pretty decent selection, and everything tasted pretty decent, too.  I'd say 3.5 stars, but will bump up to 4.  (Plus, unlike anything I've experienced before, their service rocked -- servers came by constantly to see if we needed anything (we did stay for 3+ hours, hee) and were really friendly -- and this was between 11 and 2:30!)

jxq7I2Qb2-WUaQ8SLN3RwA.text: I disagree with Jason R's review about the disapointment, and Rob M's review about probability of it being the best.  It's alright, nothing great.  I had the lunch buffet and nothing stood out which was sad.  I tried a little bit of everything and nothing stood out and said "BAM MOTHERFUCKER THIS IS GOOD!"  The deserts were tasty but they were just slightly under Bellagio Buffet's deserts......which isn't a bad thing.    The price is alright, but I'd only hit this buffet if you were staying at Mandalay Bay, Luxor or Excalibur.....it's not worth going out of your way for.....but worth avoiding Luxor's and Excalibur's buffets.

pUfqMSiS6d0kxxVJ_FuNcA.text: Hostess was very nice and attentive. Food was good. Jumbo shrimp, fruit, coffee, dessert what more can a girl ask for.

6ieGgw_4qfh6Q95YN8lr1g.text: This place was surprisingly way better than I thought. Came at 10:40 ish. Paid for breakfast, but got breakfast and lunch. Came in during the transition. Their beef sausage ( different from the breakfast sausage) was very tasty. Also really like their flank steak. The Mexican rice was also very good. You seriously cannot beat the price

wDPqdzDAGQS0hsp3x6jobw.text: We went for breakfast and the customer service was bad. The workers are very rude. And the breakfast food was awful! Barely ate anything. Worse Buffett I've ever been too.

6QDWqlQH2eLU-9TVPPXZoA.text: I went to this buffet with my family on Friday afternoon around 1pm. There was no one in line... that should have been my first sign to walk away and try something else... but we had been here before and it wasn't that bad.  The prime rib, cold crab legs, and hot crab legs are the star of this buffet. Other than that, there isn't much that is tasty. I liked the beef empanadas, but they were a little too salty. The shrimp tempura was good, but tasted exactly like the kind you can buy from Costco. The desserts area was lacking, but they do have very tasty cookies... especially the one with white chocolate and cranberries! I also really enjoyed the vanilla sauce with the bread pudding.  The service was ok. Our plates stacked up with 3 or 4 dishes before being taken away, but our drinks were brought out and refilled in a timely manner.   I wouldn't suggest coming here if you are only going to go to one vegas buffet during your trip. But it's not bad, it's just not as good as the Bellagio or Wynn Buffets.

FmUhA38bAl_akSUmFC0z9A.text: Day 3, buffet 3, my last....boo hoo...  But at least it ended with a good brunch. 30 dollars after tax and tip though cause it was President's day...boo holidays! I have no idea if the brunch was any better than usual or if they jacked up the price since they could get away with it that day. Pricey for brunch buffet, I would've liked it better if it was a few dollars less. Food was pretty good though.  Interesting that its kinda like going to a movie theater since they have kiosks where you pay for your meal. No wait when I went at round 11. They then tried to seat us in the dark area, but we requested to be seated near the large windows. Of course, we got what we wanted, but was also seated next to a large party of very loud people with a little boy they let do whatever he wanted. So a tradeoff...sunlight vs quiet. It's a good thing that you walk off a lot in buffets.  The placement of the food is a bit odd in a way, the regular food and the dessert were separated by a huge main room. Hehe limiting temptation maybe? Anyhow, they had a good selection of regular lunch food and breakfast, and a wide assortment of pastries and breads and desserts.  Main things that stood out to me, duck, hash browns, and the pastries and desserts. I really have a soft spot for anything light and flaky and baked. Haha. I ate a buncha other things too that I remember liking, salmon, asparagus, braised short ribs and all the other miscellaneous breakfast items. Duck was nice and tender with the skin crispy. Mmmm...I wanted more but didn't wanna fill up on heavy stuff before my ride home. Hash browns were in big triangle shapes that were really crispy and yummy. Oki so like McDonald's hash browns basically hehe. And the pastries...I only had room for a chocolate croissant but I wanted to try everything else they had. They also had make your omelettes, crab legs, prime rib, some asian food, etc etc, but I didn't really eat any of that.    And so, a good place for brunch, but try not to come during holidays. No idea about dinner time. Pastries...

m1mXfQWrP9A09TWFtHXq4w.text: As a part of a hotels.com deal, we got a voucher for $40 to use, so we decided to try the breakfast/lunch buffet at Mandalay. Really nothing more than average at best. The selection wasn't phenomenal and the food was just your average buffet. I did like the carnitas and sausage, but there was nothing special about this place. It's $15 for breakfast and $20 for lunch. Not one of the more expensive buffets, but if we didn't get comped, it's not a place I'd return to.

cTXLVv9zTX_rAIq0mrHSOQ.text: This buffet has a great brunch menu.  The food is delicious if you're into breakfast and cake for brunch.  I enjoyed it very much, but im sure its not the best vegas has to offer.

yQlOYGdf9wD4LXse3xeG0g.text: Incredible brunch buffet. Everything from breakfast food, to Chinese, to American, everything is available. So many quality choices. Unlimited mimosas for $6!!! Waiters are very attentive and polite. Price was very worth it for the food. Will visit again!

9i3kTc_FrGBR1rAnEhCZxQ.text: They didn't have a huge selection like the other buffets I've been to. The food is ok.  The only item I really enjoyed here were the oxtails! OMG, they were to tender and the flavor was perfect. I would probably go back just for this item alone.  After I was done, I checked out the dessert table. I ALWAYS get my creme brulee and they did not have that here so that was disappointing. I just grabbed a chocolate cake and something with coconut but tasted mostly like marshmallows plopped onto a pastry cake like shell.  Again, it got 3 stars because of the oxtail dish alone!

NMCJbD6ZQ57o5-czuFp97g.text: I recommend spending the extra money at the Bacchanal buffet in Caesars Palace! The first time I went to this buffet 12 years ago I loved it, but we recently were staying at the Mandalay Bay for a night and wanted to just dine in the area. It costed a little over $30/adult and $20 for my 5 year old. The food selection was not as much as what I remember it to be and it just seemed over priced. The quality was good, just disappointed on the lack of selections and having to wait for certain food items. I would not go back just because there are so many other places to choose from in Vegas. I would also rather pay $50/person at the bigger resort/casinos for a better selection of food/seafood.

Gz2i3sTjD1XoIrvGmJR8tw.text: It is not as good as I thought, the food kind are lot enough, but the chicken every kind are so hard, the others are too salty, the cheese cake taste not made by cheese, it makes us thirsty after we came out all night. It not worth for eati

q88X4a9mR4d4nuLc_m4h3w.text: For $30 a person this buffet isn't worth it. The items that are being served here don't stand out. Usual pasta, pizza, prime rib, crab legs, salads, etc. The food wasn't horrible but definitely not worth $30.   The desserts were ok, but as usual there's was nothing that would make me come back. You're honestly better off spending the $30 per person and going to a nearby restaurant within the casino.  5/10 (overpriced)

wYYK8pxBnLY6tGfecVk5gA.text: Horrible!!!! Bartender had a bad attitude ( mr. Robert) he made his unhappy face to everyone. Drink is include in a buffet but he is respect for TIP ! I heard he said cheap! How people will tip you if you had bad attitude face all the time. I went with my family (8 people) we all said the same thing. Seafood was only ok! Very disappointed.

DOjKDRBwjGy_MLVausdwMQ.text: I'm trying to figure out how such a great place like Mandalay Bay allows this lousy place to survive? This is not what I envision as part of my mLife experience!   Most items were mediocre, tasteless, too dry, or just frozen food reheated. Desserts? Pitiful.  I will credit a good waitstaff, but the kitchen staff looked bored. I would be too if I had to serve up this slop.  MB management: how about it? Go sample the buffets at Bellagio, Wynn, and Wicked Spoon. Then shut this place and try again.

55vR_qRWuyEYuNKV-uB6vA.text: Very good husband had a field day with the seafood. Our server Todd was the best. Kept our drinks coming and clear the dishes every time he went by. Was the best service I have had in a long time. I just retired from being a server in a Buffett at a Indian casino and I know good server when I see one. Todd you deserve a raise. Thank you for making our dinner fantastic

zrYzZU8zPYENbMaO60I0GQ.text: I am so disgusted and disappointed. 10 years ago we ate at the Bayside Buffet before seeing Mama Mia and I still remember how delicious the Creme Brulee and Prime Rib were. So I was so excited to eat there again last night. It was an experience almost 24 hours later I am still upset about. It was by far the worst buffet (and quite seriously some of the worst food) I've ever paid for. The shrimp alfredo pasta was watery and tasted nothing like alfredo sauce. The ribs were dry and rubbery. The potstickers were barely warm and so dry I could hardly cut them. The mashed potatoes were clearly from a mix and had way too much water added. There was no prime rib but something called steam ship. It was dry and tough. As we were leaving, my husband saw a uniformed employee eating prime rib in the dining area. Obviously they kept it hidden from the general public. The seafood jambalaya looked good but tasted like old fish. I thought for sure the desserts might redeem the whole experience, but no. It was very slim pickings. The cakes were dry and flavorless while the "crumb topping" on the apple pie looked mushy. We had a 30% off coupon bringing the price down to $23. I am shocked that a resort like Mandalay Bay can get away with serving such awful food. Maybe they're trying to drive customers to eat in their fancy restaurants. Save your money and drive to the M Casino south of the strip. Same prices but delicious food, huge variety and amazing desserts.

OQELQy57YQ08GopEN9R7kQ.text: It might be because buffets make me feel weird...or that I was overwhelmed by it all...or that I ate too much and felt sick...or that we had just had a few wild nights in Vegas and my body was giving up, but I really just wasn't that into this place. The excitement of having crab legs with my eggs, pancakes and bacon was great, but I really wish I wouldn't have done that. I would have been better off saving room and being able to eat all of my grits. Or just having fruit and some water to replenish. But who does that at a buffet?! When there are crab legs and pancakes?!   The staff that we encountered here were frantic, though helpful when we needed them for beverages. Other than the chaotic feeling we were getting (we were with a large group that had reserved in advance, so I'm not sure what the craziness was about...perhaps it was because everyone was hungover and arriving at different times...), no heavy complaints.   I'm just not that into smorgasbords of food upon food upon food.   ...but crab legs and pancakes!

4SXIx6BOa6vk2uU5U1kWXg.text: Worst buffet in Vegas. We were in a hurry but wow! Wasn't expecting. Buffet that crappy. Two bites N we were out!

qSoz7i1Njaeu_uxBICzBSQ.text: No selection, no deserts, okay tasting food. When you go to a vegas buffet, you expect something amazing. This place was no more special to me than your average LA buffet.

Vs2HrJrhXudFEBVmzWG2jg.text: Went here for a family reunion on 2 occasions. Lunch is $21.99 and Dinner is $32.99. I think this buffet has the best tasting crab legs and best value for your buck for lunch. The spread is great. Top 5 things in this buffet: Panko crusted salmon, oxtail stew, grilled steak, bbq chicken pizza, and CRAB LEGS! I would make this the 2nd best buffet in Vegas next to Bacchanal Buffet in Ceasars. No complaints here...

GU0r6JK6soe7mJPGx6PZDw.text: Service was great. Patrons around us not so much. To maximize your value, start with the item you really want to eat first. Flank steak, beef short ribs, all excellent. The flatbread pizzas are AMAZING!! Crab legs were mediocre. Word to the wise wait till they bring fresh ones. Don't eat the crab legs that are at the bottom of the Schaffer.

rQeg47Wsk6Rg_bDsYjEcvw.text: Used to be great. Just ate there again and was disappointed. The place still is beautiful to look at, but the food is underwhelming, with the exception of dessert.  The sushi was horrid but understandable as the women at the sushi station were speaking in Spanish to each other.  The cheese cubes even were fairly bland.  Mandalay Bay is a beautiful resort and one of my favorites but this is a bad representation of their dining options.    On the way back home, we stopped in Primm and ate at Primm Valley's buffet and it was much better than Mandalay's.  That is just sad.  Actually Sizzler or Hometown Buffet is better.  I'll gladly stay at Mandalay Bay or Four Seasons, but will go to Mirage for a buffet.

7bSqAF2JKZaYW4kvSadKDg.text: Back in the day this was a 4 star but as the economy took a hit, like all the buffets, so did the quality of this buffet  I would categorize this as a mid-tier buffet....

GnwduD-5sB_wBvaz79bkkQ.text: We succumbed to laziness and ate here. We know it's over priced and the food are your regular buffet menu. Except for the ox tail. A bit chewy but at least it's something new.   What more can I say... bleh.  Eat outside. Support local restaurants.

X2qu3LPHli8spLNV24ABDQ.text: We went for Sunday brunch. It was definitely price friendly compared to other buffets we visited.  The breakfast options were great. Tons of meats and an omelette  and carving station. The bananas were brown and less popular food items looked like they had sat out a while.  Desserts were average.  It was empty and clean which is huge compared to other buffets.  The worker asked what we wanted and when he said no sprite zero he gave us all diet coke but that's okay.

plGuV3TgHKVVh_kw8LGokw.text: Ok, I NEVER write reviews. But this is really really bad. They just rip tourist off.   It's the lamest buffet in Vegas. I've been to Arias, Wicked Spoon and Le Village. They are all good (Arias being the best). Go to any of those. They have 3ple the amount the food and 10X better quality.

B1FDOPz4AC3vlMLTS0Cr1A.text: went on Thanksgiving lunch... we paid at 2pm, waited in line for 1/2 hour more to be seated... we were seated and I grabbed some food to start eating... NO ONE came to tell us that in another 1/2 hour they were going to take out all the food and close for Thanksgiving Dinner (which they don't usually do).  HELLOOOOO, if you are going to take out all the food before the lunch people finish eating, at least have the DAMN courtesy to tell us at least on the line to pay, or have the waitresses go around and let us know that that is going to happen... we just ate a little, and then when we were going for our second round, pufffffff nothing..... are you kidding me!!!!!!    So, we waited to see if they were going to put food out, but then the "manager" came at 3:45pm and told us that they are going to served dinner but if we wanted to stay we can pay the extra difference for dinner, that they usually don't close the restaurant, but because it was thanksgiving they were doing this.... OK... why you didn't show up 1/2 hour before they took out all the food or let us know ahead of time that you will pull this stunt!!!??!?!?!?  then she started saying that the waitress don't usually do this, that is when we pay, the cashier will tell us, but only if we paid by 2:30pm, because at 3 pm they remove the food... HELLO... I paid at 1:59pm, waited in line to be seated for another 30 minutes, so that was 2:30pm, and then you took out the food by 3:00pm.... that was so not fair.... BAD MANAGEMENT!!!! they just want to get our money!  Not even on the lowest chinese buffets they do that to the customers, they will go around and let them know that they have only like 10 or 15 minutes to grab whatever else they want before the remove all the food.    STUPID Management!!!!! you need to be better organized during holidays... if not, you'll get more people pissed off at your BADDDDDDDDDD horrible service!!!!    We are not going back again! you guys are BAD!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MtQF8QGHq6t7amaeE-t-Uw.text: They have an omelet bar in the morning. The food is international from pot stickers to kielbasa sausage. The desserts are your typical cookies and little cakes. The coconut macaroons were good. The pot stickers were hard though. And some of the meat was not flavorful.   The fruit is delicious and beautiful. They even serve pecans! The strawberries were a beautiful gemstone red.  It's an okay buffet place that doesn't really have quality that can compare to the other vegas buffets.

vko6xH2gq3_wpYx2E8dqxw.text: All-you-can-eat 3 star food pretty much sums it up.  Some buffets have hidden gems.  This one didn't.

BpJPS6F6iBv9lvfGbu_wnA.text: Excellent!  Usually, twice at same hotel buffet is more than enough.  We had 6 meals here and never got tired of the selections and tastes of the food.  A lot of special attention can be tasted throughout.  I had the best lamb chops grilled by Chef Edward himself since my trip to Greece 20 years ago.  He can be seen behind the buffet tables teaching and directing his staff.  He brought me a whole jar of Kimchi from the back.    It was Father's Day and he prepared special meals for the Day.  Other places only do that for Mother's Day.  You can tell he is very proud of every dish he offers and the staff also seems to share the attitude.     Special but simple spices to usual buffet varieties can be tasted.  We were very satisfied.  We will go back again if only just for the buffet.

3yQXtsmPudIgBTXckvSUAA.text: I've been to this buffet over the years a few times.  The food has always been good quality.  But mostly I like the relaxed atmosphere.  The locations next to the big windows are the best.  It is super pricey though, but this review is only for the food and place.  If you care more about saving money in Vegas, then this isn't the place to eat

1QXtO-7cdYPbr3m4o70CIA.text: You would think a Vegas casino like Mandalay Bay would have a sufficient buffet hosted in their hotel, but I was sorely disappointed in the Bayside Buffet.  I went here because some online site said they served a little bit of seafood. The only seafood I saw was your typical shrimp cocktail, and a soup with very little crab legs in it This buffet should be categorized as more "American" in offering than seafood.  I ate around 12 pm which is prime lunch time. Being disappointed that there was no seafood, I picked a bunch of the standard things. However, the food already felt dry from sitting out too long. I ate what I could from their limited selection.  I may or may not give this place a second chance. The service was okay, but the food just wasn't very good.

Cr_4FP6xD3-hVDn1qCZ6Hg.text: First, I must say the workers and help are amazing here. We tipped big as they were VERY quick to clear everything and place was VERY clean.  That being said, the food was awful! They made us wait thirty minutes for the steak and it tasted like it was gamey and old. The shrimp were mushy, seafood spicy mix was mostly veggies and none of it tasted right. A few things we were pretty sure they were sour. Even the bread was stale and hard. Desert which is normally my favorite in buffets was barely edible. I couldn't even eat the canoli I did complain and the server did say the help has changed recently. It was NOT a good value and cost almost $60 for two adults, one child for lunch. Would not suggest

kK7bv7FzwX5EGNBT7ZJieg.text: I had high hopes coming into bayside buffet. This variety and quality of food was disappointing. The only good thing I could eat here was the hot crab legs. The taste of the Chinese food was horrible. Every other thing I looked at looked extremely greasy. The beef you have sliced was mostly pure fat. I will never come here again.

ldqLTJtjW0ktqfiLfkQokw.text: Yuck! Powdered eggs, microwaved food. I'll pass. Better at Starbucks with coffee and muffins.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty on a Thursday.
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eicFg7ehg88lHKkfC64i_Q.text: In regards to buffet options this place is pretty much standard. Price, quality, and options are what I expect here. You have one row of buffet options that is shorter than what you can find at Orleans, planet Hollywood and aria . The ambient is nicer than the those mentioned. My only complaint is the 2:30 dinner change but that's really because off my scheming self.   When I tried to get food around 345 and realized the food was all gone except for salad, bread and sushi, the server then told me I have to leave before 430 and that all the food has been removed for breakdown and cleaning in preparation for the dinner shift. Which would've been okay if the cashier or my server had told me about a last call or had it written down somewhere. Not after it happened and I'm still hungry!not worth paying $20+ for salad, bread and hard sushi.   Prime rib is uncharacteristically sweet. Panko salmon is great. Skip the sushi and the Chinese.

anDirUSPlOJDBy5ayJacpw.text: I usually never go to buffets in Vegas however we got comped the buffet at the Mandalay so we basically had to go here. The food is mediocre. They also basically False advertise the prime rib. They don't always have prime rib, the day we went they had something called steamship. I had never heard of this cut of meat before but me as a surgical anatomist and an aspiring butcher I looked into it. Steamship is the top round cut of meat with the femur bone included. This is a lean, cheap primal cut of meat. This is very very different than prime rib. It still tasted good but it is not prime rib. The crab legs were salty and scrawny. Overall disappointing however most buffets disappoint me anyways.

54Tmzsui-3Ux9gHFC2tRHQ.text: This place used to be the it buffet... Fast forward several years and the quality has gone downhill quite a bit. It's still decent but could use an update and definitely a price drop for what you get

W8w9XQdO_xo9sTvzZKqmwA.text: As I am typing this I have about 3% battery left. Be thankful I am giving up the rest of my battery to warn you. Hehe.  Literally just got done eating there & I gotta say if you're planning on going there please don't waste your time or $$$.  It is over priced & nothing I ate there was satisfying.  How sad... They jack up the price for holidays too.   Do not go there my friends!!!!!

_7GDyUMZX9UKz2ahNgfX_A.text: Friday brunch review. I went for the meats.  The roast beef, lox and cold shrimp were good. All the other meats I tried were overcooked and dry. My guest enjoyed the oxtail and seafood stew.  I give it two stars, my guest, three.

Rxhp2hfpynF-aj-_4bRkLw.text: The staff is friendly. Then it gets worse.  We came for breakfast and had rubberized pancakes, weird tasting eggs Benedict, deep fried frozen hash browns, stale desserts and OJ from concentrate. The people handling the food wore rubber gloves while they wiped down utensils, ovens and stove tops. Then they handled the food without changing those gloves. I guess they are to keep their hands protected - not for sanitary food handling.   The omelet station made a decent omelet and the bacon was tasty.   $56 for two people. Never here again. Flamingo has a good breakfast buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zNLXMjqLNmDY9gtKacc-7w.text: Very disappointed at the selection and quality of the food. Can't believe they charge $35/person when I can go to a Chinese buffet pay less and get more variety as well as quality.  Do yourself a solid and walk the buffet before paying. Dont believe the hype.

5M4nzgaXDqJXyy_j5YsZPA.text: Attended brunch after experiencing the coolest Elvis wedding of my niece and her new groom John!  This buffet was a step up from the other we tried.  Fresh omelets with fresh veggies, can't argue that move.  Chorizo and eggs, which was a huge plus for me. Some other surprises, but it's a buffet, and not all bad.

bB9gZif17ZV8JTbpWp7_pQ.text: I would give Zero stars if possible. Screw this buffet. I've never been so sick as I was after I went here. I spent 71$ and some change and it was the biggest waste of money. They really need to check on their staff or make sure they are cooking food fully through. Something is clearly wrong if all 10 people in my group are sick.

rSprUXrRsNo33y2szgtL_A.text: Don't bother. It's worse than a buffet at home. The good reviews and the staged food photos are from years ago. Not indicative of the current state at all!  This might have been good once, but I fear it's gone downhill and no longer reflects the quality and excellence of the MGM brand.  Six of us were eager to try out the famous Vegas buffets last night. We went here assuming Mandalay Bay would be a lock. Hostesses were excellent, prices reasonable.  At 7:30pm we found a few glum patrons picking at their food.  I saw a few steam tables and searched for the main buffet area. But a few steam tables, a salad bar and a little sushi/fruit area were all there was. This is smaller than a buffet back home!  After trying and failing to eat, the rest of the party concentrated on getting their money's worth from the bottomless beer.  The food was bland, meat options overly fatty, variety severely lacking.  I found the manager and walked her through the most serious issues.  - bartender had a leg and butt cheek up on the salad bar table. - salad bar was thrashed, with ingredients and dressing everywhere. Two staff were standing by the salad bar. They never moved to clean it up. Manager said she usually cleaned it herself but hadn't had a chance to get to it. - two platters of sushi contained no fish, were broken and smashed, and fell apart. Manager said the rice wasn't made correctly, but she couldn't do anything about it. - multiple serving spoons and tongs had handles laying in adjacent food. Food was dropped and dropped across the serving areas. Manager also said she usually did that. Other workers wouldn't move to clean anything. - no prime rib. Instead a small beef roast was present. Our deer-dressing manly men could hardly cut it, it was so tough. Unable to chew at all. Manager's response was that they had steak knives upon request.  Throughout all this the manager was very nice and understanding. She was able to refund one of our bills, but not the others for folks who had tried and failed to eat.  What would fix this? A relentless focus on cleanliness, excellence and attention to detail. If you have little to work with, at least do it the very best. Don't let handles lay in food, have someone dedicated to continually cleaning up serving areas and spills on floors. Demand quality for the small selection of food available. Care!  Mandalay Bay has plenty of other great food options. But the Bayside Buffet is truly the worst food I've found in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Typical of the buffet area.

7hHPavmTC0b6zU9LhBR3Tg.text: First I have to say that the service was an A+!  The waiter was very attentive and very friendly.  We got there around 1pm and the food selection was great but the restaurant was not busy so the food turnover was not there.  I noticed that the sushi wasn't the freshest.  The avocado on some of them were browning and the fish just didn't look appealing at all.  I took the last avocado rolls and noticed that they did not refill the item the whole time we were there.  My husband enjoyed the freshly made pasta as he selected the pasta, sauce and fixing in the pasta.  They had a good selection of Asian, Mexican, Italian and American food.  The food quality was not the best but overall it was not the worse.  I just wonder if I had came earlier if the food turnover would have been better.   The dessert selection was above average.  I enjoyed the carrot cake and cheese danish.  Lastly, I did thought the place was very clean and had a great atmosphere.  We sat next to the window and enjoyed the view of their outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake, brownie smore and cheese danish
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OrfXGoGcixMzVSY5TIs18g.text: First time in Vegas and I ended up staying at Mandalay Bay Hotel. Looking around for places to eat and came across this famous buffet. It was really good. I loved that they have breakfast, lunch and dinner all at one time. I will be coming back to this buffet. I bit over priced but amazing food.

dUYlghjk-_4XG7nvrps0lQ.text: For Vegas, average. Anyplace else, overpriced and underwhelming. Just didn't seem like they were trying. Quality was iffy. The ham was dry, like it had been sitting under heat lamps for quite a while. Not great food, and not a great price, suggest you go elsewhere.

aHgsdB_7lx9XVisNJa5pbg.text: Tried to check in but was writing this as I left Las Vegas...  This buffet was underwhelming.  Not bad, not good.  Plus there was not a lot of variety for desserts.  TONS of hardened cookies at the dessert bar.  The food was a little bland and service was fine.  80.00 for "Eh".

cPZH0n38l0RqK8K7XE5h-g.text: Had lunch here with my daughter and was surprised at the food selection.There were many different culinary offerings and an extensive dessert station too. The ambiance was relaxing and our server was polite and professional. I am not much of a buffet person, however I was pleased with the food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Wh6SJGRxyARY490fpVNEg.text: Food is good but not much to write about. It is a buffet and it's cheaper than anywhere else at this resort.  One thing I'll note is that they have crab legs that are very popular here.  It's better than any of the fast food options at this resort.

XZYYyesKec1Cvpbd6hW8Og.text: Just ok and not worth the price. The food was very mediocre buffet food. It's not the kind of spread one would expect from Vegas, so don't come expecting a lavish Vegas buffet. Only a few elements were tasty and not full-on mediocre (I'm talking less than Village Inn quality). The French toast and the sausage were good, and the cookies were good. That's it, though - even the orange juice was watery. It's a big space, and the service was fine. The diversity of options was also decent. But it was not something I'd ever pay for again.

-4Y1OU3IBkKEUTfozjbNLQ.text: I did receive better service here than the buffet at Aria. The food does need a little more selections to justify the cost.

gvv1X1O210762ciT_U1pNQ.text: Save your money. We arrived late and didn't want to deal with "reservations suggested" restaurants so tried here. Bad choice, especially for the price. Bright spot was the almost invisible made-to-order pasta station.

lQzmGWRsMrvwDbdQPJcJdw.text: We went to the buffet later than the crowds so the nice part was that it wasn't crowded at all.  I paid at a kiosk which got me out of the short line that was there. One thing I did not like about that was paying for the tip prior to receiving any service.   We were seated then looked over the buffet.  Everything you'd want was there.  Prime rib, Mexican, Asian, seafood, salad bar and desserts.   All the items I tried were good but not great.  There was nothing so fabulous that I wanted to go back for seconds.  I tried several items from each section but overall it was just okay.  For example, the potstickers were as expected but the rice dough was slightly too thick and they had been sitting awhile.  The desserts were really good and small portions so you could try a couple without overeating, perfect.  My son loved the soft serve.  It was very good.  Our waitress was very slow.  We sat there ten minutes past when I wanted to leave just to get an iced tea.  I had nothing to drink in the hotel room so really needed the tea.  Oh well, it gave me time to watch this tiny Cross Fit girl shovel three huge plates of food into her tiny person...quite a show!

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemony and the perfect size
Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very orange flavor

kExr-C62TaOU5zmBUjeqaA.text: It was okay....  I came here for their brunch/lunch buffet, $25.99 on Saturday afternoon.  We were seated quick. You can order any drink you like. It was part of the buffet so I ordered water, coffee and orange juice. The selection of the menu was sad. They repeated some of the dishes in different stations so there was not a lot of variety. They had an omelet station where the chef will cook how you like your omelet.   The selection of the menu was from scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs with cheese, toast, croissant, sausage, harsh brown, steak, salmon, turkey, fruits, desserts and etc... Nothing really stood out for me. The sushi was very disappointing. It felt like it been there a couple of days. The rice was disgusting nasty. Definitely skip that. We asked the server when is the lunch selection coming out because we came there around 12. The server told us they will be serving brunch, whatever they are offering now all day until dinner. My friends and I were disappointed. We were looking forward for crab legs and ox tail soup.  Definitely not a big fan of this place.

wU1Mvx1qgmbxOUjZ9o4U1A.text: Worse buffet experience ever. They lure you in by their online menu promising a wide variety. When you actually pay the $35 to eat, there's 1 edible option, the salad. I was looking forward to the Dungeness crab legs, no flavor and the claws may as well have been empty.  The "beef" was so dry, Stevie Wonder could've confused it for beef jerky.  The Spanish rice was OKAY, and that was because we were starving.  I definitely will not be returning.  I guess the money spent went towards a very friendly hostess, and waiter. Thanks, but no thanks.

yZW9dZ_InLcn-3NJ581uVQ.text: Its a smallish buffet. They were not busy on  Tuesday night at 7pm. Many off the items that had been fried tasted of old grease. The shrimp was a bit off. There was turkey and new york strip at the carving station but we didnt try it. We picked up a bite or two of several things for a test run and nothing was good enough to eat again. The desserts were hit and miss. They made money on us for sure. Disapointing

AfYDxja8DjjB5sBfvpdLUg.text: Overall a very nice buffet! After paying $50+ at Bellagio the night before, I was expecting a noticeable decrease in quality at this buffet since it was only $34.99. However, there was a generous food selection and many unique items that were very tasty. Also, there were a good amount of seafood options which was a plus for me! I did come on a weekend, so I can't speak to the weekday selection and quality. Nonetheless, I'd highly recommend coming here if you want the buffet experience but don't wanna ball out at one of the bourgier hotel buffets.

4_d--uiYcrSW1Mh8YCfGqA.text: I came here JUST for the crab legs. Spent a crap ton of money to find out they don't serve them anymore. The manager said that if he brings some out for me, then he has to bring them out for everyone. Boy, if I'm paying $25 for a buffet, I want my crab!!!!!!  Also the food was super eh.

gAtB3HyZX9JaKwSXtmv0zg.text: Went on a Wednesday evening, buffet was 30 something dollars each. Yeah its cheap for a Vegas buffet on the strip in a well known casino but wow, total let down in every way.  First off customer service, we got the grouchiest waitress I've ever encountered, no smile, no hello, just "drinks?'" me: a pepsi, 3 waters and a hot tea please.. then she walks away without acknowledging what I just said. At least she remembered and she did get the order right but forgot the straws. None of us wanted to make the grump grumpier so we just let it be. Food is the real reason they get one star. Small selection and it seemed like they were being stingy with what they put out there. Like the picture of the mountain of shrimp cocktail on here...nah it didn't look like that at all, there was maybe like 50 shrimp out there the whole time we were there. They had mexican food, but no condiments to go with it. Really thats what upset me the most, lack of condiments to flavor the lackluster food. I mean if the food is amazing then no I wouldn't care about condiments but the food was far from that, I think it barely hits fine. Their desserts are blah, wouldn't be surprised if they were boxed..or premade a month in advance, frozen and thawed when needed. They did have an unlimited alcoholic drinks option for an extra $10+ dollars. Everything looks better after a few bottles/glasses of anything so I guess this would be good option for if I ever need to eat here again.  Total disappointment. What a mistake it was coming here to eat, a few more dollars and a short car ride and we could've gone to Wicked or Rio. I wasn't the one who paid for the meal here but I left feeling ripped off.

4PBkjY-pi0mZ04MaK35FYQ.text: I think all older posts are pretty accurate. Not the best buffet in Vegas and not the worst. It was okay. Prime rib was a bit tough and not tender. Went for brunch and no crab legs so was disappointed. But overall decent. I felt a little overpriced for the quality

85yGUpI6Wn67oG2V_OYqJw.text: This place is pretty good tho there food set up is a little odd. I almost skipped over the omlette station cause it's so tucked away. But over all well lit and clean, service was good at first but towards the end our waiter was mia. Some of the desserts lacked that sugary kick or flavor that makes you want more. May come back next time I'm in Vegas cause its better than the rio and a fair price.

ivfwVgA9ifOPYfZzuJkGLg.text: $28 Saturday "BRUNCH" Just like the HomeTown Buffet back home.. but pricier not really that good. Basic food, stick French toasts.. mini waffles.. I didn't like the luxor buffet but now in think it was better than this Bayside buffet. On a good note the OJ is good.

BLcFRBMUJCFIiMH4Yh4EkA.text: This has to be the worst buffet on the LV Strip for sure. On a busy Saturday night, the food was old, over salted and dried out. The chicken noodle soup tasted like it came out of a can and the desserts looked like it came straight out of a box. And to top it off we had the rudest waitress. When I asked for a straw, she looked sternly at us and said, "We don't give out straws!!!" then stormed off. She was unpleasant the entire time we were there. I would never come back here again.

JVJn8O_49mdoUjThIlKYtA.text: Ate here awhile ago. I'm looking at reviews for buffets because I dont want to make the mistake of going to a bad expensive buffet. The experience here taught me that  and I wanted to leave a review about my experience. Costs us around $40 a person yet it was so nasty. Even if it was $10, I wouldn't want to come here.   The service wasn't good too.. I came back to my table and I heard the waitress saying something rude to the other table about the way we didn't eat our food all the way. The food was too gross to finish lol. The other table just smiled and carried on. I wouldn't know what to do if I was the other table too. The waitress said it in a joking way, but it was rude to us and was said behind our backs. When she saw me, you could see her stop right away.

d9CFg2Rh0YSrBK-6tnRXsA.text: This was the worst food experience I had in the past 7 days in Vegas. For about $30 per person, the quality of the food is not better than Golden Corral. There are amazing buffets in Vegas (the Wynn is one of them) and for a tad more $, you'll have access to top-quality dishes prepared and cooked with care with great ingredients. Just don't bother with the Bayside Buffet, for the same price, the pool-side grill will leave you happier.

-YE2slXcR3ZZ9Bzo_S9FlA.text: Please don't waste your money. We came here for their brunch buffet for $25.99 and the food was worst than Hometown Buffet. Choices were very limited. Their fried chicken was hard and dried. I mean, how can you mess up fried chicken?!! Prime ribs were so hard that I can't even cut it with the knife. It's ridiculous.

mKJTR1SN1d5wn7uHuj8WjA.text: I was somewhat let down with the Bayside Buffet lunch/brunch compared to my experience with other buffets in the area. I had a two free lunch comp here per day I stay here, so luckily it didn't cost me a lot except they charge $20+ for my 7yrs old (brunch) or I would've been really frustrated. The buffet it is really small, a lot of selections, but not a lot of good selections. Overall, save your money and eat somewhere else (unless it is comp) or for about $6-$7 more go to Bellagio buffet or similar.

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ox tail!

Ru5z19LHYRNhmxNUzXQOWQ.text: Super disappointed  I took my visiting friends from Europe to experience one of the better hotel buffets (that used to be) Quality of food was mediocre at the best, presentation questionable and the selection for the price very limited.  They don't validate parking which cost me another 9 bucks on top of expense for 3 people dining there I will never go there again nor I will recommend it to nobody   If you want better experience try Wynn. My friends were really impressed after visiting Wynn - such a positive difference

LzU0dtTZhYtV2rQ-Wx2J7Q.text: I was very underwhelmed by this Buffet. The food was not really good. There were plenty of options but it just didn't taste good at all. There were only 2 things that I thought tasted well and that's all I ate. The price is, however, very reasonable compared to everything else that's in this hotel.  We did have a very large party so I understand that the server may not be able to accommodate all of us immediately but he wasn't at all. Several of us asked for water refills and he never brought it out to us. He did have a little attitude with us. Would not recommend this buffet.

M_i06MiHGTxCGETdjvKoRg.text: Quick service. The food was decent. I tried several items and everything tasted good. We went for brunch which is about $25 per person. There is the typical buffet food such as omelette station, fruits, salad bar, Mexican breakfast items, some Chinese food items, and American food. Really good seaweed salad and caprese salad. Lots of desserts including no sugar items.

6UFylU3kVhArMHqFBts5Mg.text: The buffet was a big disappointment. If you like your food over cooked and under a heat lamp for long periods of time this is the place for you. The sushi was inedible the noodles were cold and the pizzas were worse than Lunch-able pizzas. Dessert?? How can they be bad? They can at Bayside Buffet. Save your money for the tables folks...

0AGAoDholEqS3lzG2o78Tw.text: $40 for a mediocre buffet not worth it at all. This is gotta be one of the worst buffet I've been to in Vegas with the exception of the MGM buffet. They both are mediocre

r1lKCUU8idd6TUgviSFcgg.text: We are ate dinner with my spouse there to New Year night. After 1-2 our later food make me sick and nausea, diarrhea.. Unfortunately I couldn't go to the party i entered the new year in the toilet...

FjvV-VunhzvnJ1iTHiamZQ.text: This is a review for the breakfast buffet. Breakfast runs until 11:00 AM and has the following:  - Carving station turkey and ham - Omelet station (red onions, mushrooms, ham, bell peppers, cheese) - Bacon, sausage, waffles, pancakes French toast, cereal, chicken fried steak, tater tots, hash browns, fruit, oatmeal - Dessert bar with cakes, cookies and soft serve  The breakfast buffet ended up being about $25 a person after taxes. Our server was courteous and efficient. Drinks were brought promptly and used plates were constantly being cleared. We came at 9:30 AM on a Monday and it was not crowded at all. This was great for getting seated immediately. However, it also meant the food wasn't being turned around quickly in the heating trays. So there was times where meats or carbs would be really dried out from sitting there too long.

Wn5-A_10gYflWX4o4TqYWw.text: This buffet has been awful dessert menu. It is fairly small and no beautiful view. It has a decent selection of regular dishes found that other buffets. Service is awful.

DxJQywtmqX0vdb674x1nJg.text: When you think of Mandalay Bay there is a certain quality that comes to mind. It's a nice hotel, very aesthetically pleasing however the buffet is entirely lacking. You get the Mandalay price and more of a circus circus food choice. Don't get me wrong the food wasn't horrid.... it's just I expected more. There was nothing special about the food. Nothing that made you say goodness I need to come back here. I did like that they had a pasta station where they cook your pasta made to order.... but the cosmo has the same thing.  Three stars because the staff was really awesome. Lance was great. Even though he was manning the pasta station  he was very attentive to other stations as well.  Point of the story, don't go with high expectations. It's an okay buffer but if you want bang for you buck bacchanal @ Cesars is the way to go!!!

544q8uknxwfYQw1jYzijiw.text: Not a bad selection for brunch ... $56 for two people  Service is as good and the place was very clean

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NGu4DdgYChoorim6dMYgXw.text: One of the WORST buffets I've try in Vegas,  I mean, come on, MANDALAY BAY offering this crappy food? At $35 dollars per person?  Even Golden Corral is waaaay better for half the price. Only reason for one star, is the pecan cookies, vanilla swirl ice cream and mash potatoes, but everything else is hardly edible. NEVER AGAIN !!!

0iKtVXaUfYZiJ2leGTCpFg.text: Came here with a gf for her birthday. Wished we went somewhere else. There was a really good price for the upgrade to all-you-can-drink beer, but we didn't upgrade...& I'm actually really glad we didn't.  Once we were seated, we waited for our server to take our drink order, but 10 minutes passed & still no server. So we just got up and grabbed food. Our server came by only twice throughout our time there. one time was to take our drink order and the second time to drop off our drinks. Inattentive service.  The food was all very bland or very dry. I didn't even eat a whole plate of food. After I picked at a few things on my plate and figured I couldn't eat it anymore, I decided to give the desserts a try... Not a bad idea right? Ehhhh. I put a few things on my plate and the only good thing was the NY cheesecake in a cup.  If you like to waste food & money, this would be a place to go.

kjZvCW59HGMbvYzMYGaRaA.text: I think I have been to nearly every buffet in Vegas.  From Wicked Spoon to the M, South Point to downtown.  The only one I have not yet tried is Bacchanal at Caesar's.  Tonight was my first time at Bayside Buffet and I wasn't expecting much, but wow!  There were so many choices!  And many of the items were so good.  I think this is my new favorite Vegas buffet!  It's only $33 for dinner - a bargain compared to most others on the Strip and better than those who are much more expensive!

YIHcCbMRJcO0ow1ry1iAHg.text: Not the greatest Buffett but definitely one of the better ones in Vegas . We went during brunch and I have to say that there was plenty of healthy choices and good comfort food to go around. Desert bar was god but lacked tiramisu that we wanted but overall a great Buffett

photos.caption: Photo of Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Healthy is possible

NZFkA8yRCAsZSYT1B_vetw.text: I don't know what these people are about but I enjoyed this buffet very much. Could it be better -yes, but when I compare the price with some other buffets around town I got a better deal and the food was pretty good! We arrived late and we were soooo hungry so we unpacked and came straight to Bayside for dinner. It wasn't busy so you can talk your time and chose what you like. I enjoyed the salmon, mash potatoes and paella! Definitely worth the $30!

82dl4spzza4Tx2-HIwmtHQ.text: I just want to leave an update. I am giving these 4 stars for Mandalay Bay Buffet Morning Shift Manager-he actually listened to me amd issued a refund for my experience. Overall their hotel staff is very helpful, I will be coming back

tXmilrZLj4Owg-BZU1CYdw.text: I Went to this buffet since I stayed at the Mandalay Bay recently. This buffet is really bad compared to others on the Strip. Most of the food was incredibly bland (especially the alfredo sauce from the pasta bar, which was watery as well), the carnitas were dry and difficult to cut, and the mashed potatoes resembled library paste. This buffet is such a disappointment for a luxury hotel like Mandalay Bay; I'd recommend Wicked Spoon buffet at the Cosmopolitan any day over the offerings here.

JOa-u9ybc1GhMWevwjLBGA.text: People are so picky and their reviews are so embarrassing that it figuratively makes me sick. If you can't find something to eat at Bayside Buffet, then you really ought to broaden your horizons.  Bayside Buffet offers a vast selection of breakfast and lunch foods at around brunch time -- I found nothing that I could truly say I disliked, though their was some sort of Asian chicken (orange chicken?) that was bland. Other than that, this is a solid buffet. The breakfast Mexican options were probably my favorite part, but all of it was decent or better -- mostly better.  The only reason I'd consider giving Bayside Buffet three stars is the service. We had a pile of plates on our table, and it took quite awhile to have them taken away from us. Maybe buffets ought to just have an area where you can bring your dirty plate up and set it? Just a common sense, easy solution thought. And how about a drink buffet so we can fill our own drinks? It took a good while just to get a refill of my water.  Anyway, I was pleased with this buffet and left satisfied. It was a little better than I anticipated, and I'd go back.

2-xVckoGfolwVnxDVmYGzg.text: We had the buffet brunch and they have a lot of selection for the price we paid.  The prime rib and the turkey were very flavorful and tender.  We love the lamb shank and oxtail a lot.  The dessert was just so-so, but the bread pudding was great.

mHsrQZA4BFU7BpFq_87suA.text: Loooove this buffet. Everything was great such a variety. Will come here everytime im in Vegas

iCbhZltY8LFFwDsSwG27tQ.text: Its a buffet. Something I am normally against entirely. But you know what? I thought it was great. My husband and I woke up during our stay at the Delano and were starving and the amount of bacon I needed was not going to be satisfied at a usual dining establishment. We bellied up to the Bayside Buffet, which we thought was very reasonably priced for the weekend at $25, plus you can add a Bloody Mary for $5! We inhaled eggs, copious amounts of bacon, sausage, fruit, and crab legs. Who knew you could get unlimited crab legs for $25?   Was all of the food amazing? Did all of it look like the most appetizing food I've ever seen? Absolutely not. But it's a buffet. That's what I expect. The service was very pleasant and the food was a good quality. What more can you ask for?

TCGtEzdl07i9eagcf9bRKQ.text: We've eaten breakfast here for the last 3 mornings, because it's included in our package.  The food is good, and the waffles are AWESOME. My only complaint would be the omelet bar. The bar doesn't really have options for the omelets. Staff is friendly and food is fresh.

6i4i5UVekvRG-scNU9Q1gQ.text: Buffet was pretty average. Reasonably priced for a Vegas brunch, however it was pretty limited on the selection. Some items were heavy handed with the salt (example - Brussels sprouts). I am sad to say Golden Corral runs side by side with Bayside for half the price.   One positive was the service was 4 stars.

e_VDCFJyKxMphNJedT2VHg.text: Lunch buffet was ok. I was disappointed in the Asian food options and overall there were not a lot of options. This place is far from the Strip so would think they would up the ante on this but no cigar. I wouldn't recommend based on taste alone.

wDbQVBHQGfX_9kAN9B3T_w.text: We were able to find plenty of things that tasted good. The staff was also very friendly and accommodating. The only thing would be that if you take too long picking your food while leaving your table unattended, you might find other people sitting at your table.
